Statement:
Once when I was in the cell group (religious activity) I found  
that almost everyone in the group read the bible daily and I felt  
guilty in my heart.

When I overslept for the second time on the day I had an  
examination.

I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But  
when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten  
it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of  
mine.

About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was  
nothing wrong with me.
When I was left alone at home one night by my brother.
Misunderstood by friends.

When I was in the 12th standard, I could not speak English.  One  
day, while  talking with my relatives I used a wrong word and   
my cousin corrected me, believing that I did not know English.  I  
really felt ashamed then.

When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came  
home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so  
frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited  
until somebody passed by.

Our Headmaster came to our hostel. The lights were off but there  
was a lot of noise. We shouted at him when he knocked at our  
door. We later saw that it was the Headmaster.

My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said  
mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.
When I forgot the lines of the play during an orientation camp.
When I was caught going out with another girl by my girlfriend.
The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

When I was a student at the Institute doing my M.Phil degree, one  
of my professors called me before the convocation and told me  
"You have got the gold-medal (first rank) in the university and  
tomorrow you will be on T.V".

After studying a lot for my H.S.C exams, I could not make it to  
the medical stream and I felt sad about this.
My friend told me he really likes me.
Bad temper of the serving lady in the students' dining hall.

I was travelling, we were 15 person, one of them I met at the  
travel and didn't like her. One night I was asleep while she and  
her friends were talking too loud in the kitchen. I got up to ask for  
silence and since that day I felt constant disgust for her.

When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine  
as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part  
with a few coins for their drinks.

I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although  
they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
When I was caught in an elevator and it got stuck between floors.

One day I had sunned my favourite shirt and was putting it back  
in the wardrobe when my younger brother snatched it from me and  
wore it.  He had not had a bath and was very dirty.  I scolded him  
but he answered back and locked himself up in a room.  I was very  
angry so I starteed kicking on the door and abusing him loudly  
and freely.

When I was starting in romance with my husband, we went out to  
curt, and we stayed in the car "making love". At the time I was  
seventeen and I was very immature until a day I lost my  
virginity.
When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.

I was not prepared for the exam but I wanted to sleep the night  
before the exam.

One day in a crossroad somebody crashed my car. I got out and  
this person laughed at me. I felt such a great anger that I got  
in my car and went away.

My grandmother died over the summer. I knew her very well, she  
baked great biscuits. She was in the hospital but expected to  
improve and go home soon. She died in her sleep.

At secondary school, one of my classmates lost her locker key.   
During a class I saw two other classmates holding a key and  
talking secretly.  I do not know why I suspected them, also  
another classmate supported me.  He remembers that these people  
had only one key in the key-ring, this had seemed strange to him.  
 Besides another classmate said that he had seen them selling  
books at a book-shop and they should not have had such books.  I  
told the teacher and the person was caught.  He had sold the  
books and was forced to quit school.  I found that I had not  
helped him as he stole later on also.  I felt guilty

When I took the B.A exams,I was expecting a 1st class even though  
I had not done very well. When the results came out I felt sad as  
I had missed the 1st class by 12 marks.

I felt unfairly treated at an airport, being told to use a  
different counter (for domestic traffic only).

I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of my  
jr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolwork  
and who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older and  
more successful than they were. At the time I pictured some  
adults like this that I knew in the complaining situation.
Saw a real party leader.
I felt disgust when I saw a dead animal on the roadway.

It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk  
and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol.  
I felt fear of what could have happened.

I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying  
to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of  
materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play  
fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.   
Now when I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was  
intense.
I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.
Finding out that China is still backward in science.

When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I  
felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family  
and then I learned slowly to understand to life.

Talkiing about the past happy hours with two friends at night in  
a camp a few months ago.  We shared our feelings, notions and  
every hidden anxiety.  I thought that they cared for me and I  
was very happy and satified.

It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's  
funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).

When I state things with great positiveness and try to convince  
others, and it appears that my statement is not right.

During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his  
girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my  
brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place  
for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I  
had never asked her.

When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I was  
very happy to see him and couldn't believe it was him with me.

A children's film in which I played a clown, with spotlights,  
cameras and the director who demanded jumps and guffaws.

When dropping a carton of boiling soup onto a co-worker's leg -  
causing great pain, and for me, severe embarassment at my own  
ineptitude, and shame that another person suffered as a result.

It was discovered that I had received a warning letter as my  
G.P.A was very low.

When at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him in  
the head. The blow caused a flesh wound and I was afraid of what  
would happen to me when the teacher found out the circumstances.

I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil)  
from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became  
No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.
One day I went to see a rather disagreeable film (X).

I was returning from the Universtity at night when I was accosted  
by a boy who molested me, passing his hands on my body.

I was catched when, as a little girl, I played tricks. I was very  
startled then and wet my pants.

People having a football match outside the window during the  
lecture.

I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I  
heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to  
attend a wedding ceremony.

One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy  
substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of  
cider and threatened to throw it at me.

When taking part in the mobbing of one of my best friends in  
primary school.

A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and  
invited me for a party.
In the morning just before going to the dentist.

I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the  
first time with a girl.

When I almost fell down from some rocks because I had been acting  
foolishly and playing dangerously.
Death of General Ye Jianying.

I read about the national and social spirit and self-discipline  
of the people of developed coutries like U.S.A, England, France,  
Germany etc.  Comparing this to the Indian people I felt guilty  
as they have no national spirit or self-discipline.
I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.
My boyfriend made me a proposal.

When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension  
between friends so as to bolster the impression one of them had  
of me !

When someone threw a firecracker into my room at 7:00 am in the  
morning.

It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a  
present together. However, now I had bought something together  
with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.

I felt this situation when a certain woman from a close village  
shouted at my mother because she didn't get what she wanted, she  
wanted some salt to put in her relish.

My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at  
home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked  
on mucus secretions.

When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me,  
because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.

This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact  
a few years ago.

My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out  
with me only because of my defect.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father.  
I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either  
parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and  
the stepfather disgusted me.

I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my  
sadness was so great that until today I remember everything  
about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people,  
the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was  
the greatest sadness I felt.
Someone attacked me with a knife.
When I forgot the lyrics during a song contest.

When I provoked a fight with my mother, hurting her feelings very  
much.

Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known to  
have had great psychological disturbances.
I felt sadness when my grandfather died.

The time I went to see one of my girlfriends at Area 18 I found  
that she was not there but in the room she was sleeping, in the same  
room there were some women visitors with children so the room was  
smelling very badly with some faeces and urine in it so I didn't stay  
any longer.

When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the  
night.

When I pulled a chair from under someone at kindergarten and he  
hit his head.

It was during a school holiday - I was found necking a girl in my  
room by my father.
When I met friends I had not seen for the last 2-4 years.
[ Being close to another person.]
I was very fat, and was ashamed of my body.

When Christmas holiday started, I felt very joyful when I  
finished my last exam.

When I was at S.Y.Bajaj I wanted to get admission in another  
college and this was not easy and I felt angry.

A few months back I had gone to my friend's place and they offered  
me tea and coffee.  I do not have the habit of drinking tea or  
coffee and so they offered me a glass of milk instead, so I felt ashamed.

I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I  
categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any  
hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because  
I couldn't organize myself.
When I fought with my friends.

When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I  
needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.

I went to the cinema with my friends, without telling my mother  
about it as I had been to the cinema the day before also.  When  
she asked me where I had been, I lied.

In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite  
intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest  
future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I  
couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them  
threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my  
luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was  
quite  disappointed and disgusted.

When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gone  
for a walk.

When I was 10 years old I stained our bench with a fountain-pen,  
I tried to twin the cushions, but then there were colour nuances.  
Then my mother catched me, she saw it and became very angry.
When I was selected at TISS X.

When I noticed that a person I found attractive had seen me  
picking my nose.

I slipped on butter one evening in the Dining Commons landed on  
my rear causing my tray also to land on the floor.
When my brother was born.

I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the  
forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear  
noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.

I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like  
normal people.
A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.

During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know  
in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered  
her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our  
adresses.

When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just when  
he looked at me, I felt frightened.

A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many  
friends were present and good music.

When I beat up my brother in order to control him and make him  
obey my parents orders.

Being sexually assulted and told my friends about it (we cried  
together).

My nephew's mother just left one day (my brother and she were  
not married). My nephew, Anthony, was shaken. I was sad for him  
because a similar situation happened to me.

A friend wanted to give me a surprise into my room and I thought  
she was stealing from the room.
When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.

At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a  
sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off  
because he didn't like me.

I was afraid when I learnt that my father was seriously ill in  
hospital.
When my grandmother died of cancer.
I was told to do something I did not want to do.

When the teacher asked me a question, I did not know the answer  
and I just stood still for about a few minutes without saying a  
word.

When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had  
 seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been  
waiting to see us.

I was to prepare relish for the family. I overcooked it and no  
one liked the meal that day.
Cannot remember such a situation.

[ I do not remember when I last felf ashamed.  I do not usually  
feel ashamed of what I do.]

A few weeks back my daughter had very high fever and I was scared  
that it might lead to brain damage or convulsions.

A few weeks back I received a Christmas card from a friend in  
England.  She had not written to me in a very long time but it      
showed that she still remembered me.

My friend and I worked for the community centre by holding a booth.  
 One day my friend went off to another booth to play.  This  
meant that I was very busy and could not maintain order.  His  
behaviour disgusted me.

When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in  
public.

When I was involved in a car accident last November, after the  
first fall of snow.  I lost control of the car and it spun round  
and landed on the opposite side of the road, on the hard  
shoulder.  It was stopped by a pole on top of a bank sloping down  
to a stream.

When I saw a drunk man urinate upon himsellf and he seemed to be  
thoroughly content with it.

I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years,  
when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal  
that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a  
bit guilty for what had happened.

I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before  
I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my  
father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a  
flood of the same emotion.

When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard       
when it entered my room at night.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry  
examination.

A boyfriend with whom I split up with came over to a friend's  
house where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontation  
in another room he tried to find out if I was aroused by my  
friend by feeling my parts.

Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is  
something I just can not tolerate.

When I did bad on a chamistry midterm which I could have done  
well.

China cannot let you give more lectures because you are needed in  
the specialist clinics. We are so backward in medicine.
Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.

I ate very fattening food in front of my boyfriend who would like  
me to lose weight. I am supposedly pursuing a modelling career  
but first I must lose weight. I had been trying to diet.

A much older man took advantage of me during my childhood (four  
to eight years of age).
I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.
A fear of lack of personal powers.

In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was  
complete silence.

South Korea winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympic (more  
than China).

When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and  
that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange  
for the ones I had given her.

The emotion came to me when a certain girl who was not polite to  
her mother hit her sister severely.

I wanted to go out to walk but I didn't know either where or  
with whom, suddenly an invitation appeared.

During an argument between friends, one of them accused me of  
taking advantage of some other friends who usually come to the  
university in my car, saying that I ask them too much money for  
the petrol.

When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run  
in order to get away from him.  We were all alone and all I could  
see was this hand coming towards me.
Nearly caught masturbating.

I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be  
operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me  
in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.

I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the  
subject in this manner I will not attain this.

During a party I overheard a conversation about china. When I  
wanted to give my opinion one of the people came out to be Chinese  
and his opinion was right of course.
When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.
When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.

I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kind  
at school and I was only in form II then.

I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived  
them.

I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand  
into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came  
to report to my parents.

During military service I heard the story of someone who tried to  
commit suicide and as a result of this got a week custody.

Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did  
not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her  
dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the  
consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had  
done it.
When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.

My roommate being nice to a party leader in order to get into the  
party.

A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our  
relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was  
very angry about that.

The first time I went away with my boyfriend and lied about where  
we were staying.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

My teacher asked me a question which I failed to answer and I was  
told to stay behind after the class and give the answer after  
studying it from a book.

When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It  
made me forget all my problems.

At what I was capable of of selfishly using others for sexual  
encounters, while I held a vision of having a deepening  
above-board (you know, "girl next door") devotion to a girl in my  
head. My drives and actions did not match this so consequently I  
felt disgusted at my failure.

My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our  
relationship by letter.
When I was admitted to the University.

In form three we were taking our mock exams and someone else (a  
friend) was making noise when the examinateur picked on me and  
said that he would tear up my answer sheet.  I got very angry  
with the girls involved.
A very close friend left me.

I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardly  
studied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that I  
hadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.

Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much.  
Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their  
group, although it was late in the evening.
When my fellow classmates were involved in a quarrel.
When inadvertantly I found myself in the ladies room.

Taking a trip to crocokile country I fell out of the boat and was  
motivated by fear of being eaten to perform great swimming feats.

When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in  
my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the   
morning for manual work.

During 7th grade our class mobbed a famale teacher so badly that  
she had a breackdown and was hospitalized.
Saw the film about Eight Nations Army conquering Beijing.

When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him  
"Mister".  I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry  
as he had belittled me.

When I slipped on a glazed frost road and a car almost ran into  
me.

I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting  
for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly,  
inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful  
that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think "what  
others are thinking of me".  It was delightful to dance to one's  
heart content.
When I failed the grade seven exams.

[ On discovering the red-tapism and the bureaucratic, corrupt,  
decadent, degenerated infrastucture of every public utility,  
office and service; and the rampant corruption at every single  
level of education and other institutions.]

In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got  
ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these  
marks.

I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him  
but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.

I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad  
for a long period.

I suddenly found that those whom I considerered to be my good  
friends did not care for me.  Although I could still be with them  
I felt unimportant.  I deeply thought about the reason behind  
this so as to see who was responsible for this.  Finally I made  
up my mind and decided not to expect too much from them.  I was  
sad when I decided that they were no longer my good friends.

In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I  
was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.

When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents  
were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

Suddenly found out that I was the lasr one to leave the anatomy  
room.
Telling my parents that I did not well in an examn.

I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I  
planned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went to  
the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my  
consent.

When our cat was killed in a car-accident I was very angry at the  
driver of the car because he didn't take enough care.
I said nasty things which I did not mean to a friend.

I broke off with my partner as I wanted him as a friend and not  
as a lover.  He reacted very violently and I felt guilty as I  
had made him so desperately unhappy.

When I was offered a place in the university as a full time  
student.
My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.

When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (I  
thought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion of  
joy.

When I had insulted my father two years back, at that time I was  
very angry due to some reasons.

When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university  
telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.

When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to  
listen to me.
When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.
I went home and visited with my family and friends.

I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in  
February.

It was when I was allowed to take my wife away from her parents  
after being refused for three times on grounds that she should  
first write her examination.
When I shout at a colleague in classroom.

In 1983, my results at the university entrance exam were very  
poor - far from what I had expected.   I thought that I would not  
be accepted at the university.

I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several  
weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that  
two of them perished.

During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit  
suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she  
looked miserable.

Very often I take care for my little sister and oversee her  
duties. Most of the time everything went fine, but sometimes she  
absolutely didn't want to obey; then I hit her (we frequently  
were hit by our father).

The time when my sister had her first baby I was so happy and  
joyous because she stayed for two days after marriage before she  
had a child.
When I entered a toilet in a bar and it stank.
At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.

When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my  
standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who came  
to do it was very rude to my mother and me.  I rushed to thhe  
dealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as he  
seemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side.   
Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoke  
to him.  The mechanic was asked to apologize.

Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for -  
money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.

My parents attitude towards each other when they should become  
reconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.

When I was attending an authorized demonstrationand the police  
rushed brutally at the demonstrators, without any warning.

Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous  
when my school's team won the conference championship last year.

When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not  
allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I  
made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place,  
though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with  
my pals.

My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time.  
She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the  
relationship without going out with other people. I was her first  
boyfriend.

I felt ashamed when a friend, I had always respected, insulted me  
in public.  He was drunk.

I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the  
vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really  
surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it  
there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because  
of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard  
about that I was very angry.

I was driving and stopped at a stop light. I was planning to make  
a right turn as soon as it was clear. It was clear on the left so  
I started but a man was just in front of the car.

When I was watching a movie in which there was a pit full of  
dangers and there was only a small safe place on which a man was  
standing; he had to catch the lady who was thrown in or else !  
The pit was 20 feet deep.
When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.

After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great  
joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the  
whole of my studies.

Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which  
revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had  
thought possible.
When my mother scolded me for coming home late, i.e after 7 P.M.

On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's  
car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was  
forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The  
other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.
Saw someone acting in a false manner in public.

I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my  
school congratulating me for my performance at the previous  
year's exam.

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently  
and immorally
Arguing about price with private shop-assistant.

I found a problem in homework which would not get solved although  
I tried my best.

Going out with another girl besides my girlfriend and not telling  
her.

When my mother slapped me in the face, I felt anger at that  
moment.

My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These  
instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship  
which at the time seemed doomed to fail.

When I finished a test type of exam and did not dare to answer  
any question, I doubted whether I would pass the exam  or not.

I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my  
birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.
Some boys boasting about their ability to tell dirty jokes.

At a social event when none of the guests would help to serve  
food or clear tables. It was all beneath them.

I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to  
visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was  
very different from what I expected.
When the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.

I was ashamed when my friend and I were cross with each other  
till we apologized to each other.
Someone being arrogant to me.
Not applicable to myself.

When I slept for the first time all alone in the house where I  
live now. A man phoned me at 2.00 am. He wanted something from  
me. I was afraid.
When I could not complete my assignment on time.

I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in very  
bad taste.

It was during the beginning of the term. I had K100 and kept it  
in my handbag. I left the handbag in the wardrobe but didn't  
lock it. Next time I found that K30 were stolen.
When I saw President Reagan get elected.

That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and  
the person that did it got away without any punishment from the  
law.

I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was  
human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for  
the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.
My boyfriend returned after a long absence.

I ride my motorbike in my village and everyone stares at me as if  
I was a rare specimen.

It was a shameful moment when I heard that I had failed my  
Primary School leaving Certificate Exam in 1978. My girlfriend  
was there when the news was released.

My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch  
back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.
[ I feel angry when somebody is unjust to me.]

A man in a car was following me when I went running early one  
morning in a fairly secluded area.
When I was put into a tennis team below my standard.

I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I had  
longed for.

I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was  
crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not  
stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...

A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancer  
and has only a year to live.  I  heard about it 6 weeks ago.

When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my  
other friends and me.

Seeing persons spending money in a shopping center with  
completely indifference to the misery reigning in our country.

Once when I was walking alone at mid-night, I happened to put my  
foot on a frog, as it felt smooth I thought that it was a snake   
and I felt afraid.

One day I went to see a movie without my parents permission.  It  
was an adult movie and I was scared that my parents would not  
allow me to see the movie.  However after coming home I felt very  
guilty at what I had done.

[ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended  
on my conduct.]

When my brother was selected to the University of Malawi (the  
Polythecnic). I was very excited and I rejoiced due to one of our  
family members qualifying for University level at long last.

My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about  
kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I  
knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.
When my dog died.
I forgot to convey an important announcement.

Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact  
with a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast to  
Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt  
shamed when I finally confronted her again.

I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the  
part II exam.
When I couldn't go for a trip with my friends in a holiday.
Seeing a person panhandling money on Telegraph.

During a holiday in East-Germany I got aquainted with a boy who  
lived there. We started writing, but I only wrote once. I felt  
ashamed because I probably was one of his sparse contacts with  
western Europe.
When I got my B.Sc degree with first class.

I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect on  
other people.

Once by coincidence I clutched a stranger (in a rather intimate  
way), thinking it was my boyfriend. When by hindsight I  
feel ashamed when thinking about it.

I went to see the entrance examination results at university.  I  
rejoyced at my success.
When I got my drivers licence.
When I passed an exam which I had failed last year.
Not being able to answer question in a seminar.

One of my good friends told people something I had told her  
in confidence about someone else.
After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

At my native place I was riding my cycle, which did not have  
lights, at night and so a police man caught me.  I requested him  
to let me go but he would not so after a few minutes I just  
escaped.

I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our  
"11-months jubilee", I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red  
rose.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He  
telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.

I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I  
did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a  
disagreeable classmate watching the scene.

I cannot remember exactly such a situation. But I know that  
once I went to a very dirty lavatory and that disgusted me.

At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was  
prevented from participating in several activities.

Argument with roommate over a lock he had put on kitchen cupboard  
without telling anyone.

When I dated a close girlfriend's boyfriend a few times. He told  
me that it was over between them and I accepted it.  When she  
found out she finished our friendship.

I have chosen to put my son in a private school were the  
examination marks are low.  Every time that he gives me his term  
results I am left with a sense of guilt.

On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends.   
When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a close  
contact with people whom I regard greatly.

I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I  
had wanted to.

I was very scared when I went to the examination hall for my M.Sc  
examination as I had studied a limited partion of the course  
thoroughly and I was in great doubt whether that would be asked.

I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met  
someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my  
self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to  
myself.
Getting into a crowded bus.

Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work -  
harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker -  
disgusted by his implications.

I have been thinking of changing my major for a few months.  My  
original major was Chinese language and it blocks my way.  I have  
to face many problems at the sametime and I do not know what is  
real and virtuous.  I do not know if I am not interested in  
Chinese or if there are other factors which make me sad.  I am  
not very clear on what I can do for the study of Communication  
and Journalism.  I am not clear about what I can do.  What are  
the limitations ?   I hesitate but I feel more adjusted now.

Leaving University in 1982 following exclusion and lying to  
parents/friends about reasons for leaving, i.e. lying about the  
fact of having been excluded.

When I was ten I got shut in the school with a friend.  I had to  
jump out of a window and cross a beam 10 metres high.

As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it  
dying.

I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very  
"indepth" relationship and so after feelings of grief and loss  
were over I felt an immense sadness.

When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relieved  
because it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.
When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.

All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did  
not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number  
but I do not think that this was true.

I received money from my father at a time when I was completely  
broken.

When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus  
Christ as his saviour and Lord.

This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second  
time.

While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and  
irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.   
I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.
My son was born.

Saw my class leader acting like a God when he chose people to go  
to your English lectures.

Grandfather lives in a home for the elderly. He always looks  
forward to visits. On his birthday (by coincidence it was on  
"Mummy's day") however, nobody went to see him. Is the own family  
more important than grandfather ?

Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a  
pushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded by  
smouldering wood and flame.
Maltreatment of children.
When people next to me play the fool.

The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to be  
operated  and before the operation the doctor said that it was  
mater of life or death.

I remember my religious experience.  During  a gospel camp, a few  
friends of mine decided to believe in God.  The joy that I felt  
at that time was more than words can express.  I blessed them and  
praised God in my heart.
When I passed my B.A exams.
When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.
My roommate's sister committed suicide.

During a football game I made an offence towards an acquaintance.  
Later on this acquaintance also tackeled me and the game became  
very rude.

One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was  
supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.

I was at the corner shop, which I patronise regularly I had only  
a $ 50 note and I purchased about $ 3 worth of goods that I  
really needed - the keeper made sarcastic remarks to others about  
people using him to cash notes.

When a friend of mine had her period, while thinking she was  
pregnant.

We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquors  
left the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending to  
prepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rum  
down my throat.

When my ex-husband left our house, and the children cried because  
he was not coming back.

During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering  
with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for  
him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.

I took a math midterm and I knew I did really well and it was  
Friday so I felt great joy because the week was over and I did  
well on a test.

At a school dance when my supposed "best friend" kept walking  
away from me whenever I came near her.

My mother left my father for his best friend, and he moved to  
Papua New Guinea. Despite the fact that I am closer to my father  
than to anyone else in my family, I had to move in with my  
mother, and say good-bye to my father, not knowing when I would  
see him again.

I was accused of having drunk a bottle of liquor and then  
refilling with water.

One night, after having decided to finish our relationship, I  
took my girlfriend home.  While driving back home, I felt that I  
had not handled the whole thing very well.
Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.
I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.

When I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in a  
disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my  
body.
When my sister became pregnant at UNZA last year.

I was walking outside the union refec after rain when I tripped  
and fell.

Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middle  
of the night in Italy.
When I was at school.

When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I had  
soiled.  It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to want  
to see the blood stains.

When I was very young, one day, I kicked my grandmother and  
caused her an injury which took a long time to heal.

I had been separated from my girlfriend for about a year.  On her  
birthday I put a present in her mailbox.  I had spent two days  
choosing a suitable present for her.  I waited for a few days and  
there was no reply from her; at last I received a thank-you card  
in my mailbox.  On the card there was only my name, the words thank-you   
and her signature.  I was very sad then.

While watching the movie called "Deer hunter" on TV, when it  
showed how prisoners were treated.

One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something  
inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

I felt disgusted one day when, as we were eating, a child  
defecated on the table side.

When some people, including me, are treated in a way which  
equates them to an animal or a thing.
[ I was thinking about death.]

Talking to friends about how old you are and we cannot be as  
successful as you at your age.
Betraying someone's trust.

After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key  
inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own  
house but the house of people I hardly knew.

When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thought  
that he had told about it to a friend of his.

When I secretly tried smoking for the first time, being 12 years  
old.

I should have given a test lesson to get a job. I had no courage.  
I didn't make the test.
I failed to show up at an agreed date.
When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.
When I got low marks in B.Sc final.
When I passed my form three exams.

After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the  
friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers  
of the party, did not drive the intruders away.
When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.

My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me  
verbally.

It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate  
had an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutor  
caught him. During this time I was turning my question paper and  
it made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matter  
for him to be caught.

When I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes, it was  
almost a brothel.

New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the  
steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the  
first time.

A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she  
had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.
When unjustified hurting other people.

The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the  
moment of dying I was with her.
Not finishing homework in time.
Not chosen for all English classes.

During an informal discussion I contributed a lot even though I  
had not spent much time studying.  Whenever someone said that  
someone was not paying attention, or that he had too many other  
things to do, or that the persoon was not trying his best, I  
would feel ashamed.
Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.

This was when one of the Clinical officers scolded us in the  
hospital on how to make beds but we did not deserve to be  
scolded.

When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see  
her predicament from the window.  She was given a the cold  
shoulder.

I felt guilty when I read an advertisement for a job as a chemist  
in the newspaper and when my friend asked me if I had applied for  
that job, I told him that I had not even seen the paper of that  
day.
When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

When I was informed that a short story I had written had been  
accepted for publication.

I was travelling in a bus from school going home for holiday. In  
the bus unfortunately I stepped on a bag in which there were  
delicate things.
Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours  
were terrible.

A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain  
things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an  
aggressive manner.

A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense  
feeling of sadness.

I felt sad when a thief stole all the clothes from my friend's  
cupboard at school (boarding).
I am not doing what I should with this questionnaire.

When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a  
boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date  
a boy whom I liked for a long time.

A girl in our class was nicknamed "fatsy". Later, I heard that  
she suffered from diabetes mellitus.
When one lets friends down

I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.  He  
was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point  
of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.

When I heard the examination results and when I recovered after  
having been sick for a week.
NO RESPONSE.

Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her  
for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking  
"the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and  
encounter.
A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.
I was afraid that I would fail an examination.

I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was  
sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think  
was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water  
it seemed like no one would care or remember.

During carnaval I danced for a few minutes normally I don't dance  
because I am rigid in my moving around during a dance, I stopped  
very soon.

When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing  
around on me.

Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second  
birthday.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special  
occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my  
family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process  
which have been going on for centuries.

In a situation whereby a friend's actions were deliberately  
against my wishes and (with) no regard to my feelings.

I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my  
sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the  
telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

After a party in which I made love with a boy in public. Later on  
I heard that others were talking about me and called me a slut.

Recent break-up with my girlfriend. We had been together for over  
a year. I was overseas and discovered over the phone (while I was  
at work).

In a playground I was playing at the seesaw with a little niece.  
I wanted to stop but nobody came to help me. When I got off, all  
alone the seesaw fell down with a big smash. My niece got hurt  
above her eye. Now there is a scar.
Every time I do not write something well in English.

Whenever my father smokes the smell makes me feel very  
uncomfortable.  He never listens to my complaints and I curse him  
furiously in my mind.  I cannot solve this problem by violence  
because of traditional moral values.

A person I really like left for overseas for a few months, I had  
hoped to go out with her soon.

I told someone that I still had a relationship with a boy  
although it was finished already 3 months before. That person  
seriously discussed several things relating that issue. Then I  
felt very miserable because I had told lies.

When I crashed by bike into an old lady crossing a road and  
knocked her down.

Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent  
as they are when you are young.
When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.
Falling in love.

I reproached my mother's cooking and criticised her  
personality, and she felt hurt and depressed.

One night I had to bike home all alone after a party. Then I  
found out that I was pursued by a man in a car.

I told my elder brother that he was irresponsible and that I did  
not care for what he did because he was teasing me.

I felt very disgusted at a friend to whom I had given a Psychology  
book to read, and she did not care to give me back the book  
during the exams.
My boat running into another boat.

I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to  
attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.
Did not finish homework.

I was disgusted to see a person vomitting and I was told to clean  
the place where the vomit was.

When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a  
chair.
You ignored the fact that we could not hear you at the back.

I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I  
had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.

While drinking a soft drink, I had the impression of swallowing    
a piece of glass so I went to the district hospital and got  
admitted there.

I felt guilty one day when I was accused of running away from  
classes and I was caught.

I was angry when someone stole a magazine which I had borrowed  
from another friend and locked it in a drawer.

When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games  
with a friend.

When I stand at the bus stop for one hour waiting for the bus to  
arrive.

When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he  
made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.
When I entered a bar looking for a friend.

I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3  
months without seing each other.

In a study group, a person always liked to argue on some  
unimportant, irrelevant and minor points.  He tried to persuade     
others in an unfriendly way.  He was obstinate and would not accept   
other's point of view.

I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark and  
windy.  I became rather panicky on the way to my house.

In a certain occasion I saw a dog in the street eating something  
so strange gooey that I wasn't able to eat lunch because I  
remembered the scene all the time.

Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had  
passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the          
biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.
When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.

It was about midnight and I wanted to go to the countryside (I  
was in town) to watch the stars in the sky.  My mother did not  
like this, in spite of it I went out for a while.  My mother got  
angry.

While shopping, a person close to us created an uncomfortable  
situation for those who were with her.

When I was 17, I told Mum I came in at midnight, when really it  
was 3.30.
Not brave enough to take up a challenge in a group discussion.
My mother's death.

Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find no  
dinner prepared as I had expected.

When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our  
relationship was new, fresh, vital etc. once again.

I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there I  
found that the bed had been wet the previous night.

When the others did not do their bit of work on a group  
assignment task, and I had to do all the work.

The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor  
said that the ear was completely all right.

When I was not selected to go to the University of Malawi I felt  
very sad.

I arrived late at a seminar concerning my major subject at  
university, although I had been appointed to formally oppose the  
paper which was being presented.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me  
something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it,  
but at that time I was not able to remember it.
When I found out the CIA was mining Nicaraguan harbors.
Helping older people on the toilet.

I was alone in a cottage I often stay in.  I was woken up by a  
rustling sound in the middle of the night.
When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.
Canoeing across harbour in winds - 20 knots and rising seas.

During a football match, the other team was rude and they hurt my  
team members and me.  The coach was prejudiced against us and  
punished us unreasonably.  Later we fought with each other and  
the match had to be cut short.
I had a quarrel with my parents

I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse with  
another one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.

I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than  
me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted  
more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in  
vicinity.
Telling a lie.

Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and said  
no. I then went and didn't the same thing with someone else and  
hoped the first person never found out.
Person talking about a situation while eating.
Someone acting stupid in public.

It was quite recently, at the football match between the national  
teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish  
referee who ran the match quite partially.

The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my  
grade six.

That day I was alone at home after coming home from school.  I did  
not know where everyone else had gone, I kept waiting for them to  
come back and nobody came.  It was getting very late and I was  
terrified.

I realized that a fellow member had grown spiritually.  I was the  
leader of a spiritual group and had prayed for him.  He did not  
want to burn the incense but his mother forced him to do it.   
Finally his mother told him that he could discontinue if he got  
good results at school.

When I saw a girl in my economics discussion section smiling and  
asking stupid questions to the TA. just to get attention. She was  
obviously ass-kissing. It happens in every Econ. discussion held  
weekly.

I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of the  
student's association did not blame me, they helped me do the  
work.
The sudden death of one of my parents.
When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.

While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a  
woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property -  
via a flooded river !

A girl who also hires a room in the house where I live always  
tries to make a quarrel with everyone available she disgusts me.
Overeating a traditional type of food - blood pudding.
A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.
I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.

One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then  
realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to  
have them as friends.

A friend's boy-friend treated her very badly, let her serve him,  
provoked her and just utilized her.

When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not  
have a raincoat on me.

Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a  
catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the  
food or when watching the way some people eat.

When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide  
how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of  
such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she  
told me.
When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.

During the week-end at home, my mother fries greasy and unhealthy  
meat dishes which make me feel sick.

Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed  
terribly.

My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them.  
But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am  
to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is  
not late still.

In March I was busy studying during the night I could only sleep  
two or three hours only for fear that I would be weeded and sent  
back.

I went to a pub with a group of friends (not very close) and  
I was with one girl most of the time, while the other girls in the  
group wanted to be with me.  They stopped talking to the girl I  
was with.

Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.  Naturally this  
is during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results.   
However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear.   
This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of student  
lectures.  I was one of the participants and my lecture happened  
to be the opening lecture.  I had been confident all morning, about  
twenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failing  
me.  I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was really  
paralyzed.  This incident of fear is still fresh.

In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the  
opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions  
as negative. We however only posed several questions which she  
couldn't answer.
I cut a friend's hair in anger, without any consideration.
To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.

My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values)  
and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have  
noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by  
drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.

When my present boyfriend asked me initially to go out with him I  
had waited a long time for this to occur.

When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged -  
although I was glad that he had found what he wanted, I was very  
sad at my own personal loss, since I had always hoped we might  
one day reconcile.

During the summer I received grade cards from my TA's. I expected  
a B no better in Computer Science. I looked at the card - I got an  
A - I was ecstatic.

I call my mother at least once a week. However last week I  
completely forgot. This morning she called me, she thought I felt  
ill.

This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by  
a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally  
spoiled my New year's night.

The curriculum of the year !   The English course was very heavy.  
 I had not prepared and the teacher asked several questions  
during class.  The students were not ready to answer the  
questions and the teacher was frustated.

I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter.  
However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too  
late.
Finding out that the girl I like does not like me.
When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.
When I was in the toilet and someone came in.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of  
being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at  
work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been  
drinking.

I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved  
who had to leave for her motherland.
Our neighbour came and gossiped, about others, with my parents.
Had fear of losing husband.
Being hooted at when I was learning to drive.

I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well and  
someone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.
Being insulted in public.

One day I heard from a friend that the boy I loved had gone out  
with her and not with me.

When I saw in the newspapers, on the T.V, and magazines the  
chaotic situation caused by the drought and hunger in  
Mauritania.

When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.   
A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see  
him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.
When I saw someone eating live worms.
When I passed a very important exam.

When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long  
time, would come and see me.

When I was touring Asia with my present football team, I saw old  
Europeans with young asiatic prostitutes.
When I failed the S.S.C examination I felt very ashamed.

When I used to go to my chief asking about any doubt about the job  
and he didn't care, didn't answer me, leaving me speaking alone.
When my brother was very late in arriving home from work.

A teacher gave me lower grades than I was entitled to, and was  
hoping for.

Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into notice  
but thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at the  
first moment I felt shame, not ache.

The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves  
from the flying bullets.  This incident occured on our way to  
Feira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.

When my boyfriend did not turn up in time as he promised he would  
be coming.

I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for  
a long period, my father came back home.
My roommate messing up our room.

After having told an authority figure a very large lie I was told  
she believed me, because she believed I had never lied to her.

When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I  
like.
When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.

When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously  
and fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightly  
damaged.

When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused  
because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my  
boyfriend found out.

Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me  
afraid.
When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.

When I was in F4 I led my class to a riot.  However the form  
master said that my conduct was good and asked me to tell him the  
names of those who had taken part in it.   I replied that I did  
not know.

I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about  
"Hainburg". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the union  
speak about the situation.

Not being able to spend more time with a friend who was visiting  
me.

When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for  
hours. She was in a good mood.

When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I  
am shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular  
because there is no time for anything else.
Hit a dog with my car, and didn't stop.

This situation happened when my friend me with a knife which I  
stole from him.

I was angry when I had not been granted a leave out pass during  
the last weekend.

Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he told  
me that although he told me he was going to take me to the  
concert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayed  
overnight and I said "well, when he leaves me I will be ruined  
for awhile, but for now we're together." I woke up in his arms  
and it was the happiest moment of my life.

My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.   
She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things  
as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

When I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smoking  
tobacco.

I beat my young sister because she refused to wash plates. She  
started crying and I felt sorry and guilty for what I did.

My roommate refused to walk with me to the English lectures. I  
have to walk alone in the dark. Lectures are in the biology  
building.
While dancing in a restaurant last week.

I am afraid of my academic results as I will face several  
problems.  I am scared of my limitations and the unlimited  
problems and I do not know how to cope with them.
When my father passed away.

When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a  
boyfriend.

I asked someone to bring some present to my father and found out  
that he is not a reliable person. I was afraid if my father would  
not get the presents he would be angry with me.

When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated  
teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite  
undeservedly.

I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunately  
we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I was  
ashamed when I told my friend about it.

[ This is an everyday feeling.  Many situational events : causes  
are unclean and dirty environment, illiteracy, poverty and  
neglect of human resources, disgust at the lack of perception on  
the part of us ( educated few) for the lack of drive and drive  
towards their redemption. ]

The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad  
then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

In the 12/83 my boyfriend asked me to forget him, as it would be  
easy.

I was testing my new roller skates in the street, suddenly a dog  
ran barking in my direction, very threatening. I was very  
startled and terribly upset.

My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad and  
lonely.

Feeling inadequate in a group situation, being unable to convey  
my own thoughts and feelings.

I partly colored my hair black. My mother didn't like it and  
reproached me to be a "subversive element". Later on she stated  
that this was due to my friends. As I see it, this all resulted  
from colouring my hair.

When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a  
very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.
When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.

I was ashamed one day when we were found stealing and roasting  
maize cobs from Agricultural experimental projects.
Aticle published.

This is an event I will never forget.  I am considered a good  
mimic.  This particular day we were waiting for a professor  
to take her class.  This  professor had a peculiar accent and a  
very horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had this  
class at the fag end of the day.  So this particular day I got  
into my element and started imitating the professor, and the  
professor entered the class right in the middle of it .  I was  
unaware of her presence, some of my friends tried to warn me but  
it was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.  Then I  
suddenly noticed the silence and turned around to see her  
entering the class.  I do not know till today if she actually saw  
what I had been doing or she had completely ignored it.  Through   
out that lecture I died of shame.  All the more shameful was the  
fact that she gave me a character certificate.
Getting into this university to do medicine.

I had a habit of wetting my bed when I was young.  One day, when  
I was invited to my friend's place to stay for the night, it  
happened again.  I was ashamed of myself.

When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the  
Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.

Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one  
week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my  
friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was  
terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an  
improper and unsavoury conversation.

A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December  
last year.

In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and  
behaved in keeping with his state.
I kicked the chair in the classroom to express my anger.
I was bitten by a dog.

I felt disgusted when my appointment to meet the E.N.T.  
specialist had been turned down. The specialist came from U.K.  
and went the same day and we do not have one.

Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and  
wine.
When I got separated from the man I loved so much.

A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she went    
on holiday (I live in a collective).

I was trying to have sex with my best friend's girl but she did  
not agree to it.
Once I had to visit a rather special person.

My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, but  
it was hopeless, he had to be shot.

An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken  
enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands were  
hurt.

On a road trip with a group of sorority and fraternity people, I  
became intoxicated and basically raped. I don't remember the  
actual event, but I know the feeling that I experienced later.
Forgot to collect post for a friend.

I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things  
more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very  
self-centered.

Yesterday I read in the newspaper that a 30 year old woman had  
abused her 2 month old son and had caused his death.  I was very  
angry after reading this as this is not a human act and to abuse  
so fragile a life is not a forgivable sin.
Passing a very difficult examination which I didn't expect - MCE.

My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years.  
His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.   
It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but when  
much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn,  
I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.

Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different  
city, I felt no longer "under the wing" of my parents even though  
they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I  
was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions.
When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.
I had failed some subjects in mathematics.

I was raped once when I went through a dark alley at the back of  
our house. The man pushed me in the bushes. I fought back and  
succeeded to escape.

One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could not  
fish as a fisherman had already put his net there.  We pulled  
out the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away.   
The net was large and may have cost $1000.  The fisherman used  
the net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.

When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the  
teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the  
materials out she turned round and saw me.

When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was  
happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to  
have a good time without alcohol.

I was stood up for a date function by someone who I really cared  
for.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.

Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher -  
waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.

I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words  
at a man without any reason whatsoever.

I was in a very small class and the professor said something  
about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.

When I forgot to take out money for my mother. She asked me what  
she would do, because I had messed up her program for the  
following day.

On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It  
stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it  
but I was very frightened.

When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had  
passed away I was very sad for the children were not even sick  
before death but suddenly died.

When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his  
own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.

When I was leaving home I decided to leave without saying  
good-bye to my young brother.  My brother saw me and said,         
" Will you not say good-bye to me?"  He is only 31/2 years old.

Once I bought my sister a pair of sports shoes as she was going  
to join an athletic meet.  However the shoes were a little big  
and had a few flaws.  She muttered all the way and blamed me for  
having wasted her money anf I felt guilty.

I was playing a sport in an advanced PE class and many of the  
people were not advanced.

With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. When we  
wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I  
had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m., actually it  
was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.

When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying  
Psychology because of its low status.

After training for an Australian championship competition for a  
year and then injuring myself 2 weeks before the competiotion.

I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job.   
After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from  
anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies  
were the only alternative.
When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.
When I feigned sick leave from work.

Someone told me that I was chosen for English lectures because  
the class leader is going out with me (not true).

When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thus  
including me in the "family war".

When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident and  
that I had a scleral tear in my left eye.

In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the  
sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.

I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for College  
education.

A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad  
when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had  
once regarded as great and significant.

After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being  
selected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.
I had to change a baby's clothes for the first time.

When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher  
tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I  
burned with shame then.

When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as  
thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the  
overall result was poor.

My parents were out and I was the eldest at home.  At midnight a  
male stranger phoned us and spoke to me in a rough language.  I  
hung up and heard someone walking outside our door.

The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a  
song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song  
about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.

Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with  
unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked  
in me many negative emotions.

At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her,  
and not being committed to her.
When I heard a lion roar for the first time.

When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were  
made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to  
do this.

When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee  
and I refuse to give him this.

This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday life  
in a city like Bombay.  One day I was travelling by bus, three  
men dragged two fellows out of the bus.  Once outside they were  
beaten into pulp.  These two fellows, who got beaten, were pick-pockets  
and they were being beaten by all and sundry.  I thought to  
myself -"what is life?".  It is one hell of a place where  
everyone is after someone else.  One waits to cut the throat of  
the other one just for a living, (money).  When I think about  
such things - the purpose of life, etc, I feel very disgusted and  
dejected.

One day, I discussed a very important question with A.  A  
suddenly declared that he would not accept my position and  
thought that he himself was right.  Moreover, he attacked   
strongly, not my opinion but me personally.
