My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the final  
examination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade they  
said nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have become  
very angry.
I fell outside the door of my house.

When I almost ran over a small boy who suddenly was in front of  
my car.
My last genetices midterm - a decent grade.

This is difficult, since I don't remember feeling disgust towards  
anyone.

Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth.  
They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelve  
weeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said I  
needed psychiatric treatment and give me no support.

A few years back I had proposed love to a girl who later turned out  
to be related to me.  Though we were in love with each other, we  
both felt ashamed and withdrew from each other.

When I was about 17 years old and I stole some pens from a  
stationery store because I didn't have enough money.
I was called racial slurs behind my back.

While at school I had to write an essay for doing something wrong  
that I didn't do. I wrote the essay about how I was mistreated and  
got Saturday morning detention along with a few other kids, but  
they didn't show up.

When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not even  
express my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.

I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends  
of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things  
wrong.
When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.
At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.

Winning a race that I had been training for, for many weeks.  
(Running Race).

A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along  
with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I  
had to face the situation.

A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him  
until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.
Won a prize for effort.

Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. "Tried" because  
it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not  
competent and cultured.

When I inadvertantly entered the ladies room and met some girls  
on my way out.

The second time I went to the entrance exam to V.S.P. and  
didn't get approved.

My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my  
grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory  
comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had  
died recently.

When my boyfriend last told me he loved me after I gave him an  
impulsive kiss.

I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in  
love with another man.

When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and  
war.
Before an exam which I, finally did not take.
Comments from other children on my alcoholic father

Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby  
my financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will be  
well catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for the  
last five years of my life.
When I heard the bad news about the death of a close person.
When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.

I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected  
manner.

At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him more  
than anyone else because he does not realise how much love and  
happiness there could be between them, and is, and how much he is  
damaging himself apart from mum.

Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled  
out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of  
traffic lights.

When I opted for my research field, for them the percentage of  
marks was more important than my knowledge.

I was ashamed when my classmates discovered that I fell in love  
with an uneducated girl.

A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never  
accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.
Saw people quarreling in a bus.

When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and  
this was obvious to a third pereson.

I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.  I had gone camping         
with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very   
sudden to me.

I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship which  
we created ourselves.

When my mother threatened me with thrushing me of the stairs, when  
I once more should make a comment.

When I received the S.Y.J.C results, the marks I obtained were  
not up to my expectations and I missed admission in engineering.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing  
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd  
taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last  
3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for  
Council.

When my girl and I decided to get back together after our  
separation.

When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take  
him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.

My class leader told me I am not chosen for your English  
lectures.

When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been  
careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary  
mistakes concerning things I know and understand.

When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He  
would have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination,  
even though his case was relatively mild.

I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working  
place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at  
the Higher Agricultural Institute.

When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not  
know how long he would live.

The trick was really intolerable.  They hid it, and I was worried  
and restless all day.  When I saw them I really wanted to slap  
each one of them.

I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at  
a distance of about four metres.

I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close  
friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being  
right dominated.

When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was  
occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time  
student at UNZA.
I thought I had taken a decision but I hesitated.

The first time that I saw a dead person.  This was when I started  
my gross anatomy practicals.
Suddenly met someone in the biology building at night.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.
After a big fight with my parents.

I heard part of a conversation in which one talked very low about  
women.
Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.

I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had  
trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father.  
I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this  
emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can  
happen in this world.
Some students talking when other people are having a nap.

After my shoulder operation, I woke up in the hospital room  
alone. I was in pain and was still under heavy medications. I  
could not find my parents.
Because I had not studied.
Watching the Asian Olympic game (China winning).

My sister once stole my mother's money and made her very angry.   
After this my mother would beat her up for unreasonable reasons.   
One day my sister lent her book to a friend without telling my  
mother about it.  When my mother learnt this she beat her up and  
even threatened her with a pair of scissors.

My classmate at TISS has the habit of biting his nails and ever  
since my childhood I have never liked this habit.  This person is  
near me in class, dining hall and the campus so I suggested that  
he should stop biting his nails.  However he found it difficult  
and my disgust feelings have not changed.

I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a  
friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my  
boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting.  
After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell  
him that.

My father has a chronic desease. In the autumn of 1983 he had a  
very strong fit or seizure.

When I was 12 years old I was caught by the Ticket Collector when  
travelling without a ticket.
Being threatened by another person.

When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I  
felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.

A close relative of mine died in a serious car accident.  I was  
one of the first two people to see the corpse and I had to do it.  
 Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time  
that I was seeing a corpse.

I insulted the girl to whom I had proposed when she turned me  
down.

I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text  
and didn't stop stuttering.

It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my  
sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so  
that I could take my exams.

My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another  
close friend of mine.

Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV  
dealer.

Through the media and their presentation of a kidnapped child who  
was raped.

My teacher reminded us not to do a Summer job, however I did it  
for two months.  Yesterday I was chatting with my teacher and  
when we talked of the Summer job, I felt ashamed.
I saw a lot of starving people in a T.V news report.

Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. business  
managers to their actions esp.
When I "hated" one of mmy flatmates who was nice to me.

I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg,  
especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.

One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There  
was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.
I was caught sneaking sweets.

Before one of my final exams of the third year - natural  
sciences.

I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my  
brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.
Failed to keep an appointment.
This situation occurred when I entered into a smelling ward.

When going for my driver's licence for the third time, because  
everything, it seemed, hinged on getting it. I was really nervous,  
and the testing Officer made me a little afraid as well. There  
were lots of things to worry about. I passed however.

Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of  
darkness when going home.
I said something which was against my conscience.

I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat.  
He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a  
drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting.  
Besides, he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be  
pitied.
I felt joy when I entered at the University.

I recently became sexually involved with my sister's lover. I  
care for him very much, but I am ashamed of the hurt I may cause  
her.

I felt ashamed when I fought with my mother on some issue, and  
caused her trouble.

I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I  
went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it  
really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its  
life.

When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I  
had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a  
malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.
I found I was pregnant and unmarried.
My grandfather's death.
At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.

The first time that I caressed a girl, I was about thirteen and  
she was eighteen.  I noticed that it did not affect her at all.

My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I  
had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day  
enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.
Doing anatomy alone for the first time.

I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, I  
called my mother.

Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only  
thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking  
only about himself.

As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an  
examination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longer  
time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

I worked with several classmates on a project.  I was very  
anxious about the project while my partners showed no concern   
and when we had meetings on the project my classmates  did not  
pay any attention.  Some of them read books while the others  
argued on irrelevant questions.  The meeting would go on for two  
hours without the main theme being discussed.  We wasted time and  
could not reach a compromise.  My classmates avoided doing the  
work and the responsibilities, they seemed to value other  
projects more than this one.

I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was  
probably an imposter.
I felt guilty when I "stole" the boyfriend of a friend of mine.

A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend.  
Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was  
shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long  
time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full  
speed.
Watching TV about china is behind in winning gold medals.
I offended my mother.

Passing (by car) over a bridge where only one car could pass. There  
was a precipice on both sides, no protection grilles, and the  
bridge was completely muddled.

I was beaten up at a private New Year's party once, through no  
fault of mine.

At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and  
distrusted me.

One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some  
strange noises which put my imagination to work.
When I ate a rotten apple.

Last year, when I took the college entrance examinations I  
failed the FUVEST. It was for me the most frustrating situation  
because I had studied all year long, and only thought about this.

I was disgusted when my brother was arrested because of stealing  
money.

When I heard that there had been some women raped at uni, just  
near where I usually park my car and walk by myself at night.  
Although I wasn't in danger it unnerved me for days and I was  
fearful whenever walking through the area.

After a disagreement between my parents, when I was alone with my  
father and my sister, the aggression continued, when my father  
tried to put me and my sister against my mother revealing facts  
that had happened in the past like a talk between my father and  
his mother in law where she told him that my mother was not quite  
save.

I had a small argument with a relative and some other people got  
implicated.  It resulted in a proper row.
A close friend died.

I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down,  
was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one  
who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told  
the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and  
threatened me.
The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.

I felt disgusted when I was in a restaurant which didn't appear  
to be clean and orderly. (I do not like to be in unclean  
environments).
Forgot to turn up on prescribed day for jury service.

I was a passenger in a jumbo-jet which was accelerating down the  
runway and almost at the point of take-off, when the pilot  
suddenly braked and put the engines into reverse thrust, in an  
obviously urgent attempt to stop the aircraft. The hostesses show  
signs of concern and my first thought was that something was on  
the runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.

When I was a Sr. in HS. one of the class counselors died of  
hepatitis. She was very sensitive. She knew my shyness and drew  
me out to improve myself image. I missed her funeral - so I could  
not publically grieve. My parents didn't understand.

My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the          
primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.   
Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him  
away, and they later contacted his parents.

Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and  
I had not seen him for 10 years.

When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned  
my love.
I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.

When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was  
rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.

I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for my  
exams.

This happened when I could not get into the school I had  
initially wanted, and ended up doing something I had never  
thought I would do.

Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procure  
abortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.

When I found out my roommate had been talking behind my back  
about very personal things.
When I broke my leg I felt fear.

I and my cousin went to a filmshow at night. We went without  
making it known to my mother. While we were there at interval, I  
came across my mother just close to where we sat.

A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left  
some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My  
uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that  
we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.

When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relation to her (I  
lived with her for several years).
Having a good trip on a boat with good friends.

When I discovered that my girlfriend was going around with  
another boy.

Motor failure on a boat outside Gottenburg when we were in heavy   
seas and the wind was strong.  As we could not steer the boat we  
drifted towards the rocks.  We did not succeed in attracting the  
attention of any passerby until 4 hours had elapsed.

I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation:  
suddenly a friend came in and said "Have you already heard  
that..."; there was a terrible consternation, silence, then  
everybody shouted excitedly "How could that happen...".

After making a joke about a friend's marriage that was too  
personal.
I saw in the street a man spitting.
Slaughtering of animals.

When I failed an exam last Summer.  I had worked very hard for it  
and I was very disappointed thinking that it was hopeless to  
continue at college.  I did overreact.
When my behaviour was immoral - thinking about sex.

I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes  
came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents  
attention by talking to them.

I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment  
but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed  
holiday job.

When an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no just  
reason, and thus showed off his power.
My girl-friend left me.

When an old schoolfriend phoned me to arrange an appointment to  
talk about old memories. I hadn't seen him for 8 years.

Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected in  
tutorial.

A female classmate was always late for meetings which were for  
the homework and not social gatherings.  We were very busy and  
the deadline was close but we had to waste half an hour or an  
hour waiting for her as we could do nothing else then.

When I became conscious that men don't wnat anything they don't  
have a goal. They have: sex, but this isn't important.

I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at  
first he had said that he would not do that.
My boat didn't win a race which we were favored to win.

One day when I was sitting in a not very crowded bus, a middle   
aged woman was standing beside me.  The person sitting next to me  
got up to get off and this woman pushed me and occupied the seat.  
 Then she took off her shoes and put her feet on the seat.

This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and  
found him screwing my girlfriend.

When I was accepted as a student of Psychology here at  
Gutttenburg.

When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it  
I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for  
not having the time to write a good essay.

During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about the  
subject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.
After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.

Some people whom I do not like at all, and one of the reasons is  
their physical appearance.

I was involved in a ... attempt on a man I had developed a close  
warming relationship with. Although I knew I had done everything  
I could and that his progress of a "normal" life was poor I felt  
guilty as if I could have done more.

I was sitting on the bus coming back from school. A man from  
nearly forty years sat beside me. After a while I looked at him  
and saw that he was looking at me with opened throusers and  
holding his penis.

I had asked the teacher to write a recommendation letter for me,  
but I had not provided enough information and had run short of  
time.

I felt very guilty when I tried to teach swimming to my younger  
brother, as I myself could not swim very well and my brother  
had started sinking to the bottom, however my elder brother  
saved him.

When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up to  
change the working environment.
When my beloved uncle was shot dead by relatives.

A girlfriend ended our relationship in an abrupt and unexpected  
manner.

When my darling found me walking hand in hand with another girl  
whom I loved also.

Every year during carnival I am very joyful I have an intense  
feeling of happiness then.
Receiving a nice present from my parents.

Before Uni started, I had to leave home and take up residence in  
Brisbane (the "big smoke") leaving home, my family, and moving to  
such a big place was quite intimidating at first, and I was  
anxious about it.

When I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day.   
She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolish  
thing to do.

Not succeeding in a cross-country skiing competition, which I  
intended to win.
People impolite with me because I did not get a good report.
Saw some girls dressed up like Americans

I lied to someone and some time later this person found out that  
I had not told him the truth.
When my grandfather died.

One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men  
molesting my girlfriend and me.

On the road there was a dead animal with its entrails showing and  
its skull crushed.

I was afraid when I met my Uncle because this time I was with my  
boyfriend I thought I was not going to be given pocket money.

The time I shouted at most of my friends at a party.  It was as if  
 all my friends had done something wrong, or may be it was the  
influence of the beer.

During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When  
we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his  
way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he  
finally arrived but after a very long time).

One day I was near home, kissing my boyfriend in a car when my  
mother appeared and asked me to go home, because she didn't know  
about the event.

I am a school teacher.  One of the classes does not obey me at all,  
keeps on talking, does no work.  One afternoon, everything went  
wrong, and I got exceedingly angry.

I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she  
went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It  
was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who  
had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we  
went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

It was when my father caught me with a girl in dark corners and  
asked me what I was doing there.
To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.

I made an unkind remark about the ethnicity of some friends  
without realizing it.

Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on  
entering a government building with several people there.
In an important situation for me, my father behaved inadequately.

As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a  
neighbour.

A day I was with my boyfriend and a couple of friends in a bar,  
and he said something that I didn't like (I don't remember what).  
Without thinking I slept him in his back, getting ashamed and  
sorry just after.

Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me  
when I was not responsible for the theft.
When my dress was stolen.

When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock.  
 I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the  
gallows.
When I got a small present form a person I like very much.

When I received the mark well above requirements for the course I  
wanted to enter, yet I was not accepted - anger at the injustice  
of it, because I didn't receive early release of H.S.C. marks.

My friend and I planned to search for old documents and utensils  
in the cellar. It was very late at night when we arrived in the  
cellar. He indicated the place where the police (40 years ago) found  
two dead bodies. I got very scared when he told me this story.

When my Bictorian "friend" was staying at my house we ere going  
places together, and sleeping together. At the time I had a  
boyfriend locally. The first time I had to face him after  
sleeping with the guy from Melbourne I felt very guilty.
When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.
I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.

When I found that my ability to do ordinary work was worse than  
my fellow mates.

Guilt at having pressed another person to expose/explore his  
personal weaknesses/faults, to the extent that the other person  
was made to feel terrible/defensive.

When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and  
there was no water to clean up.

When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few  
days later I was shown to be wrong.

Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink made  
with milk and usually drunk warm) with my friend at College. We  
get on really well, don't withold any feelings about each other's  
friends and are pretty good at cheering each other up when we are  
homesick.
When I went for the first time in my life to a nudist-beach.

After having watched a crime show on the TV, I was about to take  
the dog for a walk. Then, suddenly, there was a man on the  
porch... (We live some distance away from other people).

Political and military trnsgressions around the world, generally  
speaking. This cannot be described through this questionaire.

My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed  
there a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.

My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months  
in hospital.

After a courtship of three months I made an end to it. The boy  
was very sad about this.
When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.
When I had to act alone a character for a public (40 people).

Once, my friend and I went to the Tai 60 to cycle.  My mother had  
told me not to go.  Unfortunately I broke my pectoral girdle and  
had to go to hospital.  When my mother  came to see me I felt  
guilty as I had not listened to her and I had to soon sit for a  
public examination.

One night I and my friends went to the cemetery. We stopped the  
car in front of the wall and suddenly the grave digger appeared  
over the wall looking like a ghost. I was already afraid and  
almost died.

After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to  
Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a  
man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his  
car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being  
robbed in Marocco.
When a close friend wilfully cheated me.

When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on  
my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.
My parents told me that they do not like my friend.

When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark about  
something I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.  My deed  
had been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore my  
sense of shame.

I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A  
few days later my mother noticed it and asked me about it, I told  
her that I had no idea.
When I got engaged to a boy of my choice.
Having a fight with a class mate.

When the results of the part I exams came out I felt tremendous  
joy in my heart.  The results came out after a long period of  
worry and anxiety, so it gave me endless relief and joy.

When at school I thought that I was going to get the best results  
in mathematics, but it was someone else who got the prize.

One day, at an important place I met a group of girls and while  
we were waiting for a bus these girls started smoking and  
commanded me to smoke; I felt very disgusted.
When I offended my parents without wanting it.

One summer when I was camping with friends they devised and  
elaborate plan to scare me by having our camp attecked by a wild  
animal (one of them) and then convincing the campground was  
the home of a satanic organization.
I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.

I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a  
Christian.
I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.

Classes were over and I wanted to go home.  A friend of mine  
asked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home.  I said  
no.

When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister,  
Indira Gandhi.

I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me  
when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.
Same situation as before - having my car stolen.
Every time I see a spider or a snake.
I took an exam which I failed terribly as I had not studied.
Quarrelled with my younger brother.
Loss of close relative.

When I came to know that my feelings for someone were not  
reciprocated.

When my boyfriend told me that it would be difficult for him to  
marry me.

I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in my  
friend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual and  
moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then,  
I felt it in my soul.
Meeting a male friend with whose wife I was having an affair.
When my girlfriend became pregnant.

When I failed one of the tests because I had not worked hard  
enough.

I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in  
Madrid.

I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with  
drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually  
for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do  
things stupidly and unjustly.
My friend had trouble and I was not able to help him.

I had been in love with a certain young man who pretended to love  
me but one day I found out that he had another girlfriend who was  
also a friend of mine.

When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I  
respect.

A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see  
me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town.  
Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got  
impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone  
skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment  
to be able to see her.
When I failed my Standard 8 Examination for the first time.

When I got my first unknown compound while doing my M.Sc  
research, I was very happy.  This is because my research was based  
on this type of reactions and compounds.

A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let me  
go to your English lecture.

I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationship  
with his girlfriend.  She finished with him.

I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left  
the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that  
sloppiness and impudence.
When my cousin passed away.

When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month it  
wouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girl  
take vacations that month. The anger was because of the  
resentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.

When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home  
because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a  
man. But it remained undone.

When I complained about a colleague to the manager and he told  
her that someone had complained; this colleague came to me  
believing that I liked her.

At primary school the teacher caught me cheating during a  
dictation.
When I was told that a good friend was seriously ill.

When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had  
ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died.  I could not  
 understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

Getting a friend an open container ticket because I got caught  
speeding.

I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and  
hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the 
boy on the ground.
Low evaluation of other people's cares.

When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother was  
out, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.

When I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time, I started  
to cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything and  
after a while I was crying.

A girl whom I trusted and with whom I had shared personal, confidential  
matters twisted the facts and told it to a common friend of ours.  
 When this common friend told me the version my friend had told  
her, I was angry.

I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of  
quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his  
living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.
I failed to complete a working task within the agreed time.

I could have died when I was caught cheating on a test in high  
school. That was my first and last time.

I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after  
we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's  
problems.

When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, had  
got herself involved with some very undesirable characters and  
was experimenting with drugs.

Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him  
very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the  
hunter who shot him.
The loss of a very good friend.
Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.
When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.

Watching "11 am". They had a programme on the starving refugees.  
Their plight was a source of sadness for me.
I felt guilt when I betrayed the person whom I loved.

The elections of 1982 and 1985.  The thought of what a social  
democrat and communist majority could achieve, especially "worker  
share" funds and its extension.

Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel  
ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted  
to say.  Thoughtlessness.

To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination,  
I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the  
students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I  
had the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in  
the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come to  
be able to be with me.

I feel disgusted at not having got aa "A" in yesterday's  
practicals of G220.

My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool).  
Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we tried  
hard, we could not find out the cause.
I was "best man" at my brother's wedding a year ago.

This is one feeling I never betray, but I must confess that the  
last time I slighty felt happy was when I passed my M.A with a  
high rank.  This was a few years ago when my friend told me about  
the result.

When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I  
felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.
When a friend of mine was beaten for what was my fault.

When I was a child my parents caught me with a pornographic  
magazine.

I had to meet a girlfriend to go out for a drink and she arrived  
with her aunt, to whom I was introduced.  Then the aunt left.
Noticing my flat had maggotts !

A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to  
marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not  
leave her alone.

I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was  
very quiet. Then a man approached me and said "Hello".

Riding home from school after completing two midterms in two  
days, and feeling I did well on them.

A friend came to visit me late one night. He promised to stay  
only a quarter of an hour, but he stayed 5 hours !! He didn't  
leave and I was very angry.

I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me,  
that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could  
not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.

I dated another boy several times, when I was still "going with"  
my former boyfriend. This made me feel a little bit guilty towards  
my friend.
The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.

After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we  
are able to pay for.

When I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I  
would not be coming back home for a long time.

When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.  I was the first in  
the family to have got a 1st class, so all the family members  
were very happy and they gave me the opportunity to study  
further.

When a mistake occurred at work which I was not responsible for.   
This was disclosed later.

On a sailing boat at night, under a full moon, listening to Pink  
Floyd, drinking good wine, with good company, the boat being  
steered by autopilot, and a full eclipse of the moon.
I do not help out enough at home.

I felt disgusted when I was not given money for lunch at school  
by my father as a punishment for beating my little brother.

I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.   
Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased  
threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.

While walking through an old mining area, I unwittingly disturbed  
a wallaby which, in its resultant flight, accidentally fell down  
a deep mine shaft. On investigation it seemed uninjured, but it  
was impossible for the wallaby to get out, and also for me to get  
it out of the shaft. To prevent its suffering a slow death, I  
shot it.
When my last relation broke up.

My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I  
misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On  
realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in  
the sand.

Once a female classmate told me that the clothes I wore seemed to  
be a child's clothes.  On hearing this I felt a little ashamed and  
I criticized her clothes though there was nothing wrong with  
them.

Sitting on the bus seats supposed for disabled people, children  
and old people (by mistake)

Got a package from my parents, without even a small note  
enclosed.

When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things about  
me when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friends  
with my boyfriend's other girl.
When I quarelled with my parents.
Finding out that I am not an as able student as I thought.
I was angry when my abilities of a singer were underestimated.
The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.

When I promised to visit my boyfriend and I didn't fulfil the  
promise.
When I met an elephant in the bush.

[ When bad and disgusting language is uttered by people, or when  
someone tries to show what is beyond his own capacities.]
When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.
I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.

I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace  
when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves  
that I have fallen in love with him.

I was riding with a friend in his car. At a speed of 120 km/h on  
the snow-covered motorway I would have liked to get out.
When I come home late at night.
The passing away of my mum.
When  fell in love with my present girlfriend.
Before going to the dentist.

For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief  
when you are away from home, too.

I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my  
affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if  
nothing had happened.

When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I  
wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.

When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving  
through a puddle of water.

I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where  
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't  
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the  
side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow  
light.

When I found my boyfriend, who I had been dating for a year, at  
another girl's house. We had had previous conflicts concerning  
the girl, but he had always claimed they were just friends.

I was hitch-hiking when a man stopped and gave me a lift to  
Nijmegen. During the ride he asked me whether I was in for fun.  
The man was fat and tatooed.

I came home from school very keyed up. At the dinner table I  
unfortunately unloaded a lot of my hostility off on one of my  
parents. I'm ashamed that I didn't dispate and control these  
feelings before coming to the table or even let the energy build  
up in the first place.
Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.
At a prolonged separation with my family.

Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital  
after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.

Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to  
give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to  
bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.

I became very angry with my friend because he didn't do shopping,  
while we agreed on him doing this. My being angry was proved to be  
without reason and I felt guilty about it.

During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants  
made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.
Had to tell people that my parents are divorced.

When the student union leaders were expelled from the university  
and we continued to study.

[ I feel disgusted at people who talk negatively about a person  
without knowing the person well.]

When a person whom I had invited did not come on the appointed  
day and time.
Once my father slapped my mother for a small quarrel.

Arriving in New Zealand as a teenager - first overseas trip -  
something "exhilarating" about the change of scenery etc.

I was in a garden one evening and I saw a snake coming towards  
me.
When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.
When my dog was stolen.

One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done  
a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.

One dark night with no street lights, a car was obviously  
following me.

When my parents work very hard and get tired - while I go to  
school and study instead of helping them. I feel that I'm letting  
them down, disappointing them.
I received a letter form home telling me that my sister was very sick.

When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and  
looking down on me.

When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of  
yours and you are at the bottom of it.
My inability to assert myself positively in a group.

Being very close to having an auto accident, almost driving off  
the road.
When my boyfriend took me to his father's grave.

When my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room after  
I had told her that I was  only in the bathroom having a shower.  
 She left and I had to do without supper.

At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help  
another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the  
wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.
When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.

Found out that me and my best friend are both chosen for the  
English lectures.
On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.

When I think that I do not study enough.  After the weekend I  
think that I should have been able to have accomplished  
something during that time.

I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and I  
thought about the sad incident that had happened to them in the  
near past; I knew that they were thinking about it too when I made  
the call.

My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girl  
some time back and she is no longer mine that she said she was  
still mine.

When I got into a bus I found that my wallet had been stolen.  
It was not a great loss from the monetary point of view but I  
lost some documents - identity papers.  As a result I had to  
spend several days in order to get a new one.  I will always  
remember all the work I had to do and the bad treatment I  
suffered because of the bureaucratic behaviour of the civil  
servant.  I had already had bad luck and they treated me like a  
criminal.   At one point of time I really wanted to quarrel with  
them.

When my family heard that my Mother's cousin who lives in  
England wrote us to tell that he had cancer of the lymph glands.
I felt this when I was copying homework for one of my classes.

I felt disgust when I saw a drunkard vomiting very offensive  
matter.

Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the  
theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical  
driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.

When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football  
and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought  
our joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no  
one expected we would win.
I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
Did very, very well on a Physics midterm.

In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had  
been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.

About not helping my sister when she asked me to help her on her  
chemistry class. I pretended to be busy.

I was alone at home, a man forced the front door which was  
locked, forced and tried to open a window.

Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the  
house and came back very late.
Saw a dead rat on the street.

I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky  
wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.

I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I  
wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.

Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatant  
lies about me and the headmistress would not let me defend  
myself. She was also telling lies about other members of my  
family.

[ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him  
unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was  
thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]
When I was selected to a University College of Nursing.
Mentioning a book to the person who borrowed it.

A child was admitted in hospital with Meningitis. I was asked to  
do lumber puncture to obtain Celebral Spinal fluid for diagnostic  
purposes. Since the condition was already bad, the child died as  
soon as I finished the procedure.
When I had my first boyfriend.
I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.
I like someone who does not like me and was rude to me.
The day after the night I drank too much at a party.
Marriage crises.  Boredom.

When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a  
friend of mine.
A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.

In the traffic I insulted a man who crossed my way. Afterwards I  
paired with him, and felt shame because of mine lack of pacience  
and ridiculous attitude.

I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whose  
problems I had always shown deep understanding.

When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while I  was  
buying bathing soap.

Being insulted in front of my parents, and they believed other  
people (those insulting me).

Last week I had planned to play tennis and had booked a tennis  
court.   However when I arrived at the university gym the clerk  
told me that the court was being used for lessons.
When I failed at the first entrance exam.
Meeting an old friend from high school.
When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.

I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who  
needed it immediately.
When they told me that I had got a study grant.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and  
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately  
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to  
remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was  
that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askad  
me to tell her about it.  I was very angry with my friend as I  
had trusted her.
Having gone to school without learning anything, as usual.
[ The day I have not worked (academic) hard enough.]

Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a  
disco.
When I learnt that I had been betrayed by my friend.
When a close friend did not write.

My got my mathematics test's marks and could not believe that it  
was true.  In the past I would have at least 80% marks.  Was I  
getting weaker at studies ?  This made me feel that I should not  
expect too much from going to the university.
When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.

After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were "inflated"  
enormously.

I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely,  
for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf  
and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me  
that she had been waiting for some news from us.
When I was insulted by a man.
Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.

I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for  
my studies.

When I encountered not only with my father's lack of  
understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as  
a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be  
right are concerned.

A person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and got  
sick.

We owned a shop and I used to serve in it occasionally. We  
sometimes took lollies out of the stand and Dad caught me one  
day.

I saw a film where snakes were crawling everywhere. I felt them  
crawling over all my body with that ... skins. The noise that  
they did disturbed me very much.
When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.

When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander, was just as racially  
prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned.

After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did  
not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said  
that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.
When I saw a very disagreable scene.

When I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be a  
stranger.

When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility  
of elucidating this.

When a patient in the ward died (one who had been under my care).  
I felt as if I didn't give the appropriate care to the patient.

When I attended school, our class visited an institution for  
mentally and physically handicapped persons. Although I tried to  
control my feelings, I was disgusted.

I look up to my Karate-teacher. When I came to a training lesson  
after I had not trained for one week, I was totally stiff. I was  
ashamed.
When my mother found out that I smoke maryhuana.
When ditched - divorced by husband.
When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.

I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who  
usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short  
illness.
When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.

When I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautiful  
little kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and I  
followed her out, then witnessed them being born.
When the gear broke on my car.
In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.

At a discussion a friend took a "faschistic view", what I had not  
expected.
Someone had stolen an article from a library journal.

A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, I  
felt hurt and disgusted.

I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me  
with the boy who is my best friend.

When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill and  
probably would die. We had not expected this because he  
was always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn,  
gave him medicines during the night.

I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I  
have done things good in relation to other people especially when  
my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.

I felt guilty when I mislead a person into thinking he was a  
close friend when that person was more of a casual acquaintance.

A friend of mine that is abroad undertook recently an axam to  
enter on University in Dallas, and was approved.
My grandfather's funeral.

When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my  
licence.
Death of the family dog.

My sister was impolite to my father when the family was having  
lunch together at a restaurant.  She thought that our parents had  
been prejudiced against her, this was an extreme thought.

I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen.  I was  
with a friend and did not know that she was related to this man.   
My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.

Yesterday, I was just about to cross the road when a country guy  
who was ahead of me spat out a mouthful of betel juice on the  
road.  It was very windy and had I not checked my speed I would  
have had a very good shower of his saliva.  Though I was not  
angry, I felt that these people were very indecent.
I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow students  
during my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-maker  
and caused great conflicts with the teachers.

At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a small  
mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that,  
he did not listen to me but sent me away.

When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our  
mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my  
classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first  
mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more  
than that and I put down "very good" for fear of being scolded.  
Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for  
what I had done.

When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a  
madman.

After my graduation exams I was waiting to get admitted to a post  
graduation course, however the situation was not very favourable  
for me and I was upset.  Suddenly, Bombay university offered me a  
seat and I landed up in Bombay for my post graduation studies.   
This happened last year and was very pleasant for me.

Looking up end-of-semester results, and finding I'd failed three  
out of seven (subjects).

Describing to mother how a hole in the wall had appeared while I  
was babysitting.

When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due  
at 1400 hours.

In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's  
birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get  
drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit,  
but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in  
moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed  
drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had  
to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home  
and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I  
didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.

I felt happy at the settlement of our marriage, even though we  
are from different socio-linguistic backgrounds our parents  
agreed to the wedding without any conflict or discussion.  We had   
thought that they would object to the wedding but it did not happen.

This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my  
friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her  
dancing instructor - he is a "user", i.e., takes advantage of her  
good nature.

I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter  
to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year  
courses.

When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after  
having  gone to a disco without permission.

My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days  
later he stole it from my father.
Listening to horrot stories at night.
I called off a relationship with one girl so I could see another.
I had worries about a certain illness.

At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told lies  
about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard  
the conversation.

I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the  
terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the  
white population.
When my grandfather died.

My mother revealed personal details about me and the  
negative aspects of my character to other people when I was  
present but unable to defend myself.
Sending pictures home when I'd put on so much weight.

This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was  
attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate  
woke me up.

I was of the opinion that 12.00 pm was too early to be back at  
home after going out, so I stayed away longer, knowing that my  
mother would be worried.

The week before I entered to army, when we were being selected.  
During 5 days I had to pass 10 hours a day waiting for the  
answer, which at last was the worst. The fear of being convoked,  
of hearing the fated phrase, was constant.
When I was finally qualified for my profession.
The behaviour of people spitting everywhere.
When I tripped while getting on a bus.

My main disgust is against codfish because I detest even the  
smell of it.
When I was chased by a big dog near my house.

I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and could  
not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew  
about the story.

The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son.  
I can say those were the happiest months in my life.
My cat died painfully and slowly.

I beat up a female friend after I heard the defamatory stories that  
she had been telling.  I was later called to explain my  
behaviour.

It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a  
boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons.  
Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.

I felt afraid when I smoked maryhuana for the first time in my  
life with a lot of friends in the middle of the street at day  
brake.
When my grandmother died.
When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.
Saw my father with that woman he is married to now.

I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress my  
mind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerate  
at all.

My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had  
been wrongly parked.  However the sign had been put up only after  
I had already parked.

When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most -  
floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general  
one).
Zhu Jianhau did not break the world record for China.

I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood.  
During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. The  
fact of being alone in that house frightened me.

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others  
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

When I didn't notify someone that he was summoned by a headmaster  
and as a result he ended being on a heavy punishment.

My mother always evokes feelings of guilt in me. For instance  
when I miss the last bus I know she will be concerned for me and  
stay awake till I arrive.

Someone who always took care for the key of the sportshall stayed  
away without letting us know. Next time he did as if nothing had  
happened.
When I had not understood anything after a lecture.

I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and  
vomited.

Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother  
became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and  
lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our  
rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually  
died.

At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.  He  
tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to  
speak about me with his companion.  I detested this dirty  
growling man.
When my best friend died, at the age of 16.

At about nine p.m., I went home by bike on a dark cycle-track;  
because of lack of time I had to take the short-cut.

When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room which  
15 year olds aren't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol,  
marijuana and contraceptives !

When my parents behave very "witty" towards me, they make insipid  
jokes about which they laugh. Or my mother who treats me like a  
little child.

When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there  
naked.

I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and  
directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it  
rolled by and hit me.

Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station  
at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and  
the government decided to delay it for another year. When my  
father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.

I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I  
realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never  
see eachother again and none of it mattered.
When my friend was punished for something that I had done.

When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I  
had learnt all the lines.
Being put down by the class leaders.

One time I set up my journey at night going to a certain bar. On  
the way I met my friends and they told me that two people had  
died because of heavy fighting. I proceeded on but with fear.

Students on campus were unnecessarily creating trouble just to  
heckle the authorities - not to achieve something concrete, but  
to further their own interest.

When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog  
standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how  
it would react later on.

I did not do the homework that the teacher had asked us to do.  I  
was scolded immediately.

When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening to  
stories about torturing people or animals.
When I bought my car.
My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.
When my mother died in August 1978.

My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When  
my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started  
shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.

A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene  
words.

I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I  
did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt  
while he was playing.

When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who  
had been murdered by terrible methods.
When I was six years old, my favourite cat died.

When I was in primary 6, my father died.  I was very young then  
and did not know what had happened.  The weeping of my relatives  
and my tears made me sad.
My father left us for another woman.
When I was caught with someone's daughter.

When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to  
prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at  
last that she would not turn up.

My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was in  
hospital for an eye operation.

I had this feeling before my graduation and never dared to speak  
to my relatives and  friends.  Because of this feeling I would  
avoid situations, however I do not know the reason for this.
Forgot to do some shopping that I had promised to do.

When I made the winning goal during a very important football  
game.

I felt shame when I was asked by my cousin that I promised to buy  
her a birthday present but I didn't buy it for her in front of  
friends.
Speaking in front of a large group of people.

In a park near our home, a group of young people who were  
strangely dressed were seated in the middle of the street.  They  
began to eat while carressing each other.

When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a  
moment.
Gave the wrong meal tickets to other people (my classmate).

Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this  
I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful  
moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.
I feel ashamed when I am praised.

My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all my  
friends were attending.

The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that  
the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.

I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. It  
went way up in the air and then around and around. Heights are  
not my favorite spots in life.

One day I went to town to get my grocery.  On my way back, I took  
a mini bus which was full of drunk students.  I felt very  
disgusted.
Dog dirt which thaws in the spring.
In a disco, there was a dirty little chap who punched my bottom.
I felt angry when my friend told me that I had stolen her money.
Made a statement that other people did not believe.

When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a  
very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking  
corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident  
happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver,  
after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely.

When I lied to my mum, who later came to know that what I had  
been teling her was false.
[ I am joyfull to be alive every night.]

We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.   
Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let  
him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.
A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.

[ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my own  
good.]

I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final year  
degree exams.

When I didn't meet an appointment I had made. The person phoned  
me but I thought of something (I told I was ill) so that I didn't  
have to go.
Winning a game after a long time of losing.

I was very happy when I received the year end results as I was  
worried about how well I had done.  I was very happy to know that I  
had passed.

I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she  
wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found  
out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use  
it. She never found out.

I once felt shame when I failed to fulfil the promise to marry a  
daughter of a certain gentleman.

I escaped from communicating with God for a long time.  I did not  
read the scriptures and I did not pray.  I felt that I was  
getting further and further away from God.  I felt guilty as this  
was because of my laziness.

A friend of mine was hospitalized after having been diagnosed as  
having typhoid, he had to forgo his exams and also his ambition  
of doing a dissertation at the M.A level.  It was a very sad  
event for me and I felt very sorry for him so I volunteered to  
stay with him in the hospital.

In ward 2A there was a patient suffering from Syphilitic  
Paraplegia and had pressure sores. The wounds had offensive smell  
that only a few people .... the place.

I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a  
high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.
I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.

I was supposed to go out with my girlfriend one Saturday night,  
but I got really drunk with some friends earlier that afternoon  
and evening. So, I totally forgot about going out with my  
girlfriend. She showed up the next day, and that was when I  
remembered.

When I entered the dissecting room for the anatomy class and saw  
several dead bodies lying on the benches.

I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to an  
older, strange woman.

When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people  
stood around the open grave and cried.

Getting back my math midterm, I received a lower grade than I  
thought I would get. After going through the questions I felt  
that the grader had graded harshly and I had made only a few ?  
errors.

after getting a fail notice for a math class, I realized I was  
not doing very well in school in any subject. I began to fear  
failing a class or two.

On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the  
least, reason or better motive.
The first time I left home.

I was in "Hainburg" in December and I was angry about the  
politicians and the police.

I have done the teachers training course (B.Ed).  During our  
training I was asked to handle the ninth standard class in a boys  
school.  I was scared to face the class the first day.
When a close friend died.

I came across a girl at the school bus-stop, I had seen her  
several friends as she was a friend's friend.  However my friend  
had never introduced me to her and when she got off the bus I  
smiled at her but she did not respond pretending not to have seen  
me.  Her arrogant behaviour made me sick and angry.

Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland  
for a year as an exchange student.

I stayed at the Coast for a weekend with friends. My brother came  
to drive me home, but was rude, and in a hurry to rejoin his  
friends. I was embarrassed because the family involved was  
extremely nice, and hospitable to him.

A tiresome person held me up all day long.  I was very busy then  
(I can not remember what the problem was).  He continously tried  
to make me talk to him and disturbed me.

When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at  
home when I was preparing for my MCE examination during the  
night.

One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had  
objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced  
me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him  
for over an hour.
Found my name on the list of attending the English lectures.
When I heard my sister got in a bad car accident.

I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in  
getting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, I  
felt I had lied to them.

I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some  
silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry   
clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

I was at the table at a French friend's house.  They served me a  
big dish with roast cauliflower and sauce.  I had to eat it.

My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most  
expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove  
home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state  
and her actions.

I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of the  
fright and because I was nervous.

When I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I  
wouldn't have to go to school. I lied to my mother - she realized  
I had been lying when she got home from work and found that I had  
been over to a friend's place.

We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium  
(the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the  
crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had  
to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole  
town !
When I was admitted to the Sofia University.

My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and  
also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get  
over it. During all that time I felt very sad.

Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began  
to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was  
only "the thing to do", and not really an act of love.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.

I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving  
it or when someone deceives me.

I had an important amount of money with me and felt fear of being  
assaulted.

I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect,  
lied to me.

After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious  
cuts which were gaping open.

While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry with  
eachother because we were both fed up.

I was ashamed at being the only one to have got a C+ in ED120  
assignment.
My bed sheet (present of my parents) damaged by roommate.
When I found out I got accepted to Berkeley.

My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick  
him up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.

When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he  
did nothing to relieve the situation.
Confession to my parents about my involvement in a moped theft.

Discovering a good friend had lied to me, resulting in a  
detrimental relationship with another person.

One rainy day when the streets were wet, and as I was walking down  
a slope, I fell down out of my carelessness.  There were many  
people and they saw me, so I felt ashamesd.  Moreover I hurt my  
ankle and it was painful.

When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be  
heard.

My mom told me not to gamble, but I did anyway. Sometimes I would  
even take some money from my parents and brother. She found out  
and yelled at me.

When I heard that my girlfriend was getting married to another  
person, I felt very sad.  That day I did not eat anything and  
kept thinking of her all day long.

There was a scene of shooting in front of my house, I was very  
afraid. Two armed men confronting. I didn't discover the reason  
of the incident.

I was talking badly about a person to some friends, and  
discovered that his daughter was listening.
When I was told that the form five results were out.
I got to know about the death of a close friend.

After my final examination at school I was glad that the  
examination was over and that I had passed it.

I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt when  
I said I would.

A friend of mine felt bad because of something I had done to  
something that belonged to him.
When I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.

I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interested  
me, by my employers.

I was 4-5 years old when I hid the bicycle keys of a not very  
good friend.  After a few hours I pretended that I had found  
it.

I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was very  
drunk, as he approached us he started to undress.

Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by  
some people because he was found raping the wife of the village  
headman.

When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I  
felt guilty the next day.

I was with a girl one night and then did not call her again,  
although she had asked me to do so.

I went on a picnic to the country side park.  The beautiful  
scenary made me feel relaxed and every worry disappeared , thus  
the picnic was worthwhile.

When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different  
directions.

Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a  
few days before and then one morning it was gone.
When I failed an exam.

One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to cross  
a meadow by a dark road.  There were bushes on the other side of  
the road.  The weather was damp and a bit foggy.  I heard steps  
behind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.
I did not do my homework and went to see a film.

The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt  
the other person very much.
When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.
When my first girlfriend an I left each other.

At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed  
in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.

When I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he was  
now a female (I don't know it/them personally).
After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was,  
and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to  
please God. I could never understand how something that brings you  
joy could be a sin.

When I watched the T.V programme called "The living planet" and  
saw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man.

Disgust with oneself after being intoxicated enough to go to bed  
with a stranger.

The day the results of the certificate exam came out.  I went to  
school and at first I did not feel frightened.  By the time I  
reached the fourth floor ( the results were being given on the  
fifth floor) I found it difficult to walk and felt that I would  
die.
I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.
