I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.

When I had to lie to my boyfriend so that he wouldn't suspect I'd  
bought him a xmas present as expensive as I had.

When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice,  
and his attitude made me glad.

In September 1984 I got two girls pregnant and the families of  
both the girls confronted me .  The fact was that my parents were  
around and I felt guilty answering some of the questions.

The shame came when I was beaten by my teacher at school in front  
of boys and girls some of whom were my friends and a girlfriend  
apart from being classmates.
The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.

I had wasted some time instead of doing something I needed to do  
to give to a friend. (Also in the time I wasted I had done some  
things I did not consider morally right).

I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a moment  
when nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.
When I swindled money out of someone.
A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

When I went to visit a relative and saw how messy and dirty his  
place was, in the absence of his wife.

After moving out of my apt. I took all the furniture and dishes  
and everything. It was mine but I took it all just to spite my  
roomies. We had a few (a lot) of disagreements. I felt guilt for  
moving out for the bad reasons.

I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programme  
and the teacher criticized me.

Once as a school girl I was copying at a class work and my  
teacher spotted me.

When the teacher asked me to read my composition that was the  
homework I stood up and invented one because I hadn't done it. A  
colleague saw that in my copy book there was nothing written and  
he accused me and so I was called in the director's room.

The day I was to receive my gold-medal for the M.A, my  
grandmother, who I loved very much, died after an illness.  She   
died a few hours before the convocation.  While I was  
attending the convocation I had to control my grief as she would  
not have liked me to miss it.  It was a day she had been waiting  
for, but did not get to see.

Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly  
the use of another person.
On meeting an old friend of mine.

One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the  
opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had  
the priority.

I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the  
standard 8 exams for the third time.

I had lied to a person because I had thought that I could not  
tell him the truth. When he found out he was not angry but  
understanding. We talked the whole thing over.
When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.

One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my  
friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we  
stayed indoors.

When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former  
secondary school.

For the sheer pleasure of it, I quarelled with my boyfriend who was trying   
to be especially kind to me.
Death of a close friend.

I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double  
dealers.
I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.

When after 10 months of national service I was "downgraded" and  
did not have to do the remaining 5 months.
When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.

When I was in the canteen of the United college I mistook a  
stranger for a classmate as I was not wearing my glasses.  I  
realized that I had made this mistake when I saw him again  
carefully.

I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to their  
too old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left  
them to the mercy of fate.

Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how  
they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised  
her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and  
did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.
Once I had some homework to do and I did not do it.
As for disgust.

About the girl (22 years, married) I felt guilty of the  
relationship.

At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speak  
from the stand by drawing lots.
Not giving up something for Lent.
Quarreling with classmates.
Getting into this university.

I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and  
my name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who were  
sent to Kenya for Training.

I met my girlfriend on the way and she joyfully welcomed me on  
the way home.

I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I  
developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my  
examination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I was  
dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with  
fear until it was my turn.

I was afraid to walk through the forest one day when I dropped  
off the bus around 6.30 pm.

I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street.   
Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.
At the death of a close relative.

There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a  
Medical Assistant.

I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered  
me greatly.

When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an  
examination.

On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car  
acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few  
seconds.

When my neighbours accused my brother of stealing their  
rose-bush, I was very angry as he had not touched it at all.

My mother had just been teaching me how to crochet, which is  
thought highly improper for a boy in a town.  Just when we  
finished, a neighbour walked in.
When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied having  
touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.

That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly  
9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My joy  
came after hearing on the radio that I was one of the people  
selected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at the  
L.S.H.S.
Death of my father.
When my car froze, and I could not start it.
Brother took my money to use for his own purposes.
Being asked to go out by someone I care.
When my mother treats me as a 10-year old boy.
Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.
Before the first examn.
When I lost my father in a car accident.

When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feels  
superior to me.
I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.

When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining  
engineering, after having prayed one week in the church I was  
not even selected.

A story I heard recently about a baby dying after sexual  
abuse.
An exam where questions about very specific knowledge were asked.

I wanted to get in contact with a girl I loved, but I was afraid  
she would refuse me.

In the student's union there was someone who took the photocopies  
of two large volumes.  I asked him to let me take a few, he refused  
it for an acceptable reason.

I once felt that my last hour had come when I was unexpectedly found  
in the hands of.
Being told that I have not got a personality.

I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him  
and and my Easter holidays.
When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.

After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I  
was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me  
extremely happy.

A fellow student who seemed very nice later on proved to be a  
slimy fellow towards a professor.
I did bad on a test I didn't study for.

We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to  
was very negative and not very helpful.

I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in  
the children Assembly.
Can't remember exact example.
Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up.

When I and the person mentioned above had a suspicion of  
pregnancy.

A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent  
way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about  
something.
Railway station good-bye.
My younger sister was almost run over by a lorry.

My illness a few years back.  I was sevely down with malaria and  
asthma, I had lost my health, charm and cheerfulness completely.
Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.

When I went to visit a friend in the hospital. She had to undergo  
an operation for rupture. I was glad to hear that the operation  
succeeded and that she was relieved of her pain.
I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.
When in an economic crisis I got an unexpected sum of money.

My child passed away after a short illness when he was just  
eleven months old. I was only told about his death without  
knowing that he had been ill.
Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

Whenever I am late, I feel ashamed of myself even though no one  
tells me anything.

I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept       
on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect  
me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.

I was to meet a friend at the bus-stop (he was coming to visit  
us) and he did not turn up.  After having waited for him for some time      
(about an hour) I called him up, to be told that he did not  
intend to come as he was feeling tired.
Falling off a cliff in the mountains.

When I had my first oral examination after a long time;  
especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling  
that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up  
for it.
When I passed the 12th standard board exams.

A friend of mine shot himself through the head after having told  
me and others that he would do so.

I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but  
I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed,  
lonely and deserted.
Being bored in school, not being able to marry and have children.

I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the  
car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.

I once torn the inner tube of a bike, that was not mine. Then I  
saw it was a brand new one. I felt very guilty then.
In a party of friends I got completely drunk.

[ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakes  
alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the  
same that one meets in the morning.]
My grandmother died suddenly last summer.

Fear of the turn that the examination paper would take as I  
lacked confidence.

I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it  
worse than ever. I felt ashamed.

When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister.  
Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried  
and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's  
reaction to the students demands concerning the educational  
system.

Death of my grnadfather after having been in hospital for so long  
with cancer of the Oesophagus.
After masturbation.

I feel fear when I only imagine I could lose confidence in my own  
abilities and powers. A similar feeling I feel sometimes before  
an exam.

My father was a member of the public Alcohol and Drugs Board,  
when I was picked up by the police for being drunk in a public  
place.

Several days after my final examination at school, I was sitting  
in an airplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment very  
much.

My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours  
late.

At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had  
to learn all on my own.

We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house.  
The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM.  
I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.

When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I  
depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of  
their daughter's buisness.

Once while studying for my exam I found so many complicated words  
that it disgusted me.
I forgot to zip up my trousers, this was not noticed by anyone.

Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who  
the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and  
bad but it was too late.

In a Christian gathering's lucky draw I mistook a girl's name for  
mine (a boy's name).  I realized my mistake only when I went up  
to the stage for the prize.  I did not know what to do as  
everyone was looking at me.  I blushed and went back to my seat.

When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for  
three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second,  
because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught  
me napping.

I was in a restaurant with my boyfriend when I saw my best female  
friend after not seeing her for two weeks.  We rejoyced, hugged  
and had a long talk.

I was in love with a very beautiful girl and when I went back for  
my holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just a  
friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there  
was something fishy.
When abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.

I attended a ceremony in Denmark which is comparable to our  
Halloween. They build a large bonfire and place a life size dummy  
of a witch. The crowd cheered when the dummy burst into flames.

I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for  
the term examinations.

One of my very good friends came to me for advice as her  
boyfriend had been hitting her and beating her quite harmfully.

I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder  
people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or  
moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of  
mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very  
loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me  
from the inst.

Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that the  
person was listening.

A situation of overt unfairness, manipulation of people and its  
consequences.
Failing in the English language exam.

I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without  
permission and I was found guilty.

I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for  
it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch  
under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said  
they carried diseases.

I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the  
bathroom on time.

When the Cambridge results came out and I obtained a first  
division.  I had been thinking that I had not done very well.

I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I  
said I had not passed my last exam.

I knew I had to take an exam very soon but yet I couldn't start  
studying. I also knew it was very imprtant to succeed the exam  
this time.

When I received the result slip of the higher level examination  
(an university entrance exam) and saw that I had a very good  
possibility of being accepted into the university, I felt very  
excited.

When in the initial interview for the recruiting, I don't know why,  
I accepted to do the test for army.

Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated  
physically me and my mother.

I could not find my monthly tickets for the bus when I was on the  
bus.
I felt sad when I was despised by another person.
Passed the last exam.

One of my class-mates had a disease unexpectedly, he had been in  
a coma for six days in a hospital before he died.

In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position  
to advance his own interests.

When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any  
water for two days.

After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to  
relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had  
finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I  
tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was  
amused.
Failing an examn.

The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to  
each other.

When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me  
that he had not come back from school and that he was lost.

My notes were not returned to me, it kept on being  
procrastinated.
When I was just to be divorced.

I had experienced odd moments one time when a patient came into  
the Ward in which I was working. The patient was badly burnt in  
the right side of her body. I was very nervous at the sight.

My brother lost his temper and started smashing things in the  
house.  I was quite scared, that something terrible might happen,  
till the situation was brought under control.

When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and  
I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.

When the bank let me borrow some money this winter, after my  
grant was spent.

One day, when I was sitting on the bus, there was an old woman  
standing beside me.  I was very tired and sleepy and did not  
think of giving her my seat.  A 50 year old woman who was sitting  
beside me got up and gave her seat to the old woman and said,   
" Old woman, please take my seat, the youngstters these days are  
not used to giving their seats to others."  When I heard these  
words I was very ashamed of myself and wanted to get off the bus  
at once.
Beating my brother up.
Sleeping through crew practice one Monday morning.

My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some  
problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything   
was all right.

I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me  
speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left,  
I did not try to prevent her from leaving.

A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but  
is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.
This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
I didn't get the job I wanted.

My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing  
and went out with him herself.
When I was 10, I got busted for stealing a candy-bar.

When I saw the certificate results, I did not feel very happy as I  
did not realize that I had got all the credits until my  
classmates pointed it out to me.  My parents and my relatives  
praised me and I realized that my results were good i.e 2A, 5B,  
2C.  I felt satisfied with the results and was happy.

Some students whose English is worse than mine can go to your  
lectures (English lectures).
If a guy one is not interested in makes advances.
I stopped working (had a boring job).

My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, her  
eyesight was at stake.

I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I  
cried for several days because I was so sad.

I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences,  
after having spend two weeks there with my friends.
I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.
When my beloved girlfriend got married to another person.

When we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was moving  
very fast, so I feared we might crash since the road was too  
rough.

When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of  
nine only.
Before the examn.
My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.

I was waiting to receive the participation on the profits and did  
not receive it.

A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomly  
assigned one person in each group to make a presentation.  The  
discussion in our group had been confused and the presentation  
was not very well prepared.  Unfortunately I was selected to  
present and I could not keep calm, was confused and result was  
very poor.  I really felt ashamed.

I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way I  
lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of  
trouble.

While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it,  
though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to  
demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.

I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. My  
friend was charged for the delay in returning the book to the  
Library. I felt guilty when I realised I was responsible.

When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from my  
desk and put it on.

I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and this  
has negative effects which are caused by my behavior.

One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground  
floor, I was often afraid of burglers.

One day I got on the bus without any money or season ticket and  
the driver threw me out.

Many years back I quarrelled with my younger brother for a small  
reason.  I used a pole to beat him and nearly broke his arm.  He  
recovered after a treatment which lasted several months.  After  
this our relationship was worse and he would not listen to me.

When I do or say something inappropriate which hurts people close  
to me.

When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a  
very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling  
false stories about us to other people.

My friend half-teasingly called me a bad nickname.  I felt  
insulted and kicked his hip in anger.  I was stable later and did  
not feel angry at him.  In fact I was afraid that the other  
friends who were with us would think that I was an intolerant  
person.  However I could not apologize, so I pretended that  
nothing had happened and smiled when I left.  My friend did not  
say anything but just watched me leave.

When I could not attend the college picnic due to some  
difficulties.
I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.
I learned that my girlfriend had been unjustly missed from work.
In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.

When my aunt took her own life, I felt guity for not  
understanding that she needed support.
When my grandmother passed away.

There is a girl at my work that doesn't take care much of her  
hygiene she comes always with her hair oiled, a not very agreable  
smell, and a bad appearance. Beside this she tries to be nice.

When my dad gives priority to my kid brother's band and his  
other activities.  We both play in different bands and rehearse  
in my parents garage.

I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I  
thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so  
well.

One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed by  
without stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengers  
inside.  I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and   
conductor.

I fell down in the bus when it braked suddenly and everybody  
started looking at me.

I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't  
pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was  
very sad because it became a real quarrel.

Attending to a demand made by a client (I work in a bank) I  
suggested her an application of money in a week ahead, but I  
informed her wrongly. The client arrived a week after and the  
application wasn't made and she lost with this a lot of time and  
money.

I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dear  
friend called saying that his father had died in an accident.

It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the  
first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.

I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that  
there was no reason for that.

When I was 20 years old, I fell severely ill and was bed-ridden for  
6 months.  I felt very scared for my health and my studies.

One time I felt guilty when I told one of my previous boyfriends  
we were through just because I never felt like having one at that  
particular time.

On embarking on University life. I came from a different city and  
did not know anybody at the Uni. I was frightened because my well  
known and loved friends, also all my security had been taken  
away.

I moved to Nijmegen for my study. Soon after this my mother had  
to be admitted in hospital because of cardiac compliants. I knew  
that my moving was an important reason for this.

I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long  
time.

Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with a  
stranger.

When my younger sister visited me during the school holidays and  
told me that she would not go back to school because she was  
pregnant.

While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and  
right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair  
lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to  
creak loudly.
When I failed the grade 7.

I had spent the weekend visiting relatives and friends and didn't  
study for Anatomy class on Monday.

When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was  
filled with fear.

Getting sent on a company expense trip to another state to work  
for a week at that plan.

My younger sister wanted to take classes to learn a musical  
instrument.  One Saturday morning my mother asked me to go with         
her for the registration.  I did not want to go  so I said that  
there might be many bad people at the club.  As a resullt my  
sister was scolded by my mother.

I was studying in class at night. I was in Form II by then. There  
were rumours about an earthquake. That night dogs were chasing  
one another and passed through the window outside the classroom.  
Those who saw the dogs thought it was a lion and were terrified.  
Trying to run away the desks were dragged and there was a shaking  
movement. I thought it was an earthquake and jumped out of the  
window.

I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend the  
afternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled),  
watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances -  
pressures of examinations in particular.

Upon reading a story on a serial killer by the name of Henry Lee  
Lucas who has been given the distinction of killing more people  
that any other man. I began to wonder if I should take more care  
for my safety.

Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though  
there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it  
had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me  
as she was hundreds of kilometres away.
Borrowed someone else's towel without asking.

I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and who  
wanted to talk to me.

When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me  
alone for a few years.

Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work and  
take the blame for any mistakes.

At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues  
to complete an assignment.

When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary  
school who beat us up.
When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

My younger brother destroyed and gave away some of the books that  
I had intended to keep for as long as possible.
I witnessed a scene in which two women were abusing each other.
Telling friends about your nickname.

I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read about  
a woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.

I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and  
it was moving its limbs.

A few days back I was waiting for the bus at the bus stop.   
Before getting into the bus I had prepared the exact amount of  
coins to pay for the bus fair and when I got into the bus I put  
these coins into the box meant to collect the bus fair.  I  
thought that I had paid and wanted to get inside.  However the  
bus driver called me and asked me in an impolite way if the coins  
were stuck at the opening  of the box.  He had not seen me paying  
and there wasn't a stack of coins in the box.  I could not  
understand this and the driver kept questioning me.  He made me  
feel angry and at last i inserted a dollar coin in the box just  
to get away from him.  Later I found that I had forgotten a few  
coins in my pocket and had not paid enough for the fair the first  
time.  After I had entered the bus I could still hear him  
scolding me and I felt disgusted.
Ignoring my parents'wishes.

When I caused needless anxiety to a person close to me because of  
my lack of self-insight.

I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that  
there had grown a certain distance between us.

I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and I  
was defeated.
When my father was very drunk and raging at home.
When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.
Mad at my dad.

I felt very guilty when a student, sitting in front of me in the  
exam, asked me a few questions and I did not show him the answers,  
 though I knew them.

When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate on  
them.
When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.

During the first year in university I had bad results in both  
the terms, especially the first term.  I was afraid that  I would  
not be promoted to the next year and that the others would go  
ahead of me.

When our government decided to withdraw student allowances as it  
was one of the conditions imposed by the IMF.

It was when I stepped on a python (snake) unknowingly while it  
was sleeping near a baobab tree.

I passed on some gossip that was untrue and cause two friends to  
have a fight who were already experiencing difficulties with each  
other.
When I was coming back home alone at night.

At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flour  
in it.

The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting  
on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help  
blushing.

When I was young I had gone to an old lift and played with the  
antique lift.  The guy discovered me and warned me, I was very  
frightened.

I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to pose  
twelve times, over  a period of four weeks, before I could get a  
snap of mine.  Every time the film was processed my snap did not  
come out although the others did.
When my parents insisted that I take up a teaching career.

I was a passenger in a vehicle when suddenly another vehicle came  
from behind to overtake us.  However another one was coming right  
in front so the other vehicle changed course and blocked our way  
and so we crashed against the side of the road.

While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up  
very well and they made a remark about it.

I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are not  
progressing.
A relative not acting on her promise.

The only guilt I considered reasonable was my reproval at the end  
of the semester at the University.

I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going  
to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the  
state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students  
can find an appartment.

A few months ago when I was teaching, I suddenly became very  
angry at the children and slapped some of them.

I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me  
and he lost it.

Went to a movie with a date, walked on the beach (in Alameda)  
spent some time afterwards in her apt.
I felt very happy when I won the football pools.
When a close relative is treated badly.

When I was 12 years old I frequently was pursued by others and  
got sound thrashes.
I fear before each exam.

I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last  
exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher  
seemed satisfied.
Finding out that a boy I do not like is in love with me.

I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it was  
nearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began to  
remember our courting and gave me a long kiss.
When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.
I was neglected undeservedly.

I was very scared at the time of the Ty.B.Sc examination as I had  
decided to get 1st class results.  I was afraid thinking of how  
the papers would be.
Promised to do something for other people and did not do it.

I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from a  
book off-hand, I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.

When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it looked  
underneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).

I separated with the one I liked most.  She refused all my dates  
and told me that she had dated another one.  My heart seemed to  
cease beating.  I was silent for some time and then I whispered  
goodbye and left without turning back.
A conflict with a pupil.
Car accident in the middle of the night.

Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to  
that class.

I was walking to school and I passed by a red cross post where  
there were many soldiers.  They began to pass remarks at me.

I was ashamed at myself when I saw that the other boys and girls    
of my age earn a lot of money by doing very good and hard work.

My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame  
bacause with her it is a stress disease.
Being sexually assulted in public.

In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I  
met a lion on the way, which disappeared suddenly.

One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I was  
interested.  On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I had  
not expected) and went back home without seeing the film.

I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help  
me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and  
meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got  
angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator  
as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I  
had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.

During a meeting I said something wrong and the others laughed at  
me.
The physical appearance of a meal.

When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he  
had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should  
not have been punished for it.

I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not  
enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not  
have fitted in and there was something in that.
Not acting on my promise.

We where in a bar and my friend had a fight with some guys who  
were in the table aside.

I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past.
REMARK - SUBJECT MAY NOT HAVE TAKEN THE EXERCISE VERY SERIOUSLY.
I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I raflected her joy.

When I read about or think about environmental pollution, the  
armor race, starvation, etc. Then one realizes that mankind is  
bad, most important is power and money, at the cost of nature and  
mankind.
When I see pornographic films.

When I could neither measure up to the expectations of the teacher  
nor to my own expectations in one of the assignments.

I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant  
professor whom I highly respect.

I argued with my father on matters concerning marriage.  
Traditionally speaking, I was not supposed to, so I felt guilty  
of violating my traditions which I must hold in esteem.
When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

When one of my parents insinuates something about the other  
(they are divorced).

I felt disgust after watching a picture on television about  
torturing political prisoners in India (this happened in the  
India of Indira Ghandi).
Walking in the dark and thinking about ghost stories.

It was when my friend had stolen my money (K10) and had  
disappeared.
When boyfriend lied to me.

I was coming home from a relative's place and it was about  
9.30/10 P.M.  I felt slightly apprehensive when I got off the bus  
and started walking towards my place.  I was confident that  
nothing would happen to me, yet there was this slight feeling of  
fear.

My episode of fright happened when I came to study.  I had to  
stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about  
myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.
I was not chosen for the All English class.
During a meeting.

When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane  
was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that  
we were going to crash.

Last night - finding that someone in the house had eaten an  
entire packet of almonds I had bought for a family treat.

After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had  
piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.

When I took a small boy's share of choclale.  He was our guest  
and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.

A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said  
she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised  
because in front of other people she had always treated him in a  
friendly way. I am very sad about it.

When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but  
I am alone.

I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's  
difficulty.

I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate of  
Education.

I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I  
was the quietest girl in class.

When I sat in the wrong discussion section in the beginning of  
the semester. I insisted on being in the right section and the  
TA's list should have included my name. When I found out that I  
was in the wrong, I apologized, turned red and left.
Thinking about friends overseas.
When my friend (girl) went abroad for two years.

One day, early morning my mother who is healthy fell ill.  There  
was no doctor or compounder near by and for a few hours -8 A.M to  
6 P.M she did not speak a single sentence, nor did she drink water  
or  milk.  There was no movement in her body and I felt really  
scared.  I almost lost my confidence about her survival.

When I was studying in the library - preparing for a test, two  
people sitting next to me talked to each other for 20 minutes.   
There were no other seats so I could not go elsewhere and I did    
not want to interrupt them, so I could only be angry in my heart.
Got a big fish in fishing.

When my best friend got a boyfriend. Because of this a  
relationship of ten years was finished abruptely.
An unjust calumny concerning me.
I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.

When I was working in Delhi, I had gone alone to see the hostel  
where I would be residing.

I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for  
them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and  
returned them.

When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was  
somebody else's wife and niece at the same time.  I was very  
angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after  
having been punished for it.

In the classroom we discussed with the teacher. He told me things  
that affected directly in a negative way my job and my behavior  
in the classroom in front of the other pupils.

I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girls  
kept talking about boys, chatting up etc. I bacame sick of it.
When I passed the driving test (on the second try).

Receiving a postcard form my sweetheart who was abroad on  
vacation, not being at all sure if he would write me or not.
When I witnessed an accident.

A man sexually aggressed a small girl in the bus but the girl did  
not dare to speak out.

After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg and  
got a good write up in the paper.
When I passed the grade 7 exam.
I refused to lend my homework to a friend.

In some special circumstances l lied to my parents, then felt  
guilty so I told them the truth and felt free.

While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded  
by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and  
was saved only by the appearance of other people.
After lot of explanation, to fail in my work.

When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult  
operation.
While travelling in a bus with an invalid ticket, I got caught.

After I reluctantly refused to dine with a certain man on the  
same table.

I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview  
a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really  
well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I  
hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them  
down.

When in a car accident where car was total wipe off (wipe out, or  
write off).

Whenever I see poverty and starvation. I live in an affluent  
society and am privileged to have many opportunities.

As a child (i.e. 5-7) hiking in reasonably rugged bush and  
becoming lost for a duration of 5-7 hours.

One night at three o'clock I was followed by a cardriver, who  
tried to molest me.

When I went home and there was nobody, I waited till 2 A.M and       
still nobody.  I was suddenly scared and anxious as this had never  
happened before.  In addition my mother was very weak and I  
feared that she had met with an accident.  Therefore I was anxious   
all night.

During lunch with some classmates, a priest was also there.  He  
was eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plate  
away.  He did it with gluttony.  He wiped his hands on his suit  
several times and it was full of crumbs.

When I was six years old we were on holiday in France. There was  
very heavy weather then.

I came home and discovered that someone had broken in. Then I  
realized that they probably were still there.
My wrong behaviour made my loved one feel sad and uneasy.

When I deny something to my sister and after a while I feel sorry  
and try to bypass the situation.

When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in  
me.
Facing a mad dog.
When I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.
Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.
Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.
A night spent with a group of friends.
I was raped by a friend.
When my father was saved from a severe work accident.
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.
During my last exam.

I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on  
her word, is often absent and is irresponsible.  I found out that  
she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight againt her  
addiction.

I had a friend who I didn't see for a long time. We had a  
relationship from much union and interaction. It was more that  
one year that I didn't see her. She appeared in my home and we  
talked.

When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation  
and they are together now).
A bad smelling cucumber.
Made mistakes in exam.

I omitted to do a favor to a friend, while he was very much in  
need for help.

When I didn't study for tests in High School. In particular   
remember a physics test. I didn't study because my friends talked  
me out of it and we did something else boring. I felt so helpless  
just being there - then guilt set in because I was very close to  
getting an A in the class.

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it  
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it  
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people -  
friends who I love and respect.

I had taken the responsibility to do something and I had  
prepared for it.  However I failed because of my timidity.  After  
three attempts I still could not adapt to the atmosphere and  
failed as before.  I felt imcompetent and felt that the others  
would think that I had not prepared for it.

I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My  
friend relied on them.

When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at the  
first call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. It  
was the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.
When I had my first sexual relation and it didn't work.

I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for  
it, and I was caught red handed.

When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a  
car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my  
form five exams with flying colours.
I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.

When I heard that my father had found a letter from my boyfriend  
and he was calling me to talk about it.

My relationship with a boyfriend was finished and I didn't  
succeed a years-course.

When I let my girlfriend use my essay to help her to write hers  
and the tutor found them alike.
On the scenic railway at the fairground.
When I realized that I had three more examinations to take.

My friends aren't working for the same common goal we all need to  
accomplish.

After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and  
had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly  
I felt peace and joy.

When I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as a  
school Library Assistant and also the leader of Catholic  
Students, so I felt very joyous.
Some people not cueing in the dining hall.

Motorcycle accident with two people involved, running off the  
road. Broke an arm, only.

I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not  
have the money to do it.

When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my  
family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly  
my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He  
gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties  
with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help  
me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second  
key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.
When I passed the driving test after three failures.
Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.

I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and started  
vomiting. It was so disgusting.
When I wet my bed at boarding school.

I was travelling in the South of Brasil, near the end of the  
year. I was well settled with 3 friends. At the evening of 31 M.,  
somebody, also with us, took from his purse pints of all colours,  
and the 4 of us, and other friends, that were at the same beach,  
painted each other and we went to the beach with champagne.
When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.
My mother was ill and my father was not at home.

Heard some postgraduate students talking about girls being  
unsiutable to do medicine.

My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and  
had not had time alone together for almost a month until one  
afternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showered  
and ate together.

At primary school I was accused by some boys of being in love  
with a certain girl in their class so they had to shout and beat  
the girl and the matter was reported to the headmaster.

My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed  
at night.

When I cheated my father about the book allowance at university.   
He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.

When I was travelling to school by bus, I went past a place  
where a sewer had been repaired.  There was a bad strong smell  
which suffocated me and I wanted to leave the place immediately.
Going to Chico to visit a friend.

My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then  
the older one died a week later.
On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.

A girl with whom I was staying having sex with a person for about  
3 nights running, and then with his brother the following night,  
and back again.

When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16  
months ago.
Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.
Some boys not cueing in the dining hall.

When I was young, about 6 or 7, I did not make it to the toilet  
on time.  I hid the dirty trousers in the cellar as I feared it 
being discovered by my parents.
The loss of a person I loved very much.

I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They  
soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for  
me.

I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short  
time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt  
very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she  
does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the  
decisions concerning my life.

I was looking after a child and she fell down because I was not  
paying her much attention.  One side of her face got bruised.

We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribal  
group which believes in Goddess Kali.  As it was a festival day they  
had to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a hen  
right in front of my eyes.  I felt disgusted and evenb gave up  
eating meat after this incident.

When I think now about the way my father behaved when filing a  
divorce.

Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted  
to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of  
my friends.

When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry.  
I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does   
badly at school, my family members blame me as well.
My grandfather's funeral.

The first time I slept at my boyfriends house and had to walk  
down the hall to the shower in front of his housemates. I felt  
they were judging me.

I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from the  
group.

When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards  
another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly  
knocked him out.

When a very dirty class-mate farted in my  presence.  There was a  
terrible smell.

In traffic I often get relatively angry with other drivers.  
Several transgressions make me mad, especially not yielding to  
priority traffic (e.g. coming from the right).
I stole 5c from my mother's purse for a choo-choo bar - I was 6.

I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three day  
journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and  
tiring.

When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself by  
vomitting all over the place and insulting the people who were  
there with me.

Seeing a friend "making love" to a high school girl. I  
accidentally was dragged into this room where the happenings had  
occurred. I was disgusted at the reality.

When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had  
guns.

When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my  
father and brother.   While my father was talking to some  
friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me  
sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my  
brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying  
after this.

When my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out what  
she thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returned  
home to find half my stuff gone.

When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant  
Training.
Lost my purse, the money in the purse belonged to my parents.

When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at  
Kasungu town Hall.

When I was the first to arrive at the scene after an accident,  
and found that a close school friend had been killed.
Finding out that the person I love understands me.
My roommate was rude to me.
Following an argument with my brother, he broke my golf clubs.

When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discovered  
things of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I had  
not mentioned it earlier.

At the age of 16 I had gone to see a film in a nearby village,  
about 8 kms  from my home.  I started walking as there was no  
bus.  I had to cross hills and as it was dark I could not  
identify the path.  Half way through it started raining and as  
there was no shelter I ran four kms to reach home.

When my father made my mother go through really terrible  
situations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........

I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something  
wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not  
serious and I need not worry.
When I was accepted at UNZA.
When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.

While dining with some accquaintances I was asked something  
which I should have known but I did not know.

I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love  
with me.
Not handing in homework in time.
When I took the car of someone without saying it to him.
When I think about my parents getting old.

Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I found  
roaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I  
called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came  
over and checked.

When I came to know that my exams were on two successive days and  
that there was very little time (about 9-10 hours) to study in  
between.

I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this  
put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started  
withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.

The surname of my brother was different from ours.  He often  
grinned at home and provoked others for the pleasure of it.  This  
made me angry.

Telling friends about how my parents had been treating my  
brothers and sisters unfairly.

I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her  
awfully.

When I failed the entrance exam of the medical school and was  
studying biochemistry which has no job prospects in Zambia.

I met a girl (22 years old), married. I liked her. I asked her  
for a date and I kissed her. I discovered that she lived nearby  
where I passed every day. I got amused thinking that her husband  
would be ... or me . I didn't talked to her anymore.

During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave  
the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed  
and angry.

My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I  
prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).
When I had to walk along a dark road alone.

I felt guilty when I once went out with another boy and made love  
with him while I had a close boyfriend.

When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after a  
period in which he felt very depressive.
Failing in an examn because of lazyness.

When I learnt that my younger sister had been expelled from  
secondary school because she was pregnant.  That was the second  
time that this happened in the family - the first time it had  
been my elder sister.

My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all  
very worried but it was successful.

One day in the TYBA class the teacher asked me a very simple  
question which I could not answer.  Finally the teacher himself  
gave us the answer and my friends started laughing at me as I had  
not been able to answer a simple question.  I knew the answer but  
feared that my response may be wrong.  All this made me feel  
ashamed of myself.
My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.
A mishap suffered on misinterpreting a girl's proposition.
When I imitated a teacher behind his back - walking very silly.
Accepted by the college football team.

When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous  
for me and the people close to me.

When I was a child I had to recite a poem in a show at the end of  
the term.

When I knew that a person that I liked very much didn't react the  
way I would like to, even that I knew about his feelings for me.
A murder.

When I stole a book in class and the teacher caught me, the rest  
of the class laughed at my attempt.

One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient.  
Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and  
it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid  
fearing the dead body.

There is one thing which makes me feel shameful,  when I see  
friends of my age group working and earning a lot, when I am  
still studying.  A friend I met a week ago after a period of 5  
years is earning more than Rs 3000/ month.

When I was teasing a girl, who turned out to be my brother's  
dame.

When a boy tried to fool me so he would be OK trying to show me  
that he is a gook boy.
The possibility of having failed the examination.

I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my  
homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention.  
Especially in learning another language.

I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel  
which was filled with blood of pigs.

I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in  
order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress.  
 I sold my friend, I was despicable.
Haven't been frightened for ages.

A fellow player, quite unexpectedly, scores a goal, which means a  
draw.
Saw a very arrogant girl walking like a queen.

I remember that my form 2 teacher was very fierce and dogmatic.   
My feet would tremble whenever I saw her but I had to face the fact that  
I had to go for her class.
When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.

I was disgusted the other day I was told to take off the dog's  
faeces around the house since they smelled bad I did the job but  
in the end I felt disgusted.

When I received the higher level exam results, I mistook the  
grade E in mathematics for a grade F and I was shocked.

When it was found that I had gone out of the school premises  
without permisssion and at the wrong time.

This emotion happened when I passed my primary school examination  
and was selected for Secondary School.

At a certain situation I felt myself neglected and undeservedly  
harmed.
I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.

Once I quarrelled with my sister and after this I deliberately  
messed up her belongings.

[ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me,  
though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]

For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father.  
Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very  
glad about it. It was a fine evening.
I greeted a friend and he did not respond.

After listening to ghost stories with my classmates I had to back  
alone to the hostel at night.  I had to walk through a long and  
quiet road and I was scared of meeting a ghost.

When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) on  
a close relative of mine.

My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them  
in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I  
couldn't play them again.

I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at  
the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control  
myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger  
on her as she did not obey me.

I had a girlfriend in the same class I was. I did not do well in  
my Exams, but she did satisfactorily well and was taken into  
another class leaving me behind.

It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).  It was  
during the first term Summer vacations.  We met each other while  
handing in our homework.  He invited me have a trip with him and  
we were together till 8 P.M.

The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without my  
knowledge.

This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car  
accident.
Two timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).

I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad  
would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started  
getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very,  
very far away.

When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to the  
hospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up one  
weekend from CAL to take me home.

I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street.  
I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.
When I failed grade 7.

When I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me  
"a three" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward.
NB: In Bulgarian schools "a three" is the second worst mark.
When I first heard "I like you !" from my boyfriend.
None.

I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School.  
When the results were announced on the radio, I came second out  
of 80 students hence I felt joy.

When I lost a wallet while travelling, since it belonged to the  
group I was very afraid.
When my husband told me about his pre-marital affairs.
I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.

A great friend of mine travelled with the intention to change his  
life. He didn't succeed and returned depressed. I had not power  
to support his frustration and his behavioral change.

The day I was forced to use a public convenience place in town.   
It was so filthy that it really made me sick.
When my grandfather died.

While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever   
and amusing sketch.

Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and  
cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a  
few days.

One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me  
only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it  
on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.

The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written.   
He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written  
about.
When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.

Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of  
Nijmegen) for a while.

I had subscribed for this test. We were informed by our  
secretary where the test took place. We went over there and thought  
there was a course. So we went back again I felt ashamed that the  
secretary again should see me.
Going out alone in the dark.

Two-timing - going out with person other than guy I was in  
relationship with.

I blew up at someone for being confused and because of his  
irresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had no  
right.
A woman picked her nose and spit right next to me.

In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small  
picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and  
cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had  
for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

My old boyfriend - yes the same one - asked me out. We had a good  
time. Then he asked me out the following week. He actually took  
interest.

I felt fear when one night my aunt and Uncle left me alone at  
their house to look after the baby when they went to a party.

A meeting with the family and the friends I felt dear and loved,  
sharing the gladness of being together at a birthday.

One night my father suddenly suffered from a heart attack which  
lead to breathing difficulties.

I missed an opportunity to go abroad because of some silly  
mistakes for which I had to suffer a lot.
Not getting an airplane ticket fot my mother.

Feeling helpless, not being able to accomplish what I really  
wanted to do.

When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen  
carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in,  
this acquaintance had helped her move in.

After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in  
1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the  
Examination when the results were out.

When a "friend" dropped a frog down my neck, and I didn't know  
what it was.

I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was  
slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me  
and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit  
the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to  
go back and see if I caused him to crash.
Doing well in the examn.

We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and  
said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints  
and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.
On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.

When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I  
always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth  
place.
When I arrived late at the job and met the most troublesome boss.

I was at a boarding school during my primary school days. I was  
broken so I pretended I was very sick. My father came and he  
picked me up. He spent a lot of money on medical expenses which  
all proved to be negative.

I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault,  
everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he  
surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried  
home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling  
his body.

When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently  
gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed  
over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a  
witness.

Accidentally dropped a friends camera flash, so that it was  
broken.
When I try to lie.

Each time I am confronted with reports about repression and  
torture.

Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the  
wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).
When I took drugs.

I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I  
would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students  
who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I  
didn't have any more money.
Watching a horror movie with friends.

We were at a party, this guy I liked and me.  I really loved him  
and gathered enough courage to ask him to kiss me.  He did not do  
it but instead asked me what I would like for my birthday.  I  
told him that I would like a kiss more than anything else but he  
excused himself and said that it was impossible.  I really felt  
embarassed.

I did not go to help a friend of mine, though she probably needed  
me.

When I realized that I avoided two good friends with whom I  
always shared toys and sorrows. I made up idle stories to avoid  
telling them what happened to me.

When I missed crashing, by a hair's breadth, into a man who came  
out 20 metres ahead of me when I was driving at 110km/h.

When my parents quarelled over something I had done and which was  
wrong.
That someone would discover whom I really love.

I was to take a test and I had not made the necessary preparations  
until it was too late.  There were two days to go and I still had  
not done much.

While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me,  
growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.

I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Last  
week I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame.

I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic  
"student-like" way.
When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.

I am disgusted by people who spoil their identity because of  
misbehaviour.  This morning when I was in a crowded bus, I found  
a seat on which a university student was sitting on one side and  
he had put his bag and files next to him.  There was very little  
space left and I sat down while he kept on reading.  Even when I  
leaned on him he did not put his bag away.  He did not respond and  
I felt very angry.

Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I was  
friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl  
I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which it  
was when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.
When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased  
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had  
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that  
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone  
an operation.

When my girlfriend was afraid and anxious the day before taking  
her exam.
[ I am quite shameless, not applicable.]

I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very  
young.

We had a day off from school. Instead of helping my mother with  
her job, I stayed in bed all day.

A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the  
telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry  
and made the other person apologize.

It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home  
telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a  
history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my  
third year of my Secondary School.

When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my  
mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who  
is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the  
hospital.

There is a certain person, whom I only have seen. He makes me  
cringe, feel disgust.

When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacial  
burden of the family was reduced.

A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he  
didn't come.

Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several  
reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical  
check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because  
someone had informed me about it.

The same event described under FEAR - in the bus a man sat beside  
me, with his trousers open and holding his penis.

When my neighbour's life was threatened by someone who was trying  
to break into his house.
When passing the final examinations for social worker.
When my mother had a nervous illness.

Having had a very heated argument with my sister - I began  
hitting her about the head with a newspaper I was holding.

Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along  
by would-be  in-laws.

A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a  
concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the  
way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.

When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since he  
no longer had the time to look after my garden and animals.
When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately  
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.
Was nearly knocked down by a car.

An argument among several friends because of the irrational  
behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and  
said that we were to blame.

The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes in  
family relationships caused by it.

I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were the  
only ones he had.

When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively  
with referance to sex.

When I made acquaintance with the parents of my boyfriend for the  
first time. They spoke Limburgian (a dutch dialect) and one of my  
first remarks was that I disliked Limburgian dialect.

Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in the  
Polder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: he  
took over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had something  
in his hand, we turned until we came across a man, who  
accompanied us.

I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was  
criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was  
unfounded.  When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and  
slammed the door.
When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.

I was in hospital, and then was visited by someone quite  
unexpected.

I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to  
her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.

I felt happy at the end of a 10 day student camp.  We had shared  
our hopes and aspirations and in the open situation so generated, we  
had made strong frienships and experienced our own worth as well.
Death of grandmother.

Heard that my girl-friend was chosen for the English lectures and  
I was not. I lost my temper and she is very upset now.

When a person is privileged in account of situations that are  
unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.

My parents claimed me on their income tax after I had been out of  
the house for two years receiving no financial support from them.  
As result I had to work more during school because they were  
expected by the FAO to contribute to my education when they  
refuse to do so.
Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.

When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I  
worked during Autumn 1984.

I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to  
cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a  
long time.

When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother told  
me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.
When a begggar approached me for money, I felt disgusted.

When friends found out that I had been lying about where I had  
been on a particular occasion.

A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical  
school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been  
left out.  Biased judgment !

My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get  
along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were  
sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

I was watching a procession during the Holy week, and a penitent  
approached me.
The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.

Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted  
by a friend.

Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road  
at night - trying to overtake semi-trailer. The truck pulled over  
onto our side and we hit the wet dirt, swerved back into the  
truck, back onto the verge, over a guide post and into a ditch.
I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.
When I crashed my car.

I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not  
prepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.
My guilty behaviour was found out by others.

Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors in  
communicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts when I only  
wanted 50 g).

Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has  
happened many times.

Last year my freshman yr. It was a day in March I did well on  
some tests. I seemed to finally adjust to college, it was hot and  
sunny. I was walking in front of a frat. when I heard Beach Boys  
"Surfin'USA". I had this overwhelming feeling that to be at CAL  
was good. I still have it somewhat.

My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of  
amidophen.

When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a  
particularly trying period.

I felt ashamed of my body in spite of knowing that it is more or  
less beautiful and also knowing that my boyfriend considers me  
beautiful, but this was only in the beginning.

Was threatened with a knife ... in the military by soldiers form  
another unit. The reason was girls.

When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the  
teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.

A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to       
see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked  
me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.

When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the  
rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.

Shifted from Melbourne to Brisbane. All my old school friends  
gave me a party and I had to say good-bye to them all.

At using other people, because of sexual experience that was  
using another to the detriment of both. Anxiety that I may have  
affected another for the worst.

I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought  
that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red  
switch.

I saw in an ice-cream kiosque a cockroach walking through a  
cornet.

Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate who  
had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the  
place.
Did not return the library book on time.
A saturday night a bus full of drunken people.

I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had  
passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.
Getting very low marks in mathematics.

I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning  
the plates and there was no food for me, and the blue birds   
(security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to  
be for me.

When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be  
examined by good experts and she deceived me.
Meeting generally dominating persons in social occasions.

I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour  
of a competition.

I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had  
caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my  
efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had  
intended.

When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without  
knowing the real cause of what had happened.

I felt ashamed one day when my teacher shouted at me in the  
presence of my boyfriend.

When my father died I felt myself alone and the fear possessed me.  
I was a child and all my sisters and brothers (8) were young.
When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
Not having good marks like other people for homeworks.

At my temporary job, I have to restrict  others' actions and make  
them obey me, and this very often gives me  a feeling of guilt.  I  
wish there could be some other way of acting.

Before going to school I usually take something to eat right at  
school and this time I took Father's money without him knowing  
it. I felt guilty and I returned the money.
When my brother was held up and robbed.

I had to leave an important function early because of family
