commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.
I made my boyfriend so unhappy and depressed that I feel guilty.

I found out accidentaly that while my uncle was away in Canada, my  
aunt had been bedding a young man on a regular basis.
After shouting at a friend.

I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was  
half an hour late.

I was walking with another person when a "gang" separted us and  
pushed me in to a house, hit me in the stomach and the face, then  
they left - leaving me bleeding.
When I saw my brother being attacked and I could not do anything.

One day I found an incontinent man in the ward. This patient had a  
guardian who couldn't give him a bath. So I just left him like that  
but felt guilty until I went back to give him a bath.

As a young girl in form I, I wet my bed one day at the boarding  
school and many girls came to see the person who had done it as I  
had to take my mattress out that day.

When I was young I was told to to the shop to buy a dozen eggs.   
I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughed  
at me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.

As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned  
for guilt.

Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I was  
still feeling feeble and tired.

Adolescent guilt growing up feeling "bad, immoral" sexual  
desires, some 10yrs ago.
Watching a horror film.

I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to  
interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class  
with her in our first year.

When my boyfriend was leaving to go home one night, I had a very  
deep sense of uneasiness and an unwarranted fear that I wouldn't  
see him again.
A drunken man forced me to kiss him.

I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known  
that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this  
message he was already dead.
Talking about snakes.

The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual  
crimes generally) a couple of years ago.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost  
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the  
hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I  
felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to  
me, of the unknown.
Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by someone close to me.
When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.
The time when someone let the air out of the tyres of my cycle.

My grandmother is a highly authoritative person, who lives alone,  
is independent, but doesn't know to live without commanding the  
others. I hate this!

I ate 12 biscuits one night after tea while watching TV - I don't  
know why.

I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set  
quite involuntarily.

When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a big  
glass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.
A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.
Our boarder burping after meals !

When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he  
knows needs doing.

After seeing a horror film - Omen.  I could not sleep at night   
even though I closed my eyes.  The last scene of the film kept  
coming back to me, I seemed to hear the girls in the film  
shouting at the devil.  The devil did not have any expression on  
his face and I thought that he would choose me.

I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are  
pregnant illegitimately.

In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were  
swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was  
situated.  When my friend was caught, he was on the banks of the  
river and some of us were still in the middle of the river.  I  
was very frightened.

I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which was  
completely inapplicable to the question due to my not having read  
about the subject matter.

When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me  
she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the  
study for speech therapy.

I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk  
about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They  
try to repress it.
Some boys deliberately played tricks on me in the experiments.

I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination.  
With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacher  
and also about myself because I had not remembered enough during  
the examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.

At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sad  
as I had to leave many friends and family members behind.

I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, but  
actually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was a  
full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

When I was in grade one, one day I felt like going to the toilet  
during class but I was very scared of the teacher so I urinated  
in the class.

At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred  
during university examinations and therefore I was unable to  
attend her funeral.

When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and  
her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted  
to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous  
way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long  
time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had  
been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw  
how much she had worried (herself).
Haven't felt shame for ages.
Saw poverty in the countryside.
After the loss of a close relative.

A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's  
sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it  
really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this  
time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him  
up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I  
felt very bad about it later.

A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married  
here, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays my  
parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.

That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men with  
priviledge. Not using it positively.
When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.

I felt disgust when I saw a friend walking in stagnant water  
without putting on gum boots.
When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.
When I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes on me.

When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip  
with my friends.

My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very  
naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.

I felt angry when my mother-in-law did not handle my daughter  
properly and she fell down from the bed and hurt her head.
One day in the intimity with my girlfriend I had an ejaculation.

It was my father's birthday party when I was asked to bring a  
tray of tea and other drinks.
[ When some people act very important in any situation.]

When a friend told me a story and I stayed dumb because I had no  
story to tell.

When I saw my 18 year old son grab an oxygen mask as he had  
breathing difficulties.  I had a bad conscience because I had not  
stopped smoking.  Medication for the dilation of his breathing  
tubes also caused a sense of guilt in me.

At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He  
had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison  
with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of  
guilt.
I get angry when people disbelieve me or misunderstand me.

When I went to see the dead body of my uncle.  This was a very  
dramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered a  
mortuary.
Hearing of the death of a friend who had been skiing.
Someone told me we are not as good as the All English Class.

When I saw a wino by some cans with Food Stamps and use the  
change to buy wine.

Several years ago I was caught riding the train without a ticket.  
The station-mistress treated me like a criminal almost.
Can't remember that feeling.

When I knew that a person who I didn't like, had about me other  
feelings.

Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long  
time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and  
I still do not want to believe that it is true.
From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to make  
it back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hours  
last academic year.

My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not  
enough space to store them.

When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is  
not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was  
very afraid so that I will never forget it.

When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a  
murder).
When my son has a pain in his leg (for no apparent reason).

When I received my TE Score and my acceptance from University -  
it had been a goal since I left the bank a year earlier.

Mr C took my drawing pens, without having asked for my permission  
first, and lost them.  He did not tell me about it till I asked  
him and then did not try to find them.

One night a very dear person said: "I hate you". Of course it was  
an impulse and this person didn't feel that about me. The person  
expressed regret, and everything was settled, but I can't forget.
When my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.
Getting back my Psych 140 midterm.
When I had my four children.
When I got a wedding ring of diamond from the boy I loved.

Not being alowed on a school camp with the class I'd been in for  
11 years (I had stayed down due to illness)

Car accident nearly occurred between us and drunk driver coming  
in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided  
(after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.

A friend came for dinner with me at home. His parents are  
ordinary people. My mother, however, used the very expensive  
porcelain dinner-service and the silver cutlery. I felt very  
ashamed.
I confronted a bigger person than I and almost got into a fight.

An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to  
me.

When I was accepted for further education, here at the  
university.

I was very ashamed when I was neglected by a certain friend whom  
I was thinking loved me very much.

My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months  
pregnant and that I was responsible for the "damages".  This made  
me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine.

I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone  
deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.
When I heard that my friend had started drinking beer.

When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the  
door.  I thought that I was going to fall out.

When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked  
quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.
Getting a low grade on my physics midterm.

One fears many things, for example one fears going to the  
dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected  
with the examination session.

When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard  
gunshots.

When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who  
made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about  
the killing of cows.
First time going out with a boy and other people laughed at us.

When I see all the putridness of people. The fact is the catarrh  
and spits that whash the streets of S.Paulo.

I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the Free  
University in Driebergen.

I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from his  
invalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like being  
paralysed.

My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by the  
teacher.

When I talked to another student about the notes she got last  
semester, not knowing that she got a lot of bad grades.
A break-up with someone I really liked.

A person walking his dog allowed it to defecate on the footpath  
outside my house. Although it had happened before, this was the  
first time I had witnessed it. All the skills I had learnt from  
PY 263 were thrown out the window when his indifference to my  
protestation was obvious to me.

We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)     
staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started  
passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was  
brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was  
herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks  
made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly  
remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the   
guy.

When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I was  
also very sad) "Oh, how I hated him".

I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stone  
houses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not have  
much furniture.  He took me to see his fields (I had never seen  
them before) and there were several inches of clear water on  
which the sunshine was reflected.  I wanted to sit among the  
short green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading the  
plants to death.  My friend said "They will not die" and I sat  
down happily and my trousers did not get wet.

A certain friend evokes positive feelings, when I am with him but  
negative feelings when he is not present. I feel the need to  
express those negative feelings. However, when I speak about him,  
I always think: Why do I like this, he does not deserve this, but  
still I do so.

Some time ago I was present at the wedding party of two close  
friends of mine.

I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of  
a yield.

A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because  
she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed  
money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.

I borrowed my classmate's notebook one week before the  
examination and I promised to give it back to her in two days  
time.  I was very busy at that time and forgot many things; as I  
was not very often at home she could not contact me.  When I  
started my revision I realized that her notebook had been on my  
desk for five days.  I contacted her immediately and gave it back  
to her.  Though she did not say anything I felt very guilty.

It was when I discovered that the girl who I had proposed was a  
friend's girlfriend.

I applied for a job of GALSO counselor and I made the strongest  
possible application but was denied an interview. I felt  
disgusted at the system which by promoting the cause of  
minorities makes employing whites lowest priority.
An Engineer I know wants war so he can get a job making bombs.

Achieving my goal at a swim meet. I worked toward the goal for 9  
yrs. I was capable of achieving it, but I didn't know when.

When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a  
friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother  
watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We  
never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as  
it was for me.

Not being able to convince my class leader that my friend is  
better than me to go to the English lectures.

When I was a young teenager (14)  my brother-in-law to be had  
made heavy advances to me.  I did not understand very well what  
it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are  
still there.
When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.
When my boyfriend and I made up.

I had a date with a boy, but I didn't feel liked, and didn't go,  
I wasn't home purposely at the time we arranged.
Before I moved away from home, I feared leaving.
When I almost walked on a snake.

When a friend didn't invite her own parents to her Graduation  
ceremony.
Make a mistake, offended my friend.

With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South  
Africa.

Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not  
really true.

When I heard the news of the death of my father.  It was in the  
evening and I was alone all night in my room trying to remember  
the face of my father.

When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of  
3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded  
pass).

When I was curious about it and went to a spiritism session with a  
friend. I had already been there other times (many times when I  
was younger) but that day, even if I don't believe in  
spiritism I was terribly afraid that something would happen to me  
(sort of incorporation !).

A brother from one of the Christian fellowship often phoned me  
and talked to me for half an hour or more.  However there was  
nothing important in the conversation and I found the person very  
disgusting.

When I watched TV and saw a performance of "Prince" (a popidol).  
Disgusting he'd better be a stallion.

I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and  
asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him  
anything.

When I began school at UC. The pre-enrollment the classes, and  
the question of success really scared me.

I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have  
been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went  
to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great  
the distance between us was.

One day at school I had quarrelled with a school-mate, and  
ultimately I had hit him hard.  He, being physically weak had to  
visit his doctor and remain absent from school for two days.

My grandfather was seriously ill, he had only a few days left to  
live. I had always loved him, but never told him. When I saw him  
for the last time, I had the feeling that I had omitted so many  
things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his  
forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad  
when I saw that.
When I learned that my brother had spoilt an LP of mine.

At a party where the boys were telling revolting stories about  
the girls they'd been with.

My friend had many female friends and I thought that they were  
his lovers.  I would scold him but he did not accept my advice.   
Later I learnt from his girlfriends that this was not true.  I  
felt ashamed at having misunderstood him.
Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.

[ During inter-rail-trip, after troubles, I met my little  
sister.]

When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume       
my studies in time at UNZA.

I spoke with a friend on the phone who I haven't seen in many  
years. It was a joyful event to talk to him.

After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling  
of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to  
turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I  
was able to get to sleep again.

During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the  
world woman.

I'm afraid of not being able to go to the school I want because  
of suffering grades.

My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the  
agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an  
accident.
A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.

I feel disgusted at my cousin, who is bad-mannered, does not know  
how to behave and talk to others, he does not respect elders and  
lies all the time.
When my grandfather died.

When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother  
in confindence.

Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel.  I had been slightly  
irritated earlier.  At night when I was trying to sleep they were  
having a party so I went and yelled at them.  I wanted to sleep  
as I had to get up early the next day.

I left a boy with whom I was going around without giving him any  
explanations.

I felt it when I was at home and saw a discussion without sense  
between my parents.

I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself,  
I started to talk imitating him.

I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had  
not seen for two years.

When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than  
to my mother.
A friend who was 22 years old died.

I work at a day care centre, and one day when the children were  
outdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.  I was  
not looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who was  
responsible.

Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home  
from work. Alone in car when someone came up behind the car and  
started banging and shaking it. Light was red and had nowhere to  
go until light changed. When green I took off.
My father dying.

When I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a  
possible failure.
[ When mix was coming from column for several days.]
Running away from a fire.

I was in about Grade 7, I came home from school one day and was told  
that my mother had skin cancer and would have to go to the hospital  
straight away.
Fighting with my father while drunk.
Failing an examn.
I took french leave to do my homework.

It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they  
foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.   
An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.

I was fearful when I realised that the relish was overcooked  
simply because I was not keen enough at checking whether there  
was still enough water in the relish or not, instead I was just  
playing with my friends.

The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not do  
as well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.  As compared  
with the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.

When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who  
qualified for form I that year.
I got separated from the man I loved.
When my brother (5th in the family) passed away.
A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.

I saw a skid-row (chronical) alcoholic and I was ashamed of the  
people with a high standard of living.
I do not study enough as I do not understand it properly.

When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the  
power of money.

I felt ashamed when I had not attended a class and the teacher asked  
me the reason for my absence.

It was when I discovered that my boyfriend had another girl. I  
discovered it through a letter he wrote to the girl when he was  
away. When I asked him he accepted it.

I was about to share lunch with my aunt's husband when she told  
me that I would have to wait and eat with my cousins.

I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had not  
intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I  
felt responsible for her illness.

Inter-national sports events won by my favourite national team or  
player brings me joy, e.g when India won the World cup cricket  
match.

I answered a certain question from Dr. Maqgda wrongly. She asked  
something about Femur and my answer was saying something  
concerning the brain. So I was very ashamed amongst my friends.

Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for  
my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years  
of my life.
Failed to recagnize a friend on the street.

On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just  
with my boyfriend - not really talking but just feeling  
overwhelmed.

The day that there was a black-out in the city, and I was in an  
exposition, I felt fear that something more serious was  
happening, like a revolution for example.
Failing in an exam.

When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood  
something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

I was really disgusted when I saw one of my friends soiling on  
his clothes. I thought he was mad.

When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha  
note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money  
was found later.

My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough  
but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.
I was alone and someone tried to break in from our back door.

A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the central  
underground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockers  
who were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.

When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had  
discussed and I had to be one better.
When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.

Not having owned up to the responsibility an incident where  
family car received minor damage.

When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to  
approach me.
Did not finish homework.
Getting the top price in the football pools.

When I failed the grade 7 twice and only passed it the third  
time.

When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a  
baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

I was talking to my mom on the phone and she told me that she had  
just gotten an award that day in front of all these people and  
she asked me if I wanted her to send me the article in the temple  
newsletter to me. I said no very quickly and felt guilty for not  
being more interested and hurting her feelings.

When my mother was seriously ill and had to be admitted to the  
hospital.
A boy in my class talking too loud in the lecture.

When my relatives and I were in a car going slowly on a frozen  
road.

I felt the above condition when I took my brother's bicycle to a  
market and unfortunately the bicycle was stolen and I didn't know  
how I could tell the owner about the stolen bicycle.

After days or weekends where I did not accomplish the amount of  
sudying that I wanted to because of more pleasant activities  
which come up.

We had fixed time for practice as we had to participate in the  
inter-department song contest.  I arrived and found that there  
was nobody there.  When I went to the canteen I found them eating  
lunch.  I was so angry that I aired my greviances to one of them  
and then left.
I had a very pleasant conversation with one of my friends.

My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her  
and telling nice things to her.

When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother  
who had passed away about a month ago.

When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political  
reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional  
level.
I got a job right after school was over.
When I had to walk home in the dark for the first time.

I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the  
elementary human norms.

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really  
happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me  
made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another  
person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she  
asked me.
Finding out my name on the list for English lectures.

I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left  
alone in this unfamiliar country.

I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my  
student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had  
been planned by taking people's comfort into account.

When I was a child I hid under the sheets out of fear of  
darkness.

My mother was very angry with my little sister and told her to  
put her hands on the table in order to beat her hands up. She  
forced by means of her power.
When I saw a lot of rubbish and animal waste on the floor.

I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would  
have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have  
liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know  
that I was not pregnant.
When my mother died.

Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had  
given her no attention.

When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian  
soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the  
whole scene.
Being insulted on a bus.

When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I  
would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards  
me.

The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had  
been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my  
wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.

When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives  
late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could  
have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.
The results of the mid term examinations were very poor.

I was together with my family one night, a few days after my  
father had died, during that conversation I expressed my  
displeasure because nobody understands me.

I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine  
for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one  
thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.

During the Chinese lessons a student often showed off. Moreover  
he misbehaved and dressed very badly.  So disgusting !
When I won an unexpected sum of money.

The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights,  
phisical aggrssion, etc.

When I realized that I belonged to a country which is amongst the  
poorest in the world and that inspite of having the resources we  
do not utilize them.  I was ashamed at myself and my country,  
shame at the lack of parity between the lifestyles of the  
citizens.
Disgust with a subordinate.

Defying my parents and staying out all night when I wasn't  
supposed to.

When I found out some family friends were embezzelling the  
company they worked for - using company petrol and food supplies  
and claiming furniture and crockery.
When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.

I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realize  
the extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day.  
The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with a  
good excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified the  
situation.
I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.
My sister bkoke her leg.

When one of my best friends commited siucide during these  
holidays.

I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first  
year examination and was among the thirty students who would  
major in economics.
When my father had a serious fight with my sister, because of me.

When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion   
picture director, on the radio.  I had planned to go and see his  
last film.
I asked a girl out on a date and she said no.

At my father, when he yelled and accused my sister's friend (over  
the phone) of doing something he didn't do, or know anything  
about.
When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.

When I was in my village one of my enemies had written a  
non-sense letter to a girl and he told the father of this girl  
that I was the culprit.  When I got to know this I was scared as   
the girl's father was a worse man.
Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.

When my room-mate made a mess of the room after having drunk the  
whole night at a graduation party ceremony.

I had enough time to do my assignment, and I did not do it well.   
When the lecturer scolded me, I had this feeling.

After confronting the person who stood me up, I blew up and said  
all the wrong things.

A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the  
street.

When my brothers were being cruel to my boyfriend, because his  
flat-mate bent back one of my brother's fingers. It wasn't his  
fault.

I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what I  
wanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. I  
wasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I started  
to read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus and  
felt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold,  
and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.

Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand the  
reason for, and trying to see a lecturer or tutor, but being  
given the runaround.

After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5  
examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter of  
acceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia telling  
me that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.

On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because  
I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and  
because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody  
had passed the test.
Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.
Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.

When I was giving private tutorials to my student; he would not  
concentrate and was lazy.  He had not done the home work that I   
had assigned and his academic level was very low.  It was a  
nuisance.

When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had  
failed.
When my daughter was born.

When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years,  
had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been  
quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes  
me feel really sad.

A close friend travelled to another country. When I knew that he  
would only come back after many years, I felt very sad.

When my father managed to begin a "new life" after the divorce  
from my mother; resulting in a new little sister for me.

The emotion came when I misbehaved at school and the Principal  
threatened me that I was going to be expelled.

I was at home and I heard a loud sound of spitting outside the  
door.  I thought that one of my family members would step on the spit  
and bring the germs in the house.

It was shocking news to me when I received a telegram from home  
telling me that my grandmother had passed away. I had to go home to attend  
the funeral but unfortunately I found that the burial had already  
taken place.
When I got married.

Someone, who was sitting very close to me, was smoknig in the  
compartment of an air conditioned mini-bus.

When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by  
thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how to  
swim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.

When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to  
rest.

A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of my  
car.  I was forced to use the emergency brakes.
When in my childhood we were forced to take cod-liver oil.

While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill  
for a long time, she was 17 yrs old.
As a child, when I saw an "unesthetic" sight.

I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my  
boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.

A friend started to insult another person without reason and I  
felt ashamed of her behavior.

Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every  
school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left  
each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now  
I remember about it quite often.

When I was transferred from Chichiri Secondary School to St.  
Mary's Sec. School. I was happy at Chichiri as a day scholer and  
had made a lot of friends. I was going to a boarding and that  
meant parting with my friends as well as my boyfriend for the  
first time.

Not quick enough to help the lectors to catty things for the  
lecture.

A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to  
justify a wrong action.

I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my  
position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any  
realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.

Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food,  
having extremely bad manners.
Fear of thief.
When I see dead dogs on the road.

At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he  
liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had  
attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

When I was 5, a few of my friends and I would light matches for  
fun. One of my friends confessed to her parents and my parents, I  
guess, knew or suspected I was involved but I said I knew  
nothing about it.

Somebody went around spreading news that I like people with  
money.

I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did  
not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that  
and I felt guilty.

While trying to board a train I missed the footsteps and fell  
down on the platform.
When my mother left for Kenya.
When the mother of a good friend of mine died.

Felt I had not appreciated my parents enough. Regretted the  
problems I'd caused.
Wrongly accused a classmate.

My father won't be so pleased with me as if I was elected "Three  
Good".

I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was  
informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.
When I failed the ninth standard exam in school.

I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was  
the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this  
feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was  
quite strong.

Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for  
the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas  
Years ago.

When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a  
car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.
When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.

A friend asked to borrow my notes and I did not give them away  
(my notes too badly written)

Last week, my organization summoned an executive meeting and one  
of the executive member's pointed out a loop hole in the  
committee's administration.  He could not suggest any  
improvements, so I quarrelled with him.

When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably  
angry.

It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, when some of my workmates  
got promoted to Seargents (sgts); we were having similar  
Ranks.
When a girl left me.

When I was in F4 I played a basket-ball match against another  
school's team.  One of their team members kicked a team-mate of  
mine so I kicked him back and we had a fight with each other.

I did not do well in one of the subjects last term.   I was  
afraid that I would fail.  My result was a grade D, though it was  
not good I still passed.  I felt more comfortable then.
When I passed and qualified for the university.
When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.
While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.
Each time the professor asks me a question in class.

At church camp when I accepted Christ into my life and so did my  
friend.

I was ashamed when I got the lowest result (mark) in class. All  
the same I didn't worry too much because I knew I would have got  
much better if I had read enough.
Meeting other friends who got in the good universities.
NO RESPONSE
My roommate talking and shaking her bed at night.

I was shopping in Utrecht with friends, we also ate some chips  
and snacks in a snackbar, then we saw a shabby fellow. He took a  
cold half eaten croquette (a snack) from a rubbish bin and eat  
it.
Not handing in homework in time.

I went to the school library and asked for a book, but the  
librarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an other  
colleague asked for it she gave it to him.

My young brother took my wristwatch in my abscence and sold it to  
his friend at a cheaper price.
When I committed the sin of immorality mentioned before.

When I was young I got lost on the street and the police found me  
after a day.

My sister won a scholarship to Norway and it was particularly as  
she walked across the tarmac to get on the plane and she looked  
back at us.
Fight with my mate after a quarrel.

On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near  
the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my  
girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me.  
He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I  
really did not like that.

I told my parents (or more realistically) would not do what they  
wanted me to do anymore. I guess I sort of betrayed them after  
all they had done for me.

When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was  
unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not  
surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

A "higher status" colleague of mine despised my attitude and  
organization of work.

Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other  
friends.
A film on zombies.

When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she  
had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome  
them.

Once, I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lost  
it.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the  
meantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found the  
door closed.

When my father talks about our relatives and favours them, I feel  
angry.

When I applied for a job which I thought I had a good chance of  
getting, I was not even granted an interview and did not get the  
job.
Forgetting a close friend's birthday.

I got up late and I could not go to my lessons on time.  When I  
entered the class room the stare of the teacher and my classmates  
made me feel guilty.
I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.
When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.
When my mother scolded me and I argued with her.

When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all  
lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only  
English classes)
When I see someone vomitting.
Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.

When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend and  
and brought up negative sides of her character which are actually  
not so important.

Found out that my grandmother might have been misdiagnosed as a  
psychiatric patient because the doctor did not know about  
neurologism.

At times I have been attracted to conducts which are socially  
degraded due to their ill consequences, and then I feel guilty.
Someone called me a disgusting nickname.

A patient, to whom I had given a powerful medicine, shouted at me  
in front of many people.  I realized that he did so because he  
was very ill.

I had promised to visit my girlfriend but for different reasons  
could not make it.  I rang up later to tell her that I could not  
come.

My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show  
the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.
When two of my children were critically ill with measles.

I took a girl out once and discovered that she was going around  
with one of my close friends.

I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were  
not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I   
had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.
China cannot buy your reference.
Telling white lies.

I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard  
about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.

I wanted to go to Bhopal for relief work (gas tragedy).  My boss  
simply refused to let me go, I was so angry that the only thought  
that came to my mind was to quit the job.

I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass.  I rejoyced  
at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies  
depended on it.
When I met my boyfriend with another girl.

My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and  
saw the scene and became angry.
The death of my grandmother.

When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our  
school who asked me what I was doing.

I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that  
he was going to cut me off from going to his house as well as  
playing it again.

Disgust at a girl I know for continually feeling sorry for herself  
and never acting positively to do something about her problems.

My mother and her friends were speaking badly about my father  
when they were separated, and my brothers and sisters and myself  
were allowed to listen.

Somebody was blaming me of a story which was not real and not  
true.

When my room-mate was making noise deliberately, by playing a  
flute early in the morning while I was trying to study.

When my exboyfriend threw me around the dorms because I was  
talking on the phone to another guy of whom he was jealous,  
after we had an argument in which I thought we broke up.

We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were  
dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to  
urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the  
military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine  
of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too  
late for anyone to give us a lift.

I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and  
shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the  
connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was  
drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter  
my room.
When I heard about the disaster in Bophal (India).
Fear of doing well on a midterm.
When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.
Not collecting letters for my friend al I promised.
After an argument with a friend of mine.

I felt guilty the other day because I took two pieces of bread  
instead of one in the Cafeteria and some of the girls were short  
of bread.
When I first saw a person begging.
A wurm dropped on my head.

Recently, some friends and I had too much to drink while on a  
foot-ball road trip to USC. We trashed our hotel room and I felt  
ashamed when the maid walked in the next morning.
When I was studying and someone disturbed me.
A "near-accident" in a car, driving too fast on an icy road.
When I heard that my nephew had passed away.
When my son was born.

Very intoxicated men who incite each other to fight.   I met a  
vile smelling man on the tram who got closer and closer to me  
till I got up, then he got angry.

Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as  
rustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to no  
good.
When I won some coins in a small competion.

Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in  
a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.   
He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.
When I felt lack of aid from close friends.
Failing university entrance examn.

The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the  
Zambia closed badminton championships.

I felt guilty when one of my secondary teacher left me while I  
was in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me.
The same as in "shame".

I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this  
was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the  
lecturer.

I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played  
around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I  
took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of  
the foxtail.

I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.  We  
do have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I take  
out my anger on him.

When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she  
was engaged to an another man.

My mother wrote me and said that I would not writ enough letters  
home.

I was supposed to meet my girlfriend at a pre-arranged place but  
it took me an hour to find her.

My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me  
about it before.

When I heard a rumour that the 1st year exam results were out. I  
had fear that I might be one of the failures.
The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.

I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into the  
wrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me very  
denigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.

When I slapped a nephew who did something that I considered  
wrong, and I was reprehended for this.

I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick  
caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars  
and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on  
my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.

It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to  
graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel  
disgusted.

I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant things  
in this parcel.

When I had promised to do some washing for my mother and I did  
not do it.  She did it herself despite her being ill.  I felt  
very guilty.
Not finishing homework.

Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping  
from under my feet.
When someone lies to me.
Being catched when stealing.

A teacher spent a lot of time helping me without wanting to be  
paid for it. For the exam I didn't got a good grade and I felt  
ashamed.

When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have  
made a nice walk together.

When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on  
the grounds of coming home late.
After my +2, when I did not get admission in B.E I felt disgusted.

When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone  
else and that we would not meet again for a year.  Although we  
did not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.

On a trip to Santander a child sitting beside me fell ill and  
started to vomit, seeing this made me feel very bad.

My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it  
meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.

Before the certificate examination I was very poor in Biology  
(the worst result in my class).  Ever since F.5 it had been  
getting poorer and poorer.  I had tried my best and had spent  
most of my time studying this subject.  Finally my results were  
so bad that I thought that it was just not fair.

I felt disgusted at my teams poor perfomance prior to league  
play.

I was ashamed when a certain friend of mine I used to move with  
failed to propose to a lady yet we always said to ourselves no  
lady can refuse our proposal.
During my childhood I once lied and my sister found out.

When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home  
immediately instead of waiting a few hours.  They could have  
easily waited.

During the last academic year i.e 1983/1984 just before the  
closure, we were surrounded and threatened by the paramilitary  
forces.

I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked  
if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.

When a friend from whom I preferred to hide my private life  
discovered that I had relations with a man.

I was making very strong statements about infidelity in couples.  
Then I discovered that one of my best friends, who had just been through  
a very sad case of mutual infidelity, was listening.

I felt the above condition when I was found in a house playing  
with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was  
unable to answer.

I found out that someone that I knew had someone else taking  
tests for her.

Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something  
funny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl's  
face.
Hear a very nice joke made by a friend.

After seeing an "uncertain" child work on a model for several  
hours, I watched a "bully" of the same age destroy it, telling  
the child that it was worthless.

I once saw an old man up the road, fossicking through the rubbish  
bins and the gutter. I was really disgusted at first but I've  
seen him a few times since then and now I feel really sorry for  
him and I often give him cigarettes when I see him, because he  
mainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.
Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.
When my grandfather died.

When I asked my classmate to teach me to do my homework, he asked  
me to study by myself first but I did not do it.  When he asked me  
 if I had studied, I felt very ashamed.

When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raised  
criticisms all the time.

Once a friend had pushed me and I had fallen on to a window which  
then broke.  I was taken to tthe principal's office and he  
accused me of having broken the window.
A relative died.
I felt this feeling during the exam in higher mathematics.

The day I was nearly stabbed to death by ruffians who wanted to  
take my money.  I refused to give them any money and they started  
running after me, I ran into somebody else's house to save  
myself.

I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knew  
that I would never see them again.
I went out dancing and found my boyfriend kissing another girl.

I was working in a classmate's house with a group. A girl began  
to graze her foot against mine under the table.

When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been  
very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers  
from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an old  
flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.

When I went to a disco with a friend I started behaving badly  
embarrassing him without reason.
Not doing well in the examn.

I am troubled by hair growing in my neck. I was troubled by this  
for a long time and was much ashamed when someone brought his/her  
hands close to my face.

A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being  
clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally  
graphic.
B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima  
calling for her mother.
After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.
When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.

I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better  
appearance.

I felt guilty when I skipped a two hour practical class I knew I  
would miss out on more information which I did not know, but I  
couldn't cope with going.
Heard some ghost-like noise at night.
When I attended my cousin's 31st birthday.

After I had given the wrong answer to my students they pointed  
it out to me and I had to correct myself.
When my grandfather died.

When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing  
our relationship.
Good news about a sick relative.

I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant,  
since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.

Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often  
recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my  
general impression from severl situations which evoked this  
feeling in me.
Before an exam in logics.

When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due to  
transport problem, whereas the truth was that I had woken up  
late.  I thus cheated my boss.

When I received my U.E. accredited as I was totally unexpecting  
it and I was so happy.

When I was detained one day in school, by the vice-principal, for  
indiscipline.

When a patient had died soon after I had told the guardian to  
wait outside the ward.

I hit my little sisiter on the head with a stone while we were  
fighting.

When a "friend" woke me up in the middle of a blessful sleep by  
knocking on the door.  Then he started calling me names and  
saying that he had heard that I had been talking behind his back, this  
was a lie and the guy was drunk to the core.

When I got really drunk on Norvegian Indipendence Day, and was  
not allowed to participate in football (soccer) games for two  
weeks. That was very unpleasant.

After an exam I was in a very bad mood as I had done it very        
badly.  At home, my mother took so long to ask me how things had   
gone that I lost my temper.  I overreacted and made my mother cry.  
She still prepared lunch for me and did not scold me .  Suddenly,  
I thought that it was my fault and I started crying.

Did well in an examn just before my father's birthday: the best  
present I can give to my father.

I lost a conference because I hadn't got in touch with a certain  
person to inform her that I would go with her. I thought she knew  
what I wanted.

The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back  
to University and to the exams.

I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I  
realised that I could feel very jealous of other women because  
of my boyfriend.

I once stole my father's money and denied having done it. Instead  
father threatened my young brother and he was beaten. He was  
innocent and I felt guilty.

When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although  
I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.

I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with  
either of them, so I had to change my plans.

My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am,  
bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and  
in a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her to  
really hurt her.

I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed.   
There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance,  
not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.

Every time I was around this one person I would stick my foot in  
my mouth by being nasty. One time I accidently said something  
fairly cruel that was totally inappropriate.

A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the  
end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted  
marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.
My article not chosen by the college newspaper

One of my friends went and told another friend of mine that I was  
going abut with another guy in Lilongwe besides the one I had.  
She said I was seen with him hand in hand.
The sadistinc exacution of a student in the USA.
A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.

I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met  
and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a  
fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.
Before the examn.

My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a  
peculiar manner.

The day the results of the Chinese university was announced I  
should have been very happy; however my grandmother, because of   
her prejudice and misunderstanding, started a  quarrel with my  
mother.  She expected me to take her side and she deliberately  
talked of my mother's wrong doings.  I was very angry because -  
one my grandmother was not being reasonable and two because it  
should have been a happy day and three we had moved into a new  
house that day.

I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the  
Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information  
was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the  
Headmaster.
Once, during a performance I did not sing the way I had to.
NO RESPONSE.

When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high  
tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.
When I discovered that my mother had been involved in adultery.

I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that  
I would not do well.
NO RESPONSE.

Being with a close friend, in the city, who was involved at the  
present point in time in outrageous activity.

On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought  
me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.

I was ashamed when I was being introduced to the church  
congregation.

When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He could  
hardly walk. I didn't dare to go to a veterinarian because I was  
afraid he would kill him.
Can't remember any episode of disgust.
Ran into a parking car on a bicycle.

I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and my  
friends.

A condition in which I was disgusted followed when I lost money  
on my way home from the college.

Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritated  
because at night the music didn't stop in time. And at breakfast  
my boyfriend ran away because we didn't agree with him. I felt  
angry.

Iqam chosen for your lecture and my best friend is not. Now he is  
angry with me and I cannot help him.

Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle -  
driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.
Almost had a bicycle accident.
I overreacted towards my mother and felt ashamed afterwards.

At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with  
a guy she knows I really like.

I felt guilty when the truth was known about my impregnating the  
girl we were staying with.

I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in  
an exam.  She told me that I had passed.
When my father died.

Walking around the University at night by myself, having been  
previously warned of rapes, etc.

The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving  
Exams and I was selected to go to college.
Saw my roommate messing up our room.

When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we  
decided to be legally separated.
Failing an examn because I did not work hard enough.
When I saw the pictures of the draught in Etiopia.

I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many  
bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the  
girls who did him wrong.
I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.

About the car (sadness) I felt anger the way I acted after  
negotiating it.

Finding out that my health condition may be against my attending  
university lectures.
My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.

When I left a carnaval ball at 4 o'clock a.m. I was alone in a  
foreign city and I had to go back home, when a guy appeared and  
tried to "catch me".

As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it  
might bite me.
My friend not allowed to go to the English lectures.

Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did not  
communicate on time.
When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.

I felt guilt when my friends were punished to slash grass at the  
gound because of making noise in class. I was in the group of  
noise-makers but I denied having done any noise.

I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by  
motorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I did  
not care about a cold, he said that if I did not care for  
anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said  
something like that).

When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and  
went well.
Staying alone in the dark.

I told my pesent boyfriend that I was an Australian as are my  
parents. As the relationship developed I found it harder and  
harder to confess and became sure it would end our relationship.  
He eventually found out when told in front of me by my mother.

When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I  
feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of  
the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is  
aware that I know that they are wrong.
When someone told a secret I told them not to tell.

When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I  
could have avoided.

I received a poor grade on a midterm even though I got all the  
right answers and knew the material. I went to the TA to try to  
raise my grade and he wouldn't do it.
When I read racist slogans on the walls.
When I decided to separate from my husband.

Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in  
love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with  
another boyfriend.
Pictures of Nazi extermination camps on a T.V program.

A girl I was with yelled something out to this group of guys I  
knew. It sounded really childish.

People who came to our home - and requested "Put out your smoke".  
That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even  
politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to  
the situation.

Day before yesterday my mother bought me a new pair of shoes,  
without my having asked for them.  She told me that when she saw  
the pair of shoes she felt like buying them for me.  I really  
liked the shoes and they made me feel that my mother cares for  
me.
When my grandmother passed away.

When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment  
"myself" i.e on my own initiative.

I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got  
very angry.

I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings  
in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with  
complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the  
hand of the other person, etc...

When I have sometimes been unfair to my parents, when I have  
happened to deceive them over some trifling things.

My father promised to send me pocket money at the month-end since  
I wanted to buy a new pair of shoes when I was at secondary  
school, but he didn't.
I got a very good grade on one of my midterms a few weeks ago.

When a close friend met me at the station in the middle of the  
night, when I came back from a long and tiring journey.

In a situation with my girlfriend I took a decision.  Later when  
I thought about it, I realized that it was an erroneous decision.

I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time  
with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.

I experienced anger most recently when I had committed a sin  
which I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made a  
vow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.

Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad  
experience which was changing his whole way of looking at life  
etc.

I wanted to borrow lecture notes from a friend and he did not  
lend me them.
When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.

Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a  
party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the  
next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said  
and done on the night before.
Finding out about people can go mad for social reasons.
A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.

For not having succeded in getting the job as a translator that I  
wanted.

My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the           
West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.
After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.

I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above  
our bedroom.  I knew that nobody lived there since it was an  
office.  I got frightened (later I was given a "natural"  
explanation).

We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were  
watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering  
me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)   
by hitting one of them.

A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to  
dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.
When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.

When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A  
subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and  
neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

When I said good-bye to my girlfriend.  I had spent two years on  
developing this relationship and it was unsuccessful, I felt very  
sad.

Unknown person knocking repeatedly on backdoor when no one else  
was at home.

I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.    
When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.
I was told that a friend of a friend committed suicide.

In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of  
society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by  
Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a  
reflection of my own shortcomings.

When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which  
there was a rotten human skull.

My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would  
find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's  
room.

I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling  
terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that  
was stinking.
When I forgot my mother's birthday.

When my friend did not pass the high school graduation  
examinations.

My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was not  
guilty. He was misled by his wife.
When an unknown person provoked me verbaly and physically.

When I forgot the birthday of my best friend and I innocently  
came to visit her one week later.

I remember that once, a friend did not co-operate with me due to  
some unavoidable reasons.  Unaware of this I treated her unjustly  
till I realized everything, and then I felt ashamad of my deeds.

I broke my knee when I was skiing over "Yastrebetz" (a racing  
track in a Bulgarian winter resort).
A terrible fight that I provoked with my friend.

Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it  
off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until  
that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives  
were brought to my knowledge later.
My best friend chosen for your English lectures.
I broke my friend's badminton racket and she kept quiet about it.

I had a girlfriend who lived several kilometers away from my  
home. One day she wrote me that she'd visit me. On her way she  
had a car accident and was badly injured. I was very sorry to see  
her lying in a bed in the hospital.

During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it  
impossible to continue discussing.

When I told my uncle a false story - that people had stolen the  
books from my room and I demanded money from him.  When he found  
out the truth I was in trouble.

When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in  
it and threw it in the dust-bin.

When my sister had the still born child, she was emotionally very  
deep down, and it took her a long time to recover.

I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest against  
a rude and immoral teacher.  I sneaked out and told the  
headmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.

When I could not hold my bladder while making a telephone call  
and ended up wetting myself.

Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square.  
Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I  
went into the role of a performing clown.

When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and  
was in hospital.

During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted  
her parents by having had sex in their house which they  
overheard.

When I discovered that the house we had hired in Tonga was full  
of cockroaches.

A scene in a film in which one man repressed another one. By  
concidence, their position was reversed. The other man was  
repressed in an identical way as he did before.

One night during dinner my nephew was naughty, so I quarrelled with my   
parents.   I regreted this as my nephew was only two years old and I   
had to tolerate him !  The quarrel made my father think that his children   
may not take care of him in the future (it was a slip of the tongue and   
this made me realize that my father keeps his thoughts to himself).  I was   
still very angry so I dropped my bowl and chopsticks and went to the kitchen   
to drink tea and then ran to the other side of the house.

I was ashamed with my biology lecturer when he asked me a  
question and I could not answer it.

We lived with 3 persons in the loft of a house. It often occurred  
that other persons again and again climbed the stairs with much  
noise. When I was studying I couldn't concentrate and got angry.
Doing poorly on a midterm.

Once when I had started to write a paper, there was a phone  
call for me.  I had to go downstairs to receive it and after the  
conversation I discovered that all the information had  
disappeared from my mind.
At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.

When I learned that a relative had been spreading rumours about  
me.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They  
were special people to me.

When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to study  for six  
years, came back home safe and in good health.
A certain night during initiation.

When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and  
myself.
When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).

I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I  
expected it to be very active with people, gangs, fast cars etc,  
thought it was actually quite quiet, though also oppressive. I  
walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

When I opened my TE Score envelope, and saw I got into  
Physiotherapy.

When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to  
our favorite dancing.

One day in class, the professor asked me a question concerning something  
he had been explaining.  He was very close to me (beside me) and I  
had no idea what to answer.
When two drug addicts tried to take away my money.
When I hurt my parents in one way or another.

I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.  A man  
sitting beside me started to stroke my leg for a while, he left in  
the middle of the film.

When I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked the  
Institute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held in  
TISS.  However, because of the administrative officer I could not  
get the money.
Not doing my share of the work for the house job.

My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to  
seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of  
Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki.  I was not at all  
interested in any other place and had no time to study for other  
entrance exams.

At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My  
reaction was not as it should have been.

When I broke off with my boyfriend after three years.  It was  
quite unexpected for him and there was no particular reason for  
the break up, such as someone else.
When my honest intentions were marred by another's jealousy.

Angry when our team (small boys) lost the county championship  
football final.

I saw someone that I thought I knew repeatedly drunk. I do not  
like to be around alcoholics.

Being in a Malaysian city with my girlfriend coming out of a  
picture theatre - seeing her rush up to a taxi that a very old  
sick man was trying to get to. Seeing her take over the taxi.

When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for  
her all night, not knowing where she was.

I slammed my little brother into a wall because he was bothering  
me.

When I forced a close friend of mine to ask a girl things about  
herself.

When I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate  
and was selected to go for Secondary education.

This morning I spent a lot of time on my toilet and missed the  
train to the university.  My mother told me that I spent more  
time than a woman on my toilet.  I felt a mixed emotion of shame  
and anger.
Beaten up by a classmate in school.

I felt angry when I heard that my sister had failed the  
Examinations which we hoped she was going to pass with  
distinctions.

I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which  
I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt  
guilty.

My mother was ill and asked me to prpare our lunch. I went to do it,  
and while I was working, she stayed behind me telling what I  
had, or not to do. I asked her to stop meddling, and to go to  
bed. When I went to ask for help to my sister, my mother said that  
I was proud, that I asked for help only when I wanted and that I  
wasn't able to cook by myself.

That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was  
cought.

Once I had to go home on foot at 5 a.m. I had to pass through a  
forest and I was going alone.

Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with  
whom I get along very well.

[ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing  
which is part of my work.  Intense reading also brings me joy.  I  
also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]

I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a small  
part. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkward  
when I had to show what I had prepared.

At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very  
good, I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There  
remained only an undescribable joy and a feeling of warmth,  
security etc.
Had an insulting letter from my father.

The first day that I was close to a dead body, in my third year  
at UNZA, school of medicine.

When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a  
fortnight.

When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk  
of her being pregnant.

I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into a  
little cup. There was a thick white "wad" in it. I tried to take  
it out and throw it in the sink.

I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of some  
incultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.

I tried my level best to care for my client, I took an  
appointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor he  
expired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.

The government's announcement of the withdrawal of the student  
allowances in 1984.

I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and  
attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she  
was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.
When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.

A friend doesn't let me study when I want to. She doesn't feel I  
need to study and doesn't understand how important studying is to  
me. I get very angry with her.

With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and  
urinated on the floor in front of everyone.
