For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.
Not doing well in the examn.
Viewing the nuclear war film "Threads".

We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while  
visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an  
hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door  
between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.

It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a  
celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned  
out that there was no audience at all because everyone had  
pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got  
furious.

When I did not concentrate on my studies despite my mother's help  
and cooperation.

When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the fact  
that he had more time to do it than I had.

After I had cheated my parents that I had lost my textbooks so  
they had to send me money.
My fiancT left me for my best friend.
Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

After I was thrown out of a car in an accident, this resulted in  
a fracture.

A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me no  
attention.  She keeps up appearances but shows almost no interest  
in me.

I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory  
attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out  
of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she  
took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate  
them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.

This also happened when I was very small.  I was beaten up by my   
mother for no fault of mine, I had just beaten up my younger  
brother for what I thought was his fault.  I was very angry with  
my mother.

When I was responsible for getting my friend run-out in a vital  
cricket match.

At school when I had a shouting argument with a friend over my  
ability to carry out a particular duty in the correct way without  
harming her.

I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had  
not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time she  
genuinely took notice of it. I felt shame that I was almost  
taking the part of a husband, or at least an equal which I should  
not.

I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and  
next day he told me that he had chat up with another girl.
I had just masterbated with another boy.
When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.
When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

When other people refuse to do their house jobs and give the  
work to someone else.
When I don't fulfill my obligations.

My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did not  
care for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack of  
concern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthur  
like a brother. He was easy to talk to.
When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night  
and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous and  
overstrained.

I had gone to the hospital for my research and got late in  
reaching home.  I feared that when I reached home there would be  
a quarrel because of my being late.

I was very sad when I had to leave persons with whom I had a very  
intense relationship I also had to leave the environment which  
was part of this.

I was scared when I realized that I might miss the train which I  
was supposed to take.  I was 1500 Kilometres away from home and when   
I heard the depart whistle I was still 150 feet away from the  
train.  I finally made it.

My father died 4 years ago, 18 months after my mother died. I  
feld my sister was responsible for his death, in that she "hadn't  
loved him". I felt ashamed for myself, and for my family.

This was when I was being followed home every day from the campus,  
by a stranger.  He would follow me to the campus and then sit  
outside my class.  If I was not there he would ask my friends as  
to where I was.  He was a dark, ominous looking person and I was  
terrified of him as I did not know his intentions.  I reported  
him to the security officer, who turned him over to the police.   
I was even more petrified then.

When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have my  
point of view and they monopolise a conversation.

We had to take our cat to the vet for mercy killing (an  
injection).

When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me  
too.

When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST,  
and I wasn't approved in the second fase.

When I realized that we are living on borrowed time, and that the  
nuclear holocaust appears to come closer every day.
Being aggressive against members of my family.

The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the  
driver made the same excuse every day.

Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw  
another one, as if out of control of the driver.

When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I  
had taken this test.

I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as much  
money as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brother  
was better off then me.

When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been  
withdrawn  and so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA,  
even though I registered as a student later.

Following heavy stirring / ridiculing a close friend who was  
very vulnerable to such attack - inspiring fierce, defensive  
counter-attack.

Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if I  
was alive or dead, I remained "cold levered" during the situation  
but felt great fear.
Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.
I went to visit friends and it was very companionable.

When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that  
disgusted me.

When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her  
boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole  
thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He  
embarassed me in front of a crowd.
I was so angry with a patient who refused to take drugs.
Going to a concert.

Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with  
baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk  
convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the  
police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.
Insulted by somebody.

A friend's father had died, I was to come and see this friend  
although I did not know his family.

At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and  
by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.

I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She however was  
fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.

I always feel guilty when I see my mother sad or fed up with  
life. I really dont know the reason.
Finding out that China is backward in science.

The first day I visited the hospital I was disgusted because I  
experienced offensive smell which I never expected. I nearly ran  
away from the course.
Could not help a student who needs help.

I felt much anger and perhaps I feel it till now, against my  
girlfriend's sister who incited her to betray me just when I  
needed her very much. She didn't think of anything, simply  
passed over everything.

I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me.   
Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem a  
lot.
When I masturbated in my room.
Not doing well in the examn.

When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people  
and close friends.

Despite my being affectionate, sincere, and helpful to close   
relatives of mine; they turned around and accused me of being  
inconsiderate in my relationship with them.

The last time I had to phone the Registry, after having called  
them so many times in the last few days.
When my dog died.

Death of paternal grandmother to whom I was very close - died of  
cancer.

Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back  
by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the  
association).
Saw someone licking his dining bowl.
Noisy people in the library.

When I was not in a position to control myself.  I had said too  
much and had been cruel with no other than my mother.
When I saw a scene on T.V where a castration was shown.

A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before,  
did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half  
a year later.

When one meets new people with whom one is forced to collaborate  
with.
When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.

After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I  
passed my last exam.
Scoared a goal in a football match.
When my mother kept me in leading-strings.

I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in the  
presence of my friends.

A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a  
wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an  
invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all  
my empathy.

When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of  
medical uniform.

When I learnt that I had failed an exam,  This not only influenced  
my emotions but also other important tasks, it also made my  
record imperfect.

I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with  
handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.
When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school,  
I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail,  
but it appeard that we both had passed.

I was dancing Malipenga (traditional dance). I exaggerated the  
steps I was supposed to make in the negative way. This happened in  
front of spectators. It was bad for our Boma (group) because I  
was on the front line where ability is displayed and it is this  
ability that counts when choosing the winning side.

Taking part in the mobbing of some girls in my class in primary  
school.

When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous  
language of Maori at an important function where I was the only  
woman in the group and it was expected of me.

Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from  
boarding school on accrediting leave.
A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.

I was not able to help my sister to understand that her husband  
is a bad man before she was married to him.
When my sister died in a fire accident at home.
Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.

Had a very good friend. We grew apart I found myself running her  
down to other friends.

I was at home alone, and heard noises on the roof, and doorknobs,  
and drawers.
[ When I see that the toilet is unclean.]
When a close friend drowned in the American River.
When I got the loan for my studies.

I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effet on someone's  
problem.

When I received a letter from the university telling me that my  
application had been accepted.

When I lied to my wife and told her that I was going to the  
Copperbelt on a buisness trip, she later found me in a hotel with  
a girlfriend.

I had a test in the class and I had not adequately prepared  
myself. I didn't fare so well on the exam and I felt bad about  
it.

This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I  
(being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in  
and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months  
later, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feel  
guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for  
myself and my future.

I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successful  
in my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and was  
selected for Secondary School.

When I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. I  
was very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to the  
veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a  
short time I had liked him very much.

I spoke to my mother on the phone.  She had skin cancer and was  
waiting to be operated.  I forgot to ask her the date of the  
operation and just before finishing our conversation she gave me  
the date in passing.

When I heard the last regulation of the socialist govrenment  
concerning pensions.
When they stole my dark blue tennis.
I asked someone to go out and she accepted right away.

I once watched the series called "Dynasty" on TV, and I detested  
it.

This happened a year when I was having a hard time, I got  
admission to do research despite obstacles in the procedure of admission.

When I broke a tea saucer. I felt ashamed. This was during the  
birthday of my girlfriend.
When I and the boy next door set fire to a house by accident.

I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to  
watch another film on the same channel. My friend switched over  
to the other cannel without asking me what I wanted.
My best friend betrayed me and told other people my secrets.

In a public swimming hall I saw a very aggressive man who  
practically attacked the children who got in his way when he was  
swimming.
I have a new born child.

I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's  
playground, when a toddler ran in front of me I knocked him over  
and he hit his head quite hard and began crying.

When a certain girl I believed to be my life partner refused an  
engagement.

I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not  
want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, they  
lost the text-book and gave me no compensation.

I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to the  
racism she has been subjected to.
Saw a dirty street.

When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because  
of indifference or cowardice.
Walking in the dark by myself.
I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.

A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the street  
with a woman, appparently his girlfriend.  I was walking on the  
other side of the street and thought that I was not supposed to  
interfere.  Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.

When I saw the film "Johnny got his gun" which deals with the  
consequences of the Vietnam war.

When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should  
do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped.  
Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.
When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.
Insulted by a woman in public.
I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
My friend has to go on field trips, he just told me.
When I passed an exam.
As a child when I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.

After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit  
blood.
The price I was charged for work on my car.

When the thing that made my friends and relatives sad happened to  
them.
I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.

When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he  
was annoyed, proceeded to ignore me for several meets with no  
apparent reason.

This situation happened when I was found kissing a girl who was  
my friend's girlfriend.

Fear - paralysing - that I would not be accepted by the God who I  
believed to be there because I was "morally bankrupt" (before  
becoming a Christian and realising that that was why Christ came to  
free us from sin and to forgive us).
My old friend visited me in the university.

Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth  
year twice.

One night, I went out with some friends for dinner and I did not  
tell my parents that I would come back late.  I thought of  
phoning but in the end I did not.  When I arrived home, my  
parents were very worried.

When after a party celebrating a friend's 21st birthday - upon  
leaving I found 10 people outside throwing up and further 4  
unconscious.

I put in two years of hard work and it was neither looked at nor  
appreciated.

When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would  
have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the  
letter.

When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I  
was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were  
very hard.

In school I had difficulties mith mathematics. When I had to work  
for an examination, I really felt disgusted.

Every time I meet a certain person. We cannot get on well  
together, we dislike each other.

One day my mother forced me to eat more and I refused, the next  
day she served me more rice and mutton pieces than usual.  When I  
saw this I got very angry and scolded her, and refused to eat.   
Later I felt guilty and asked her to excuse me.
When my brother's visa for the U.S.A got cancelled.

Missing lectures and avoiding university work for no reason when  
it had to be done.
At a friend's party there were several allusions to my sexual adventures.

The serving lady in the students' dining hall shouting at  
studennts.
I am afraid if I'll finish the term.

I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty  
at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being  
a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this  
emotion)

When I am travelling by car and have to meet an oncoming car  
while overtaking.

My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I  
was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay  
unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

When I was very young and we moved as a family to Auckland from  
Wellington, this meant new school and friends (etc.).
When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.
When my studies are too demanding and I cannot cope with it.

The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying  
that there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafe  
disgusted without taking the tea.

I talk too much, cannot keep things secret. I promised a friend  
not to tell something to anybody. Neverthless, I did, and she got  
informed about it. I felt very ashamed.

When my friend who is close to me got engaged and did not invite  
me.

I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was being  
followed.

When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking  
out of the glass.

I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently,  
the pedology lecturer was the cause.
When as a 7 year old, I stole money from my mother.
Lying to my grandparents about visiting my boyfriend in Chico.

Being refused to attend the neuropsychology lecture in the  
medical university.

When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I  
was stopped from punching him for it.
I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.
When my father passed away.

My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still  
living with them).  He recovered relatively well although he had  
to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale  
enterprise).

When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work  
expected of me was not going to be in.

If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my  
parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.
A friend misunderstood me.

I experience a sense of guilt as my middle son cannot express  
himself like other children, neither verbally nor in writing.

When I went to see the doctor and had to take my clothes off so  
that he could examine me.

Yesterday I broke my sister's raio. She hears it always when she  
has school examinations and now she has examinations.

I felt disgusted when I went to one of the Central hospitals  
where my hope of getting good treatment was turned down by one of  
the doctors who said I was alright despite my feeling pain.

When my brother had an epileptic attack and I was scared as to  
what would happen to him.

I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from  
living somewhere out of town and I hadn't seen her for months. We  
are very close sisters.

When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the  
examinations she was about to take.
My grandfather died thirteen years ago.
When I fell down.

I felt it when I saw a colleague of mine eating like a beast. At  
the same time he was making gestures, speaking and making the  
hell of a noise.

When I needed another job and tought that a good and known person  
(my employer) could help me. He simply said that he couldn't help  
me.
I was sexually assaulted one night by a stranger.

We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following  
us.

[ I have always been very scared and tense before an exam and  
before the declaration of the results.]
Someone messing up the room we share.

When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught  
me with them in my bag.

When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered  
about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see  
them as soon as possible.

I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an         
operation.
When somebody despised a friend of mine.

I had promised to send something to a friend and it completely  
slipped my mind.  I felt guilty for having forgotten.

When I "passed out" a female friend of mine for no apparent  
reason.  I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like  
that I get mad at anyone, however small the provocation.

My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He  
did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.

One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I  
did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had  
a bad conscience and felt guilty.

I was disgusted at the way the bus conductor threw out an old  
woman oiut of the mini-bus simply because she could not pay the  
fare for her luggage.

I felt guilty one day when I stole a slice of bread in a  
cafeteria.
Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.
Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.

At Christmas night there was a good movie on television which I  
wanted to see for years. I was whining about it till someone told  
me it was very childish. Then I felt shame.

One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strange  
people near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and then  
came close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters.  
After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.

When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of  
an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from  
the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an  
acquaintance in the car with me.

While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not  
accomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.

While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with  
a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too  
raggy.
I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.

An hour before receiving the certificate results I was very  
frightened.  When I saw others crying I felt very tense and as  
time went by my fear grew.

This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to  
start Form I in October 1980.
When having a relationship, I made love with another girl.

When I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked had  
been sold to somebody else.

Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I  
would win , but at last I lost the game.

In secondary school I had a class-mate who talked too much.    
Once we went to the cinema after school and she sat next to me and  
commented the movie throughout  - very disgusting.

Found out that someone I knew well has been misunderstanding me  
for 2 years.

A co-worker and I had to rush a project. I was only working there  
for one month and he for some years. Instead of letting me know  
that he wanted to do the project himself, he went to the  
superviser and let the superviser tell me to let the co-worker do  
it himself since he was quicker at it.

When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the bad  
things that I had been saying about them.
Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.

Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the  
deliberation not the provocation.

Recently, I left my bag in the car of someone who picked me up  
while hitch-hiking. I spent some effort to find out where he  
lived (I succeeded).
When I was with someone I love.
Got through first semester University.
When I sit for examinations.

I received the message that I'd been accepted at the school where I  
really wanted to go.

After attending a song contest proposed by a band called "Chyne"  
we (6 of us) waited for the members of the band to greet us in  
front of the stage.  We went out after a few minutes as it was  
time to close the hall.  We had been waiting at the entrance hall  
for ten minutes when three of the band members came out.  They  
were very excited to see us, one of them was so excited that he  
had tears in his eyes.  We felt very warm and close to each  
other.  They took us back into the hall and we talked freely.  We  
were together for about an hour and during this time we felt  
that they were very sincere.

I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams  
would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to  
obtain some more information and they told me that the exams had  
already taken place.
Losing my temper with my spouse.

At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in great  
esteem.
Found out that the girl I love loves me, too.

I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed  
one night by myself in the house.

I felt a sense of shame when I compromised a colleague of mine. I  
got an information from him which I quite out of place shared  
with another colleague of mine and it resulted in an unpleasant  
consequence for him.

I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well.  
( I had not seen her for several months.)
Insulted by my mother.
When bathing at surf beach & lost togs.

My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my  
girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to  
lose her.

When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the  
washing.
Being sexually assulted on a bus.

When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now  
my girlfriend).

I had not studied very much for my final examination at school,  
so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral  
examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I  
heard that I had passed it.
I forgot about a close relatives's birthday.

In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time -  
wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had  
to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell  
exactly where, finally as a result I was late.

Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between  
OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish  
title.
Had a nice letter from my close friend.

I was in a train where a fight occurred. One person who was there  
opened his handbag and took out a gun, another who fought too  
looked among his things for a weapon to fight.
I am not good enough for your experiment I am doing.

At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothing  
will ever be the same again.

When a colleague was rude with me because she didn't understand  
the subject about which I was discussing.
The day I left my first girlfriend.

Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.  We met her with her  
husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.

I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the  
plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made  
me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.

I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to know  
each other. I was found by Mercy red-haded when I was with Maria.

I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by her  
friends.

I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to  
be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with  
others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to  
come.

As I could not be home before midnight I called home at 11.30 and  
asked them to leave the door open so that I could get in.  I  
actually woke up the whole family by calling them so late.  My  
mother could not go back to sleep, besides she had a conference    
the next day and really needed to sleep.
I was late meeting someone for an appointment.
I forgot to lock the outside door at my Land Lady's place.

When I discovered my mother had been having an affair with my  
father's best friend, and then ran away with him without even  
speaking to me about what she was doing letting me come home from  
school simply to find her gone. I was filled with disgust and  
contempt.
Punished by a leader.

One Saturday afternoon, I deliberately dressed up nicely (I had  
been in a bad mood of late).  I hoped to go for a walk in the  
soft sunlight to try and uplift my spirits.  When I was having  
lunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as to  
why I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with me  
before).  One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we would  
look very nice if we wore them together.

When I failed Psychology examination when most of the students  
passed.

I was amongst a group of people talking about how the Maori  
people were stirrers and causing trouble in our country. I felt  
shame to be a pakeha when other pakehas had such narrow  
conservative views.

I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I had  
been admitted to the university.

I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was  
annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening  
and the night I frequently felt anxious.

When I was reading a book.  It had nothing to do with the book  
itself but with the disagreable smell of the pages of the book.
When I was getting so fat.

One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a  
man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and  
asked me to cure him myself.

I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to see  
her. Later she saw me and said hi.
I did not quite succeed in breast feeding my baby.

In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn.  
 One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk  
(hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and  
I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.
The birth of my daughter.

When I was with the girl I love very much, for the graduatiion  
ball.
When my friends were rude to a girl.

A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced  
this feeling when I tried to chase her out.

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a  
stress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out  
4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and  
should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could  
walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.
The inability to read a book at college.
Damaged the tap in the residental Hall.
Anatomy lesson and told we have to do it at night sometimes.
I may not be clever enough to understand your English lectures.

[ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In  
addition I was asked many questions which I did not want to  
answer.]

I did not do as well as I expected on a chemistry exam. I  
received a score below the average and I thought I had done very  
well.

My girlfriend lost her temper without any reason and she did not  
consider or respect my feelings.

When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guilt  
is a part of my feelings.
When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.

When I was young I saw a horror film.  Then when I went to sleep,  
the film came back too my mind and the characters frighteneed my  
imagination.

I woke up at the house of someone I knew, not remembering very  
much about what had been said or done during the party on the  
previous night.
Breaking up with a girl.
When I went to my first dental appointment.
My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.

When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,    
during my holidays in Monze.

My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his  
soporification.

A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly  
visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.
When I got a bad result for one of my assignments.

When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected  
with copying at a class-work at school.

Having failed to help with the 5th of March arrangements (Women's  
Day), although I had previously promised to take part in the  
work.
Participating in a theft several years ago.

I saw a magazine with photographs of dead and maimed people whose  
limbs were separated from their body like a head on one side and  
the leg on the other.

When I was young I felt ashamed when our relatives visited us and  
I hid myself.

A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of  
mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also  
some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.

When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel  
for one year.

When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she  
would die.

I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our  
relationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we shared  
everything and all this was finished.

One time I was injured when I was playing football at School in  
Blantyre. I was brought to the hospital while my leg was totally  
swollen. The x-rays confirmed there was no fracture but  
collection of blood n the muscles. I feared when they started to  
incise the swollen part with surgical blade.

I usually come back home early but this day I came home back late  
to find some visitors at my place.
The death of my father.
When I passed an exam.

We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact  
plans to paint my room without consulting me.

" I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing  
people in your room," he said.  This sentence really shot my  
heart.  I failed to find the right words, instead I walked away  
without uttering a word.

When the paramilitary was sent to the UNZA and it started using  
tear gas and started intimidating the students without any  
provocation.

I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the  
institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I  
had got at the entrance examination.

Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend  
then over me.

In school I was very bad in running long distances and my  
class-mates laughed at me for this reason.

At school, I did not tell the teacher that it was me who  
had laughed, and she punished the entire class by making them  
stay behind for one hour.

A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and  
withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.

Saw two Canadian students boasting about how rich they are in  
Canada.

When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes for  
myself than for the children - I  felt bad about it.
Tripped on a busy street.

I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on  
my birthday.

I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I  
could not remember the words I had to say.

When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my  
certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew  
nothing about this.
When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.

When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the  
teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often  
with her.
Being alone at night.
My being admitted to UNZA.

When my parents fight lots of time, when I'm the reason of the  
fight, I feel guilty.
When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.
A dirty person, smelling bad and unknown laying on me.

I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would  
run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.

I once got a phone call stating "one of your friend is in jail,  
please come and see him".  When I went to the jail and saw him, I  
was disgusted.

When my mother asked me to do a job for her which does not  
require much effort on my part, yet I refused for selfish reasons  
and saw her have to do it.

I felt guilty when I thought that I was still not standing on my  
own feet.
My grandmother died.
Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.
Some foreign students playing loud music late at night.
When relatives have acted strangely, and unfriendly towards me.

When we could not land our plane and we knew that the fuel was  
running out.  Bad weather had already frightened us.
People spitting in railway stations.

When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia  
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the  
events that were taking place there.
My friend who was in the Bago was kicked out of the sorority.
When a thief broke into my house at night.

My mother suffers from a mental illness.  One night she was not  
feeling well and was sent to the hospital.  I was scared that  
she would die, and all night I was very sad and did not dare to  
close my eyes.

I flet shameful when I learnt that I cooked Nsima which was full  
of lamps in it.
When I was sitting in a car next to a man who was masturbating.

When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were  
magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.

I was supposed to have done some things for my mother, but just  
plain didn't get around to it.

When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speaking  
with food in their mouth, etc.).
Seeing maltreated, dead animals.

I felt guilty because I stole some sweets from my father's  
grocery. When he asked me who stole the sweets I told him it was  
my brother who stole the sweets and he was scolded.
When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.

I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother's  
judgement and action on what I had done.

My friend had been telling me about a certain bird which when it  
cries at night it's the sign that someone will die. So one night I  
was alone in the house and I heard the cry of the bird and I was  
afraid.

I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one  
of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion  
resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my  
reason.

My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something  
which was serious and a real burden to me.
I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.
When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.
When I got separated from the woman I loved.

I have a two-month old baby.  When I came here, to the  
university, to attend lectures, I had to leave the baby with his  
father.  I felt guilty.

After a long time (of no communication with him, physical  
illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected  
to see him.

Truely, I got very ashamed when my brother was sent out of  
Business Machines Limited Company due to improper handling of the  
office equipment in Sales Services.
Finding out China is backward in science.

After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the first  
semester exam.  I failed one of the exams, and when I looked at  
my results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.

Too many people in TV room, I was not able to get a seat to watch  
TV.
Girls dressed like foreigners in the university.

When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to  
accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was  
directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We  
were with a marriage counsellor then.

I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in the  
family drinks.  I felt that I had let down my parents and my  
friends.

A boy phoned me at night and wanted to talk to me for 30 minutes  
outside.  I thought that he would reveal what he felt and would  
question me on our relationship.  I treated him as a friend and  
did not want any misunderstandings.  Therefore I refused to meet  
him and told him that I would see him the coming day.  I was very  
unhappy as I feared having hurt him and got him into trouble.

At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment  
of one's personality.

It was when my father beat my mother while she was ill for three  
weeks and now she was recovering.

I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to  
answer in the presence of the patients.
The day when my son said for the first time "mummy".

When I saw a lady putting on a pair of trousers, I felt it was a  
disguise according to Malawi culture.
I was made a very sharp remark at a rehearsal.

I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long  
time.

I was disgusted to discover that my girlfriend of few weeks was  
already fooling around with another guy.  I was disappointed as  
the guy was a rogue and I respected my girlfriend.

Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for  
a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I  
might lose him.

A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their  
clothes and their way of doing.

This happened when I went to check my first year results, I had   
thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass in  
all my courses.

I think that I am rather shy and do not mix with people as I  
would have liked to, out of shyness.
Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.
Saw an arrogant girl walking pass by.
My friend will find out that I am in love with her.

Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the  
minority.

Nearby the end of the year my wife and I were having a car ride,  
when it appears another vehicle, driven by a drunk driver and  
provokes an accident.

When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something would  
not occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenly  
I saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence,  
and irresponsibility of that person.

[ When I break someone's things out of carelessness, or do something   
to make others feel unhappy  or hurt the self-esteem / self-confidence   
of others, especially if they happen to be friends or family members.]
Staying alone in the biology building after the dark.
Late for a lecture and therefore missed it.

When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual  
emotion.

I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an         
operation.

I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher,  
because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.
Criticized in front of the class.

Coming home one night - my sister was home, and had been drinking  
heavily and started picking arguments.
When my father died.

On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to  
be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of  
her behaviour and paranoia.

I fell on the ground while crossing the street.  My cap covered  
my eyes and I felt quite "difficult".

When my father was imprisoned for burning the house of his  
younger brother.

When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a  
long time.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were  
talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it  
might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I  
felt it a very near and possible event.

I had to undergo an operation in Summer and so my family had to  
stay at home during the holidays.  I felt guilty, above all  
because of my brothers.

When some friends and I get acquainted a guy during vacations I  
thought he was disgusted and "a friend" of mine for whom I feel a  
little disgust wanted to stay with him.

When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regard  
to close friends, even in situations that those friends need  
them.

When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had  
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night  
out in 20 years.

When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting the  
family first.

When I learnt that I had to repeat the first year, I found the  
solution immediately but was blocked by many difficulties.

When I was a little girl about eight years old I broke the bey  
from a closed. Mother asked who did it. I said that it wasn't me, as  
I almost never lied, and my brother did it more frequently in  
spite my brother denieing it my mother gave him a few slaps.

I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody  
in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following  
me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At  
last I arrived home.
I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.

Close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at having  
done it and knowing that they knew.

Not beeing able to stay with my mother for the National Day  
holiday.

After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one  
year in a foreign country.

A friend and I were going to have a study session together in  
which we quiz ourselves in biology material. Because I believed I  
didn't study enough. I feared I would fail.

When I received the news that my beloved grandmother had died.  I  
was at the boarding school and was only 13 years old.

My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to the  
music of the International singer Sam Mangwana. I had no hope of  
going there since I had no money so he gave me the money for  
admission.

When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and  
I felt totally helpless.
When, late at night, I discovered that they had stolen my bike.

It was at the time of my M.Sc exam, when I was not in a position  
to take the exam after having studied seriously.

I was very angry when I heard that my brother was beaten by his  
friends.
I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alley  
one Wednesday night.

My class leader told me the university won't let all of us go to  
your lectures because we are not All English Class.

When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the  
floor.

One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I  
saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me  
and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I  
had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible.  
Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.
When I do something unworthy.

I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in  
Nijmegen where I study.
A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

When I got a stereo walkman from my father when he had finacial  
difficulties. I thought that although he promised to give me that  
present, he was not obliged to do so.

I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to  
thoughtlessness of some colleagues.
Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.
When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.

I had fear of my father (parents) when I first became pregnant. I  
was afraid of delivery itself and whether I would give birth to a  
stiiborn or a baby.

Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a  
nonsense.
When I met my mother after months of absence.

It was in the evening when I heard that my girl went to Zambia  
and that she would never come back.

I felt sad with the two situations I described before. The cat  
and the school. Sadness was intermingled with the other feelings.

Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a  
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had  
stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my  
daughter.

We were writing Primary school leaving Examinations when I had  
fallen at the steps going into the Exam room.
Shame of being reprehended.

I felt disgust when I kissed a guy that I know. I was on the outs  
with my boyfriend and this person appeared but he has nothing to  
do with me.

Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for  
ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.

I felt glad to live again when I went to a meeting about the  
"Knowledge". There are 4 techniques of meditation that connect  
you with the essence of the human being.

I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of my  
superiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.

When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls,  
because my car had broken down.
When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.
I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.
I saw a friend's husband with another woman.

I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no  
visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card  
and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was  
working now.

I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of our  
national holiday as a servant.

A bus drove over my right leg.  The event itself was not very  
frightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward for  
three hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.
When I fell in love.
When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.
The dying of a close member of the family.

When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4  
weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I  
had a job there.
Losing my temper to my sister.

I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed  
my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the  
second reel ended.

When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as  
she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard  
to accept.

I took my math midterm and got it back the following Wednesday in  
class. It was a totally low grade.

That afternoon I rushed home to look at the result slip of the  
higher level as fast as possible.  I opened the envelope very  
carefully and found that my results were much better than I  
had expected and thus I could enter the Chinese university.  My  
diligence had paid and I was very happy.

I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable  
of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in  
the tram.

I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would  
never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed  
about what I had said.
Not being able to help my friend to do homework.
When someone chased me from his house.

In May 18th, 1984 my boyfriend went to the U.S.A. In December I  
was told he passed away. He had cancer of the Oesophagus.

I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current  
separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly  
(actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was  
drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather  
large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no  
one to help me).

On the last day of my school life I was very sad, specially on  
the farewell party day.  I felt sad to leave behind my beloved  
teachers and friends.

When my mother betrayed me by obtaining money from my husband  
when we were separated - pending divorce.

This happened when I was in the 10th standard.  The paddy crops  
were in a bad shape as it had not rained and there was no water  
in the well, so I was in a very sad mood.  I came to the  
conclusion that I would ignore the paddy field, just 12 hours  
after this it rained for one hour.  This was a very tense time  
and the rain brought me tremendous pleasure.

I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed  
towards the precipice along the road.
A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.
When I heard my grandfather's wife had leukemia I was very sad.

When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies  
took liberties, more than what was normal.

At a private party I literally fell into the food. The party was  
completely ruined for the host, carpets had to be cleaned, etc.
When I felt the smell of industries that pollute.

My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was  
blood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death and  
partly I think, due to the fact that I couldn't/didn't cry.

At the moment when I heard the result of an examination and it  
proved that I succeeded the second year of my study.

In a Mathematics class, the professor asked me a question and I  
gave the wrong answer.
Whenever I see an alcoholic.
When I insulted an elderly person for no reason.

As a child - being sent to the shop by mother - buying some  
chocolate - getting caught by mother.

I felt disgust when I realized that I had eaten something fatty,  
and vomited too much.

A person whom I thought to be honest took and spend the little  
money that I had and I had no way of getting any money in the  
few following months.

When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came  
up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had  
changed.

When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of  
Zambia.

Having an affair with my good friend's best friend. And every time  
I see my best friend I feel guilt because we can't tell him.

Receiving a letter form a girl that means a lot to me  
emotionally.

Someone didn't show up at a meeting in spite of having agreed to  
come.

I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That  
appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long  
time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the  
departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.

I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting  
I forgot to take the minutes.
Managed to run 30 Km on skis fairly simply.

At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.  He was  
very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long  
time and had relieved himself in his trousers.

I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the  
scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at  
times just plain rude behavior.

After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt very  
sad.

When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima  
with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.

While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on  
his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him  
permanent injury.

I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother  
always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting  
my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I  
just behaved aggressively towards my sister.

My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway  
if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I  
start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are  
perhaps dead.

A teacher was very blunt in his relation to a child so that the  
child was very upset when arriving at home.

I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my  
parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived  
self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as  
I am.

I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England.  We had  
said that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (we  
were not going to the same town in England).  As soon as I walked  
in he called from England as he could not wait till he came  
home.
When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.
I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.
Bought something bad from the shop and they refused to change it.
Finding out I am not chosen for the English lectures.
One of my pupils escaped from school to the street.

When I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the whole  
day dancing and eating sugarcanes from our garden.

When I got permission to study at a place which was far away from my  
home.

When I was forced to call the telephone company about a bill  
concerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord.  The  
bill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had been  
using my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his own  
phone reconnected.

It happened that one of my best friends just took my shirt  
without my knowledge, I hadn't put it on for many days and I was  
short of clothes.

My girlfriend and I agreed to go to the cinema. However I  
completely forgot our appointment. I remembered it two hours  
too late when I went to visit her.

A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few  
months old.
When I learnt that I was selected for form I.

I was sitting in school, waiting for my sister to go home. Suddenly a  
boy put fire in a paper and threw it were I was sitting. The  
paper didn't get me, but I felt terribly disgusted at this  
cowardliness and irresponsibility that caused a great  
discussion. We went to the director and he, drunk as always, said  
that I was ... attention in school. I felt disgust of this  
situation, and of the persons implicated in it.
When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.

I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a  
science class here.

When I confessed to my girl-friend (now my wife) that I had  
betrayed her with another woman.
People hunting animals.

We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and  
suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My  
friend had to turn the car rapidly.

When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged with  
giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove  
it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.

I misunderstood a girl and thought that she loved me.  One day  
when I was talking to her, her boyfriend appeared and I felt  
ashamed.

In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation  
was disgusting in itself.
Finding out that my best friend was deceiving me.

An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the team  
leader.

[ When family mmembers or friends blame me for something I am not  
responsible for.  I feel very sad as it was not my fault.]

When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology  
student.

When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was  
about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.

The more than satisfactory result of a recently-completed  
university subject was communicated to me by phone.

I felt so afraid when dad fell ill, he had never suffered from  
that disease since and I had never seen him as he was.

I feel ashamed every time that someone makes me a positive or  
negative critic.

Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak  
about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke,  
that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his  
friends, but I was present.
I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

It was in March 1985 when one of my fellow students borrowed my  
wristwatch and after sometime he broke a glass of that watch I  
got angry when he was telling me but the anger didn't take long  
to fade.

A person (a male) told me that he liked me.  He has a problem, he  
is a homosexual.

I think that the only time I really felt shame was when I was  
very young and I had to defecate on the street.  I was very  
worried in case someone should see me.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it  
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his  
own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it  
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the  
preceding week.

I felt angry at one time when I was chatting with friends and  
suddenly another friend joined us and started opposing any  
comment I added to our chatting.

On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very  
disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been  
aggressive though he could have been.

I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and  
I thought I was lost and was going to panic.
When my sister was very ill and was admitted to the hospital.
They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.

When my sister had the opportunity to do some modelling work. And  
I was quite jealous - later on the photographer decided not to  
take her photograph, and she was very upset - I felt guilty as a  
result, almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity, by  
not being genuinely happy for her in the first place.

I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally  
grew into anger.

[ I missed my twin when I was on the verge of being thrown, which  
I disliked.]
When I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.

When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard  
about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really  
became conscious of her death at that moment.
Saw someone messing up our room.

I was enjoying the company of bird life while I was eating lunch  
in a park when a group of people began throwing sticks at some of  
the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing  
them being scared away.

The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because my  
attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.

I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with  
myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I  
rarely become ashamed.

I was talking with an aunt of mine that I adore and I found  
courage to say "I love you" and just after that came the shame.

I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole  
week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway the other teachers  
thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to  
observe was not well liked. The teacher was in fact really nice  
to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had  
given me.

My cat died from an illness.  It had been with us for 7 years.   
It was a lovely cat.  It had been ill for one or two weeks and  
the veterinary surgeon had told us that it was dying.

When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and  
up to this moment my sadness is still on.

Leaving home to move closer to University. As an oldest child,  
this experience was traumatic for both my parents and myself.
Falling in love with a close friend.

I'm crazy about football. When my team lost a goal in the Paulist  
championship, and so it lost the classifications.

My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had an  
abortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued to  
do so.

When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved  
back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything  
(normally he ofter grumbles at me).

When I had lied, saying that I never take bread from the dinning  
hall and a friend of mine caught me doing it.  He thus proved to  
me that I did in fact take the bread.

One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car,  
but I was too frightened to go and see.

When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at the  
match.
Watching a violent movie.

Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his  
studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he  
was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also  
because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the  
test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we  
found out that he succeded in entering at the University.
I had to pay a fine because of speeding.

I had gone camping with my old classmates and there was a storm.   
We were in a flurry but at that time I felt the love and concern  
of my friends.

When I betrayed my lover, she told me something in confidence, I  
felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the  
person concerned, as I felt the situation volitile, did this  
without telling my lover, she felt like piggy in the middle, as  
she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it gossip I  
felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited, thought,  
NOW I would not have done it.
Getting ill.

I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car  
accident and was admitted in hospital.

During my birthday party a friend drank too much alcohol. So much  
that he had to throw up. Worst of all was that he couldn't leave  
my friend alone and that he was molesting her.

When a boy whom I refused to be my lover told all his friends  
that I was his girl he has refused me because I was not faithful  
to him.

When my father failed to send me transport money after the  
closure of the school.

My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and  
disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school  
weakened.

My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she  
committed last night.
Given duty by the leaders which I do not like to do.

When I was young I was playing football near my parent's house  
and while playing I fell on the ground. At first I thought I was  
not seen by anybody, but when my mother laughed I felt very  
ashamed.

When I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabid  
hyena just near the path in the forest.
Did not do what I promised to do for a friend.

I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediately  
put on a kilo.

Last semester when I dated a girl whom I've known for almost a  
year. However one night she said she wanted us to be "just  
friends". I confided this to a friend Jim I was really suffering.  
A month or two later he broke up with his old girlfriend and they  
started going out regularly. I have no girlfriend nor have I had  
a romantic relationship of any significance. I feel some anger  
but we are friends again.

It was the first time that I gave a birthday present to my friend.  
  She wrote me a letter as she is my girlfriend.  The content of  
the letter was so sweet that it made me feel very happy.

When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had  
told him that my father had retired.

I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the  
way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.   
Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty  
about her sadness.

I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant that  
a close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.

Finding out that some students are getting good reports they do  
not deserve.

When the church choir came one Sunday after being away for some  
weeks.

A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my  
own flat.

I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my  
fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for  
my ex-boyfriend.

My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station after  
he had drunk some beer.

I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war.  
After the film I felt disgust.

When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, it  
wasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I woke  
because of a certain end.

The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I was  
very young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was going  
to crush me.

I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been  
spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front.   
I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this  
neighbour's house.

On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on  
the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of  
standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was  
also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to  
the Principal.
I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.

When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had  
big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of  
the night and shouted at me.

When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator  
in the kitchen.  I was going to clean it when I found that the  
drum was full of mud and slime.  I felt disgusted.

Making a sexual pass at my cousin with whom I have a very close  
personal relationship.
Reading a horror story alone.
When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
Squeezed the puppy in the door.
Finding a hair in the soup.

When the car I was driving skidded on an icy road and landed in    
a ditch with one side against a rock.
When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.
Death of grandfather (unexpected).

A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was  
not the same as before and something had gone wrong.

During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown   
was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a  
machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.

Right now I volunteer at a hospital. Yesterday, Halloween, I  
dressed up as a doctor and went to work. The volunteer  
coordinator told me after my shift that it was dangerous to have  
done what I did.

Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends  
quarelled.

I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had  
left me.
I couldn't fulfill a promise.
When the girl I loved turned me down.
When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.

When I misled a person: I said that I would do her a  
favour and didn't.
My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.

While I was pushing a court roller out of a ditch, I slipped and  
fell down and the roller rolled back towards me -down slope-It is  
a miracle that I still have my legs intact.

I was indignant at the unimpartiality shown by the referees at  
the football match between Bulgaria and France.
When I was told to attend an operation in theatre.
When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.

I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules  
she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.

When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a  
movie.

When another fellow worker decided to leave the company. We had  
been very close and we would not be able to work with eachother  
any longer.
[ When I feel that I have made a mistake.]
Having received an offer to do post-graduate work.

When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance  
exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.
When I was told that my father had passed away.
Little contact with my father before he died.
Grovelling people.

I felt guilty when I was given a prize which belonged to someone  
else.
First day at University (I didn't know what to expect).

When a girl I knew aborted and threw the seven month foetus in a  
man-hole.

When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I  
was unable to see this person because of the situation.

The joy came to me when I heard that I was going to start a  
Medical course at the Lilongwe School for Health Sciences.
People who discriminate other people disgust me.

I missed the train and had to wait for the next for two hours.  
For this reason I missed an appointment which had been very  
important for me.

Despite our good performance and excellent results the management  
refused to meet our demands.

I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid,  
telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged  
everythiing for them.

After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That  
feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good  
grade for an examination.
A person died (not really a friend).
When I felt alone and without love.

When I learnt that a friend of mine had talked about me to  
another friend and had said wrong things about my abilities and  
attitudes.  I was very angry.
When I did not buy what I had promised to.

Sitting alone in a quiet room, concetrating on things happening  
around you. Thoughts come into my mind which make me afraid.

When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports  
practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened  
but he recovered later.

I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told  
it to some others who were implicated in the affair.
Not getting the reference paper.

I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have  
nothing against, disturbed me by "terror ringing", i.e  
continously interrupting me by telephoning.

Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to  
the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this  
summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another  
town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had  
to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I  
was crying.

I was at home and we were sleeping when we heard some robbers  
breaking into our house.

My ex-boyfriend began to date my best friend. After they had been  
seeing each other, I found out that he had been sleeping with  
another girl, without my friend knowing, I told my friend what he  
had been doing behind her back.
Being treated unfairly.

I saved up money for a good purpose. As I also have to organise a  
party I am afraid there will rest only a little money for the  
good purpose I feel guilty about this.

When a close relative got quite drunk. It was a relative that I  
had respected for a long time and looked up to as a child.

This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutely  
heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up  
one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never  
saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was  
"TRUE LOVE" !!

I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At  
night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids  
were on the move.
Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.

When I told a girl that I could not take her out that night as I  
was entertaining my mother who had come from home.  However, I  
later met this girl with another girlfriend at a hostel where I  
had taken out another girlfriend of mine.

In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus  
stank.

When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at  
all.

Fear came towards the end of May when the P.T.S. results were out  
after hearing the failure of my fellow three friends.

I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with his  
drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.
When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite  
fortunately).

By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed  
to be loaned out.

I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my  
mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel  
when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt  
I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and  
guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
When seeing a friend that I had not seen in a long while.

When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father  
before they briefly separated.

At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging  
that fact to members of family and friends.

A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowing  
it.
Shame of not doing something well.

When I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in his  
pants after having drunk beer.

I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a  
good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents  
and through them from the pupils.

I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which  
I should not have made.

When I heard that a woman of my community had aborted and got rid  
of the foetus by throwing it in the drain.
When I was ditched by my girlfriend.

I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of  
hours.
Dead rat in the kitchen of the university.

I was sitting on an electric swing, suddenly the machine went  
out of order while I was still in the upward position.
My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).

One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well,  
but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thought  
about the consequences that this could have brought if I had gone  
farther.

A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close  
to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside  
myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly  
solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.
When my sister was born.

As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinate  
manner afraid of the death of my father and mother.

Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was  
directly involved in it.

Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I  
didn't study.

There was a sofa in my flat which belonged to the old tenants who  
were acquaintances.  It should have been picked up a year ago but  
they had postponed it.  Eventually they decided on one date and I
