stayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do.   
They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not got  
in touch with me.

My mother and father had forbidden me to ride my scooter on the  
road, and I had transgressed (together with the "wild" kids from  
across the street) by riding my scooter down a steep hill near  
our house. My mother sent the boy next door to collect me, and I  
was severely scolded.

I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life  
of another by means of utterly unfair methods.
When I broke something and a friend of mine was blamed.

In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in the  
queue.  A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking me  
either to pay more attention or to leave.

At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had  
admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do  
it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be  
rebuked in front of the other pupils.

[ If one has planned to do something "important" and then, for  
some reason, fails to do it.]

Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without  
knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I  
came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents  
when I remembered how much they had done for me.

On Christmas eve,1984, I had just finished the exams and was  
afraid as the results of one of my major subjects had been very  
unsatisfactory.  I thought that I had only a 50% chance of  
passing.  Even if I failed this subject I would not need to  
repeat.  However I liked this subject very much and my results  
were bad because of my lazyness.  If I was forced to change to a  
minor in this subject I would be very unwilling.

I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of  
his mouth while speaking.

I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and I  
neglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I had  
freeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior and  
lies.

I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with a  
fellow worker.  Later, I visited my former fellow workers and was  
told that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.

While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of  
cows.

On Christmas eve I went to a classmate's home with other  
classmates.  The next morning when I came out of the toilet she  
said something and I did not understand what she was saying.   
When she pointed at my trousers I discovered that I had forgotten  
to zip them up.  I rushed back to the toilet but by the time the  
others had guessed what had happened.

I went to the shopping centre to buy something and saw packets of  
Kapenta  with maggots in them. Oh !
I felt shame when I found that I was almost last in the exam.
When I was successful at my work I was full of joy.

I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home  
from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a  
forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very  
frightened.
When others let me down, fail to keep agreements.

When I got to know that the friend I am closest to got engaged,  
and she was going away.  I was overjoyed for her, but also felt  
frightened as I was very emotionally dependent on her.  I did not  
know what I would do without her.

I felt anger against a person who told bad things about me in my  
absence.

When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal  
feelings and then days later changed her mind.

When I realised that I had become too emotionally involved with  
the person I'm going out with, and when I began to like someone  
else and questioned whether I really care about person I'm with.

After having finished my B.Sc, I was struggling hard to continue  
my studies and had taken the M.SC exam.  I was not sure that I  
would be selected in the written exam.  When I saw my name in the  
selected candidates list I was overjoyed.

Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm  
or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had  
behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made  
you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the  
way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

I feel sadness when I only imagine that I could lose a close  
person. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.
When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.

Almost crashing my car, something which could have led to great  
problems.
Failed an examn.

When there was a possibility of getting on better in professional  
life. I valorized very much this aspect. People showed me this  
possibility, not the real fact (even because until now ...)

I saw a man falling on the walkway. He seemed half dead, and was  
immobile. I felt disgust for the people who passed by without  
doing anything to help.

When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very  
long time.

When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my  
clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out  
in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents  
discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt  
ashamed.
When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.

I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my  
father took his purse and payed.

When I was selected to this university despite my having  
studyied in difficulty throughout my secondary school days.
Cheating to get the best grade on a test in 7th grade.
Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.
Getting a part-time job.

I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I  
was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the  
floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the  
fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was  
involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.

A  group of youngsters dressed in fads talked foul language on a  
bus.  They also insulted the  pedestrians on the road and were  
impolite to the passengers of the bus.

When I was 4-5 years old my mother gave me some parts of a  
chocolate bar and ordered me to bring it to my father working  
outside. On my way I could not resist the temptation and ate it  
myself.

For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when  
I don't see her even for two or three days.

Asking someone to give me back the money I once lend him because  
I needed it myself.

A kitten had wandered into our office, and I was told to take it  
back across the street. When I crossed back, the kitten followed  
me and was run over and killed by a car.

New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; my  
partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little  
opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated  
and my boyfriend's parents were present.

The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing  
accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the  
house.

I had an appointment with a good friend. He came 3 hours later  
than we agreed upon. During the last hour of waiting I was afraid  
something might had happened, because usally he is in time.
When I got through the first day here at the department.

In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat  
people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for  
his family and himself.

I made a very insulting remark against a person whom I care for  
very much. This event was caused by a third person who didn't  
like the person I insulted.
A friend's brother died.

I didn't do very well on a midterm and I'm disgusted with myself  
because I was prepared and thought I did well.
When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.

When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I  
had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.
When I had to come back from my village last Christmas.

I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who help  
each other in exams, to the professor.
When people remember us and shows interest about what we do.

The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and  
they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed  
me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left  
for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.

I had a feeling of shame when I found myself unable to answer  
some questions from my tutor simply because of a lack of  
preparation.

I am currently taking CS 50P. I had to finish a couple of  
assignments but I was hindered because I could not get a passing  
score on my program.

Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends  
whom I had known before I moved to a new district five years  
previously.

When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices,  
which my father also adheres.

When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work  
place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.

[ It irritates me when people talk about me behind my back.  I     
prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face instead  
of talking behind my back.]

I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very  
much.
When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.

When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell  
ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.

It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I am  
familiar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequently  
occurring cause may be described as "the self-assured dullness".

About two years ago my girlfriend suggested that we separate.   
This really gave me a shock as I had never thought that she would  
say such things.  The reason she gave me was that we were not  
suited for each other.

A certain girl asked me what my major was and when I told her  
that it was P.A she started criticizing it saying, "I hate that  
course."  She just shows off in front of other people.
When I failed the M.S.C exam.

When I do not put in the needed amount of hours of work or study  
for the day, I feel guilty and try to make up for the lost  
time.

One evening when a boy who was drunk made a pass at me by trying  
to kiss me.

After mischieviously ringing on the chemist's trade-entrance  
doorbell and getting caught by him.
When my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.
When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.
My first kiss.

When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language  
course and I could no longer catch up with the others.

While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's  
brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes,  
mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.

When I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film  
"Twentieth Century".

When I thought for an instant that a very good relationship with  
a person had finished.
At home when they lost three pieces of my puzzle.

I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after  
not attending his lectures.

When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have a  
pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do  
not care very much about children.

When someone tried to rape one of my best friends and he claimed  
it was her fault. He the hassled her, claimed she was loose, and  
threatened to sue her.

When I was in the puberty I smashed the favourite toy of my  
little brother because of a fit of rage.

My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I  
had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me.  
Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on  
my birthday two weeks later.

Someone told me I was chosen for the English lectures because I  
am good looking.

I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to  
find out and I had to tell her I had lied.

When I lied last week. I lied to someone to get info. for a  
paper I was writing. I told her that the info. was for a  
newspaper article. I was afraid if I told the truth she wouldn't  
help me.
I was scared of water when I was a child.

There were old people in a crowded bus and I did not have the  
courage to give them my seat.  I closed my eyes to sleep and then  
opened my book to read.  In my heart I wanted to give them the  
seat.

A friend of mine got pregnant anf failed the first year at  
university.  The boyfriend refused his responsibility and they  
ended up in court.

I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failed  
to answer a question in the classroom.
[ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]
Getting into this university to do medicine.
When planning to marry.

I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it  
carelessly and it broke.

A teacher giving a test was called by a student by his first  
name. He (the teacher) said that he didn't give him this liberty.

Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas,  
sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.

After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I had  
passed all my written examinations.

My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because  
I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of  
not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same  
way.

One day my friend told me that she had heard that I was moving  
about with her boyfriend. I was disgusted with the news.

When I think of death - not my own but that of my parents,  
brothers and sisters.
I do not recall being scared in the near past.

When I heard that my sister had shouted at my friend's cousin at  
their place.

Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in  
the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).

When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them  
financially.

One day I took a packet of sweets from a certain Grocery at  
Nathenje. Then later on I started to feel guilty and realised  
that I had done a wrong thing to him.
Can't describe any disgust situation.

When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and  
one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real  
bad about it.

When my brother went out with my new shirt that I adored, and  
returned it dirty with grease.

When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that  
the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead  
of listening, I become angry.
Over an argument.

We were discussing a subject ( I knew very little about it) and I  
was holding my ground.  They showed me that I was wrong.

When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the  
yard.

When I was young, one day in the car we fell sick and ended up  
vomitting on each other.
Getting separated from my girlfriend.

One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was  
spontaneous and lots of fun.
Cueing for a bus and the drivers having long dinner.

I had something wrong, saying wrong things and being impolite to  
someone, and this had embarrassed the this person.  And I  
still meet the person.

When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them  
and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.

When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in  
revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights.  
Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me  
asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a  
little.  When my friend remarked about it, I understood that it  
was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.
I was very angry at someone.
I felt extreme joy the day I was baptized. I was one with God.

A close acquaintace cried for me. I felt happy because somebody  
cared.

I felt much anger when my fahter interferred in my relations with  
another person whom I liked very much, ending something that I  
adored.
I was accused of a misdemeanour, unjustly.

I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.  I had booked a seat one  
month back and I had also got a telegram confirming this.   
However, in the train my name had been omitted from the  
reservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant was  
alloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for the  
seat.  I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment when I  
paid money.
That I would do bad in a class and not get into Bus school.
Birth of children.

Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and  
miss it, it reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it  
would be to be her in the same situation.

I was angry when I heard that my only girl was going about with  
another man. So I decided to drop her but later the story came to  
be untrue.

I was seven years old and swimming outside the flags at the Gold  
Coast. I was caught in a rip and taken out about 100 m. I  
couldn't swim too well, but an older friend (17) swam out and  
saved me.

When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was  
very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.

When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to  
fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost  
fallen.

Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noone  
gave them money.

One afternoon, helping at home on the property, I was  
(mustering) getting in cattle and a bull turned and came for me.

Once at a camp a classmate criticized me in front of others.  Now  
I find that this classmate is very disgusting.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last  
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.
Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.

I read a newspaper report that a little boy was forced to look  
while his sister was raped.

Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no  
one to help me and call First Aid.
Going to CAL not knowing anyone.

When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I never  
thought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really felt  
ashamed of myself.

At a party, several comments were made about the personal  
situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected  
and uncomfortable.

I received a phone call from a high school friend whose younger  
sister studied with me at the University and gave me a lift every  
moning. She was going to get married to a guy whom I knew too and  
who had died when he fell from a building, I was afraid to lose  
somebody since I had already lost a brother in an accident.
When I heard that my father had passed away.

When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His  
legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I  
came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few  
days later he died.

At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle   
of a lesson.

After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very  
happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.
My father gave money to my brother but not to me.

I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusion  
after an accident.
When I took away my best friend's boyfriend.

After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for a  
holiday.  I had never been abroad before and neither had I taken  
a holiday for a long time.  When finally my parents agreed and we  
got the airplane tickets I was over joyed.

When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I  
woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.

I always feel ashamed when I do not succeed in accomplishing  
something in which I had put in all my efforts.
Doing unexpectedly well in an examn.

I was physically assaulted and sexually abused about a year ago.  
Just the feeling that I might not get away intact, or even alive,  
produced fear.

When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally  
demolished car with two fatally injured passengers.  The car was  
so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the  
scene of the accident.

My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and  
take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for  
me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own  
feelings were intensified.

When I heard that my father had been involved in a car accident  
in Lusaka.  This happened when he had gone to get the car which  
had been stolen in Lusaka.
When my aunt died.

4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were  
entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first  
episode.
When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.

My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought  
another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I  
felt quite ashamed of myself.

When I was hungry, I tried to take the money that my mother  
had saved up for something else.
Listening to my roommate boasting about her new clothes.

Many years ago I saw the film "Psycho" by Hitchcock for the first  
time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly  
dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep.

I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty  
days.

When I made up with a girl-friend of mine after having been on  
unfriendly terms with her (my fault).  I cried with joy that  
evening.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting  
for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a   
woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I  
was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found  
him.

When I knew about my sister's in law finacial situation and what  
she was facing.
When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.

When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried about  
getting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I found  
that I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately,  
could jump for joy.

After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect  
and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see  
each other rarely he had not forgotten me.

We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise.  The  
teacher came to ask us as to who was making all the noise.  I did  
not own up so the  whole class was punished.
The morning after a wild party.

A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important  
for my work, but she forgot it.
[ Laziness makes one sad.]

Realizing that a friend had been talked into signing a certain  
contract.

My girlfriend had started going around with another boy.  Her  
cousin, also a friend of mine, asked her as to who she preferred.  
 Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to  
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole  
new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and  
traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I  
wouldn't see many of them again.

When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed  
only helplessness and indecision.
Obscene phone calls.

I'm afraid of driving on the special seat of a mororcycle, mainly  
with certain colleagues who by exces of self-confidence drive  
beyond limits or measure in the traffic and the main victim is  
always the person who sits behind the driver.

As a child, one evening I had read a novel about ghosts and I had  
thus spent a sleepless night as I kept feeling that there were  
ghosts dancing around me.

I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural  
Institute.

In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass  
two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned  
myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these  
examinations.

It was when I was selected to go to a Secondary school to start  
form I.
When I was admitted to the University.

When I was in lower six class during the Summer I joined a  
research group of the Chinese university student union.  I knew  
a lot of CV students there.  A year later one of them was  
travelling in mainland China and he got T.B.  He died a few weeks  
after coming back to H.K.  We all got together for the funeral  
and when I looked at the body for the last time I felt extremely  
sad.
Love problems.

I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten  
would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about  
something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the  
kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright  
till I got hold of her.

When I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the  
woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have  
respect for anyone.

The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions  
going from a to e for each question.  She asked me to do all this  
in one and a half hours.  It involved a lot of describing and  
explaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could not  
finish the work.

[ When I act thinking that I know everything and I then realize  
that there were things I had not thought about, thus hurting  
others.]
Saw a selfish person doing a selfish thing.

While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an  
acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling  
false stories about herself and praising herself.
Getting ill.

I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something  
that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to  
tease me.

When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining  
low marks, but they were much higher than expected.

I can't remember being truly angry. Usually it's just  
disappointment that I feel. One situation would be with my  
brother. He and I used to be close but now he seems to be  
avoiding me.
They wanted something to happen but I didn't.

I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking  
place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming  
traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed  
his car on the place.
For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.
When my gradmother died.
As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.
When my grandmother died.

I was walking alone along the place where people fear that there  
are always thieves there and the people who kill their friends  
during the night two months ago.

I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and  
growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until  
several weeks later.

I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine after  
a lovely holiday trip.  The night and the sea were dark, and the  
wind was blowing.  I feared that death was there on the boat, I  
somehow felt sure about it.  I feared being left alone.

When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the  
boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would  
accidentally go off.

For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among  
people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a  
wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.
Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.

I was alone in the bus when I tripped and fell, and dropped all  
my papers.

On Reperbahn, in a restaurant, a "charming" old saleswoman came  
to beg a drink for herself.

My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face  
down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he  
fainted and so I called the first aid.
Not being a good host for a friend from a far away place.
When I couldn't find my dog which was missing.
Looking for the toilet in a dark place.

Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire  
vehicle.

At night when I was coming from Lingadzi Inn I heard a hyena  
crying in the Lingadzi jungle. I was alone.

Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without  
leaving a trace. Usually he tells me when he wants to do  
something like that, therefore I was afraid that something had  
happened to him.

I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8  
exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my  
birthday.
A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.

Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given for  
one question (the question was graded by the professor and he  
indicated he liked my answer).

Before getting back the results of a test in school, when I had  
worked very hard and was worried about not succeeding.

When I have seen people very drunk and making fools of  
themselves.

I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing could  
stop it - at least I think so.
When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
When I had a serious argument with a dear person.
Going out for dinner, or during one ice-cream and four spoons.
Angry with my brother, who was making fun of me, teasing me.

When I heard that there is teasing and bulling at Secondary  
School.

A month ago I turned in an English paper in late after I had  
already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it  
again.

I used to have two boyfriends in the past. Then one of them  
wanted to get engaged to me. I agreed but was guilt-conscious for  
disappointing the other one.

Finding out that China is poor, so we cannot have good reference  
books.

Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk  
men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from  
another carriage.
When a guy chased me when I was out jogging.

My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her  
chatting with another guy.

I wasn't able to see my girlfriend on her birthday and because I  
was late arriving home from uni, I didn't phone her as arranged  
at a certain time (she rang in the meantime).

When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of  
the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.

When I lied to my best friend about a boy she really liked but he  
didn't like her. I told her he did and she bugged him for a long  
time embarrassing herself.

I woke up in the middle of the night as I had jumped and shouted  
with fear.  I thought that someone's cold hand or something  
similar had touched my hand.  I crept down under the covers and  
went back to sleep.
Being in love for the first time.

My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of  
mine.

It was when I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It made  
a cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.

A man was yelling outside my window at 3.00 am, yelling threats,  
though not to me.

I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned  
my sister out of my parents home.

When a classmate hit me on my occipital region when I was busy  
studying and concentrating on my classnotes.
Finding out that I was deceived by my friend.

When I worked as an "au-pair-girl" in London, I received a call  
from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and  
wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and  
especially when I saw her.

A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his  
mother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because it  
relates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn't  
lead a normal life and it just seems unfair.

When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, so  
that he was slightly injured.

When I was told that a boy did not want to be my friend without  
any apparent reason.

My mother had fallen down from a ladder when she had been  
gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived, I saw  
people of the life-saving service giving her medical care.
When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.
I stroke a person undeservedly.
Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).

During the exam period I studied in the library alone.  A close    
friend of mine, who is also a classmate, told me that my  
application for a Japanese inter-cultural exchange programme had  
been accepted.  I was not very sure as I did not know that the  
list had been declared.  I ran to the board and saw that I was  
really included in the list.  I was so excited that I smiled all  
day long.  When I met my classmates and friends I told them the  
good news.  I was so happy that I could not concentrate on my  
studies.

When my parents-in-law scolded me, without any reason, in front of the  
other members of my family for the first time.  They had called  
me from my room where I had been studying for my exams.
As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

I was at school and afterwards went to work. After work I went to  
see a friend and stayed out late. when I got home my mother was  
awake and I felt guilty.

When I tried to explain to a plumber, face to face, that the  
toilet was broken and he did not believe it (it had been mended  
ten times).

When a close friend of mine collapsed and passed away and the  
illness was not known.

When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one  
movement it would have bitten me.

Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends  
was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming  
in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and  
prevent the accident.

I felt guilty when I was found to be the chief leader of making  
noise in class.

I had stopped talking to a very close friend of mine.  A week  
later he came over to try and make friends with me  again and  
from the way he talked I felt that he was a very mean preson.

I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence  
and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed  
that they would come for me any time.
Unable to help my mother to cook.

Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been  
seeing many others during our relationship.
When I got separated from my first love.

Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my  
home town.

I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned  
out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.

Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be  
perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I  
realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against  
both girls.

A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't  
the slightest grounds for it.
In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the  dark.

I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road  
with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we    
saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do  
anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have  
any legs.

A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to  
show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people  
had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading,  
unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting  
themselves with no shame or embarassment.

I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some  
fear that some men would attack me and rob me.
Listening to long speech of the party leaders wasting my time.
When I was going to take the practical exams.
Being misunderstood by friends.

I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.  I had  
raised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.

In neglecting some work that had to be done around the house and  
telling my roommate I would get it done.

When I woke up after a night of drinking I couldn't remember and  
discovered several untoward things had occurred.

When I tried to hide a fact from a person for irrelevant reasons  
and considered such an attitude childish.
Insulted by disgusting people.
Failing an examination.

I borrowed a piece of music of someone and I always forgot to  
give it back. That person wrote me a letter asking me to give it  
back. I did so and I told him an idle story why I kept it for so  
long.
China cannot give your lectures bigger place and sound system.

Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other  
people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being  
deceitful, unfair, etc.

On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day,  
beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.

Calling lecturers nicknames when talking to housemen (They told  
ne you are even younger than they are so you should not be giving  
public lectures).
When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.

When my friends and I were camping in a weekend, and with little  
food, we met a middle age couple from a small town that invited  
us to eat in their house. Their house was small, badly built with  
old and dirty forniture and utensils. The problem was with pans,  
and dishes, and even the food.

When I found out that my girlfriend would not be coming back to  
UCB for one semester, but would be living in San Jose.
When my mother was angry with me over my friends and boyfriend.

My friend did not do well in the examn because I did not help  
him.

Crossing a street of several ways the cars began to move and I  
thought that I was going to be trampled.
Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course.

I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joined  
us. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone in  
shame without knowing where to go from there.
Family member survived an operation.

When I was told that the brother who was staying with me would  
not go to the training school that year but only the year after.

I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some money  
for a few major items (e.g a radio).  but when I arrived at the  
inter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolen  
from me.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no  
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The  
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

When something went wrong for me I lashed out at someone else  
whom I loved and who was not in any way responsible for what had  
happened (my sister).
At a weakness on my part.

A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine.  
Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.
When my mother's heart nearly stopped.

I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I  
were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise  
from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house.  
 A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this  
alley.

I work at a petrol station. When there is a foreigner who wants  
petrol my collegues treat him very impolite.

My mother had sent me to buy a few things.  The change I brought  
back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend  
thinking that she would not notice it.  However, my mother told  
me that the change was not correct.

A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an  
examination.

The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and  
experienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - total  
enlightenment and freedome - bliss.
When I saw the movie "Poltergist".
When I robbed a loop in supermarket.

When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with  
our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made  
me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.

When I went to a halloween party and had to walk through a shopping  
center dressed like a witch.
Talking to my close friend.

When my cousin's wife refused him sex and claimed that she was my  
girllfriend.  I think that there is something wrong with the  
woman as I have never even thought of having sex with her.

I felt angry when I saw on T.V the last slaughter of negroes in  
South Africa.

The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression,  
as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the  
situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's  
out of me.

I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I  
had done was wrong and it disgusted me.
The sight of vomit on the street.

Once my presentation was the worst among my classmates as I had  
not prepared it well and had not seen it as important.  My  
presentation was so confused that it clearly showed my poor  
preparation.

The same fact about the girl (22 years, married - guilt -  
disgust), the fear was the main factor in our relationship.

My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he  
had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and  
I felt very angry at him.

When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so  
bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized  
how bad it was.
When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.

I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the  
shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an  
old man when I was in those shoes.

Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be  
blamed. I left them without supervision.
Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.
The last time I had sex.

When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother  
discovered that.

I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had  
not asked for but got it anyway.

When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing,  
that I had tuberculosis.

I came out of the house at 7:20 am Monday morning getting ready t  
go to school and fight for a parking when I saw my car had a flat  
tire.
When my mother caught me masturbating.

I wrote a letter to my father to ventilate my bottled up  
feelings. Afterwards I thought it was too negative.
I had a car accident.

In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told  
the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him  
that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard  
that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.
When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.

When I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted at  
by my parents.

When people manipulate others through appearing better than what  
they really are.
A boy who shot dead a squirrel.

When Dad went to a Sports Day and was the only parent there, and  
he was cheering for us.
My sister was afraid of her husband.

When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could  
be freed only with big difficulties.

A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island  
by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals -  
they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of  
them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were  
totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking  
for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2  
nights.

My daughter was a baby and was crying to be taken on my lap. I  
felt very nervous and moved her away and went out. As soon as the  
feeling of nervousness passed I was taken by an enormous feeling  
of guilt, for having rejected my daughter.

An out-patient asked me to read for him a certain prescription  
but I was unable to do so. The patient was dissappointed and lost  
hope in me.
When I told my girlfriend a joke openly and frankly.

When I talked maliciously about a colleague at work to someone  
else.  Immediately afterwards I felt ashamed.
When India lost the Benson and Hedges cricket trophy.

One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted  
a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.

An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give  
me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

A girl entered in the division where I work and greeted everybody  
but not me.
Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

It was my birthday and all the members of the group made me a  
surprise in a public place at 10 p.m. giving me flowers and suvenirs.

At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by  
cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.  My anger had  
nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an  
expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .

When I was cycling to school, I nearly got knocked down by a car  
which (overtook me too closely) did not give me any swerving space.

When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had  
not expected to do so well.

I was disgusted to find out that the water isn't filtered or  
purified before it leaves Latimer Hall from the drains.

Prolonged "niggling" of friend on a single theme which I  
considered of no consequence.

I know that a certain person feels very lonely, and that she  
always looks forward to seeing me. However, often I am too  
busy to visit her, then I feel guilty.

When someone does not listen to me after having asked me to  
repeat what I said. This happened more than one time with the  
same person.

When I realized that I was not working hard enough and was not  
being useful as an individual to the society or the family, guilt  
at spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wasting  
my life.

When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling  
me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a  
clinical pilot study.

I met a woman who was looking for our house. She stopped me but I  
ran away. When I arrived at home I found the same woman and she  
told my parents what had happened so I felt ashamed.
My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.

When I entered the wound intensive care at the Central Hospital  
in Blantyre which was stinking.
The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.

I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in a  
restaurant I was going back to the hotel when a prostitute  
approached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried on  
walking I felt that I was being followed by someone.

When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked  
me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded  
because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust  
saddned me.

When I didn't get a certain job at Lillehammer which I wanted  
very much.

On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By  
chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for  
the dress-rehearsal of "Aida". It was a different world for us  
full of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantastic  
pizza in a restaurant near the "Arena".

I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was my  
friend.

I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a  
great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the  
large number of pupils who fail.

Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very  
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to  
fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted  
my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money  
which was just like a miracle to me.

When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very  
good and we were very satisfied.

When I contacted a sexually transmitted disease and the  
lecturer came to know about it as it was he who treated me for  
it.

Leaving the house myself and a female friend had shared for 6-8  
months because of the friendship which developed and our approach  
to each other in occasional instances of several personal crises.

When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my  
lover and future wife.

One time at the hospital I passed near the intensive care room.  
The offensive smell that came out disgusted me in such a way that  
I didn't even dare to enter the room.

Watching a football game. This remindes me of the time when my  
father was still alive and when we watched football games on TV  
together.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic  
ordinance. In fact I was innocent.

I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helped  
me for everything.
When I first came to the campus.

I was walking from my friend's house, a few blocks from my house, when a  
car began to follow me. He waited I passed by it rotateed a little and  
stopped on my way. I changed completely my way and the car went  
on following me until I turned at a corner and running I hid in a  
garden of a house, waiting for the car to pass by. I went back home  
terribly afraid.

My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km  
off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough  
room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there  
once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel  
guilty.

I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital)  
as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed  
money from my purse.

I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot  
licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a  
natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses  
and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck  
and it was a real adventure.

I joked with an unfamiliar friend in an obstinate tone.  I was  
afraid of his misunderstanding me and being hurt and angry at me.  
 I felt sorry over my conduct and thought that I had to find an  
opportunity to apologize.

I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and  
she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.

We had made an appointment to complete together a piece of work.  
It appeared that I was the only one who hadn't prepared anything.
First time in anatomy.

When I heard about the treatment of a friend in jail. Really  
inhuman. I never realised that such things also happen in the  
Netherlands.

I failed my Nutrition paper which was the paper ending the  
course.

I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that  
didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the  
attacked person bleeded to much.

When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film  
marathon I wanted to see.

I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't  
phone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a little  
tension which became worse.

[ When I have achieved what I wanted to achieve, I feel the above  
stated emotion. Also when I am sucessful.]
When I am at home alone.

When I ate my sister's food and then she found out that it was  
me.  I felt very ashamed but still refused to admit that it was  
me.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was  
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing  
him because he is so dear to me.
When I was complimented and called "delightful".
Always when I meet the person I love.
The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.

A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who was  
also drunk.

When I spoke ill of a fellow worker in the absence of this  
person.

I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot  
it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time,  
I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.

I was caught stealing a box of matches in the supermarket and had  
to plead guilty.

I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching  
the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed  
for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would  
require.

I visited a place in Morocco where they worked the leather.  I  
saw the skins emerged in a liquid which ressembled putrification.
Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I  
realized it too late.
Finding out that I can go to your English lectures.

I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into  
the woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escaped  
from the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I was  
afraid.
When I became aware that an acquaintance had stolen from friends.

I promised a friend that I would return a book to it's owner for  
him , but I forgot to do it.

At the hardware store, trying to convert Imperial to Metric  
measurements, I made a mistake, and didn't buy enough tiles for  
the bathroom. I was angry at myself, because I hope to be a Maths  
teacher.

When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted  
to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him  
that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had  
hurt him so much.

I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away  
untimely at home.

At the crowded conditions of living.  I always quarrel with my  
elder brother as he puts the T.V volume at a deafening level and  
I can not practise my piano lessons.  Thus I feel that my home is  
disgusting.

When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died  
because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years  
in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers -  
no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be  
sitting in the "lliving" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I  
felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't.

When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And  
most important she also liked me.

My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening,  
when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's  
expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support  
me and I began to weep convulsively.
When my new jeans split while I was with the youth group.

When I got associated with a boy one year ago, I neglected my  
best friend. When the relation with this boy finished she behaved  
very easy-going towards me. I felt guilty then.

When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a  
doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told  
the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This  
was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

I bacame involved with a boy for a very brief moment not because  
I liked him but because I needed some sort of company. The  
consequences weren't as I expected and caused me much shame.
My mother's death.

I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of  
the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they  
called me early morining to ask me "what are you going to do  
about the matter ?" (which had been discussed in the meeting).   
Then I got angry.

When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three  
years.

I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got  
angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she  
kept on telling lies.
Not handing in homeworks in time.

My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the  
information that she had died.

Four weeks ago I felt very much touched to find an asciatic  
patient who had asked the very morning to be tapped of the fluid,  
dying in the evening. I was really disgusted because this was the  
Medical staff's negligence. Had the Clinical officers done  
something that very morning he might have been alive today.

I told my primary teacher I hadn't done my homework as my mother  
was in a car accident. My teacher rang that night to see how my  
mother was - she was fine i.e. no accident !

I felt anger when I had a fight with my father, and he beated me.  
My mother came to help me (because I was beeing beated) and he  
also beated my mother.

The negative feelings towards me displayed by my  
"parents-in-law".

When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I  
was not present either to see the person or to try to share my  
emotions with other friends.

I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approached  
me and yelled "I fuck you", then however he stopped and laughed at  
me.

I arrived an hour late for an important meeting ( I had  
misunderstood the time).

I trusted a friend of mine, but she lied to me about something  
and this disgusted me.

When a girl I wanted very much, said "yes" and fell in love with   
me.

At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve  
when on a class trip overseas.

When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgements  
on him.

When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away after  
having had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.
Insulted by teacher.

I was not able to explain well to my good friend to make him less  
angry.

I received a letter from my college telling me that I would not  
be allowed to sit for the exams because of my low attendance in  
class and the bad experience in the terminal exams.

I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain  
man. I felt anger.
When my mother was robbed in a shop.

On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch,  
there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;  I was very  
scared till I managed to get him back onboard.

I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill,  
while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he asked  
me if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.

I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain  
girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing  
them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt  
guilty.

I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to  
bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.
Did not read reference when other people read them.
When I could not fulfill my expectations.

I felt joy when I passed the worst phase in my life and  
discovered how many people considered me important to them.

Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night.  
Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day  
before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to  
church with his parents.

I was dominated by a certain person and even though I knew it I  
could not change my own reactions.
When my term paper was evaluated.
Being insulted by my roommate (she is in the English Class).
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.

One year, when I went to a camp, I was chased by a dog.  I tried  
hard and finally managed to escape from it.  My torch suddenly  
went off and we talked about ghost stories and I thought that  
there were ghosts.
A parking fine.

When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of  
my clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigations  
it was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boys  
in our hostel.

I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough,  
and was told that my work was not up to standard.

One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lump  
of soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. I  
thought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately he  
did not and he put it in his mouth.
After intercourse.

Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming  
me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my  
boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude  
himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his  
girlfriend.

Some boys told me your nickname is "Little Girl Doctor", I did  
not tell them off and laughed with them.

When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I  
do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very  
hungry.

On my birthday, my closest friends were here at Berkeley pithched  
in a lot of money each and bought me ten records to replace some  
of my records that were stolen. They threw a small surprise party  
for me too.

When my father and I worked on the house just after he had  
recovered from illness, I was rather lazy.  This meant that he  
had to work hard and was not very well later.

My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I  
refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry  
for that and something like sadness.
Failing examn.

I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation.  
I was very afraid to fail.
To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.

[ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person something  
in which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]

When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that  
I had no time and that I would play with him the next day.  
However, the next day I said the same thing.
To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.
Being chased in the dark by someone I did not know.

When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to  
the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this  
short time.

When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which  
I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more  
money to carry on studying.
Thinking about death when walking alone at night.

Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned  
enough.

When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished  
with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one  
which I had desired a lot.

My parents and brother came up over the weekend. We are a very  
close family. This was my first year away from home. They brought  
one jacko-lantern with a new design. That is the old joke that  
we have a great new design - it's always the same.

Now that the 49ers are winners, the fans are coming out of the  
woodwork and jumping on the bandwagon and that disgusts me.
Not being able to argue against class leaders.

I made a joke about the rat of a boy. I compared his rat with a  
sausage. I told the boy he had a delicious sausage.

Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us  
started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180 turn we  
followed and ended up in a gully.
Saw in the TV South Korea cheating in the Asian Olympic games.
Being insulted in public.

I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely  
drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

I "snapped" very abruptly at my mother when she said something  
silly and stupid, (in front of other people) she looked so  
defenceless & hurt & told them that I'm always doing that.

A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her a  
cheap one.

The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.   
I did not like the man.

I don't use to lie to my parets about what I do, and the two  
times that I felt anger were when they doubted me I said that I  
was going to the club, and they didn't believe me because the day  
before they had met me at FLIPERAMA. I had the wish to kill them.

When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus  
holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt  
angry over his actions.

My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual level  
to a sexual relationship that had a large physical content. Born  
out of inconsistency with my personal beliefs and value shame at  
largely using this sexual partner.

I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days  
later he died.

I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of  
members of my peer group while still at school.

After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and  
felt guilty about having taken it.
When I was bluffing in front of my mother to get more money.

When I was 12 years old, some friends of our family had come to  
watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other  
people had gone, my mother told me that it had looked as if I had  
wanted to make sex.

In a play (secret friend) during the time of the high school I  
had to give a present to a boy and I was very ridiculous because  
of this.
Car accident, hurt three of my closest family.
My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).

One day when I was working, I went out for dinner with friends  
without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.

When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write  
Examinations in a few minutes.

When I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrong  
manner.
When I saw an insect going up my arm.

It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could  
at last be with the people I wanted to see.
When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried to  
finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat to  
veterinary to either kill humanely or cure.

When I passed the whole weekend with my boyfriend, coming back  
home on Sunday afternoon he met my parents for the first time.

When I had to give a speech about some historical event, to an  
audiece of about 200 people my own age whom I did not know.

In an examination ,which other students found easy I could hardly  
think and did not know what to answer.

When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to  
Catholicism but then once received - o.k.

When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was very  
happy.

I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do,  
naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits  
that get me mad.

I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident.  The  
incident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind.  I  
wondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me,  
though nothing very serious actually happened.
Finding out some people had been talking about me at my back.

My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a  
good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.   
Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to  
defend my friend.

I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another  
collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.

A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs  
were broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after the  
accident.

Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a  
"cold" film). I do not know the reason.

When I received the first year results as the first year had  
involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the  
results.

When I nearly drowned in icy water wearing ice skates.  It was  
difficult to get out.
A typical family argument.

When our religion teacher presented shocking sectarian thoughts  
and doom's day as official teaching.

When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.   
The store then contacted my parents.
When I see rotten meat.

I felt anger at my roommate due to his habit of leaving dirty  
dishes in the sink and generally not cleaning after himself.

Having suffered a not very pretty sight, I reacted by uttering  
some very cruel and sharp words.

In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus and  
a tram.  The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.
I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.

I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouth  
persisted in trying to dominate the conversation.
My best friend could not get into university.

It is some years ago when my mother found me stealing relish in  
the pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.

When the cast general election resulted in Norway getting a  
conservative government.

A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to  
my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got  
to learn about this from another friend of mine and when she  
arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later  
ashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was at  
my place.

This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study  
there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance  
Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

When I read the newspaper that morning I found my candidature  
number on the admission list of the Chinese university.  I was  
satisfied and happy and the cumulative anxiety disappeared.  I  
only wanted to cry out that I had succeeded.

Someone had to do a lot of efforts to make something work. With  
my help he would have finished much sooner, but I wasn't in the  
mood to help him.

On New Year's Eve, when I went to the house of my girlfriend's  
parents to meet them.

I felt disgusted when I was in a helpless position at the loss of  
my fiancee.

When high level results were declared, I found my candidature  
number.  I was very happy as I had not expected it.  As I had been   
injured before the examination and I had performed poorly.
When somebody made me touch human faeces.

A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have  
enough confidence in me he asked a third person.

I felt very sad when I saw the first list from the names of the  
people who entered at the University and my name wasn't there.

Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering,  
over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

Finding out I am chosen to collect norms for Chinese aphasia (I  
will contribute to China's catching up with the West in  
neuropsychology).
When I go out alone at night.
Getting to know that my uncle in America had a brain tumor.

When a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep  
the child away from the fire.

I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of  
mine.

Since I moved into the dorms and I've been spending most of my  
free time with my boyfriend. I hardly see my old high school  
friends. I had several bad incidents with my 2 past best friends.

I saw a bag on the street and just then a stranger passed by.  I  
picked up the bag immediately and gave it to the stranger as I  
thought that it belonged to him.  But it was not his bag and I  
felt ashamed.

The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be  
alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this  
prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of  
the window.  They saw me.

I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journey  
a few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle of  
the town and I did not know what to do.

A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a  
"street walker" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was  
falsely trying to impress with my family.

I was walking home from a place on southside and I live on  
Northside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.
Quarrel in the family.

I was pregnant and thought that by not having the baby I would  
hurt the father like he did me regardless of the life we had  
created.

Receiving close friends form abroad, whom I hadn't seen for  
years.
My bicycle was demolished.

Realizing that school will soon be over, and we will all go  
different ways, perhaps never meeting again our friends from this  
year.

As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father.  It was more  
the ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of my  
grand-father which made me sad.
Does not apply.

While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting  
helplessly.

When I took a car which was not mine, and suddenly it stopped  
working.

When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle  
of the class and I had to gesticulate.

When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a  
student like me.

On December the 28th I was filled with Joy when I was told by my  
bosses that I had been selected to attend a course at the  
Lilongwe School for Health Scienced in Lilongwe.
Insulted by the class leader.

My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get  
her on my back, she slipped and fell.

When I heard that an acquaintance of mine was spreading rumours  
about my affair with a close friend.

From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I  
am in a restaurant.

Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue  
duty as a soldier.

One morning after breakfast I was still not satisfied.  My nephew  
(a small boy of 2) had not eaten his breakfast and just when I  
was taking a bit of his share someone walked in.

I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from  
Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my  
uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final  
journey within four days.
When I had to represent my boss at a meeting.
When I talk to my friends.

The day that my boyfriend appeared at home with a pair of rings  
for our wedding.

My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools  
and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.
T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.
Encouter with a prostitute.
When I forgot about a meeting at work.

I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely  
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and  
anger.

When a good friend of me told me one evening that she didn't want  
to live anymore.
When I was molested by an old drunk man.

When I arrived too late at a meeting of mentor (the night before  
the introduction of novices on the University start).
When we got a young dog.

My husband falls ill and does not follow the doctor's advice on  
the treatment or the diet control.

I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see  
that nobody cared about what was happening to me.

When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close  
- I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted  
violently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation.

When I visited a creche. The conditions weren't too precarious  
but the children were in conditions of physical and emotional  
penury.
The loss of my mother.
I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.

A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on  
a great bald field.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends  
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable,  
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I  
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.
I lost a close friend.

I thought that the guy I had been associating with for over a  
year went out 2 or 3 times with a high school girl whom he claimed  
not to like.
When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.

Some of my friends had an argument.  I had earlier phoned one  
of them and that may have influenced him to argue.

Finding out that the class leader can go to your lectures, and  
his English is worse than mine.
Every time I went home with my school report.

I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had it  
for so long I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed at  
myself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.

Sometimes when I go to work my crazy boss (a hyper Jewish lawyer)  
insists I do things his way (filing, typing, etc.). He sometimes  
blames me for things I didn't do, and I can't yell back at him.

One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to  
somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

The time I was at secondary school during the holiday I appeared  
to my father while heavily drunk and I talked nonsense like in  
some sort of carefree.

When my father told me that I should help my mother more often,  
because she was so busy. And I realized that he was right.

When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friend  
who was sick, and owner of the restaurant refused to allow me a  
drink later in the evening (which is usually always available for  
workers), did not thank me, and was generally indifferent towards  
me - I felt I did not deserve this.

My roommate liked to listen to some meaningless songs which had  
melody but had no content.  We lived together so when he played  
the recorder I was forced to listen to them.  I could not tell  
him that I did not like to listen to the songs, as I had no right  
to disturb the freedom of others.  So I would find a pretext to  
leave the room and go somewhere else.

My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at  
the station.
I saw a dog who was eating excrements.
Saw Chinese people flattering foreigners.

I am not especially good at English, and after the high school  
graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the  
whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done  
excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My  
family was at home.
When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.

Finding out that China does not have enough foreign currency to  
buy books.
When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.

The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had  
left open.

By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt  
her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.
My grand father caught me eating his private jelly bean supply.
Staying in the room alone at night.

A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor  
of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We  
decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning  
because we had business on the following day. The instructor  
tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite  
of everything, all the time he made me angry.

When my co-resident opened the bathroom door while I was bathing  
inside.

I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of  
practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".
