A and I were walking along the new Asia stairway to the Chung Chi  
college for our lecture and I saw him with her.  He put one arm  
around her shoulder and laugher brightly and joyfully.  I did not  
dare and did not want to look, just walked by them quickly.  The  
interest of talking to A disappeared and I just wanted to remain  
silent.  But I did not want A to know and so I left him and went  
to F.  I should have expected this to happen.
The same as in SHAME.
When I won the first prize in a cross country race.
A girl I love does not love me.

Yesterday when I received a B on a history midterm. I felt  
overjoyed after having received C's previously.
Being told that I am a stupid person.

A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the  
supervisor did not like me.

When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person.  
His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.

When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started  
the process of breaking up.

Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to do  
it. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast.  
I felt guilty - "he's just done all that work for me".
Getting my accentance letter from CAL.

I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be  
announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results  
were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.
I won the country ski championship.
Getting into this university to do medicine.

Doing something wrong at home, and then letting my (normally)  
more rampant brother take the blame.

In our class we had a test on Nursing, so a friend from the Army  
was caught peeping, by using a paper which had already answers  
which was written by him. So all of us from the Army got ashamed.

After going through much shame, I became a Christian and  
something new happened in my heart.  Joy that overflows was  
manifest in me.
My car skidded on the wet street.

It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift my  
astrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.

After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner that  
evening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.

I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and  
education.  I said something and then realized that I did not  
know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt  
ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything  
about.

When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of  
a sore on the leg.

A sense of guilt I felt once when I couldn't defend the  
confidence my teacher had in me and thus discrediting him at a  
concert.

My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite  
my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.
When I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

Several good friends made me a surprise visit and this made me  
happy.  They are my closest friends and we had not seen each  
other for a long time.

I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on the  
same day).

When I did not get admission in M.Sc after my B.Sc, I felt really  
bad.  When I started my journey to Bombay, after having accepted  
my uncle's offer to come to Bombay, I was afraid, wondering if I   
would succeed or not.

I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last  
born in the family.

I was very drunk at a certain wedding party and I got involved in  
a fight.

I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way.  
My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped  
my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

I entered the wrong room, and got into a bed where someone  
already was sleeping.

In a social situation I became interested in a woman. We talked,  
we laughed, we enjoyed each other. She desappeared for a few  
minutes, and a little after appeared with an other man.

Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a  
year.

When a member of the family complains about the food that is  
served, it disgusts me.

I feel disgusted since I am unable to cope with all the wordly  
affairs as I spend much precious time to pursue my hobby and  
to be admist the people I love and long to be with.
A very drunk person.

I entered the hostel this year.  My mother was ill and could not  
move and needed people to look after her.  Every week I left home  
to go back to school, I felt guilty.
Found out that I am not good at football.

I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our  
holidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came to  
see me at school, I was very joyful, and I didn't want her to go.

Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something.  
He never said "please" or "thank you" or any other kind word.
Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).

One day before Christmas, I went shopping with my brother and his  
friend. We had a good time. But on the way home we were almost in  
an accident because the weather was bad.
It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.

I felt disgusted when somebody told me that my previous boyfriend  
was her boyfriend.
Postgraduate students talking about girls stupid.
My friend was badly hurt.
When another person's mother died.

When I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selected  
to go to a Boarding secondary school.

When my grandfather died, with whom I had a very close  
relationship.
Being chosen to do this experiment.

In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first  
months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for  
all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first  
time) and even forgot that I had a gun.
When I read a lot and did not remember anything.

A time when I was very afraid of something was when I broke my  
father's antique lamp.
Korean judges cheating.

A few lies that I had indulged in, a few years ago, while raising  
loans from my friends.
When I saw a large spider crawling up the wall.

The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of  
economics.
When out of work.
Insulting other people.

I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to  
pick me up from work.

I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, and  
from the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but when it  
came to it, I let them down.
When my grandfather died.

[ During my childhood when I could not get what I wanted from my  
brother/sister and parents.]
Death in the close family.
I gave a wrong answer at school.

When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not done  
and did not do anything to defend me.

Somebody wanted to beat my brother at a wedding ceremony and I  
was trying to protect my brother but the other man was calling  
names to both of us.

When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would  
probably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for a  
long time.

There was a family fight in my house some time back.  My uncle  
had given me a watch as a present and I lost it.  During the  
fight he accused me of having sold the watch.  I was disgusted at  
his false accusations.

When my friend got very low marks in field work even though he  
had worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.

My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pm  
however she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we had  
to go out that evening).

When I found out that a person I went to school with had died in  
a car accident.

At hostel, my roommate was a very selfish person and would avoid  
doing anyhting that did not concern him.  A few of us prepared lunch  
together and had decided to share the work.  My roomate had  
promised to do the same but I had to wash the bowls everytime  
after dinner.  I tried to wait and thought that he would realize  
his fault.  I did not want to tell him to do the work as he is a  
university student and ought to have self-respect.  He  
disappointed me and so every time I saw him I tried to avoid him  
and did not want to keep any contact with him.

A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a  
shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat,  
then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous  
from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the  
bench.
A lie on the part of a person close to me.

The people on my floor last year were very close. This year 4 of  
our best friends live together in an apartment. My boyfriend and  
I dropped by on one of their birthdays and stayed for dinner. Two  
other people had already been invited and I felt uncomfortable  
and unwanted. Then I realized I was the one who always called  
them and they rarely call me.

When I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing many  
difficulties.
China winning the Asian Olympic.

A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I  
called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised  
another person to give him a lift.

My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off by  
mutual consent.  The consequences were - unrestrained weeping,  
feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.  I felt  
that I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.

I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about  
our problems, I told her lies.
Being close to drowning.

When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity  
better but I had not done it because of reluctance or  
carelessness.

When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman  
games when I was eleven.
A grenade blew out next to me.

Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance  
examinations.

When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in the  
U.E.F.A cup.

When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other  
people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.
Staying alone in a dark place.

I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the  
second year.

After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had  
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he  
feels glad.

The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed,  
hitch-hiking to work.

I took a psych. experiment with a totally unappealing gay man as  
the experimentor, some homosexuals are funny or cute, but this  
guy was disgusting. Plus the experiment was about gays too.

A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a  
small Lazer).

When I committed a sin mentioned in ANGER. A sin of sexual  
immorality.

My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the  
hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic  
Hospital, then he died.

A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the  
class during a tough mathematics examination.

I had a very horrible dream one night, I dreamt that I had fallen  
off a very crowded train.

When I knew almost the same day about two great friends of mine  
that had serious existential crisis, and mainly when I notice  
that I'm in the same situation that they are, but I didn't  
realize it.

I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself  
with high ranking officials.
Saw a classmate knocked down by a motorcycle.

When we decided, my boyfriend and I, that we would separate, I  
realized that he would have wanted to continue our relationship  
and the coming separation hurt him.

I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with  
him, but at last I did not without having informed him.

A friend unjustly put the blame on me to relieve his conscience  
and also spread lies for the same purpose.

When I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreated  
him, and caused a great instability.

I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in  
which the children were involved as accusers of one of the  
parents.

Doctors ignored relative who complained about pain, and is now  
dying of cancer.

When an uncle of mine who is very ill started to cough wich  
sounded very dirty. (He can't help it of course).

This happened when it was finally confirmed that I had stood  
first in the university for the M.A exams.  A few days before the  
official results were declared a clerk had brought the results  
unofficially.  So I had been expecting the results but the  
confirmation allowed me to legitimately feel happy at my  
success.
Acting in a play at the orientation camp made me feel timid.
Article published in the college newspaper.

Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and  
died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.
Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.
Fighting with class mates in Highschool.
A friend came to visit me and I was not there.

My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious  
and gained consciousness after some time. That time I was at  
school; this news reached me through someone.

I was on a trip to Phillipines during Summer and I was staying in  
a hotel.  The room I was staying in was very silent and had very  
dim lights.  The last night I felt frightened and lay awake - I  
could hear some sounds around me and dared not open my eyes - I  
waited for dawn.

Was accused of having hidden intentions in a situation when I  
believed I was acting honestly and fairly.

When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young  
prostitute who was not older than 18.

I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from the  
back of the lorries.

On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years)  
cigarettes.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.

When I saw that my bed at the hostel was a mess I guessed that  
someone else had used my daily necessities.  I felt that my  personal  
sanity had been affected.

Inventing a fictitious series of events, as a result of which I  
ended up in a conflict with my two closest friends.
When quarreling with friends.

During an argument with my brother, I behaved rather  
intransigently, even cruelly, wishing to morally hurt the "person"  
opposed to me.

One day I was with my girlfriend and other friends were behind  
us, I fell down because the place was slippery and I really felt  
ashamed.
When I hurt my sisters for no reason at all.

When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing  
after several months absence (I was not needed during this time).

[ I can not remember anything in particular.  What I can remember  
is feelings of having done or said something which then had  
negative consequences.]
A close friend of the family died.
Being unable to stop urinating on the bus.

When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and   
how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical  
book in English that I did not understand.

I was jerking me off in my bedroom, when suddenly, my mother came  
in. She looked at me and immediately left the room.
When I was selected for the university.
The death of an animal we had reared.

I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we   
started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started  
teasing me.

I felt disgusted when I found out that someone had betrayed me.  
That person had been dishonest with me and I felt used.

Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage  
that occurred at the building site I had designed.
My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.
When my little sister was born.
When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.

A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what was  
saying. She acted as though I wasn't even there. We were doing  
group work so everybody had the right to speak yet she just  
ignored me. She made me feel insignificant.

When I don't go to my parents on Sunday and phone them to tell  
them that I have to study. The truth is that I listened to sports  
on the radio.
Not finishing homework in time.

Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to do  
it due to transport troubles.

When I purposely locked my babysitter out of the house at age 4  
because I DIDN'T LIKE HER.

I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to  
our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved  
him very much.

The day I went to eat dinner in the dinning hall and found a  
dead fly in my gravy.

I stole a coconut cake from a reception table and when I put  
in my mouth I realized that the host was watching me.

This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case and  
took it to the deputy head-master.  I was called by the  
head-master and he threatened to suspend me.

When I heard of the death of a friend who had just finished her  
training I felt very sad for she was young.

When a car ran into me. The moment that I felt on the street I  
thought "This is my end, I am going to die".

The day I encountered a queer mamba face to face in a chunk of  
leaves behind our house.

When finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predicting  
changes in my life, and I became happy.

I felt anger when I saw that I was being misleaded by my  
boyfriend, he went out with other girls. I felt anger for his  
falsity.

At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense  
and always wanted to kiss me.
People not resprcting my opinion.

When I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there was  
moonlight.

I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar in internal  
diseases, simply because the assistant professor is a person who  
deserves high respect.

I read a story in the newspaper about butchers treating their  
animals very badly. They disgusted me.
I feel anger when somebody forbids me to do something.

When I woke up one morning and went to the kitchen I discovered  
that our dog had diarrhoea.  There were small "piles" all over  
the floor and the smell was choking.

I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture  
of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine  
took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some  
unnecessary work.

Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character -  
gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.

My parents do not like my friend and told me to stay away from  
him.
When my mother surprised me while masturbating.

At the end of my senior yr. in high school I found out that a  
friend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminally  
ill.

Once in primary five, I had forgotten to take a book to class and  
the teacher punished me by asking me to stand at the back of the  
class.  I thought about the way my mother would react if she saw  
me being punished.  My mother was very good to me and though she  
did not see me punished, I felt sorry for her.
My father told me in the letter that my mother is ill.

When my pet dog,who was to us a family member, died.  He had been  
vomitting for the past three days and we had not found the time  
to call a vet, finally when the vet came it was already too late.
When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

The day I got a letter from the U.G.C informing me that I had  
been awarded the junior research fellowship.
Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.

I felt guilty when I tore a photograph I found at my boyfriend's  
place only to realise that it was his sister who was on the  
photograph.

My father promised me a bicycle for my birthday. Just before my  
birthday he forgot he promised this to me.
Can't remember any such feelings now.

Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For  
tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker  
player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to  
win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been  
necessary.

I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.  I had  
brought along a lamp which was not working very well.  The door  
made strange sounds and I was sure that strange things were  
happening.  The most terrifying bit was that there were many  
wardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass of  
the wardrobe I felt that there were "objects" behind me.   The  
whole night was spent in fear and restlessness.

I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I  
could not feel it at all.

Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close to  
structure.

Sometime back I was coming from the wards and lice were all over  
my uniform since patient's blankets have a lot of lice. It  
happened that my boyfriend picked some lice from my white uniform.  
I was so ashamed.

I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months.  
 I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we  
went there because we knew we would meet there.

A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything  
turned out fine.
When I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.

My brother told me that a person (whom I know) had insulted him.   
I am very fond of my brother, and as he himself can not get angry  
or hurt, my protectiveness was aroused and I got angry.

A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the  
goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally  
forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.

I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a  
wet lawn.

My father resigned from work, and soon after this his elder brother  
died.  The next day my granny died (my mother's mother).  My dad  
remains the only living member of his family.

I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to  
illness.

When I discovered that the girl I was courting was a relative of  
mine.
Finding out that I was deceived by a friend.

[ No answer as I see very little difference between shame and  
guilt.  Therefore see answer for "shame".]

I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning,  
although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From  
3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.
When I first passed a job interview.

At my Summer job a new caretaker had been employed who was my age  
 but I preferred going out for lunch with the accounts personnel  
rather than with him.
When I learnt that my close friend was going to immigrate.
The day I finished my military service.

Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my  
part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly  
she did not give up for a longer time.

I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of  
alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting  
next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.

I was very ashamed when I failed a test in Standard 7. The  
teacher told the other students to shout and laugh at me.

Once I was stopped by the police in Spain, when I had some  
"grass" in my tobacco.

When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made  
to my friends, who did not approve of them.
When I saw my family after a separation of one year.
Once while crossing a road I was overcome with fear.

I had a schoolmate who went to the hospital as her brain was  
bleeding.  She fell unconscious for three days and when I went  
to see her I saw the miserable state the family was in.  Moreover  
I could not do nothing for her.  I was very sad.  Finally, she  
died.
When my grandmother died after a long illness.

A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his  
behavior.
I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.

I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car  
broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from  
Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at  
1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.

I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my  
friends who share the flat with me.

I was spending a few days at my aunt's place.  One night I got  
home very late, I had told them I was going to a party but I went  
to another place.  They were very worried.

Housesitting and hearing the alarm go off. I knew someone had to  
be breaking in. I called the police and was panicking while on  
the phone. It was awful. It turns out that I stepped on the  
hidden alarm without prior knowledge of its existance.
When I first had a sexual intercourse.
Leaving high school.
One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.

A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar  
terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no  
reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I  
would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).
When I offend somebody unfairly.

We went fishing some 5 or 8 kilometers off the shore of Lake  
Malawi. Before we could settle down the lake became very rough to  
the point of threatening our lives.

Some colleagues decided to go out on a Saturday not inviting me  
to decide either the place nor the time.

I felt ashamed when my lecturer said in class that I  
happened to be the dullest of all.

A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion over  
me. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.
A classmate damaged ma iron and tried to hide the damage.
People not cueing in the college dining room.

Once when I complained I caused a great discussion between my  
parents.

I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other  
person didn't appear.

When I dropped a bottle in the state liquor store and everyboby  
started laughing.

I saw in a movie a block on which affluence and poverty existed.  
I saw that the rich made no attempts to help the poor.

When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and  
disappointed.
Disgust of drunkers and of blood.

When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron   
which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have  
thought that I had been stealing.

We had to move to a very different city because the company where  
my father worked also moved to that place. It was very difficult  
for me to make new friends than.

When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in  
front of a group of my friends.

My boyfriend suffered form ill health for some months, this week  
the physician told him that he was restored to health.

My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something he  
knew was extremely important to me.

I was really angry when the President general of UNZASU was  
arrested by policemen.

In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite  
pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory  
which he himself had never known. His information was from  
fortuitous sources.
When the relationship with my girlfriend broke up.
My good friend misunderstood me.

Occured while preparing for a midterm in Social Welfare that I  
thought was going to be very hard and felt unprepared for.

I felt disgust toward meat when I felt sick with the steak after  
a week only on meat.
A close person lied to me.
Getting lost in a strange place.

When I was taking an exam in grade 5.  The examinator found me  
with a note-book and accused me of copying, All the students  
laughed at me.

I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go out  
together. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren't  
there. I became very angry because I thought they were gone  
without me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.

As a child I suffered of nightmares. Even since than, I have  
never been so anxious and fearful.
I felt guilty when I lost K43 for my friend when he was arrested.

At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home and  
personally.

Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to  
surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.

A rainy day, I was cycling downhill and a car door suddenly  
opened and while trying to avoid it the back wheels of my bike  
got caught in the tram tracks.  I somersaulted but had no  
injuries.
I crashed my father's car.
Due to some reasons my boyfriend and I decided to separate.

A certain Area Party Secretary came home in the morning and said  
we had to leave our home and build somewhere and the reason  
being that they wanted to establish a market. The Chairman knew  
nothing about it and was very angry.

When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers  
wandering around, doing nothing.
At work a boy was injured because of my lack of supervision.

I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend  
told me that she would go to travel next year with another good  
friend. We couldn't talk this out.
My uncle died in the Vietnam War.

In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they  
greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.
When I got accepted to CAL.
[ I have not felt this emotion.]
When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.
Selling my used car.

I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the  
car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away.  
At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it  
cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week  
(including rent).

My mother wants to talk very often about her life. I dislike this  
because she always talks negatively about the same people  
whatever I do it doesn't help.
First time in anatomy.

After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and this  
lead to my wanting to empty my bladder.  My friends gathered  
around me and two of them had to help me to the toilet.  I was  
ashamed at having to go to the toilet in the presence of my  
friends.

When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School  
out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful.  
Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers  
who had passed after repeating for several times.

Receiving a much wanted letter from a very good friend who lives  
abroad.

When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing  
going on in the world.

I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because  
I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with  
this person.

When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to  
see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us  
with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he  
got more money.

I was with a friend in a stationed car when, suddenly a man  
appeared on my side and an other with a gun on his side the  
hold-up lasted a few minutes but it was terrible. I had never  
seen a gun so close.

When I found out that my sister had been playing with my  
confidential things which she had taken from my hand-bag.
When I heard about the death of my aunt.
When I had passed MCE examinations.
At an unjust insult or injure.

My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he  
could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I  
could not but detest him.

I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend  
called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because  
I was prevented from eating.

One night I could not practise my violin as my family was  
watching T.V with the lights off, so I wanted to listen to some  
tapes.  It was dark so I asked my brother to bring me a torch,  
however he scolded me.  I was so angry that I slammed my violin  
on the floor.

When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for  
several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath  
the air that smelled of her presence.
Forced to fill in a questionnaire.

When someone took my things without having asked for my  
permission.
My friend misunderstood me.

Lately I've felt guilty because I'm folling behind in my classes  
and not studying much.

When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at  
night, and two men started closely following me. There was nobody  
around that I could run to.

Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go to  
school back East. We are very close and have been together 4  
years.

When I met another person I began to go out with him, and my  
boyfriend (with marriage accorded) met us together he did a great  
scandal, he broke the engagement and I began to go out with the  
other, and it didn't work because my mind was all mixed up.

A letter from my boyfriend began in such a way that I thought he  
was going to end our relationship. I was afraid of reading the  
rest.

A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than  
me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her  
own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).

I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did  
not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid  
that he would grumble.

I felt guilty when I was robbed of a friend's radio at Lilongwe  
bus depot after promising that I would keep it safe.

A day when I was getting out of the shower I covered only the  
front part of my body with a towel (I was 7 years old), and I  
didn't see that my cousin was in the room.

When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor  
balcony with his legs hanging out.  He was holding on tightly to  
the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost  
his balance when he sat down.
Once I answered my father rudely.
The high school entrance exam.

Whenever I am alone in a dark room, walk alone on the street,  
sleep alone in the room at night or see something which is only  
partly visible.  This emotion was very strong when as an 8 year    
old child I saw something horrible.
My parents came to visit me.

There was a conflict of interest between me and a close friend of  
mine.  He only thought about his own interest and not about our  
friendship.  This behaviour hurt his friends.  Another incident  
is when a friend isolated himself without giving any reasons.
The birth of my first child.
When I went home by train from Sicilia, I was molested by a man.

Not speaking to my sister-in-law due to lack of interest in a  
relationship on my side.

When I went to meet the family of my boyfriend in a party in his  
house. His mother was eager to know me and all his friends ready  
to make jokes about the situation.

I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this I  
felt a dead bird laying under my bed.

One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with the  
sensation that there was someone in my room.

After being away on a holiday for 2 months, a friend, who lived  
interstate, had remembered when I'd get back and phoned to  
welcome me home on the night of my arrival.

When I unjustly accused a person of my family of something she  
didn't really do.

While playing basketball I broke a team member's spectacles.  His  
face was injured by the  pieces of glass.  It was not serious but  
I felt guilty and blamed myself for being too careless and  
vigorous in my game.
When my mother was very sick and almost died.
Cueing in the students dining hall.

Two years back someone invited me to be the tutor of her  
grand-daughter.  The grand-daughter asked me some questions in  
mathematics so I taught her.  However she did not listen to me  
and this made me feel unhappy.  The second year it was the same.   
When I entered university the girl's parents suggested that I be  
employed as their daghters tutor.  They told me that at university   
there was no homework and I would have a lot of time so they  
made a time-table  for me which required me to be the tutor five  
days a week.  They did not respect me and anyway I had another  
child to teach.
Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.

My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that at  
night, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfect  
darkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.

On my birthday, an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had not  
met him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.

I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock  
someone knocked violently on the door.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.
First day back on the job.
When my father was ill.

While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death,  
threat and fear of loosing people close to me.

I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the  
transport money I had to go to school.

My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter  
addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and  
said "the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun  
was shining on it". Hah Hah.

Receiving notification that I had made a successful application  
to the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feelig  
of achievment and joy.
The quarrel between my  parents.

Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog.It was terrible to  
feel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.

When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in  
the family after 19 years of baby boys.

I was given a wristwatch by my first girl and after two days  
another girl of mine also gave me a wristwatch.

After seeing a terror movie at the cinema, I was so scared that I  
couldn't even drive the car into the garage. I often thought  
about the film afterwards, hoping such things couldn't exist in  
the "real world".

I was with my girlfriend when some guys that I don't like made  
fuss at my girl.

When I found out that the guy I was dating at a particular time  
had a steady relationship going on with someone else for a long  
time.

Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling  
and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in  
effect lowering myself to their level.

When my flatmate put me down because she "thought" she was better  
than me, or she felt she was.

Late one night I was pursued by gipsies who had no good  
intentions.

I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go  
home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear  
it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by  
talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess,  
blinding and blaming.
When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.
When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.

When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep  
the promise.
Finding out my grades at the end of my freshman year.

When I learnt that I could do further studies at the Chinese  
university.
I received a letter from a friend whom I was missing

Being stopped by the police for a traffic offence which I don't  
think I committed.
When I came back from my holidays.
When my first niece was born.
When I was travelling at night.

When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I  
was right and she was not.

Quite recently I realized that I had had some erroneous views  
about life. For instance, I had always lived for other people,  
had forgotten my own person and suppressed my own feelings. I was  
ashamed because I had not been concious of that until I had a  
conversation about it with a person.

When I left my sister's house after staying there for a few days.  
She has two little boys, and they are very warm people (the  
family). At the time, I was in need of this sort of contact, and  
I grew very fond of children (no, I'm not a paedophiliac).

I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do.  I did  
something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though  
he promised not to report me, I am still frightened.

I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't  
die, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be put  
down.
If I don't go to lectures, I often feel ashamed.
I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.

The way this particular girl spoke, behaved, and reacted the  
first time I was introduced to her, I felt certain that something  
between us would materialize.

In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison  
and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read  
detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less  
powerful people.
When I was charmed by my relatives.
I realized that the girl I loved had to leave me.
When I fell head on in a fountain.
Someone frightened me in the dark.

I was walking in the countryside alone when I came across two  
dogs who began barking at me.  I did not know whether they were  
tied up or loose, but I was afraid of them approaching me.

[ Generally when I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of all  
the thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]

When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it,  
by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own  
urine from the wet soil, I did it.

One winter day I, unwillingly, was outdoors with my younger  
brother (10 years younger than me).  I lost my temper on him and  
wanted to throw my brother down the snow bank we were on.  I  
pushed him but not as hard as I had wanted to. We were alone the  
two of us.
A girl I was with went off with another guy.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned"  
relations.
Parents finding out I smoked.

When I was 13 years old I wrote passionate love letters to my  
boyfriend and I later found out that his sister had read them.
I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.
An old lady slipped and nobody helped her.

I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting  
open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.

My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now  
her brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walk  
and she can hardly talk.
Not being able to help my friend.

Many years ago a friend wanted me to with her to southern Europe  
and I preferred to travel alone.  I felt guilty because I wanted  
to go on my own.

[ Whenever I put myself in other's shoes and try to make the  
person happy, comfort him or make friends and I am misunderstood  
and rejected, especially when this person is a family member or a friend.]
When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.

When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my  
parents.
When I had beaten my auntie.

When my mother found me in her bedroom "stealing" sugar in her  
bedroom.  According to our customs there comes a stage when a  
child stops using the parents bedroom and I was well past that  
age.

Leaving a friend of mine alone at a dance - I felt I should have  
kept her company.

After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was  
very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.

On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long  
time.

When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while  
under the influence of alcool.
When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.
Being slandered by friends.

When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outside  
the school grounds when I was at the secondary school.  We were  
caught by the headmaster.

Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little.  
It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.
A party with friends on New Year's Eve.

Practicing wind-surf my body was caught under the sail. On trying  
to get out my leg was caught in the lashing. I was afraid of  
dying by asphixia.

In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring to  
a question I posed. I felt very unsure and I was afraid to fail.

My friend and I had offended our classmate unintenionally.  We  
wanted to apologize to her so we decided to visit her.  We knew that she  
was stubborn so we were frightened.  When we rang her door bell,  
our fear was at it's climax

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many  
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to  
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any  
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

When I did not defend my close friend when my father degraded  
him. I felt guilty for allowing my father to get away with his  
actions and for the hurt my friend felt. I cleared the matter up  
with my father a few weeks later.

When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was  
16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short  
time.

On a social occasion, I noticed that I reacted on the basis of my  
autonomous nerve system (I could not help it).

I was less than 10 years old when our neighbour's dog chased me  
to the roof of a small shed and there seemed to be no hope of  
getting away from there.

When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time  
that someone so close to me had died.
When I won my car.
When my team lost a championship.

I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying  
for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason,  
they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and  
unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could  
manage things.
When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.

When one finds out that someone you know is not at all like one  
had thought, for instance friends who steal and things like that,  
quite unwarranted.

When my parents separated temporarily and I was left behind with  
my father.  As I loved my mother I wanted to go with her.

Close friend leave to go overseas for an indefinite period.  
Farewell scene at airport.

I work part-time as a shop-assistant and a customer spoke to me  
very loudly about an Indian man & white woman with children - how  
horrible that was and would I want to have little dark children.
Having quarreled with a boyfriend, he threatened to leave me.

I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively  
well prepared.

One night I saw a man being knocked down by two other men. The  
victim was kicked against his head.
When I noticed that I do many things to the pregiudice of myself.
When someone makes advances that one does not want.
When I missed my train this morning, I felt sad for some time.

I used to play with a group of classmates and I found out later  
that they were cheap in thought, behaviour and conduct - they  
would smoke, fight and speak foul language.  I thought that they  
destroyed the image of college students.

When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his  
friends and that he was dead.

I kicked the dog outside on a cold night because he was annoying  
me. The next day he came down with the flu and we thought he was  
going to die.

When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.   
Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out  
well and we enjoy ourselves.

Being involved in a car accident and having my thumb caught in  
the glove compartment. My sister and I had a Fear of finally  
telling my parents, since my sister was the driver.

When I was concentrating on my work, my friend disturbed me  
continously.  I asked him to stop but in vain.

When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people  
jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were  
shouting something at the same time.
Talking to a close friend.

My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and  
suffered an aphasia.
When I qualified for form I.

The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the army  
was really mean.  I detested this.

I took my father's car to church one Sunday (I told them that's  
where I was going ) I decided instead to go for a drive to the  
beach - on the way I got a puncture.

I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every  
time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

When my boyfriend was changing his behavior there was something  
wrong, I felt sad, because it's desagreable when a relationship  
is ending.

I was walking one day and I met a man who wanted to ask me about  
my brother but I didn't stop to hear what he was saying. I was  
ashamed when I found him at home and he told my brother what had  
happened.

I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, I  
realized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop -  
and I then needed the money.

A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. He  
tries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunk  
too much.

Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in  
Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and  
masturbated.  Very disgusting.
When my father revealed inconsistent morals.

I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and  
had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me,  
played cards with other people.

I was a prefect at secondary school.  On the sports day I told  
others that I would take down the names of the people who  
misbehaved and after some time I sat down for a brief rest.   
Suddenly the head prefect came and scolded me in front of others.  
 I was very angry as there were other prefects sitting and he  
picked on me.  I thought that a brief rest was not  serious  
enough to be blamed.
When I had a good result in the certificate examination.
Finding out my best friend cannot go to the English lectures.

My boyfriend and I did not have any contact with each other during   
the Summer holidays.  I met him the day of the registration and looked   
through him.  In the canteen he asked me if I wanted to have a drink and   
I said no as I did not want him to do me a favour.

[ Generally, when I am late in attending to matters (for example  
paying bills).]
When I have a plain appearance.

I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.   
More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a  
death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, with 
vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.

When I saw my father coming out of the bathroom. He thought that  
he was alone at home and came out without his clothes.

I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I  
always started crying so that he had to give in.
Not included on questionnaire.
A TV program on whale-hunting.

I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber  
in my cup.
When I was involved in a car crash.

I was sitting in the bus and a man with a very unpleasant  
smell came and sat next to me, to top it all he smoked  
continously.

When my oldest sister discovered that her boyfriend had another  
girl.

I played chess with my 12-year-old brother. I made a stupid  
mistake - and he won!
When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.
I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.

A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died within  
two years.  We had not finished our studies then and could not  
bear our responsibilities as her children.  My mother had tried  
her best to take care of us but she lived in pain these two  
years.  Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her as  
cancer is incurable.  I was very eager to replace her in  
suffernig , even die instead of her.

On school, during a fancy fair, there was a stand of amnesty  
international. There I read (for the first time) a description of  
the tortures of a woman, what they did to her.

When I am alone at night after having read horror stories, and  
then I heard unexplainable noises.

When I was first taken to the dissection room where I found 10 dead  
human bodies.
Diagnosis that I have a stomache ulcer.

My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly  
would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was  
confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a  
student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to  
assume my financial situation.

One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning,  
to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.

I was caught stealing food at my aunt's place.  I had tried to  
hide the food I had taken from the pantry while my aunt was in  
the kitchen, however she went to the pantry and discovered the  
stolen package.

During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This  
led to friction in a lot of situations.

My friend had organized a birthday party for me secretly, I was  
very happy not so much for the presents but because they seemed  
to care for me.
When I failed my first biochemistry test.

When I study my butt off for a midterm and still get an average  
grade.

My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and  
cousins.  She said that I was very lazy and I felt so sad that I  
cried myself to sleep.

When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to  
read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.
Thought had discovered true love.

Hearing about developments of sience in the West a lot better  
than China.

I was very angry when one day I went to see my girlfriend I  
talked to her and could not answer back. She was depressed for  
reasons which were not known to me.

When my girlfriend left me to go out with another guy, even  
though she knew that she was wrong.

When I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on the  
varnish, this pulled it all off and I didn't admit my guilt.

When one of my closest friends failed to make it to the third  
year of university.
I saw a septic, smelling wound.

There is a boy who I love very much. I asked him to have dinner  
with me, but he refused I don't know why he didn't go with me,  
but I felt very lonely.

My roommate leaving my drawers in a mess after plowing thourgh  
them looking for something.
When I accepted Jesus Christ as my personal saviour.
Cooks refused to give me food.

Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My  
life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it  
disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away  
instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to  
wait at his home so that I could see his new car.

I felt disgusted when my cousin decided that she would stop  
going to school saying she wanted to get married. She was only 14  
years by then and she didn't understand what she was thinking.

I remember when I was in Standard 6, I failed one of the terminal  
tests and I told my parents that I had passed but after they  
found out from the class teacher that I had failed, I was proved  
a liar.

As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the  
last offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person -  
fear came.

When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased and  
hindered by my cousin.

My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years  
ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for  
money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered  
her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was  
terribly angry with my sister.

My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear that  
I would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn't  
have seen this, but they blew and I did.

When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas'  
Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she  
said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a  
light had to be left turned on.

A piece of work was marked as bad by the teachers I and some  
fellow students didn't agree with their vague criticism. I felt  
myself taken in by the teachers and felt disgust.

I was living at home during the Summer vacations and towards the  
end decided to take some of my clothes and other belongings to  
the appartment in Guttenburg.  When I had finished I went to my  
ex-boyfriend's (relationship uncertain) home and stayed there  
till 5 A.M.  I had to leave then as my parents needed the car for  
work in the morning.  My parents do not like my boyfriend.

I went singing with a group of young people on January 6th (The  
three Magi), a local custom called "star singing". One of the girls, my  
girlfriend, broke the star. Being the accompanying person, I felt very  
angry thinking of the consequences.

When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which cost  
SEK 20000.  I had waited for it for 2-3 years.

When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought  
there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and  
trembled.

In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as  
I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load  
on the tractor trailer.

I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade  
eight.

They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that  
the one I had was out of date.
When my father bought me a suit.
Saw a snake unexpectedly.
When I was admitted to the University.

In contact with a poor family of northeast it was offered to me a  
crab to eat at my request. But the fact that this crab was  
prepared antihygienically and his appearence was also  
antihygienically it caused me disgust but I ate it anyway.

I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this  
feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.

In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with  
several employers, after several years of dedication I was  
dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

While I was waiting for them to give me the marks of the most  
difficult subject this year.
An inter-college basket-ball match.
The sight of a man who ran amok (fighting) at a dance.

I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I  
would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on  
account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at  
secondary school.
When my grandmother passed away.

I got a good reaction from my tutor and tutorial group for a  
presentation I'd given that I was very worried about.

When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and  
it was split into several segments by something I could not see.   
I suspected that it was witch-craft.

When I tried to breake it up with my boyfriend, and he refused to  
let me go.
Finished a difficult midterm.

When my grandmother after staying with us for awhile went back  
home.

I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for  
my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.
Not winning a medal in the swimming contest.

When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our  
holiday together.
Left alone in the biology building surrounded by empty buildings.
When I got my B.A degree with first class.

The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leaving  
Certificate Examinations.
At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).
When the contract about my shop was signed.
Disappointed by a friend.

At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplary  
student by our pricipal.  This is something which made me feel  
very happy.

At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little  
brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined  
creepy men sneaking into our house.
When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.

A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had  
tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I  
told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling  
depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of  
confidentiality.

Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going  
different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total  
when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.

When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making a  
journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.

My parents did not approve my choice of a boyfriend (now an  
ex-boyfriend).  He happened to be 13 years older than me and he  
was considered completely unsuitable for me.  IDIOT.

When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but  
I didn't cope with the task.

I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept  
under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a  
half.
When I learnt of the death of a friend.

We had friends to dinner and one of them threw a beer bottle in  
the air, and it bounced on an expensive table and damaged the  
table .The person did not apologise.

I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraid  
trying to anticipate the reaction of my father.

When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was  
the first time that I lost a brother.

I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it in  
time so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sad  
about it and couldn't talk to anyone.
Got a present from my friend for my birthday.
Lost a friend.

Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a  
long time.

One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring a  
motorcycle through my own efforts.

I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for  
them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of  
them cut up some material I flared up.
A tailor ran away with my skirt.

When I argue with my sister.  It feels sometimes that I have the  
upper hand and I use it.  I often argue better and this makes her  
terribly angry.

My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where they  
adopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.

I had a discussion with my mother concerning my sister's divorce,  
we disagreed strongly.
After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.

I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knocked  
down by a car.

Today I did a lot better on my architecture project than I  
expected.
Peeping.
When I stole something.

After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did  
not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was  
madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I  
told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my  
mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward  
factors.

In May somebody blamed me that I made him to be caught while  
peeping during the Nursing Test which made me feel disgusted.
A close married friend has just had his first child.

In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants  
and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued  
ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with  
us.

The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his  
permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.

One of my relatives became seriously ill. I felt sad because I  
didn't know if she will ever be the same again.

My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to me  
a feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at my  
parent's place I will remember it for long time.

Reading about executions and massacres which happened during  
World War II, I felt disgust towards those who did it.
When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

When my elder brother failed form five in 1968 when I was 5 years  
old.
When I was a kid I stole toys from other kids.
When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.

A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself.  Disgust that  
turned into sadness-unpleasantness.

When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of  
deep perturbation.

Not attending school, when  am not sick - but in need of mental  
rest. Staff on your return query your "sickness" - it is easier  
in N.Z. to be sick, rather than confide other personal reasons  
etc.
People not cueing in the dining hall.
Saw something stupid and ignorant happening in the countryside.

When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite  
my excellent certificate.

At one time while at primary school I lost a pencil case of a  
friend and I didn't mention it to her until after a fortnight.
I was the last among the list of failures in my class of Biology.

When a good friend of mine behaved in a very cool manner to me  
for a very long time.

When I was doing my homework at home, some relatives came and  
advised me to help my mother do the house-work.

On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me.  
At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills  
me with disgust.

In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between  
my group and the graduation commission (two students of my  
classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about  
them.

I made an appointment to pick up someone. However I arrived  
too late and she had to wait a quarter of an hour.

I had planned to study for my mid-term exams on a certain day and   
my room-mate called me to ask me to go out for a stroll.  I tried  
to make an excuse so as not to go out but she refused to listen  
to me and insisted that I go out with her.  I find it unnecessary   
to talk to her anymore.
My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.

When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians  
at ther wedding.

Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back and  
molested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration did  
not occur as the driver of the car stopped that.

Remembering (at the time I did not feel guilt) in recent yrs. how  
angry I would get when I was babysitting my new brother and he  
would not stop crying. I did not do anything harmful or shocking.  
But I feel guilty for treating him the way I did especially  
since I adore him now. That's why I spoil him now.

A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my  
studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.
My best friend suddenly acting strange towards me.

When I received the results from my final examination - Higher  
School Certificate - and received a mark that was beyond my  
wildest expectations.

One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriend  
and out of jealousy he started calling me names.
When my mother interfered in my life.
Failing an examn.

I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part  
very well but did not know the second part.

I felt disgust when I received visitors at an odd hour. I was  
seriously preparing for Examinations, so I did not appreciate  
their coming.

Sometime ago I felt very angry when my mother wrote me telling me  
that my elder sister was messing up things at home by her  
internalised aggressive attitude towards parents and her husband.

When I was first exposed to the dead bodies, for dissecting         
purposes at the school of medicine.

When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone -  
loneliness drains me.

My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to  
tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other  
people because of their social status, beliefs, color and  
outlook on life (perspective).

When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a  
nonacademic degree.
Relatives visiting me.
When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.

At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was getting  
rolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstly  
getting drunk.

I had a misunderstanding with my father and after some time I  
found that I had been wrong.

When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt  
well and very happy for being able to express to myself something  
that was suffocating me.
Getting a letter from a friend who did not write for a long time.

Once I woke up in the middle of the night and felt frightened as  
everyone else was sleeping and I could not even go to their  
room.
Before my final examination.
I spread abroad an intimate secret.

A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said very  
unreasonable things about me, that hit me strongly.

I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music  
was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed  
on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre  
that was almost empty.

"Boy, you have been admitted to the medicine school and your  
uncle is coming back fron Canada next week," my father told me  
and it was a happy moment.

I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his   
departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer  
holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.

When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time  
and I had lost his address and telephone number.
When my one year old son gives me a spontaneous kiss.

I read a book about torture. The book described exactly how the  
torturing was done.

After some time of work I was transferred to another place and in  
an other quite harder job.
Going to see a good film with my best friend.
When my elder sister died.
Being mistreated by my former primary school teacher, Mr Zalu.

When I crashed my car and it had to be scrapped then.  It was my  
fault and I feel depressed as I miss the car.
I was scolded by my mother for no reason.

The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the  
relationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me.  
And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.

I was biking with my boyfriend, the sun shining after a long  
period of bad beather, afterwards we spent the evening and night  
together.

This last August when my parents dropped me off and moved me into  
college I didn't know anybody here; I was 17 and Berkeley really  
scared me.

Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I  
trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly  
feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in  
our fate.

When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks  
because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about  
why I was home late.

That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal  
marks.

When I lost my study grant without having attended any exam in  
the career I had started, and it was too late to cancel my registration.
When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.

I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the  
gutter, in broad daylight.
When my girlfriend left me.

I had this feeling when I met a girl, not that she was dirty but  
she was to "fresh", dump and childish.
Watching suffering in Third World country.

I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times.  
Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come  
home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.

I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly  
suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She  
mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.

I was wearing a short skirt one day and someone told me my  
underwear was showing.

A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does  
not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me  
by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with  
both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and  
would like me to be close only to her.

I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home  
in Woodlands.

When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave my  
home.

I felt disgusted while studying for my applied psychology and  
mental testing papers in B.A.

I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticket  
collector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feeling  
of shame.

Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people  
challenged me to fight for no apparent reason except they were  
drunk.

In September 1984, I was forced to live with someone I did not  
like.  The first week we were at loggerheads and our conversation  
was like a debate.  The atmosphere was very bad.  When he learnt  
that I had got 95 marks in a test he told me " A failure, You lost  
5 marks."   I was very angry, not because my marks were lower  
than his, but because I could not tolerate his pride.  I did not  
show my discontentment and carried on doing my work.

The first time that I "played with myself" despite being a  
Christian.  I had read in the bible that it was wrong to make  
love to someone one is not married to.

One day, when I realized that I was alone, I felt fear of  
loneliness.

I saw a movie called "The Thing", the film directed by John  
Carpenter.  The monster in the film made me feel disgusted.
When junior doctors returned to work after bunking them.

While intoxicated I invaded someone's (a girl's) personal space  
to a large extent.

I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date   
with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was  
afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.

Sometime back I used to stay with my mum alone then time came  
when dad joined the family from his working place I found myself  
having fear for him for no cause at all.
Forgetting an important appointment.

When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing at  
secondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.

I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most  
of all when we are at a party.

When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought  
the cloth after months of hindrances.
Not being accepted by classmates in university.
I am scared when I stroll alone on the Chung Chi college campus.
My love proposal was turned down by a lady I really loved.

When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we  
were on a camping.

The saddest moment in my life was when I lost my younger sister a  
few years back.
Not applicable.

A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certain  
behaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid when I saw  
him.
When I got indecent offers.

They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some  
awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

When a professor caught me absent-minded and not paying attention  
to what he was saying.
The death of a friend.
I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.

I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we  
started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said  
that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some  
time later I apologized for that.

The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called   
the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.   
I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining  
school to cool off.

After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destination  
and the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.
I was scared in the dark when I was a little boy.

Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person  
responsible.

Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour,  
commonly not accepted, and making the child cry.

I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not  
accept my Visa !

When I drove partially across the country with my father. We  
stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I  
got was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of the  
country.
When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.
The stories about the way my grandmother treated my mother.
When my grandmother died.

I had promised myself that I would do one good deed every day.   
One night I saw a beggar whose muscles had been atrophyed.  I  
walked passed him thinking that he was feigning.  Later I  
realized that he had not been pretending and I had a feeling of  
guilt as I had not kept my promise.

When I failed an exam for which I knew that I had not studied  
hard enough.

My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an  
unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a  
newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood first  
in my class.  Thus I got the first prize from the college.  I was  
most happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.

When I received my S.Y.J.C results which did not allow me to get    
admission in engineering.

At night when I was alone at home (all the family members usually  
get together at that time) someone knocked vigorously on the  
door.

When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie "Deer  
hunter")
Seeing this badly made questionnaire.

Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was  
cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident  
that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.

A few months a close relative of mine died.  I had never expected  
this to happen and was sad for a few months.

I had a driver licence but I didn't drive for a long time, than I  
started to drive again, and had to get into hard transit and  
highways.

I am always sad when my boyfriend goes away. He lives and studies  
in an other city. We have gone steady for 2 and 1/2 years and  
everything is going very well, but sometime this situation makes  
me feel bad and very lonely.
Teacher suspected me stealing money.

Discovering that Lillehammer provided no musical environment that  
suits my taste, even though I had been told so.
When my 6 month old son is happy and well.

Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very  
controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed  
with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So
