myself close to him as I never felt before. After some time his  
mother demanded the care of the kid and we were obliged to send  
him back.

A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator  
entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the  
fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the  
smoke in that direction.
Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.
When I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.

When my rights to use a shared house had been usurped by  
co-owners out of pure selfishness.

Once when I was studying for my examination, I was asked to do  
some work which was unavoidable.

A friend of mine had sex with someone of a different race on a  
Winnebago trip down to USC in front of everyone (all my friends  
embarrassed my sorority house name).
When I attended the concert of a pop singer.

When I was dreaming that I was being chased, in the upmost of  
horror the door of the closed felt down synchronicaly with the  
dream scare.

My elder brother often criticizes my mother's cooking.  Once he  
did it very impolitely and lost his temper.  This made all of us  
very sad.  I was very angry and I scolded him.  He asked me not  
to interfere with what was his buisness.

Three weeks ago a friend of mine bid me good-bye before going  
abroad.  I felt happy for her as she was achieving something by  
making the trip, but I also felt sad as I would not be seeing her  
for a long time.

I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident  
but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my  
brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it  
impossible that had driven the car.

I am a Christian but I cannot find any meaning in life . It  
seems that I am deceiving myself but I cannot find the way out.
Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.

My younger brother and I had been fighting over the TV/Video. He  
kept on turning it on and off every 2 seconds and was not  
listening to my authority and was being cheeky. We fought and I  
ended up in tears - he'd won.

My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in  
love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied  
that he loved that girl more than he loved me.
When someone took my pen away.

When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.   
Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.
My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many  
people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said  
and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear.  
He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted  
when he told that.

When I felt I had let my parents down, especially my mother, by  
having sexual intercourse for the first time, and a few times  
after that. Also, when I went on the Pill.
Seeing a pornographic film when looking for a place to live.

I had a cousin whom I loved so much. Unfortunately she passed  
away suddenly and one time I had a dream in which I was talking  
to her yet she is dead.
When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.
When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.

When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to  
others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few  
notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his  
grovelling and the manner in which he had treated others.

I preached to a F.3 students in a gospel camp.  They thus knew  
more about God and made up their minds to believe in Jesus.

This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which I  
kept in the cupboard.
I made a comment that at the moment didn't fit.

The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call  
from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of  
the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was  
an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I  
had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss  
that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss  
was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary  
was taken away from him.

When I was the target of a great many insults and completely  
unfair accusations of a large group of people.
Doing this pointless questionnaire.

I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I  
was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in  
the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.
I forgot something I agreed upon with a good friend.

The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what my  
parents would further do to distroy my relationship.

When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not  
democratic.

When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and every  
one read it and started teasing me about it.

When I forgot to cook something that my mother had told me to,  
and at supper time the food that I was supposed to have prepared  
was not there.
Saw my unfair report.
[ In an aeroplane.]

Being caught by parents in a compromising situation with  
girlfriend.
When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.

Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and  
later was telling me that he couldn't give it back to me because I was  
rude at a certain time.

I peeped into Maurine's bedroom and saw two people - Maurine anbd  
my step-dad.  I thought, " Why did she break her promises ? Why  
had she invited me ? Why do old men go for young girls ? "

This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was  
brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.

When my brother-in-law's brother stole my clothes when my  
brother-in-law and I had gone to cut wood for the fire.

Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told  
the group around us of advances I had made.
A pig in the well from which we drink.

My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of  
whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did  
something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.

When I insulted my young sister for a very little misconduct of  
putting on my shoes. She wrote me an apology letter and the  
message she included made me feel guilty.
Passing by a good friend's home without coming in to visit him.

A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known  
that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
When I first suffered from syphilis.
When I had been angry at my friend without any reason.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
On rising. No apparent reason.
Death of brother.

When someone made me a compliment after an examination just at  
the moment I needed it. It was amicable, hearty and sincere.

At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two  
people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and  
discriminating.
When I failed the grade seven exams.
Before an important examn.

My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after  
having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway  
station to meet him.

For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and  
who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

My teacher said that being university studets we did not have  
any self-initiative or self-control.
Seeing a pornographic movie in which animals were used.

In the last day of carnaval I met a boy and began to flirt with  
him. I was in love with him. When he introduced me to his friends  
I died of shame because I was with them before, I met my  
boyfriend in carnaval.

I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have  
to tell them I have failed an exam.
Was caught stealing apples in a neighbor's garden.

On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me  
and I did not know who they were.

When I had to go to the gynecologist and to sit on that special  
chair, I felt ashamed.
A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.
The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.
When I failed one of the first year's courses.

One saturday night I did some meaningless work and went to bed  
very late.  Next morning I had was very sleepy so I continued  
sleeping even though I had work to do and I missed the Sunday  
service.

When I realised that I had rejected a boy, who was fallen in love  
with me, rather bluntly four times.
Talking to someone I disliked.

Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not  
understand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.
When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
I felt disgust of my father when I knew he had a lover.
When I found out that I can travel with my best friend.

I felt ashamed of feeling sorry about myself when I passed  
through the situation of being betrayed by my girlfriend.

Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a few  
days. There was nothing I liked in that period.

I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had  
enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.

My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quite  
young and pretty naive and he was pretty crude and real, sort of,  
macho. It was dark, at night during the summer and we were  
talking.

When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited  
economically.

When my boss enrolled in a course to satisfy his own ends - to  
trample on his associates.  I have the misfortune to have one of  
my superiors in my course.

Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while  
I thought she was in love with me.
I realized the girl liked to be with me.
My grandmother died.

Waking up from a bad dream in a dark night with noone else  
around.

I cried for 3 hours because I felt very miserable. Then I called  
my boyfriend and he said lovely things to me. After this feeling  
disappeared I felt ashamed.

When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked  
quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

I was looking at a one-man show on television. He told very  
disgusting things so that I started to be disgusted with it.  
(Later on it proved that this was his intention).

I was so excited once that I told my classmate that she was old,  
this hurt her and I felt guilty.
My class winning against another class in a football match.
At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

After I said something that my boyfriend disagreed with, he  
walked away from me without discussing what bothered him. I  
became very angry with him for treating me this way. Yesterday,  
November 14.

I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.  At night my  
class mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was  
"life is merriment".  I felt depressed about the way they sought  
happiness.

My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and  
watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to  
turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and  
started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid  
that he would do us a harm.
Someone spread rumours about me.

A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did not  
even think about me when she did not need me.

I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that  
I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health  
Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.

Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we  
started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of  
interest in knowing personal details and then they started  
talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little  
interest in those activities so I talked to another student  
sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me  
questions on those activities.

When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to.   
He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible  
complex about it.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.

The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia on  
holiday.
Telling my parents that I did not get into a good university.

I was admited to the Chinese university of Hong Kong.  The day  
the results were announced I looked in the newspaper and saw my  
candidature number.

I was out with a friend in a place where it was very, very busy.  
When we wanted to go I bumped a person, who dropped his glass  
beer I offered a new one but he didn't accept it.
Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).

When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without  
any result.

When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make the  
coffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and I  
thus arrived half an hour late to the class.  On top of this the  
coffee was undrinkable.

While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the  
lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.
When I failed an exam.

I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.  One  
of them studies in a private school and the other one is  
repeating his form five.  They do not know what they are doing.   
They follow every word of their teachers, books and systems.   
They always try to rationalize their bad acts by some game and  
they are satisfied with their awkward life.  I have tried to  
persuade them very often but have failed.  This time I had a  
fight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish the  
floor).

When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be  
forced to marry her or go to court.

I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I  
would not report for work as I was not feeling well and that the    
doctor had refused to give me sick leave.  My intention was  
actually to go out of Lusaka for a week-end.  I left the same day  
and the following morning my boss found me in Mongu.  I felt  
guilty when asked to explain things on my return.

At the death of my friend's father and especially as this  
happened ten days before her wedding.
Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.

So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved  
into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially  
my family - forever.

When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had  
undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death.  
When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after  
may weeks.

I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had  
problems of how to move to this place.

Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking,  
picking up shells, laughing, chasing seagulls.

When my roommate came home at 10 in the morning after sleeping  
with a guy she did not know because she got drunk. (Se has a  
boyfriend too).
When I saw a spider.
At set-backs.
I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.

There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw  
paw-paw in the face.
When I received my promotion letter.

China can not even give you good sound systems for an open  
lecture.

When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I  
fear that something will happen to the baby.

When I did poorly on a test and I knew that there wasn't an  
excuse for not doing better. Made mistakes I could not believe I  
made.
To buy a car and didn't like the business and the car.

Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am  
to free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays the  
night.

During a class I was asked a question which I did not hear very  
clearly, so I gave an answer which was not related to the  
question and everyone started laughing at me.

When a friend, after being free of drugs for half a year, started  
using them again.
When I got a message that my child was not feeling well.

When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather  
in the open sea.

When one of my relatives went out at night leaving me and my  
friend alone, I cheated my parents that she didn't go out, after  
they had heard that she was out, I was afraid that she might have  
beaten me.

I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I  
got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present  
one with whom things are not much of a success.

When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It  
wasn't very much, but I can remember when she found it gone I  
felt very guilty.

I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love  
in an abominable way.
When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.

I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a  
lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the  
place.

When one teacher unjustly gave me zero in a test saying that I  
was cribbing.
When I had my children.
Can't remember having had this feeling.

During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an  
ear-ring.

My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and received  
the presents.

On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden, I drunk with a man  
in the train.  I had drunk so much that when I got home I fell  
asleep in the entrance hall.  I have never drunk that much,  
neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my  
mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father  
had to carry me to bed.

Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend  
came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she  
thought I was still interested in the boy.
A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.

When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I  
had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently  
qualified.

The greatest guilt I felt and I didn't know if it was really  
justified is that when I was a child I had a brother very close  
to me. He  became ill, and asked me to see  him in the hospital.  
I didn't go, when his situation became worse in the U.I.T. (Unity  
of intensive therapy) I went and he died.

In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got  
me a three day furlough.

When my mother met with a serious accident and there was danger  
that she would not survive and if she did she would loose  
her memory.
Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumn  
night. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved in  
another man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, it  
is painful for me to remember about it.

My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heard  
this my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own good  
friend could do such a thing, so I got angry.

With the job appointments committee when the headmaster in charge  
explained that a male teacher was more suitable for the  
particular post.  I had more years of service than the male  
teacher, but this was not taken into consideration.  I could have  
been given a less attractive job if things had gone the way the  
headmaster wanted.

I borrowed $ 20.00 from a friend and paid him back much later  
than I had originally intended.

I was disgusted with my girlfriend's behaviour. She was going out  
with other boys who were also my friends.

My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two  
days after.

The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis  
to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL  
(A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off  
Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and         
splinters of bone every where.

A film were a woman was attacked and raped.  One did not see the  
worst but it had the desired effect - very strong.

I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and so  
I did not want any help.  However, I blocked it and I had to get  
the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having  
followed the instructions
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

When I deeply felt that I could lose the person I love best  
because of my foolishness.
I got a present from a great friend (a dog).

I was cold to my sister without meaning it, just because I was  
upset and frustated.

I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither  
his fault nor mine.
Finding out about Chinese money cannot buy foreign journals.

One day a fierce looking man came to our house  and said that my  
father should apologize to him, however I was alone at home.

When students in our working group showed no responsibility or  
interest in our work.
Saw some young people fighting for seats on a bus.
While paddling in the river during a storm.  I feared drowning.

When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated  
from them for about three months.

When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit  
suicide.

No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I  
caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow  
beside me.

When I saw a man who hadn't the lower .... in a car  
exhibition. He was passing a handkerchief from inside to outside  
of his mouth.
When someone in my family died.

When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a major  
operation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not a  
relative she had no relatives in N.Z.

I got pass marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most  
people performed well.
When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.
I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.
When armed robbers broke into our house at night.
My teacher's death.

When I had to talk to some strangers, from whom I was expecting a  
negative answer.

When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to  
stay up all night for the fair in my town.

When I was travelling home by bus and suddenly the bus hit and  
the bus leaned against a wall.
When I was dismissed from a job after having been accused of theft.
The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.

I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits  
and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this  
conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I  
had anticipated.

I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shouting  
protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas  
submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother  
screaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at another  
person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.
I had a picnic with old classmates, we chatted and played games.

Since I've been here I haven't written to any of my relatives. I got  
a letter from my mom telling me how upset my grandparents are  
from not hearing from me.

The sports fishermen who catch gulls instead of fish with their hooks.  
  It is often a mistake but it makes me angry.

When my brothers had passed all of their exams and were able to   
graduate from their courses.

I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate  
and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited  
sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear  
through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings  
despite my own being hurt in the process.

No ideal result in the University entrance examn, guilty to  
family and friend.

When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of  
separation.
When I hurt a person's feelings.

When given responsibility to grade papers in elementary school, I  
cheated a little and graded my own higher.

I felt a great joy when I knew that my father was going to sell  
the apartment from GUARUSA, because in some way we were helded by  
it, that means that we didn't go to any other place, because we  
had the apartment.

After my little sister's Graduation from High School my  
grandmother became very sick. She passed away a few months later.
Finding my glasses again after having lost them in town.
Failed to do what I had promised.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a  
form.

I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.   
I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

When I saw the film "Memorie of Prison" I saw a scene of  
masturbation of a man in the hold of a ship apart form fact that  
the film wasn't pleasant I had a leg of coconut candies in my  
hands.

The computer at school had left out my name along with four  
others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find  
my name on the medical schhol list.

I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitress  
and I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.

Some times I was ashamed of presenting seminaries or even to  
speak in class.

On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa.  A policeman       
attacked a group of black people with a whip.

When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank  
and danced.

When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequently  
went to his family. We had a very nice evening.

I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies.  
This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure  
are always very depressing.

Receiving understanding from within self of a subject I had  
previously wished to understand better.
When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.

I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by  
three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.

I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told me  
that a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because of  
an infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.

A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really  
evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left, I was anxious and  
angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.

Foreign students playing loud music in the night before the  
biology examn.

Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a  
friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's  
six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really  
silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh!  
You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But  
she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd  
accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better -  
it was partly having my friend there.

When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made  
me wonder if he was a really a good friend.

When I met again a great friend and talked a little while with  
him. When I see again another I miss.

When the class leader read out the names of those chosen for the  
English lecture and I was not on the list.

When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and  
when I finished I knew I had passed it.

When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary  
school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.   
The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel  
us.

When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self -  
to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future  
daughter-in-law.

I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sunday  
morning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed in  
and finching me still in bed he began quarrelling about  
something. I could not understand. I heard his last words: "Don't  
stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed" I got up  
terrified and a thrashing followed.
A theft committed by me.

I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular  
job was not done, it was not my job to do it.

My nephew is a deaf and also "hyperactive" boy. I had been  
responsible for looking after him for a full day, and was very  
tired. Then he suddenly grabbed a knife and stabbed me in the  
leg. I got so angry that I didn't feel any pain.
NO RESPONSE

We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used  
hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends  
also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to  
stop using it.

When we were in high school a few guys sometimes provoked a  
friend of mine.  They called her a pig and then grunted.  This  
irritated most of the girls.  Once, one of the girls got angry at  
my friend and said something nasty and this made me terribly  
angry.
Some students deliberately disobey me as a class leader.

Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to  
interrupt my studies.
Always when I am well succeded.

When I tell someone no. In other words when I refuse to do  
something although I could have helped him.
[ When some difference of opinion occurs in a silly situation.]

When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till     
the tour began.

The day that the results of the college entrance examinations for  
the S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my name  
on the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and   
the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, and  
not only sadness.
Being mistreated by other people.

Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Union  
announced that the All Blacks' would accept the invitation of  
South Africa to play rugby in that country.

When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their  
behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like  
the windows, glasses etc.
Left alone in the dark in a big building.

In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I  
played very badly.

When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going  
to separate.
I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.
When a friend left me and went back home for good.

When I lied at home.   I told them that I was going to a  
Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.

I broke a cup and put it back without telling anyone about it and  
someone almost got blamed for it, then it was discovered that it  
was me who had broken it.
I felt very sad when I heard that a friend had committed suicide.
I confused a girl with another.

I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking,  
along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband  
was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.

A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the  
morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the  
evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.

I tried to swindle a jeweller because my watch was broken and I  
wanted to have it repaired it was a pity but they detected it.

It was about a fortnight ago, I was declared successful in the  
U.G.C exam this year (only four in Bombay succeeded).  My joy  
knew no bounds.

When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever  
cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to  
learn that it was me who was delaying things.

A workmate and I had been antagonistic with each other for some  
weeks - he had reacted violently to my criticisms of his work  
standards.
When my grandmother passed away.
Cannot recall the emotion with any force.

I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my  
siblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the  
party I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. A  
guy called and said, in effect, that I was "nice" and he liked  
me. Hence the emotional joy.
Found out my wife is pregnant.

I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my  
extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to  
leave their home.
When I left a man in whom I really believed.

Criticizing my mother when she refused to drive with the radio on.  
I told her that I thought she wasn't intelligent enough to cope  
with the radio.

I made a comment and it was interpreted completely differently  
from what I had meant.  When I said it I realized how my mother  
had understood it.

During a football game, another player who was perspiring very  
strongly ran into me.

Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death,  
etc.

My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied  
up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had  
done nothing.

One of the greatest sadness was when my grandfather died, because  
I loved him very much.

When my last year's second semester results came through - I was  
ecstatic.

A situation where we were the center of attention, and things  
happened without my control on them, that showed our disagreement,  
and ignorance.

My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn  
up.

Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we would  
meet.

I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a  
flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was  
for her to do it.
I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
When my grandfather died.

On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a  
bird.(swans of the bay)

During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in  
speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.
Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.

My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had  
snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.

When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and   
cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have   
said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad   
impression of me.

Salo, a movie film by Pasolini. People were misused and tortured  
for the fun of a few elder Italian authorities, during World War  
II.

I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that  
country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.
When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.

I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the  
bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to  
do.

At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and  
mostly at a philistinism.

A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in  
order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a  
scholarship for an excellent grade.

With my mouth full of bun, I drank directly from a packet of milk  
which turned out to be weeks old (completely separated).  It took  
a while for the milk to seep through the bun.

The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house I  
was absolutely inebriated and was sick into a bucket.
Not accepting hints of intimate relation from a girl.

English papers are due on Friday. They are returned on Tuesday.  
This Tuesday I was afraid to go to class and get my paper because  
I knew it was bad.

When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man     
sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously.  I did not know   
what was wrong.  When I reached the  centre I started strolling around   
as I still had a little time.  Suddenly a man came and whispered "You   
have forgotten to zip up your trousers."  I was at a loss to say anything   
and I felt very embarrassed.  When I thought of the bus incident I felt   
even more ashamed.

When there was a bomb threat in Tolman Hall. This was the first  
time that I felt my life could be in danger.
Soiled my short trousers with faeces.

My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a  
coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.
[ Uncertainty about my own abilities in an exam.]

When I first failed my standard 8 exams for the first attempt for  
Form I selection.
Success in university entrance examination.
When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.

I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a  
curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations  
in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car  
because of the missing spare parts.

A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had  
made.  But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.

I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a  
lot for it.

I was an instructior in a youth organization.  Whenever we, the  
instructors would have a meeting the advisor would be present.   
He did not understand our worknig conditions but talked a lot  
and had a lot of outdated ideas.  Whenever we disagreed with him  
he was very discontent and said that we had a prejudice against  
him.  Why did he have to treat us as his subordinates ?

In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of  
view is completely disregarded.

When my sister took my things without having asked for my permission  
first.

When I was betrayed by a friend, and decided to stay apart form  
her.

I had shouted at my younger brother and he was always afraid when  
I called out loudly.

I had not done my assignment seriously.  I only pretended to  
finish the work as the work did not have any meaning for me.  The  
whole thing made me feel guilty.
When I failed my S.S.C exam.

Two days after the above incident, I was thinking about my  
morally shameful act and I felt sorry for that incident, but it  
was too late, however I did realize this.

I was reading in the paper the feature on Henry Lucas who claims  
to have killed 380 people. He was a recreational killer and a  
necrophiliac and zoophiliac. He has raped and beaten many women  
and killed men too.
The disqualification of two of my mates in the military service.

When the result of the certificate exam was announced.  I was  
surprised and happy as the result was better than I had  
expected.
Father lost his temper at home because he was mistreated at work.
I was accepted by the Chinese university.

Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the  
airport, then board the plane alone.

I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She  
was the last of my grand parents to pass away.
Seeing someone who has bleeding nose.
I could have been killed by a falling object.

A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back  
home.
Lying to my cousin about the form five examination fees.
I allowed my then boyfriend to touch me, if only briefly.
Meeting a loved man.

When my father's car got stolen from me. (A 1966 Ford Mustang -  
very hard to replace).
Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

It was last week on Sunday that I was walking with my girlfriend  
along Kawale road going to town so I tried to stop a car for a  
lift and the driver didn't stop and I felt shame because people  
were looking at us.

There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I  
always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my  
mother. So my mother always scolded her.

As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - being  
set upon by another boy who claimed it was "his land" - being  
intimidated by the boy - crying, being punched, etc.

One day my colleague misbehaved with me.  I felt disgusted and  
thought to myself that he could only do this because I was a  
woman.
When I was selected to study here at UNZA.

In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at  
me.
Before the examn.
When I failed two subjects last year.

I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.  The more I  
wanted to avoid it the more I blushed.

After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was  
scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want  
a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way  
through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and  
continue my studies.

After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend,  
who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.

I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was  
impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense  
of guilt.
When I had to plunge in a swamp of fetid and stagnant water.

At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (she  
asked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharp  
remark.

I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young  
man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement.  
This "sight" I watched from the bus.

Staying alone in the room after midnight and reading horror  
stories.

I "cooked" the engine in my father's car - it was actually his  
fault because he hadn't fixed the temperature gauge or told me.  
When I finally got home I was absolutely screamed at and the  
anger I experienced was over the injustice of it all plus the  
huge row which developed.

When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting  
and understood how little one's work was appreciated.

My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank  
an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did  
not understand that he had done anything wrong.
My grandmother died.

When I realized that my bathing suit was spotted, I had became  
menstruated.
Before an examination.

When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I  
thought that I would be found out.

When I got the midterm exam results, the results were below  
average and were near the lowest.  I was scared of the final  
exam.

I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjects  
and I found that I had failed it.

When I saw a program on Ethiopia on T.V, a fews hours earlier I  
had thrown away some clothes and food.

Some students have been calling lecturers nicknames and I was not  
able to find out who they were to stop them.
I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.
Not finishing my duty as a class leader.

While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a man  
who was under the influence of alcohol.  They terrified him with  
the thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrian  
street.  My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facial  
expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying  
themselves.
I fell off a bike in the presence of a lot of people.

One day I took my playmates to the river to swim and play. One  
of them was epileptic so he drowned into the water. I felt guilty  
because it was me who took them there.

When I found a maggot in my food at the dinning hall, all the  
food had gone bad.

Towards wife's laziness in not performing her usual duties  
because of television watching.
At work being shifted to another area.

When my ex-boyfriend didn't want to sleep with me anymore and I  
insisted. We made love but he felt very badly and I felt guilty.

I did badly in one of the vital exams, despite getting proper  
guidance from my parents.  I felt guilty of improper use of the  
chances provided to me.

I was in the dark room, it's insecure and has holes covered with  
wooden sheets in the roof the establishment had already been  
assaulted and could be assaulted again.

When I accused unjustly a person of robbery, who proved me the  
contrary, almost caused a public fight.
A father of 4 children killed in an accident.

My classmate always borrowed my notes and would not return it to  
me on time.  When I had a test she was selfish and irresponsible  
and so delayed my studies.
[ While approaching to test the situation.]
Said something I should not have said in public.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to  
come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
Failed to be elected to be a class leader.

I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing in  
particular.  I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all the  
others were sleeping.

One day I was busy day dreaming along the road and suddenly I  
heard the sound of jamming car braked behind me. I woke up from  
my dreams and it was about to crash me.

When I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and  
their government was spending millions on celebrating being in  
power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing  
food, etc.
Had an argument with my classmate for borrowed books.

Sitting in the dorm when the guys were verbally reading letters  
in Penthouse.

When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until  
midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports  
at the police station.
General Ye Jianying died.

I feel disgust at my neighbour, because she comes to our house with  
her child, who spoils our furniture.
When I shouted at my mother when she was nervous and depressed.

I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned military  
base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want  
to be caught.

When I got into an argument with someone and was very abusive,  
but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.

When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel  
but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.

3 years ago I served in the army. Once a collegue denounced me  
because of a delict, which is usually committed. I was arrested  
for 3 days. I still detest this man.

When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that I  
had been accepted at university.

My sister forgot to bring presents for my birthday, I was rude to  
her.
Being chosen to do your experiment with aphasia.

I was in a camp and went out for a walk at night on my own.  I lost   
my way and spent several hours looking for the camp.
When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.

While swimming, I hit my head at the bottom of the pool and  
required stitches. I later learned that the consequences could  
have been much more severe and that terrified me.

I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working  
for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad  
thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.
Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.
Going to take my driving test.

I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home I  
was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and  
I was rejoycing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.

I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed  
about it, I felt joy.

My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second  
month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt  
very sorry for her.

We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see all  
my writing materials plus the identification card from the place  
where I left them.

It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something, 
but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt  
ashamed and blushed.

When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not  
act very responsibly and one of them was injured.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a  
University course.
The birth of my child.

While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind  
me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation  
was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried  
to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and  
felt like crying.

(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year  
after my father died and this angered me more as I thought he  
should be dead and not my father.

When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the same  
ideals and goals in life, and that we could share all our  
feelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad when  
you have someone really close to share your life with.
When I got the first compound through column.
Afraid of a dead body.

When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the  
thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had  
thought.

One night a friend found out that I dumped one girl for another  
and he proceded to lecture me.

I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip  
together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was  
afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as  
a failure.
When a friend died.

I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition.  
 In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored   
the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell  
down.

When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually  
and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up  
to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was  
forced to hide this for a while.

When I saw a film where a black was rapeing a girl while another one was  
filming it for a pornographic movie.
I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.

While I was away for the weekend some friends went into my room  
and played my very expensive stereo without asking me or my  
roommate.

Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an  
expected miscarriage.
When I got a letter from home.

My elder sister forced me to do a few things which I did not like  
to do.

When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been  
successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant  
training course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself by  
dancing to music from the Radio cassette.

My mother and my sister carried on picking at me all day long for  
no reason at all and I ended up getting angry.

Almost crashing into the back of a car while driving along the  
motorway on my motorcycle.

When my sister's first child came home, after one week in  
intensive care at the hospital.

I made friends with a classmate whose behaviour I did not like -  
he tried to flatter other people and did not respect me.

When India won the Prudential cup by beating West-Indies in the  
final match and became the world cricket champion.  West-Indies  
was the strongest of the eight countries which participated in  
the competition.

I felt fear when once I was asleep and dreamed that I was dying  
asfixiated by a cardiac attack, I was afraid and woke up  
desperate. Altough I wasn't afraid of death I was afraid.

One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard  
the roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.

The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in  
English.

The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the  
classroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.
I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.

I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that  
he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should  
watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through  
the room.

I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of  
leaving the house and getting to know new people.

When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had  
actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting  
me.
When my grandmother, my second mother died.
When I met my mother after not having seen her for three years.
I was nearly knocked down while I was cycling.

When I pass exams, or when a close friend of mine recovered  
from an illness,etc.

[ I would classify subjectively, a certain gesture or the way of  
talking of a person as disgusting or inacceptable.]

I went to the apartment of my boyfriend and saw some people  
before his door. I thought that something had happened.

I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my  
boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member  
of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but  
his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said "I am not a  
radiator".

When I entered the dissection room for the first time and was  
exposed to preserved dead human bodies.

Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband.  
Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.

I was walking on a street alone in the afternoon when there were  
not too many people on the street.  A couple of guys were  
following me and I was ignoring them.  Suddenly one of them came  
in front of me and started using dirty language and harrassing  
me.  I got very angry and wanted to strike back at them.
A friend started to shout at me. He called me an old frump.

When I was ill and had to stay at the hospital for a period of  
time.

I was teaching someone to drive and when we were about to crash I  
was scared.

The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of  
us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had  
no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got  
engaged.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.

I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it  
happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think  
I can call it so.

One day I was the leader of the weekly meeting of the Church  
fellowship.  That day I had been preparing for the exams and did  
not estimate the time to travel to the church right and I was  
twenty minutes late.  As I had not prepared well I led the  
meeting badly.  I was ashamed of myself.

At a party, I started talking to a guy I had seen in one of my  
classes. My boyfriend felt awkward and left to talk to a friend  
but kept on looking at me as I talked.

I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed, because  
somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument, it was  
impossible for me to help him.

I wanted something in particular and did not get it, also there  
was no possibility of getting it.

Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I  
shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he told  
me that she was not his girlfriend.  I, to say something,  
commented that she must be a viscious woman.  He then told me  
that she was his girl.

Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too much  
people in it. This gives me a fearful experience.
With self at losing an important game that I should have won.

I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me  
to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come  
home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at  
home. As something like that had happened to me several times  
before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody  
and I felt very sad.

When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the  
world, and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worst  
and most hateful day of my life.

My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she is  
right.

Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We  
told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny  
noises. I was terribly frightened.

When I fell in love with "X".  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,     
responsible and worthwhile.
When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

Finding out that we cannot have good references because China is  
poor.

4 years ago my family decided to move from New York to  
California. From the time we decided to move until the time we  
left, I realized how much my friends cared for me. When we left  
and for a long time after that I was very sad.

When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers and  
sisters badly.

When I found out that I could not go to the concert (after buying  
the tickets) because of a biology test which occurred the morning  
after.

When my middle child became very difficult to handle after the  
birth of his baby brother and I did not have any patience with  
him.
When I was scolded by my dad for bad behaviour.
Someone I do not like kept talking to me.

My mother misunderstood me and prevented me from doing something.  
 In return I did not talk to her for a few days, only later on I  
realized that what she had done had been for my good.

While watching a religious film, I got very excited and made a  
number of comments which were reproached to me by an elderly  
person who respected me.

When my dad told me about something he had done against my  
mother.

The day my fiancee told me that it was bad that I could not write  
my mother tongue.

That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian  
Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.
Saw a scene in a movie implying incest as humorous.
I had promised to call a girl but I did not do it.
A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).
When my husband quarrelled with me for no reason at all.

Against the will and without the approval of my parents I went  
for a few days to my boyfriend in Germany.

I was complaining about calling people whom I didn't know. I  
forgot that the purpose is to invite people for dinner and get to  
know them.
When I passed an important exam.

At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me  
and nobody mentioned anything about that.
Not being able to hand in homework in time.

My current work load is too much.  The feeling comes back from  
time to time.

Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have  
enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there  
and I felt quite awkward.

My brother and I were driving to Brisbane when he drove back onto  
the road, perhaps cutting off another car but not noticeable -  
this driver did his best to drive us off the road for about 1/2  
an hour.

When I heard that a 14 years old girl had been raped by four  
rikshaw drivers in our town.

I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine  
when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.

I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me off  
I was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded him  
with no excuse to do so.

I had been on friendship with a certain girl for sometime and the  
love was going on well, but it happened that I made the  
friendship come to an end suddenly without good reasons.

For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our  
clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go  
into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and  
staring at us.

A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to  
the university.

One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I  
was sure that I had done no such thing.
Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

My first feeling of falling in love.  Coming across a person who  
made me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautiful  
future, who made me dream.
Saw the village I come from still pay money to buy wife.

Heard someone boasting his fortune telling and I knew he was  
lying.
First public speaking.
When I had to eat scraps from a dust-bin, because of a bet.
Not doing well in the examn.
I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.

I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she  
had obtained a grant to work in the library.

We had arranged a beach party with 20 people. There my father got  
drunk I felt very ashamed.
When a skunk invaded camp.

Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but  
expected only a moderate mark.
When I nearly collided with another car.

When I blurted out an answer in class without having been asked  
to do so.  The teacher told me that it was bad manners to do so.

When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snake    
on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.

My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to "be free".   
He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed.

When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at the  
university of Zambia.  This was after my form five at Chikola  
secondary school.

A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected  
his call impatiently but in vain.

After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of  
difficult personal circumstances.

When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she  
would ask me irrelevant quetions about my past.
Stealing from my mother's purse when I was a little boy.
The death of a close friend.

I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in  
somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court.  
I went to see what would happen to him.

When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people  
killing each other.

When on Christmas day my grandmother died. I received the  
news when I was coming back from a party on the 24th at 5 am.

When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that  
I judged very difficult.

A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did  
not bother to acknowledge my efforts, and treated me badly  
thereafter.
China not winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympics.

I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted  
as a student in medicine.

When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste  
my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological  
investigation and then I got really angry.

Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me and  
cared for me.

I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was  
not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve  
the pains of a patient.

After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to  
buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my  
mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I  
did not known about it and so was all the more glad.
The joy came when I first proposed a girl at Secondary School.

When I was in Bombay one of my good friends was getting married  
and he had not informed me about it, this made me sad.

When I became angry at my boyfriend without any reason. I know he  
cannot bear me being angry at him and that he can't study anymore  
then.
When I saw a big spider from very close.

Climbing a mountain to see a view, towards the top we suddenly  
came across a ledge with a nearly sheer drop on either side,  
which I had to cross.

Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the  
worst.

After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always  
trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps  
coming nearer.

I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the  
co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have  
this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in  
doing his duty.

When, after having cleaned up the kitchen, two hours later I saw  
that there was a big mess. It irritated me very much.

I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying  
colours and that I had made it to the university.

It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during  
an examination of personality while I thought I performed very  
badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.

Making bloopers: e.g. telling something negative about a certain  
person, while that person is standing besides you and hears  
everything.
Made a wonderful driend who understands me.

I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud  
band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother,  
right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming -  
probably in pain.
Misunderstood by a close friend for the wrong reason.

After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of  
support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

Went to a lecture about Chinese history and hear about the Opium  
War.

I received a letter which was too strong for me. It said I had  
done something which I really didn't do.
My mother in law slept in my bed.

I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good  
food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm  
atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well.  
I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her  
giving her a neck massage.

Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain  
papers.
When some friends betrayed my friendship.

We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in the  
wrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drove  
down a precipice.
Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.

When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character  
comes towards me.

I was driving my parents' car into a carpark in front of a shop  
we own, and scraped the corner of the front panel on the back  
corner of my father's utility. I didn't tell anyone, I lied about  
the bump (later I had to confess).

In the University we were convoked to a stroll like a freshman I  
was still innocent about the manipulation. On seeing the goal of  
the exaltation to poor character people, I felt anger on feeling  
myself mass of maneuver.

I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a  
social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear  
was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.

Brother provoked anger. It was when mother and father were away  
and we had to look after ourselves. He accused me of being  
selfish and a snob.

When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my  
father had brought another woman home while she was away.
When I did not go to work because I had to study for a midterm.

I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.  I was  
rather afraid because I was alone.
On seeing a scene of an accident in a magazine.
Could not buy a reference book because I got up too late to cue.
[ The same as in anger.]

When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the  
wardrobe.  My brother had done it.

When I was emotionally unstable I said things which may have hurt  
others or made them feel unhappy.  When I calmed down I realized  
that I had been selfish and had not taken into consideration the  
feelings of others.  Then I felt ashamed as someone pointed out my  
behaviour to me.

I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to  
write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my  
friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was  
looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.
When the summer holiday job was almost over.
I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.
Talking to a close friend.

When once again I drank too much and felt very rotten the morning  
after.

When I was 10/11 years old my father travelled very much for his  
work (he passed three months away from home).

When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her  
feel hurt.
I met a friend I had not seen for a long time on the street.

When I received my results and found out that I could not go to a  
school of my choice.

I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good  
and had a bad smell.

Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.  It was in a  
friend's country house and there was nobody there to help me.

My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when I  
started to tease  him and in this joke I hurt him without  
knowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave it  
back to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing that  
it was my fault.

When I was about to write my Junior Certificate Exams, I received  
sad news telling me that my elder sister had passed away.
Talking with someone I admire a lot.

I felt the emotion when I entered a certain ward in the hospital  
to visit my relative who was sick.

Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5  
years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the  
"paper work" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming  
through the customs gate.
When I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.

It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl  
but I considered it only as an "affair". Only much later I realized  
how painful this must have been for the girl.

When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it  
pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.

Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely at  
University.  I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against my  
parents' expectations.
A reoccurring fear that something will happen to my relatives.
When, as a child, I was nearly knocked down by a car.

Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically  
beaten - acting as informal bouncer in a gay bar.

I remember when I was a child of a storm that made me terribly  
afraid. I thought that the house was coming down and that in the  
next day I would be dead. Everybody was awake and I stayed all  
night in bed without falling asleep.
When my father thought that I was an unrelaible son.

One day, I was alone on duty when a patient choked while eating.   
I ran to her and tried to make her breath, but it was too late.

I went to study in a public library but I didn't know it well. I  
got a book and wanted to study hearing music. Then I went to a  
place were I could do it, but when I passed by a door a bell rang  
and a man came saying that I couldn't leave with the book.

When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after        
a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen in order to  
use them for fighting purposes.

Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing to  
cooperate after discussions to try and resolve an attitude  
problem.

In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating  
up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible  
for his guardian's failure.
Scoring a goal in football match.
Yesterday my friend gave me a gift and had dinner with me.
When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.
When I moved away from home.

I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling for  
my boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years being  
together, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrow  
that I can call sadness.

I was ashamed at myself for having shouted at my daughter because  
of my marital break-up and the unfair way I was treated.

On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a  
friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.

The way my husband and his family treated me - unfairly, cruelly,  
and unjustly.
When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.
When I got in jungle where there was a great number of snakes.

I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving  
me any thing - money to come back to school.

When my husband discovered I was having an affair with another  
man.

I felt angry when I was told that I had not been selected to go  
to the University.

Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could  
not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big  
surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our  
relationship grew closer.
Someone not responding to my criticism.

This person I know lied about how much income his parents made  
and received money through grants which he did not need. Another  
person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive  
enough money.

When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and  
ordered me to give them money or face death.

When a so-called friend let me down, when she promised to tell me  
when a certain concert was occurring, and that she'd get me  
tickets. I was really looking forward to it. She did nothing,  
just told me out of the blue one day what a fantastic concert it  
was going to be.

I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was  
unable to go because of registration.

It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for  
two years for a reason I don't know up to now.

When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed at  
having to see my parents later.
When someone stole my bike.
When I won the best prize in the National science fair.

This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees  
with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I  
always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so  
much over unimportant trivial matters.

At an office an application that I had made was turned down  
because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.

Not keeping a promise of delivering materials of great importance  
to the receiver.
Saw my brother-in-law insulting my sister.

When a pet died. The pet was the closest friend I had for 15  
years.
A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
About Sweden's arms exports.

When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been  
told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he  
avoids any confrontation, and is vague.

I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was  
finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I  
accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're  
paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said  
to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut  
me off financially and emotionally.

When my boyfriend said he did not want to see me anymore (which  
turned out to be untrue).

I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with  
whom I had previously discussed the assignment.

I was afraid when my boyfriend came home because my parents  
disapproved him of his coming home. I thought they would chase me  
out of the house.

This was when my boyfriend told me that I was double-crossing him  
with a certain boy.
When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.

I was told by a good friend that we couldn't be friends any more  
because of his relationship with another girl.

One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some  
roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like  
that.

I have a fobic anxiety for elevators. This anxiety is worst at  
the moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in the  
elevator at our university.

I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I  
almost didn't enter University.

The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness  
was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also  
experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).
When I was given detention at secondary school.
When my parents complimented me very nicely on something.

There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at  
that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her  
from entering the room.

With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come  
with me to an occasion (she was from another town).
When, for example, someone is calumnating.

Having agreed to share the taxi expenses, three people in the  
back of the car just ran off, leaving the person up front with  
the entire bill.

I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave,  
threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away  
from home.

I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her,  
however she had not understood the situation the same way so she  
did not turn up.

When I walked to church with my roommate, a bum told us to call  
the police and he started following us.
I pointed a failure of a friend of mine.

I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little too  
much with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly and  
she started crying.

I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but I  
had an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said I  
was too young to join elderly people.
Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.

I felt guilty of revealing a secret to my in-law. I told her that  
my brother and I had gone to disconight which is a thing my  
brother didn't want to let her know. Later my brother was accused  
of spending a night out.

I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after  
it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt  
guilty.

I suffer from a disease of my muscles. Therefore, I am only able  
to attend lectures for half a day. So, sometimes I miss  
obligatory lectures. However, the teachers do not take into  
account my disease, and punish me with detention work, resulting in  
an overload.

When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in  
an unfamiliar environment.  It was getting dark and we did not  
know how to get back home.

During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School  
had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche  
Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I asked  
my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good  
reason. I felt very angry with her.
I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious of  
a composition written by a class-mate and me.

I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object of  
pleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in a  
classroom at P.V.C.

While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell  
although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.

The sadness came to me when I heard that my girlfriend whom I  
loved so much got married to another man before a rebuff from  
her.

One of my best friends was found lying flat on the road because  
he was drunk and was taken by the police and put in a cell. I  
went to see him the following morning, the place was really a  
mess and was smelling badly. I didn't like it.

Finding out the great difference between China and the West in  
science.
When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

When I acted in a negative way at a certain moment by laziness
