to concede a moment of the time I thought to be my own.

When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a  
margin of three marks.
When I failed the M.S.C exams.

I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next  
to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to  
join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started  
looking at me and I had to move to their table.

I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook  
(almanach).

After a meeting ended we started talking about when we would  
have the next discussion ( I had many tests the coming week and  
could not have a meeting in between, I thought that they would  
understand this as they had always done).  They did not  
understand my problem and thought that I should not have so many  
other activities.  Their reaction made me burst into tears.

One evening when my sisters, brothers and I were watching T.V my  
kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french  
windows.  I thought that these lights that we could see were  
coming from torches annd that it meant that there were thieves  
outside.

When my sister - after a history of one abortion and one  
stillbirth - gave birth to a perfectly healty boy.

When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I  
was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back  
together again, but had doubted the likelihood of this, so I was  
very happy when my small amount of faith was vindicated.
Bad food in the students' dining hall.

At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse, sing and do  
silly things.

I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some  
unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.

Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie  
but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e  
snakes on T.V.

When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister,  
close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my  
father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.
Not handing in homeworks in time.

When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the  
death of my father.
When I tried to steal a book from the bookshop and was caught.

When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for  
it.

This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my  
trousers without my consent.

Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She was  
very late and I thought something awful had happened.
I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.
Hear people talking at my back.

When I was in lower six I joined an interview group to  
interview the general public.  One of my friends in the group  
lost her purse and she was very nervous.  Five of us had to go  
another place so we left her, and planned to see her later.  Then  
I heard her describing how her purse looked.  I realized that I  
had seen her purse on the floor and had not wanted to do any  
thing about it.

When I won the "Under 18" Showjumping at the Brookfield Show. The  
competition was very stiff and there were many riders competing.

I met my ex boyfriend by chance.  We separated a few months ago  
and I am now with a new boyfriend.  My ex boyfriend looked  
depressed, and I know I am not to be blamed.

When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my  
wardrobe.
Someone I know and respect sexually assulted a girl.
When I realized that I loved someone of the opposite sex.

When thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and me  
on gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot of  
property.

My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to my  
place. She saw me and ran after me. I didn't know that she had  
come. I couldn't see her. She held my shoulders standing behind  
me.

When I was in a Christian institution, sometimes the nuns would  
send back the people who came to visit us when it was not the  
visiting hours.  This disgusted me.
Staying in a relative's house which was broken in before.

A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not  
responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for  
some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.

The night of a high school dance, I went partying and collided  
with another car. Both cars were totalled; people were injured  
but not seriously.

When I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in the  
forest.

When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut  
to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which  
impressed me most.

When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he  
had just repaired.

Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that  
there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who  
it was and why he was there.

I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be  
done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when  
I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my  
work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt  
ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also  
a friend of mine.
Often I forget to give my immediate family birthday presents.

Finding out from this lecture that China is backward in  
psychology.

A person misinterpreted what I had told her. I had told her that  
I had failed to insert a NasoGastric tube but she went and  
scolded the patient that she was being uncooperative.
Being insulted in public for the wrong reason.
Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.

Car accident. I let a 16-year old, incompetent parson take the  
wheel and I feel very guilty about what happened even though I  
suffered the worst injuries.
The time that I had to put my dog to sleep.
South Korea cheating for gold medals.

It was last week on Saturday night when I was at Mchesi. I feared  
to cross the Lilongwe River Bridge to come back to School due to  
darkness - until somebody had to escort me.

The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used  
to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that  
made me angry.

My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest  
cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too  
old for me.
Heard about someone telling lies about me to my best friend.

I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a  
foreign language.

When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and  
urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad  
would happen to me as he would play magic on me.
It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.
I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.

Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately  
happy until a year or so ago.

When I got  grade "C" in M160 at the end of my first year at  
UNZA.  I had expected a "C+" or a "B" as M160 is easy, going by my  
capacity in mathematics.

I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my  
brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my  
unwillingness to challenge him about these attitudes in order to  
keep the peace.

It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about  
the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat  
to them.
My roommate being unconsiderate.
When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.

When my mother went through an operation, it was not very serious  
but I was sad and could not sleep before the operation.

When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family  
members did not have any special feelings, they said that he was  
already 80 years old.

When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throw  
a chair on my brother.

When my son fell off the cot at the age of 5 months, I became  
very nervous and thought that it would cause defects in his head.

Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only  
spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband  
for 3 months.

Finding out about some girls who have been nice to the class  
leader in order to go to the neuropsychology lectures (English  
ones).

When the person I am going out with let me down in a situation  
that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.

The day my boyfriend saw and touched my breasts when I was  
without my shirt, only with my pants.

I am one of four directors of a company. We inherited land held  
by our family - ours is the 5th generation. A "democratic"  
decision was made to stap-bank an area of mangroves.
I felt fear when I was young and left in my big house all alone.
When I had to talk with an important person about a job.

One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I  
most wished, around me.

When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in  
a questionnaire instead.

When I beat up my brother so badly, for not having gone to school,  
that we had to take him to hospital.

Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to  
the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.
When my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.

During the Physics experiment session I did not understand the  
content of the experiment and did not know how to do it.

When I as a child of 9 or 10 I was playing doctor with the  
neighbours boys their mother caught us.

I once proposed my own niece whom I did not know but I discovered  
after she was my girlfriend.
When I passed my MSCE Exams and was selected to go to college.

I had gone to see one of our professors about a book, and I did not  
 attend the class she took a few minutes later.

I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen for  
many years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that I  
wouldn't know what to say.
A friend forgot his appointment with me.

When an intimate friend of mine passed B.A with first class and I  
got only pass class.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

I was very sad when I did not get admission in the English  
college, as I had 1% less marks than they wanted.
People talking in an important lecture.

When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes  
I even considered him unlikable.
The death of my twin sister - suicide.

When I arrived home late at night.  I know that my mother gets  
worried and this made me feel angry.

When I found out that I had failed to pass my exams during the  
term by one point.  The fact that exactly the same thing had  
happened last term did not help.

Once, before I had learnt to swim, I stepped on a slippery slope  
where there was a lot of moss and I slipped into the water.  The  
water was very deep and I could not stand on my feet.  I sank  
and had to use a lot of energy.

I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my  
coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign  
friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we  
roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I  
didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.

After much trouble getting together in the first place my  
boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.

When I do not succeed in making myself clear to other people.  
When they do not understand what I say.

I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I was  
with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who  
were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.

I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I  
kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I  
promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after  
a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a  
restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without  
finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up  
the idea.
A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.
My best friend was not chosen for the English lectures.

When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the  
rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher"  
and came from influential families.
Someone talking about me at my back.

When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and  
which I had listened before together with friends.
When I was caught stealing money from my father.

Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a  
lie.

The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and  
father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably  
move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be  
sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six  
years).

My close friend and I applied to TISS for admission last year,  
unfortunately he failed to get admission.  We had done our graduation  
together and are quite involved with each other, so we had wanted  
to do our Masters degree together.  However, it did not work out  
as we had expected it to and this saddened me.

I saw a neighbour, from the same appartment block as me, lying     
on the road.  He could have been injured or ill.  I kept 20  
metres away and did not go to help him.
My roommate boasting about her English lectures.
Cueing for bath for a long time.

I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that  
it was also my fault.
When I thought that I had failed the examination.

At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is  
not treated decently.

One camping night, I listened to the ghost stories told by my  
classmates.

I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could  
not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the  
University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it  
finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home  
she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her  
boyfriend.

For a few days I felt very miserable, distressed and listless,  
with crying fits. When this was over I felt very happy, although  
there was no special reason.

I went to see a movie and I went with a friend, it was really  
frightening and it made me stop and think about the world around  
me and what it is really like out there. I was frightened all  
that night.

When cleaning up a pile of junk under our house, a huge spider (a  
"Jungle Spider") ran out near me. (I do not like even small  
spiders).
My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems.

I once stole a shirt from the Department Store in which I work. I  
have been promoted to work in a very privileged section of the  
store. Their belief in my integrity makes me feel even guiltier.
I tried to date a girl, but she refused.

I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range,  
and was shot at.

I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having  
an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because  
my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.
My friend started to misunderstand and hurt me.

When my roommate and I had dinner together we decided as to who  
would clean the bowls.  One day when I came back from school I  
found that she had not cleaned up.  Since I had to cook dinner I  
cleaned them myself and felt unhappy and disgusted.

When I was cycling past a parked car someone opened the door and  
nearly pushed me off my bike and into the traffic.

Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many  
friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I  
could have embraced everybody.
When my son was born.
When coming up for trial because of shop lifting.
I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.

At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my  
elder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack of  
understanding.

While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the  
cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for  
breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.

When I finished a love affair where I was responsible of the sad  
end.

When my roommate's boyfriend assaulted me. He was threatening me,  
calling me names and pushing me around.

In August,1983, the long awaited "big envelope" (a document for  
C.U.H.K admission) arrived.  It was in the afternoon and I had  
not been doing anything.  When the postman, with his big bag,  
knocked on the door I knew what it was about.  I hurriedly  
opened the envelope and my mood at that time is hard to describe.  
 It lasted several hours and only calmed down later.
When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.
When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.

Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and  
felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed  
person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having  
given her this additonal problem.

When I didn't pass the examinations for FUVEST I felt myself  
guilty for I should have studied. I had the opportunities, and  
I drew them out.

I've always defended my sister when needed, at the expense of my  
brother. This has led to feelings of guilt towards him.
I stole carrots and got caught.  I had to apologize to the owner.
[ Whenever I do something prohibited or wrong I feel guilty.]

When I realized that it did not make much sense to start a  
relationship with a girl who was not very constructive to  
establish a firm relationship.

Arguing with my younger cousin.  She is rather a nuisance but I  
felt sorry.

On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the  
increasing threat of war with the USA.
When I was accused of something I had not done.

When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from  
what I was told about it.
Before the declaration of the S.S.C results.

A few days back a friend of mine had asked me to call on him on  
Sunday.  I had accepted it but later did not go for no specific    
reason.  I just slept in my room.  The next day this friend called   
me up and told me that he had been expecting me the day before and  
his wife had prepared a very good lunch for me, which had gone  
waste.  I felt very bad about this incident and it has been  
growing in my heart ever since.
When I was admitted to the Chinese universiity.

When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two  
children differently.

My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still  
haven't had time to see her.
Reading a nice book and talking about it to my friend.

Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad she  
was.

Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I  
had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I  
had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.

Carried out a vandalistic act on some windows at an old army  
location.

The same as for SHAME and DISGUST. I was asked to resign my  
sorority which I did because I was ashamed.

When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men  
and women.

[ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, in  
class, in the street, at home, at the table..........]

When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it  
meant.   When I got to know the meaning, I felt guilty as it was  
a clear and unfair insult.

At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It  
was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have  
such good friends.
After my boyfriend and I had separated.
Fear of sexual overtures from a close relative in the family.

My aunt phoned me to ask me why I had refused the her invitation  
to dinner at her home on the New Year's Eve.

At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the  
whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me  
through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the  
car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.
Succeeding in helping others.
After having failed my driving test.

I noticed that Meryl Streep and I had similar cheekbones and jaw  
structure.

When I fought with my sister and said that she had provoked this.  
She was very seriously scolded.
When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).

When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into  
another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the  
other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt  
guilty.

I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence    
70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.
I finished my homework

My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage  
me, therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this was  
not easy for me; I got gradually used to it.

When I had come home drunk the day after a party, I felt very  
ashamed in front of my parents.

Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there  
are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the  
thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.
I didn't attend lectures.

Going home alone through the forest after a girl guide (scout ?)  
meeting.

When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and  
she was fed up with my behaviour.

We were in the country and I walked away from the others one  
night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was  
not able to see what it was.

I encouraged my brother to play football and he was hurt while  
playing the game.

The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after  
several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each  
other.

Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having to  
clean up the dish later.
Anger towards my lover for being late.

It was the time when I was in no position to secure a Ist class  
in the M.Sc exam and this was likely to affect my career.

When my friend promised that she would come to my place, and did  
not turn up - I was annoyed at her.
Deception from a person I loved very much.

When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my  
girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.

My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His  
death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.

I never failed my examinations since Standard 1 but I experienced  
sad moments when I sat for Standard 8 Examination and I was not  
selected for Secondary School education in 1978.
When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and  
she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry.  
She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the  
workshift to me so I did not sign up.
Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.
Lost my girl-friend.

Once, late at night, I was biking home and overtook a man. He  
said to me "Hello darling" I was terrified and imagined the  
wildest scenes.

While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who  
frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In  
my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

I was then in the 10th standard and was going to my native place.  
 The last bus had already left and so I started walking, it soon  
became quite dark.  The road was a village road and was deserted,  
I was not even sure if that was the right way.  I finally reached  
home at 10 P.M.

When I am angry at someone without a good reason. Later on it  
proves that he didn't do anything wrong.
When a girlfriend left me.

Once, when I arrived home very late, my parents had an argument  
because of this; my mother wanted to stand up for me.

When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7  
and we were about to take the main exam.
When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied  
intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" -  I was so  
nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I  
got only blankness.

I had parked in a corner, and when I was going out I didn't watch  
if another car was coming and went out. The car that was coming  
was obliged to stop suddenly. It didn't crash but for a little.
Stealing money from my parents when I was young.

My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I  
found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with  
the driver.
When they tried to rob me.

It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and  
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

Returning home in the late afternoon I saw an indecent act made  
by a man with the purpose that I saw it.
Earth crake.

A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me  
from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the  
time for an informal "greeting" in the church service. She said a  
few words.
When I got to know that my father had passed away.

When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and  
brought some flowers and cake with him.

A few weeks ago I thought about an exam I had to take soon. I  
remembered this just before I had to go to sleep. I felt guilt  
because at the beginning of the year I planned to succeed.
The same event described under "shame".
When one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.
When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.
When I did not give back a text book to a friend in time.

When parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry their  
daughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl accepted  
everything and later she followed what her parents insisted and  
she told me never to talk to her again.
Getting a low grade on a midterm.

When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it  
was killed by the dogs.
Having passed an exam.
When my roommate forgets to flush the toilet.

When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not  
know.

I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by  
the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly  
small distance.

When someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress up  
properly. This was when I and my friend went for a dnce one  
Saturday.

I was taking a shower in a cubicle in France. Then I discovered  
that a few children were loking at me from the adjacent cubicle.

I had too much homework and examinations and I did not know how  
to organize my work.
I saw part of a Prince video with him crawling out of a bath tub.

When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking  
behind my back.

My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt tried to hit it. It  
turned on her and kicked her over the heart, sent her flying  
through the air. I left my mother and sister to deal to her as  
they are nurses. I felt I didn't want to know if she was going to  
die, it was just too much.

Finding out about the university does not have enough foreign  
currency to buy the yournals in your reference list.

It was when I drunk urine during my childhood thinking it was  
water. My friend had urinated in the tin.
When a close classmate failed a year.

I promised my mother to come home on her birthday, but at last I  
was prevented. Nevertheless it would have been possible to go but  
I did not.

I came home one day and discovered that my sister had borrowed my  
car and had gotten into an accident with it. My entire front  
bumper was destroyed.
China not doing well in the Asian Olympic games.

It was when my Instructor awoke me late at night to get prepared  
for the training at Military college when he was coming back from  
his personal social activities.

Some classmates said I did not do enough social work. Therefore I  
was not elected as a "Tree Good" student.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.
When a friend wouldn't speak to me and wouldn't tell me why.
When I was robbed in a bus.

A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept  
putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for  
days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I  
felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do  
what she had requested me to do.
When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.
Did badly in an examn.

I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was being  
treated for it.  I feared that my own father could have been  
there.

At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in a  
bag spread all around while I was going through the metal  
detector.

Borrowing a car, and then having a minor accident (breaking a  
headlight).
Not doing well in an examn which was easy.

I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying  
in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it  
would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying  
- and it started crying again.

My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang  
saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.

Being a spokesman for the union, I got into a quarrel with a  
colleague who had been acting disloyally over a sustained period  
of time.

When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I  
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just  
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

I was working in I. when a friend of mine borrowed his car so I  
could get bach there, I had to come to S.Paulo and his car was  
here. He said :"When you get the car tell my mother that you are  
only taking the car bacause I asked, for she doesn't like me to  
borrow it". Next day he borrowed me it again for I had to come  
back again. When I was coming back I crashed the car quite a lot.  
One of the first person I met at the accident was his mother,  
that said to me "You weren't to take the car only yesterday ?"  
(before I saw her I was already ashamed).

When caught shoplifting and the police were called in parents  
also informed.

Once while walking along a hill; I fell down out of carelessness  
and I broke my left arm.

Without the employer's knowledge and even without any  
communication their bank accounts were changed and their personal  
accounts closed.

When I stared to much at a pastry that a woman was eating and at  
the same instant the pastry felt on the floor.

The fridge we had at home had a lock.  One day when I wanted  
something, I unscrewed the door but unfortunately I was caught in  
the act.

In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed,  
leaving a trace of blood behind, finally it entered the mouth of  
one of the actors.

I am separated from my husband.  The way he has behaved towards  
me makes me angry.

When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me  
from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was  
being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through  
police.

That evening when I opened the songbook while I was singing the  
song "Those were the days" that guilt feeling became stronger.   
The lyrics described well - I was really wrong.  The wish that I  
had made was really bad. If she were with me I would really be  
happy and we would play happily together like the days in  
secondary school and she would not be disappointed and gloomy  
because of me.

The mother of a small child found me shaking the child in  
exasperation, because I couldn't get it to sleep.

When I finally got a job after days of wondering whether I would  
be hired or not and counting on the money that it would bring.

I had a date with my girlfriend, the time and place had not been  
fixed.  I asked her to phone me an hour later as it was midnight  
and I did not want to disturb her family.  I waited several hours  
for her call, she did not call me that night.

When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to  
win the Cup of England.

I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a  
person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.

My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that my  
mother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn't  
tell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.
Shame I feel when I am not properly dressed.

An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his  
life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.

After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I  
started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want  
to see her anymore.

I needed a recommendation for something. I decided that the best  
person to get one from was a professor who I had never talked to  
before. I felt a lot of fear going up after class to ask him to  
recommend me considering he had never heard my name before. But I  
did.

My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. There  
were  only two TV-chairs and we were sitting on them when my  
drunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off the  
chair she was sitting on.

I am ashamed of the horrible way I used to treat my little  
sister.

I was supposed to be studying for my math midterm a few days ago,  
however, I fooled around with my roommate, and didn't start  
studying until 12:00 am. I was disgusted with myself.
Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.

I woke up in the middle of the night of a nightmare, I was alone,  
it was very quiet and very dark.

At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night  
I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a  
purposeful mannner.
Could not find my way out in the college building at night.

When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long  
separation.
Friend's fiancT left her for me.

I hate the behaviour of my so called friends, they use bad  
language, spit, boast and treat the youngsters badly.
When I met a good friend of mine after a long time.

My mother unjustly became very angry with me and sent me to my  
room while my father explained that the way she saw things was  
not correct. I had done things with the best intentions.
Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.

When I was taking the 11th standard exam, my friend who was sitting  
behind me asked me for some answers.  The teacher looked at us  
just then and scolded both of us.  Everyone started looking at us  
and I felt very guilty.

Once I had torn a few pages off a library book and I felt ashamed  
at this.

I felt guilty after hearing that my girlfriend with whom I had  
spent most of my time was pregnant.

On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet  
of flowers.

I read in the newspaper about a 21 yr. old woman who was found  
naked and dead along a roadside. It turned out she had had two  
relatives 14 and 19 who were kidnapped, raped and killed earlier.

I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he  
had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.

[ I have felt shame but am unable to remember any particular  
incident.]

I felt sad when my dear friend was needed from training school  
due to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't know  
what he had to do.

When I left after the examination to enter the University, and  
even though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.

I felt happy when my mother borrowed me the car in order to let  
me go out alone for the first time.
When I triffled with other people.

An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had  
taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when he  
asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later when I  
looked for it, I found it in my room.

When my best friend foud out I'd been lying about something I'd  
been doing behind her back.

One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the  
first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I  
requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did  
not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use  
against him, in the meanwhile people intervened.
When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.

Flirting with other girls while I already had a very good  
relationship. When there are problems in my relationship, the  
flirting increases as does the feeling of guilt.

After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more  
glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.

When one individual takes advantage of and/or injures another  
relatively defenseless individual, consciously. I feel disgust  
mingled with anger. A person on my dorm floor verbally assaulted  
another person for having a certain religious belief.

During the lesson the teacher called me and asked me if I had  
reported that I was late.  I pretended that I had but looking at  
her eyes I knew that she knew that I was lying.  I thought that  
it was really bad luck that she had examined the list of the  
students who were late.
When there is danger nearby.
During the short period of my unemployment about six years back.
A friend of mine was shouting at me in a group of juniors.
Before important sports events.

Whenever I spoke to a female classmate I felt disgusted.  She  
said meaningless things and seemed to indicate something to me  
but I did not love/like her.

I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard  
from a good friend (from my home town).

When I heard that I had got the best result in school and would  
be definately selected to the university of Zambia.
When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.
Having my luggage checked at Customs.

I spent a lovely relaxing evening with my boyfriend. We played  
games and talked all evening.

In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to  
wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the  
highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its  
loudest.

When I learned that a friend of mine had not been speaking to her  
boyfriend for a week after an argument because of unfounded  
jealousy.

One day while we were strolling along the road one of my  
friends suggested that we go and watch a blue film.  I was  
curious so I went along but I felt quite guilty later.

The stories about my aunt who was beaten and humiliated by my  
uncle.

When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death, I had a  
bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something  
very precious.

I was double crossing my fiancee and one day she caught me red  
handed.  She forgave me later.  I was very ashamed of what I had  
done.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.

The day I learnt that my girlfriend had been going around with  a  
close friend of mine.

When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards  
my students.

When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very often  
misunderstood, especially when one is very frank.
When I could not do anything because of a bad back.

I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and  
threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money.  
 I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw to  
cut a man.  I could not look at it, but I could not avoid  
listening either.  I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.
[ Can not think of anything just now.]

Friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub was  
immoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriend  
the entire evening.

[ During a certain period, I felt successful and extremely satisfied.    
When I found that any tasks or decisions that I had made were better   
than expected.]
The death of a close relative.
Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.

I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera  
(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of  
an important felow while at the same time some young and able  
singers work in a quite different field of life.

[ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demanding  
situation.]
When felt lonely about writing my family.

[ I felt guilt when I was not co-operative with my mother for my  
exam.]

When I lose on my bets on anything - baseball, football,  
basketball, track, craps, poker, or arcade - whether its 5  
dollars or 200 I feel that I should never have done it in the  
first place.

One of my best friends accused me of giving up to early on  
problems. It was only a casual remark on her side, but I was  
angry and hurt.
I'd just got the top mark in an exam.
When my parents got divorced.

A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by  
insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in  
front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in  
order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to  
calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger  
we had to comply. From that day I detested him.
When I did not inform my friends of my forthcoming birthday.

When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that  
I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig  
happened I felt ashamed.

I was very sad when I could not take the M.A (I) exams due to  
illness, and a relative of mine disheartened me about it.

When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2  
yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he  
diagnosed it.

When I got an unexpected letter from  a guy, who had been my school  
mate.
I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.
Saw a blue film in a cinema.
When I made a fool at an examination.

A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy too  
because fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So I  
feel joy for her mainly.
When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

When I told a person something that had happened to my friend,  
and this person went and told my friend.

I am a "cantor" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I  
had to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As I  
did not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could not  
sing.

When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, when  
I realised how much God loves me and that my acceptance with him  
is not based on my performance - that he loves me unconditionally  
and showed that love in Christ who died because I do need  
forgiveness.

My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise  
birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along  
too.

My joy knew no bounds when I was selected for a job even before  
having finished my studies.

When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and     
his skin came peeling off.

When my first sexual intercourse turned out to be a flop.  I was  
in a panic and ended up without an erection.

In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried  
to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my  
sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.   
There was a fight.

When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close woman  
friend of mine in public.

I felt ashamed to be Brazilian and to live under a military  
dictatorship that despoiled the people, when during my military  
service.

I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague  
of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good  
notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know  
why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was  
on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.
I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).

One day my mother went to visit her friends.  When she came back  
she scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so I  
decided not to talk to her.

When I was feeding a premature baby (7 months), the baby chocked.  
This was when I was working in children's ward I thought I had  
killed the baby.
If a close relative's life is in danger.

When I was about to be bitten by my friend's dog, later on it bit  
me.
When i was asked to be a child's godmother.

A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were  
late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I  
know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that  
particular time and I felt I couldn't do  anything about it  
anyway (i.e. being late).

When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him that  
I had told them that I was pregnant.  My daddy  told my mother  
and she asked me if it was true.  I was very angry with my aunts.

I felt sad when I heard that my cousin had passed away just  
suddenly.

One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a  
beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in  
the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty  
bottle with me.

One of my fellow students had bunked field work and in my attempt  
to cover up for him I myself was exposed, though not directly.   
We were to meet our field work suprevisor and we were afraid of  
the consequences.

I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our  
relationship.  I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to  
be free.  I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained  
firm and did not change my mind.

When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been  
raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.

Getting my kitten, found at work several years ago, taking him  
home in a box on my motorbike, showing it to my defacto.

When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it  
to UNZA.
[ An unfair punishment.]

When I made love with a girl, which I don't really love. However  
I know that she loves me.

I was on a farm with a few friends and during the talk I  
discovered that a friend of mine, was being betrayed by her  
boyfriend and a 3rd friend of ours.
When my grandmother died.

I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal  
his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.

On New Years eve I drank too much alcohol, so much that I had to  
vomit in the presence of other people.
The death of my grandmother.
Forgot to give a present to my little nephew.
When I hit my young sister without a valid reason.

This feeling comes frequently when I go out at night and tell my  
mother that I shall come back early. But then I get home a 5 or 6 a.m.

When I saw several people washing their car with water from a  
drain.

When I was going to bring back my girlfriend to LA to meet my  
parents.

Time had struck 8 o'clock when I heard from the radio that I had  
been selected to Robert Blake Secondary School for Form I. I was  
very happy for the selection. My parents and I were very happy  
and full of joy.

I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was  
not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

When I passsed the M.S.C board exams with first class, which I  
had not expected.

Told by some people the class leader only choose his friends (not  
true).

I'm allergic to most foods - eating something that I'm allergic  
to caused guilt.
Talking to a pensioned and bitter "street order" policeman.

When some of my close friends and colleagues talk about me and  
my work and say that I am the brightest student of the college.

Climbing a mountain, I got stuck and realized I could get neither  
up nor down.

My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and  
sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and  
when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad  
about that.

[ I feel shame when I do not arrive on time and others have to  
wait for me for a long time.]
Lying to a friend about something that was trivial.

Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her  
abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our  
suprise she had a baby 2 months back.

I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved  
when she said to me that she didn't love me.
When I missed the tram after having run for it.
When money was stolen from my pocket.
Just arrived in the university, not knowing anybody.

When I got low marks in the final year B.Sc exams, I felt guilty  
as I had not worked hard because I had been roaming around with my  
 friends.

When I had not done well in Geography at my MCE I was expected to  
get more than I did.

Once, when I was ten, I could not remember why my mother was so  
angry.  She fainted suddenly and I was very scared as I did not  
know what to do .

I was coming back home with my mother when the purse I was  
carrying got stolen.  It was done so swifty that I did not  
realize what had happened till much later.  A lot of money and the  
keys of the house were lost.  I was guilt ridden at my  
carelessness.  I felt terrible as I do not normally loose things  
and this was quite important, especially the keys.

Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being  
prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20  
others.

When the brother-in-law of a girlfriend of mine found us in a  
bedroom with clothes and panties spread all over the place.
At my grandfather's death.

When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me  
in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed  
with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked  
me and threatened me.

The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my  
studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They  
believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.

A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and  
therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my  
scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I  
realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.

When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received  
a letter from a boyfriend.

When I was little - Mum caught me telling a lie about who broke  
the cup.
When I see people who have no sentiments.

On Reberbahn, I was in a "restaurant" where drinks were  
overpriced.  I did not ask for the prices beforehand, and when  
the bill came I could not pay the bill.
Talking with a nice girl.

I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I  
had to go the outside toilet on my own.
Can't think of any.

At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is  
not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had  
observed that.

I was with my boyfriend forgetting that I had left the house  
unlocked. Unfortunatly a thief came and stole all the kitchen  
utensils. Thereafter I was afraid of the consequences.
When I had an argument with a friend.

I was forced to go to a party with someone I didn't love and he  
was telling people that I was his girlfriend.

When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My  
father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life.  
 I really felt like hiding.

When I wished secretly and lied to a friend of mine because I  
didn't want her to stay in my house on the beach (as she always  
does), and wouldn't stick on me.

Coming to this lecture and listen to you talking about feelings,  
I am so happy that foreigners have the same feelings as Chinese.
When my beloved grandfather died.
When one of my friends started misbehaving.
Being elected as class leader.

There was a cat on the street.  It had been run over and its head was  
open.  We passed beside it.
My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.
Some students trying to please the lecturer.

I feel anger when I see a "parent" beating and punishing his child  
in the street. Recently I was a withness of a similar case.
When caught shop-lifting as for shame.
Robbery mentioned under sadness.

Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I  
found that a collection of pornographic literature had been  
removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was  
aware of the existence of this material.

I was disgusted at the existing red-tape in the government  
offices.  I accquired my passport three months after having applied for  
it and I had to go back five times to them to correct a minor  
error.

As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more  
anxious.  My friend called me and said, " You have passed."  My  
heart was full of joy.
A situation where I stole a friends wife's wallet.
Before examination.

When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents  
treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of  
them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not  
encouraged and was rejected.
When my uncle died.
When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.

There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on the  
eight floor.
When I was selected to the university of Zambia.

Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a  
serious illness, even death.

Power cut made me unable to listen to the songs sung by my  
favourite pop star.

When my boyfriend almost had a relationship with a close friend  
of mine.

I was very disgusted the first day I went to put a dead body in  
the Mortuary. There were many dead bodies and some were uncovered  
so we had to put on top of the other bodies.
When my application for studying the masters degree was accepted.

When I received the acceptance form for the second year at  
university.

When a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant,  
unexpectedly by a man of a caliber I never expected.

This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our  
relationship due to some circumstances between her and her  
family. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find any  
reason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? This  
was one of few question which crept up vividly every time I  
thought about what had happened.
I lied to a friend.

When a close friend of mine maintained a relationship with me  
till she needed me and broke it off when she did not need me.   
She behaved life a really selfish person.

I was supposed to do something and didn't. The person was really  
dependiong on me.
A recurrent lovesickness.
Insulted for no reason.

I was drunk one night and I insulted three ladies.  The following  
morning they approached me and asked me the reason behind my  
bahaviour, I apologized for my unruly behaviour.

Outside a night club, a grown man was sitting on top of a younger  
woman, beating her up.

I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt  
that a stranger was in my house.

When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked,  
because there where persons that didn't have problems, and  
wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having  
injured it badly.
When I had to finish those big amounts of homework in time.
During a fight with my best friend.

When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a  
profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.
Death of a relative.
A gang of screaming and drunk youths "captured" a tram.

I was eating in the dinning hall and some women joined me.  I  
could not eat with them so I left the dinning hall.
When my girlfriend left me.
When our dog died.
Finding out that I have misunderstood other people.

I am not good enough to join any team to play sport for the  
class.

When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later  
accepted.

The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for  
a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be  
selected.

When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it  
when asked about it later.

I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to  
think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that  
someone was in the house.

During a recent meeting, Mr. A showed his excitement and  
overindulged in the notes delivered.  Though his curiosity could  
not be blamed, his way of accquiring knowledge was an extreme  
behaviour e.g he always tried to know what I was reading and  
gained everything he could.

The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form  
four).

When I cheated my father and told him that the school  
administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus.  Two  
months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for  
the money.  I could not go back and ask him for the money again  
as he had already given it to me once.
I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.

In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his  
guts when he was still alive.

I finished the relationship with my boyfriend, after having felt  
myself very unhappy for a long time.

When somebody I knew greeted me and started to talk with me and I  
didn't know, I couldn't remember who he was.
On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.
When I was accepted as a student.

It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered  
that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room  
which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would  
refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining  
bathroom switched on.
Disappointment over a friend.

When my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived  
and "different" from other children at school.
Introducing myself at a first tutorial this year at University.

The house was on fire, and I was saved by the dog. I am afraid of  
the fire, verging on panic.
When I was not chosen to go to your English lectures.

When I realized that I could not communicate properly with my  
closest friend.
A child beaten up by his mother.

My boyfriend told me that I had very high demands towards him. In  
my opinion this was wrong.

When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age  
of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the  
funeral: I sat on the table and cried.

My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the  
shower. Then my father knocked his fist through the door, I was  
scared to death.

As a passenger in a vehicle travelling from the steep side of  
Arthur's Pass in the middle of a sleet-storm, icy roads, sheer  
chasms to one side, sheer face to the other.

When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I could  
not meet her because of a misunderstanding.

I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and  
sister, and with me too.

I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house.  
I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there  
was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.

When my cat vomited and a worm came out which was still alive.  I  
was forced to wipe it up.

I was informed by my flatmate that, when we'd moved into our  
flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event  
actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to  
this, she had said nothing.

I gave tutorial to a student and I found that he was lazy, he did  
not pay attention to what I taught.  He did some easy questions  
wrong deliberately.

When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a  
prostitute.

At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not  
seen for some time

When a discussion resulted in an insult, which in my opinion, was  
not justified.

When I get into the tube or the train without paying for the  
ticket.

When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've  
just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess,  
and nervous.

After learning on the news about this man who killed more than  
300 women and habitually copulated into their inert bodies.

I borrowed my friend's radio cassette and the plug cracked and  
some pieces broke off when the plug dropped off my hands.

When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in the  
presence of my boyfriend.
When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.
My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.

Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months before  
she died.

Once I was very frightened at night as I had a very fearful and  
terrifying dream, I could not go back to sleep for a long time.
Not getting a job.
When I failed some tests my first year at CAL.

Uncleaniness at my work place.  The place is generally not very  
clean, but when it reaches a point, I get angry at the person  
who is supposed to clean the place and the people who are  
supposed to supervise him.

A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act  
as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an  
hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not  
want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only  
was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I  
would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.
Helping in the nursery school.
Being insulted by my roommate.
I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.

The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close  
to me.(blaming us and lying)
I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.

Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an  
awful man came cycling after me.  He was shouting and I ran as  
fast as my legs could carry me.

I had fixed a meeting with my classmates and I missed it as I was  
tired.  Besides everyone at the meeting was a stranger to me and  
I did not want to make friends with them.  Whatever the reasons - I   
felt guilty.

One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and  
took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and  
used it for her business without my knowledge.

I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while  
in a position of trust.

A friend was going to come stay the weekend with me, but  
something came up and I cancelled out on him.

I dreamed that this girl and I were cuddling in bed when my  
girlfriend walked in. I really love my girlfriend so I felt  
guilty and sad. I know that this is a wierd example but the dream  
and the feeling was clear to me as if it had really happened.

My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me  
telling me how she had got drunk the last time.

During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and  
other family members crying.

When my cousin put feaces in my washing.  A silly idea which was  
meant to be a joke.
Death of my grandmother.

A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my  
fault, nevertheless I felt guilty.
To force someone to do something that suits me.

When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at  
the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and  
in general the best records of all the candidates.

Some foreign students playing loud music before the biology  
examn.
Class leader getting me to do things he did not want to do.
I received a letter from a distant friend.

When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult  
education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought  
a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.

I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that  
my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.
Good dinner on the National Day.

When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just  
come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe  
which I opened and was overcome with joy.

On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt  
on, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.

I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I  
was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish  
that training.
When I finished the work that I had planned to do - my homework.

When I went out with a friend of mine to meet her ex-boyfriend  
who didn't know that she was engaged to be married.

My grandmother several times has been struck by cerebral  
hemorrhages. Until now she recovered well each time, but there is  
always the threat to loose her.

When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well  
in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.

A good friend of mine who is at the moment in a foreign country.  
I didn't write her for several months and now I feel guilty.

I was eating in a very nice restaurant, when the servant asked  
whether I liked the food I told him that I liked it but that  
there was one thing which wasn't so good. The servant than worked  
very hard to make it good.

When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I  
have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.

A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays.  
Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I was  
overwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria.

The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away  
after he showed had his meals.

The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get  
there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there,  
everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a  
wonderful time all day long.
I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.

I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a  
NH Competition and I was the first.

This summer I got into a fight with one of our patrons (at a  
theatre). He hit me and I hit him and her friend, he hit my friend  
and we all hit eachother.

I had a quarrel with near persons. I said many ill-considered  
things and I regretted it when it was to late.
Caused a family disturbance.

When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty,  
lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.

When I began to date, the first gestures of affection made me  
feel ashamed.
When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.

I wanted my boyfriend to stay when he didn't. He stayed but when  
he left I felt ashamed because I should have let him leave when  
he wanted. I was too selfish.

My girlfriend disliked it when I played majong (a game of gambling).   
I expressed my regrets and when I went to see her she neglected my  
existance.  I was very angry and left in displeasure.

When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for  
my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of  
childhood.

I was going around with a girl without loving her.  Not only did  
I go around with her, but we did many more things.  In the end I  
was not very sincere to her.

When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned  
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature  
National Olympiad.

Some time back I had signed a letter which I had not read.  What  
had happened is that something had been written against my  
friend and this went to the higher authorities.  My friend asked me   
-"you also signed ?"
When a person that I like very much got near to me.

Did not get up early enough to watch my class football team  
playing against another team.
When I found my girl in bed with another man.

My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend  
himself very well; I should have taken his part.

After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he  
had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.
Getting back with my boyfriend after a year away - apart.

When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person  
with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

Guilt conscious struck me when I failed my Standard Two  
Examinations in 1972. I knew that I would suffer the consequences  
of what I had been doing during class hours: thus playing with  
friends and sometimes not even going to school.

Not being chosen for the English lectures (my girl-friend  
chosen).

The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C  
junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.

When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving.  
We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore  
would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the  
time.

When we complained about the uncleanliness of the work place, the  
authorities agreed to have the place cleaned.  Even after 2-3  
days nothing had been done.  I felt disgusted at the whole  
situation.
When I got a record as a gift from a friend.

I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started  
chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we  
climbed up a tree.

I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well  
prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I  
couldn't answer.
When I was punished in school for no serious mistake of mine.
After the car accident in GUILT.

I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital   
for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.
Getting a phone call from a very old friend.

When I felt powerless to help the poor or when I don't know how  
to.
Being alone in the room at night.

I had lunch in a restaurant with a friend and I paid the bill.   
The change was that of a two dollar and a ten cent coin.  As I  
was talking with my friend I took the two dollar coin and forgot  
to leave a tip.

At the funeral of my uncle, I was one of the bearers.  I was not  
familiar with the etiquette and acted tactlessly because of my  
ignorance.
When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.

As part of the assessment I had to speak on a subject in front  
of the class. I was not really prepared and I was just reading  
the stuff I had on a piece of paper, when some of the students   
asked me something I could not give them an answer.  I felt  
ashamed as I had not prepared the topic.

When my gradmother died.  I felt very sad then ... The feeling  
started to be worse after a while.

I was to meet one of my friends (girl) at the library at 8:00  
already dark. She would be walking alone. She was 45 minutes late  
but I kept waiting, calling her room and other places she could  
have been.
I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.

I went to the ballet lessons with a little friend in the dark. On  
a very quiet place a boy approached us from behind and asked at  
what time the lesson would be finished. I gave him an avoiding  
answer, he took me up and wanted to run away with me.

Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being  
suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.

When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been  
disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few   
days earlier.
Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.
When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

I was with a group of people and everybody told me to do or say  
something.  It was a confusing, strong and traumatic situation  
for me.

My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away  
was very sad.
When I boxed my child's ears.

I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on a  
trip, and I did not turn up.

I was driving a friend's car, and I got close to the pavement to  
ask my way and I struck a parked car.
When I considered writing a load of crap for this emotion.

When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder  
I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied  
that the ladder was not very stable.

A friend gave me a lift and we met a road-block.  He tried  to  
turn back when an officer shouted at us to stop.  My friend took a  
turn suddenly and the officer raised his gun but by the time we  
were gone.

I was looking after my father's sheen in the forest. One day  
while playing with friends from neighbouring villages the flock  
escaped me and went into a far place. It became dark and I was  
afraid of father. I went home and hid myself.

On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and  
very relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the man  
watching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ran  
away fast.

I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that  
didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.

Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called  
"treatment" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II.

Saying something quite rude, but in jest, about a photograph of  
someone, but it didn't quite turn out that way.
Left alone in the dining hall at night.
After an exam which I failed.

Seeing a close friend who had just returned from twelve months  
overseas.
When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.
When friends try to put me down or hurt me.
Being together with my best friend.
Could not get into the university I wanted to get in.

When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that the  
college entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity,  
and effort weren't corresponded.

An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a  
person very close to me, when we should have been having a good  
time together.
When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.

The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog  
which lives in my street.
Going to the examn not well prepared.

My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I felt  
relieved, and was ashamed of that.
When my friend was involved in a car accident.

When my friend ended up pregnant by a gentleman whom I considered  
to be good and faithful but he ended up neglecting her and not  
bothering about her.

I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs,  
alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut  
fence.

When I lied to my girlfriend, telling her that I had passed an  
exam, when I actually did not even take it.
Insulted by some stupid people.

When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial  
problems.

When my mother found a leaf of my diary where I had written about  
my mother's lack of education, especially her poor arithmetical  
insight.

I had some sort of a stomach virus last week and  I vomited in  
college in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times during  
the trip home and again when I got home.

Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard  
about it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself  
to it.

A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange  
manner.

One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken.   
I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was not  
the servant but my daughter who had broken it.
When someone is accused or punished instead of me.

When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for  
an exam inside it and they got all mixed up.

While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold and  
selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel  
disgusted.

When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When  
I saw his body I was sad beyond words.

After being depressed because of a very bad relationship, my  
first love called me and told me that he would always care for me  
no matter what I did.
The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship.

This feeling occurred to me when my colleague entered in G.V.  
(University) and I didn't.

When my sister took something that belonged to me without my  
permission.
Selling the appartment after my divorce.

I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not  
expected this so I was very happy.
At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.

During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and  
stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had  
the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived  
with them. They were glad when I left.

One of my best friends'fiancT broke off the relationship because  
his feelings for me were stronger than for her. I felt the same  
for him, but did not really encourage him to leave her or stay  
with her - still felt shame.
When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

Saw someone who picked up a cigarette from the floor and smoked  
it.

After blowing up and saying all the wrong things, I realized what  
I had done and hurt that person and myself.

When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the  
stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his  
friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would  
fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of  
other persons.

I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a  
horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was  
that I was practically obliged to eat.

When I saw my name in the newspaper and I knew that I entered at  
the University.

When I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where I  
was (going).

When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to be  
hospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong.  
Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.
When I got very low marks in one of the assignments.

When I was accused of having impregnated someone's daughter, it  
was the girl's cousin who had done it.

Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose  
and glass-eye, rattling breath.

A friend told me that he had suffered in love and in academics.   
I shared his sadness.

This was when I was discovered stealing a piece of bread at home,  
I was very hungry a few hours before supper.

I had been caught red-handed having stolen some paw-paw. I was  
then taken the elders owning the paw-paws.
Swearing in public.

When my father banned me from going to his sister's home due to  
some misunderstanding between the two.
