I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the  
money last term.

Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraid  
to be left alone and that I could not manage it.

A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a  
taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose  
the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried  
to be intimate with me.

When I stayed alone in a house in Great Brittain and there was a  
lot of rumour in the newspaper about a murderer still being free.
Every time I meet a certain dog that has once bitten me.
Something was stolen.

When I embarrassed a friend by asking him aloud if a certain  
person was "the source of gossip" he told me about, while that  
person was also present.

Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and  
difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.
When my grandmother died.

In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed  
copying.

When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid  
look stupid.
Emotional reassurances by spouse.

A close friend of mine was leaving for graduate school out of  
state. I had arranged to gather some people together the day  
before he left to be with him and have a good time, but I didn't  
pay as much attention to him as I should have.

A friend and a girlfriend went to Rome for 10 days with their  
class. When they were back home I heard people tell "strange"  
stories about my friend and that girlfriend.

When I was made to feel responsible for the emotional state a friend of  
mine was in.

At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered;  
blood was dripping on the floor.
I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.
When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.

When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first  
time.

When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the  
spot.

My father's death in January 1983 moved me deeply.  The gloom  
prevailed for almost two years and I am still to recover from it.

A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this  
process makes me sad.

When I got the positive result of my examination to achieve the  
Bachelor Degree in Plychology.

An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long  
separation.

I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end  
of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to  
get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards  
him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to  
go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful  
message.

My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was  
expected, he came back several hours later than expected.
My admittance to the University.

When I found a letter addressed "To Mum" by my son, 6 months  
later, he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up  
after wearing them for the first time.

A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.  I realized  
later that I had been inconsiderate, at a wrong moment and the  
wrong place.

My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time  
through a pane of glass and she looked at me.
When I lied to the physiology teacher.

When I stood first in the B.A exams.  Earlier I had heard of  
these boys and girls who were toppers, but when I first heard of  
me having topped I could not believe it.
My dog died of a cerebral tumor.

My mother was always fastidious about my room, bed time, etc.   
She treated us strictly and punished us physically.   These  
things were intolerable.

After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's  
place.

I do not have the time for other people's problems.  My  
mother-in-law is sometimes depressed and I do not have the time,  
the desire or the strength to help.

My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship  
and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him  
nowadays.
A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I  
stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody  
wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said "I thought  
you wanted to invite us for dinner". "Of course", I said, but I  
thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought  
it.

My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing  
heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it  
deep into her hand.
When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.

When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arranged  
to go out together.

I worked at a lawyer's office during Summer and I got a very  
good reference from him.

I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly  
disregarded.
I feel sad about an event I can not influence.

In the past I used to think that my mother was a very nagging  
person.  When I started living at the hostel we had little time  
to meet each other.  Whenever I went home she would take care  
of me.  I gradually realized that what she had done was for my  
own good.  So very time I saw her I felt guilty.

When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while   
we were playing near his home.
I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.
Earlier, I was afraid of speaking in front of a crowd of people.

One day I was in the countryside with several friends, and we  
began to eat figs, after we were all full we noticed that all the  
figs were full of worms.

After making an effort to enter at University I found a course  
and a school of higher education which were compatible with my  
experience and potentiality.

As an evening class teacher I got positive feedback.  When the  
atmosphere is good and a kind of relaxed understanding exists.

A study visit to a chicken factory : the butchery, the smell,  
the environment and the noise.

One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend  
died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the  
funeral I felt very sad.

I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend  
which was not true because the girl was just a friend of mine.

In the compartment of a public transport railway, I did not give  
my seat to an old man who was standing near me.  It was another  
teenager who did so.

Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they did  
not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in  
her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.

I feel this emotion very often when I try to express my feelings  
in public, because other people do not understand my reactions  
and think that I am silly.

When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with  
a rugby tour of South Africa.
Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.

It happened when I lost two very intimate friends in a car  
accident.

In the recent lightning storm, bolts of lightning were hitting  
close by (1/8 mile). I was in bed at the time and was afraid I  
might be struck.
A lecturer in great detail spoke about his sexual experiences.

I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood  
I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).

I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend  
inadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long  
time. And at times still get angry at him.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who  
suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I      
realized what could have happened.

Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are  
non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.

At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had  
grown weary of it and said : "I would like to throw the book on  
the arse of Kuikka".  My classmate said : "Now, he is sitting  
there and waiting for the book" (Kuikka was one of the most quiet  
boys of the class).  I was ashamed of myself.
Insulted by a teacher in front of the class.

Unofficially I was informed about my results of the final  
examination of the secondary school. A teacher wrote them up for  
me. When I went outside, I started crying with joy.

My classmate used her personal relations to get a seat for a  
subject that I wanted also.  I had taken the pains to help him  
apply and I did not get selected.  I did not like this as he had  
not told me the facts earlier, he need not have lied to me.

I felt very sad when I was in Form three to notice that my friend  
Barley Jumbe, had lost very expensive new sports short trousers.

During my Highschool time I was chairman of the student's  
comitee. In this function I once had to make a speech to a large  
audience and I was very nervous. After three sentences I forgot  
my text.
When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.

I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.  I was very  
happy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I)  
examination where I got 71.5%.  This was the highest marks I have  
ever scored in my life.
Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.

I was rushing home from school because there was a 49er game that  
night. I got into a non-injury accident, which was all my fault,  
but destroyed the front of my car. The truck I hit was undamaged.

I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during working  
hours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out and  
I was guilty-conscious.

When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died  
later.

I was disgusted at myself when I dropped a vital catch, while  
playing a cricket match, and we lost the match; though the catch  
was difficult.
Caught lying to my father about a speeding ticket I had received.

I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my  
long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.

I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics.  
Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and  
started to cry. I grew angry.
When my elder brother died.

When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important  
family occasion that I should not have missed.

When I realized that the person I was courting hadn't been really  
by my side for a long time already. He had deceived me and I let  
him deceive me.
My father suddenly fell ill and died.

We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started  
coughing and spitting into his plate.

I had been away all night without having told my parents about  
it.  In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired.   
She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that  
she was angry and disappointed.
When my sister left home to go and live with her husband.
Being disloyal with persons I loved.
When I could study at university.

A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides  
this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died  
tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad  
and couldn't believe it (until today).

Physical violence. A friend wouldn't listen to me I repeatedly  
tried to warn him, to no avail. Result: eight people were "pissed  
off".

When I went to the clinic for a medical check-up and saw the way  
the lecturer was conducting the lecture and the kind of responses  
he got from the patients.

[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back  
home, I felt very sad.]

I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He  
threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.
The disgust I feel towards a certain person.
A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.

The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when  
I was with the person I love for the first time.
When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.

I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a bad  
language but was a very smart looking lady.
When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in  
the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have  
fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked  
me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he  
didn't deserve it.
When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.

When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did  
not know what would happen.

I slipped and fell in to a puddle and people started looking at  
me.

A close friend of mine was to get married in a weeks time when  
her father died of a heart-attack.  I knew him well and felt bad  
on hearing of his death.
When my dad caught me with a honey (girlfriend) in my bedroom.

I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to  
move up to the second year course.
When my grandmother died of cancer.

One day I lent my tennis I just had washed to my sister because  
she asked it. I asked her not to soil it as I had just washed it.  
Next day I looked at the tennis, and it was dirty with wax. She  
could not have soiled it. It was lack of consideration. I felt  
very angry.
My friend still trusts me as a friend.

The parents of a friend of mine surprised us and another couple  
sleeping in thier place.

Before the department meeting my friend ate a dish that I had  
prepared for this meeting.

In Punjab, when in the name of religion people killed each other  
during the agitation.

One night,when I was in primary 5 or 6, I felt thirsty so I  
fetched the thermos to pour a cup of water for myself.  Then I  
saw my brother lowering his head and I, jokingly, poured the        
water on his head.

When I laughed at a lame man walking down the road, it looked  
funny at the time but later I felt lousy.  It was the same day  
that I had stolen some coins from my mother in the shop.

My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school  
fees instead I spent it on beer and did not tell him about this.

When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed  
-rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.
I felt very ashamed at having got a book by force from a girl.

The loss of my father as he died of a massive and sudden heart  
attack.
When I was walking along a road alone on my way to go shopping.

I had an argument with my boyfriend.  It was my fault but my  
pride would not let me admit it.

At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering  
problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing  
the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

When I was 8 years old, I would usually come home from school  
with my mother in a car.  For the first time I had to take the  
school bus, and I mistook the bus stop and found myself two  
kilometres away from where I lived.  I was very scared, wondering  
how I would get back home.

I was rock-climbing and absailing & felt OK, but suddenly as I  
was going over the cliff I was hit by fear - I couldn't go on  
absailing down the cliff and had to be actually hauled back up  
it.

When the teacher asked me a question in class, concerning  
something I had read earlier, and I did not know the answer, so I  
felt ashamed in front of the whole class.
I prayed unfaithfully.

During a discussion I said something rather stupid and  
unnecessary.

At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new  
trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the  
trousers again.

A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I  
was able to break loose.

When the doctor told me that there was something wrong with my  
eye and I had to undergo an operation.

Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When we  
realized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a long  
climb ahead.

When I saw a documentary film about World War II (about Hitler  
and his adepts).

I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached  
our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It  
limped. Some time later, when I thought that it had already run  
away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that  
it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the  
roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I  
was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were  
some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less  
good time.

I was told I shouldn't visit my sister because the holiday was  
short.

When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one  
university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon  
authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.

Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them  
would be killed.

My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell  
me if they were visiting me or not.

I get angry with people who attain certain status without  
deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of  
other people.

My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.   
There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4  
operated.  I was scared for my uncle's life.

One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.  My sexual  
desire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.  I am  
ashamed of myself now.

Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of  
names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We  
read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar  
room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if  
I would succeed as a group leader.
When I pass an exam.

We were camping in the mountains, and a friend and I went for a  
walk.  It was getting darker and darker and we were not sure of  
the right way back.
When I met a friend of mine after several months.

Stealing money from a milk token jar from a close friend of the  
family when visiting.

News was spread that I had been found doing sexual intercourse  
with a small girl. At first this annoyed me but later on I became  
ashamed because many people seemed to believe it.

When I was caught with another man's wife.  I had taken the  
opportuinty as this man was abroad but he returned that night.

When I have to take exams I am very excited and have not much  
time for the housekeeping. Then my friend has to do everything.

Waiting for a bus not coming for a long time, and the bus drivers  
were having a long lunch.
After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.
[ When my performance (homework or other work) is better than others.]
Breaking an implicit promise.

One of those days when I was going to school with my brother and  
he annoyed me.
Doing well in an examn.

As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and I  
vomitted in the basin of the classroom.

This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was  
planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.

Once at midnight, I was working alone at office and the phone  
suddenly rang.

I was living with my brother and one day he went away on business  
and I was left alone to look after the house and the property. At  
night thieves came and wanted to break into the house.

I had been forced to get together with strange and disgusting  
classmates.  The things they talked about disgusted me and made  
me feel ill at ease.  I knew that I would feel unhappy if I  
stayed there but I was defeated by the social norms.
When I passed my final examination at school.

Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back  
from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in  
the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?

I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost  
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

The day I received the key of my apartment and we could enter in  
it, for my fiancT and I had bought it yet in plans, and it seemed  
to us that this was almost impossible to happen.
When excuses are necessary and I get out of doing it myself.
Continous fear of a nuclear war.
I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.

While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was  
held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V.  It felt  
awful to see such suffering.

During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends,  
after not having seen them for six months.

When I asked a friend to return the money that I had loaned her  
and then remembered that she had repayed me in several ways.

This issue worried me rather than saddening me.  In mid September  
I went to Guanggho alone.  I was looking for an accomodation in  
the evening and after having walked 2 or 3 miles I still could not  
find anything.  What could I do?  I was not worried about  
sleeping on the streets but because of some procedural problems.   
I finally found a place to sleep at 8 o'clock.
When my friend had a child out of wedlock.

Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying  
and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night.  It was very  
dark and I could not even see my nose.  I did not know that it  
was the birds till my mother told me so.

When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to  
tell me for several days after it happened.

When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers,  
 nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.

During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me  
outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain  
hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the  
circumstances

Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had  
separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they  
were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being  
alone.

Finding out that the university will give first priority to  
qualified practioners and clinical years to go to your English  
lectures.

When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have  
been right.
When I was in the sauna bath.

My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up  
on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two  
mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good,  
it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.

That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my  
brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and  
two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital  
 to see my brother.

I had found out that I was pregnant. I talked it over with my  
boyfriend and he was unsupportive - yet encouraged an abortion -  
I did.
I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.
[ A successful lesson.]

I was disgusted when our cricket team manager dropped me from the  
team.

I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawi  
and when making a turn, it seemed as if the boat would sink on  
the side.
When the morning newspaper has not arrived.

I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be  
present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.
A man spat on the wall of a house.

A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I  
didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.

I had a date with a friend to see a movie and my friend was late.  
 I waited for a long hour and was very angry.

One night going downstairs, and hearing a strong stirring of  
brances, which was not the wind.

I went to a restaurant with my boyfriend for dinner. There we saw  
a couple. the man of the couple was a negro and he hadn't manners  
for eat.
When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.

The fact that I was pregnant. I was always considered level  
headed and did not have sex until 18 and out of high school.

A few days back, I walked on a heap of faeces while walking on  
the road.  I got goose flesh because of this.

I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I  
was within the row of students who were making noise.

In a fight with my girlfriend in a luncheonette where everybody  
stared at me in such a way that I had to leave it.
Falling in love although she is my friend (angry with myself).

For the above: guilt at not living up to my own moral  
expectation, guilt for not being the type of person my patents  
wanted, guilt for just about bloody everything, just realising  
that I have failed drastically in my own eyes.

When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of  
mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.

Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family  
friends dinner. Told "Not to Speak". The attitude by him was  
negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range  
of experiences. Probably greater than he.

When people/press analyze a particular newsworthy item (CAL  
Football team) which I am a member and can only see the situation  
in a bad light and always put the team down.

My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance  
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his  
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the  
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old  
he was (79).

I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night  
club.

On a camp - boys and girls in one cabin. One guy forced himself  
upon another girl and was having intercourse, while the girl in  
the bunk beneath was pretending to be asleep and not be ill.

My grandmother wanted me to help her. I was driving a tractor  
pulling a dead branch off a tree. I told her she didn't respect  
me.

When a lady I was flirting with told all my class-mates that she  
was in second year while I was in first year, everyone laughed  
and started looking at me.

When I was forced to decline the invitation to my mother's 70th  
birthday because of my work committments in another area.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

During these Summer vacations a schoolmate who was not in my  
class went to Britain.  Before he left, his classmates and some  
of us who were accquainted with him had a B.B.Q on the beach.   
When I arrived I saw that some people , who were not close  
friends of the departing person(person A), were playing mahjong.   
Some others were playing bridge and A had nothing to do, besides  
it was A who had prepared the food.  Later when we wanted to talk  
and his classmates did not even have the decency to listen to him.   
They only asked him a few questions half-heartedly and then they  
talked on their own.  Some of their conversation was against me and   
another classmate.
Caught cheating on a diet.

When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken  
her time.

I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality -  
one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girls  
and she would give these girls extra attention in class and would  
ignore the others.

I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very  
cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought.  
 I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed  
at myself as a lot of people I know were there.

A friend told me that a boy wanted to get to know me.  At that  
time I felt disgusted and thought that it was a nonsense thing.

When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school,  
was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.

When I went up the stairs in a high, dark house full of shadows,  
passed a door and had the feeling that someone or something was  
behind me, although I knew I was alone.

It was extremely sad to me when I heard that a patient who I was  
taking care of in hospital had passed away. He had some abdominal  
pains.
Before an exam.

When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact  
with my parents.

My father was very angry with another man in the presence of my  
friends.
My father insulted by other people.
[ When I do not get any co-operation from my friends/partners.]

When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards  
it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved  
time for it.
When my sister broke my china tea set.

Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about law  
reform (on the radio - listening with 2 others).
When people around me did not understand me the right way.

My 80 year old grandfather underwent three successive operations  
during a single year.  The third operation was risky and I was  
scared that he would die and feared that my grandmother would be  
very sad.

I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing  
things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.

Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were  
trying to kiss me.
Not doing well in examns which I should do well (English examns).
Long illness.

I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did  
not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed  
me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.
At my sister's wedding.
I cheated my boyfriend.

When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and  
bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and  
didn't want to talk to me any more.
When they changed my office to another room without my agreement.

My parents do not like my friend and told me not to go out with  
him.

When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a  
certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

One night we, all the family members, were sitting in the front  
corridor of the house when a gentleman looking person came in.   
He was my father's client and he had come to bribe my father in  
connection with the proceeding case.  At my father's refusal he  
abused my father, my brother and I could not control our temper  
and we rushed at him.

When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young  
people approached.

When I was in P3 I was always punished as I would forget to do my  
homework.  The first time that I was punished and not allowed to  
leave school, I slipped out of school.

Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't  
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness  
(and so it is now).
I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.

[ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.   
Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being  
here on earth.]
The day my teacher of Latin and French died.
When I saw a horror film.
When my chief accused me of an error that I hadn't made.

When I succeeded in achieving a scholarship for which I had  
strived hard during a period of financial, personal and physical  
stress.

I was most angry when India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy  
held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my  
friend.

A few days back I had to ask a professor a ridiculous question  
because I had lost at a game of cards and had to pay a forfeit.

I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in  
deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.

When the train taking me to my military service left the station,  
on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I  
had a hard year ahead.
Made a wonderfull new friend.

When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I would  
tackle the questions.

I told some acquaintances of mine something that I regretted  
later.
My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.
I helped someone to do something and was found out.

An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an  
offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.

It was when we were beaten or lost the football match by 5-1 and  
then I scored the third goal to my own side.

Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had  
not washed the dishes.

I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in  
acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of  
several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my  
colleagues.
Insulted by other people in the shop.
Had a letter from my father (usually he does not write to me).

I ran a race for the CAL track team and I did terribly and then  
the coach said that I should sit out for the season. I felt  
really sad because I wasn't going to be able to run. It was  
something I always had done and now I couldn't do it anymore.

I was in a bus with my school material when I fell and sat on the  
lap of another passenger.

My sister had promised to help me to do a translation from  
English into German. But the day I needed her she told me that  
she was busy - I was very angry.

I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football  
match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was  
disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.

In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from my  
juice pot (one litre) so that I only got one glass out of the  
whole pot.

I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of  
our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her  
pregnancy.

When I found out that my good friend and roommate did not pay the  
phone bill and electric bill like he promised and let me down.
The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.

I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for  
me, I was very glad.
When my younger sister, who was then 16 years old, was pregnant.

I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary board  
exams I scored the highest marks.  Then the exams were  
postponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.  However  
when the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scored  
less than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.

I feel disgust when hearing or seeing other people being treated  
inhumanely. For example torturing in chili.

A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy  
who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was  
also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend  
of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and  
depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.
When I received a letter of acceptance to CAL.
After my father's death.

When I could not pass my exams with good marks.  My wedding was  
to take place 15 days after the exams and I tried to convince  
myself that this was the reason for my not having done well.    
However, I thought that had I really put my mind to doing well at  
the exams I would have done well.

I experience this emotion quite often but the day I was most  
angry was the day I got pulled up for something I had not done.   
It happened during my school days, I had not spoken a word in  
class but the monitor had written my name on the board.  So I  
had a remark in my callender which I had to get signed by my  
parents.  This remark resulted in me being spanked.
When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.

On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in  
which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high  
responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.

A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place  
which was 1 metre high.

My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guy  
upstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.

When I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from the  
floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I  
should not have done that and felt guilty.
At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.
Hear my name on the list attending the English lectures.
Finding out my grades at the end of my Sophomore year.

Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age  
will go to your English lectures and they do not understand  
English.

My flatmate was asking questions about my relationship with my  
boyfriend, whether I wasn't treating him as unfairly as I claimed  
he'd been treating me. As a result, I was angered, and became  
defensive.

When I saw a TV program on the North American military plan  
called "The startwar".
When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

A time when, as part of my work, I was sent out actually sort of  
volunteered to run an errand for someone who had no authority to  
send me out and the address was very far especially on foot and  
turned out to be incorrect too. The whole trip was a waste.

Once in my work it happened a fight between the person in charge and me. I  
got so angry and spoke out everything I felt at the moment.

Adultery with the girlfriend of a friend of mine, of which he  
learned.

I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted.  
Perhaps once, when I saw a big spider.
When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.

Facing the possibility of having a child when it wasn't either  
desired or permitted.
Once when I said bad things concerning a friend.
Not being able to be selected for the dancing team.
I could not do the questions on my math midterm.
When I saw a horrible movie - Alien.

When I stole a packet of cigarettes from a neighbour  and the  
next day I owned up and returned it.

I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very  
funny.

Being miserable in a party when other people are friendly and  
happy.

In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing  
with his penis in the middle of the town.

On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a  
woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so  
on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other  
in such a degrading way.

My best friend had a relatively severe illness.  I was sad  
because she was suffering.

I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see me  
but did not because he spent the evening with his pals.
I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.

Once in a public ladies room, I opened the door of a cubicle that  
was taken, although it was not locked.

I fell over head and ears in love with someone who appeared to be  
in love with me. it made me so happy that I could hardly sleep  
and eat for one week.

When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness  
and dirtyness.

When I get an exam back with a grade that I did not desire. Then  
I get mad at myself and say that I could have done better.
I lost my way on a trip in the mountains.

Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial  
"explanation".
When I was bringing in the shopping and nearly stood on a snake.

When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go  
there, if I wished, in Summer.

It was on January 1st 1985 when I accidentally broke a Fanta  
bottle in a certain bottle store in Zomba.

I could have passed the last exam of the public competition, but  
I failed as I had not studied.

I ran over my dog with a bicycle when I was carrying him tied to  
the handle bar.

During labour when the foetal sounds became faint and there was a  
big alert for a forceps delivery.
When my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.
When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.

I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately  
my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his  
feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.

When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his  
parents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.

Once I had an argument with my friends and I knew that I was  
right.  My friends went on arguing with me even though they did  
not know the right thing.

I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot  
about it.

It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this  
Institution to study as a Medical Assistant.

One of my good friends had to migrate to America.  Our friendship  
had developed quite well and it was a pity as our friendship would  
fade.
[ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
Yelled at my parents for not buying me a car like other parents.

I had made an error in planning a programme and had publicly  
accepted the mistake, despite repeated requests not to bring the  
matter for discussion a professor kept constantly passing remarks.  
I reacted angrily.

I was very sad  when I got the XIIth standard results, when I got  
low marks as compared to my friend and I could not get admission  
to courses like medicine.
My grandmother died during Christmas break several years ago.

A few days back my mother was not feeling too well and still did  
all the house work.  I felt guilty as I had not offered to help.

Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust  
that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty fawcet.

When the committee, to which I belong, was accused of having  
squandered the money of the association.

During one year my mother almost had a nervous breakdown and my  
father had a serious operation. I was afraid that our family (4  
kids, I'm the oldest) wouldn't hold together. Everything turned  
out fine.

I had been rude to my mother at a time when she needed  
comforting, not anger (death of my sister).

After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could  
not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was  
hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.
Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.
A father helping his kid to fight other kids.

In an exam when I answered the questions with very little  
assurance due to insufficiet preparation.

Knowing that I had to do the survey with him I felt very  
reluctant.  Although I do not know him I feel disgusted by just  
looking at him.  Thinking that the project lasted several days I  
regreted having joined that project.

When I stole money from my mother and she asked me later if I was  
responsible.  I never admitted it.
At a success of mine, at a real achievement.
When, as an adult I have been caught lying or behaving badly.

I went to bed with a girl and the next day she thought it was the  
start of something serious and I just thought it was fun and I  
told her I wasn't interested in starting a serious relationship.

During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy  
I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I  
like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........
Saw a man dressed as a woman.

My mom called early in the morning (On a Monday) and I had just  
seen her that weekend. I couldn't understand what could be so  
important as to make her call at such a strange hour. I missed  
the call and had to call her back that afternoon.

Sometime back, my boyfriend and I were having a walk nearby my  
parent's house. Suddenly we met my grandfather and I was  
afraid that he would report to my parents.

When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child.  She does  
not trust me and constantly misunderstands me.  I get  
particularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriend  
with whom she works.

As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother  
saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.

I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because of  
different commitments concerning life and career.  I loved her as  
a person but could not agree with the life the future would  
demand.  Parting from her was very sad.

When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated  
with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.   
Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person  
I love most on earth.

This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal  
and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was  
contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her  
response.

In Ward 1A was an epileptic patient who was burnt the whole body  
and was stinking very much such that the whole ward was affected.  
Few people could come near him.

I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I  
haven't done it.

I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life  
films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain  
animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.
I got caught shoplifting a package of gummy bears.

There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives  
in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I  
accused him of several things.

Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had  
previously failed.

Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and  
nature.

I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the  
mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my  
wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into  
another dress.

I am thinking about death, the eternal of it, the unknown, the  
sense of being here. Often, laying in bed in the dark and quiet,  
the fear makes me feel dizzy.

It was last September when I felt very sad. It was when I heard  
that I was not selected to study in the University of Malawi.

When I was fighting with my elder brother I unintentionally hurt    
him in the eye with a wooden bar.  I felt guilty and feared that  
he would be blind, fortunately he recovered after 15 days.

When a teacher tells a story which isn't true. It only reflects  
his way of interpreting reality.
When I met an old schhol friend (school love).

I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show  
rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.   
I felt frustation - bordering on anger.
Made a mistake at work.

When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress  
myself and was examined by several doctors.
A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.

[ When someone tells me something that hurts me, I feel bad about  
it and also feel sad.]
When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.

When I had exams a relative of ours, who lives in another city, 
came to visit us and I felt disgusted at him.

Discussion with my mother about the way to educate my children. I  
felt anger against my mother.

When walking along the beach with my boyfriend, we saw 2 people  
having sex on the sand dunes in full view of everyone. It was the  
fact that they chose that area in which to have sex, that  
disgusted me.
Not applicable to myself.

I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers  
dropped out.

Your prejudice against psychology students and education students  
(not allowing us to go to the medical university lectures).

A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin  
and the sticks.  He did not repair them nor did he tell me about  
it.
I can't remember ever feeling shame.

When a classmate of ours knocked on our door at 2 o'clock in the  
morning.  I was disgusted at his behaviour.

Finding out that the university police was afraid to stop the  
foreign students playing loud music (China's shame).

I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He  
was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper.  
Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was  
retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate  
with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for  
pouring his soup.
I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

I slept with a man purely because I found him physically  
attractive and was under the influence of alcohol.

I loved a person and he went away. It wasn't necessary that he  
left me to reach his goals.
Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.

Tutorial again !  A fearful feeling came to me when I sat on the  
chair and looked at my fellow students all around.  I was really  
scared that they would ask me some questions or challenge the  
ideas that I had presented.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt  
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be  
in order.

When I was trying for a girl who I really liked and cared for and  
thought she felt the same way too. But she didn't like the idea  
and just wanted to stay friends.

One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to  
advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.
My father promoted to be a professor.

At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the  
next day they promised to take revenge on me.

When I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed when  
asking and doing certain forbidden things.

My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the   
family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not  
gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been  
different.
Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

A friend of mine had a bicycle-accident because I pulled at his  
handlebar.
A close friend took part in a racist violent action.

For example, when I have promised something but I haven't  
fulfilled it.

When I was in a religious school my teacher showed me up in front  
of all my class-mates.  They were very sarcastic and cruel.

I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family  
got to know about it, this was just when I had become a  
Christian.

I tried after months to begin talking to my boyfriend again. He  
ignored me. I felt I had lowered my pride and became his  
"doormat".
Discussing psychology with my friends before the lecture.

Decided at the last minute not to do something that I said I  
would do with a person.
Being rude to someone I do not like.
When I heard that I had passed the second year exams.

I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in  
a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be  
considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did  
not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.
Relating to my closest family.

When some unforgiving acquaintance dragged up an old and rather  
embarassing situation from my past.
Left alone in dark when young.
Someone played a trick on me.

Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for  
pharmacy completed.

I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights  
were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that  
the dogs may be outside.

When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distant  
relative of mine in the sitting room, on the couch.  I failed to  
stop and get up, I carried on.

My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I  
was responsible for her.

One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my  
friendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sad  
because I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded her  
as being very faithful.

I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep  
some orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep,  
but the teacher told me to do it.

My mother always took my side. That brought about quarrels with  
my father. I knew she didn't like that and I felt very sorry for  
that.

When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having  
thought it possible.

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the  
due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.
Falling over.

My intimate girlfriend told me that her father was opposed to our  
relationship  and had insulted my integrity.

My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying  
psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet  
frequently anymore.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondary  
school leaving certificate exam.
Not being able to have a party at home with friends.

A conflict with a pupil and there were probatory teachers  
present.
After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

Yesterday my boyfriend and I wanted to play billiards. However  
there were boys playing (5 times). My boyfriend then is fed up  
and chagrined. In such case I think it is my fault.

Saw on TV China not winning more gold medals in the Asian  
Olympics.
Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.

At my grandfather's funeral - My grandparents virtually raised me  
as my mother was a solo-parent and had to work.

A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was  
not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.   
I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

I was learning judo and my instructor wanted me to assist him in  
teaching girls judo at a suburban college.  I was just a beginer,  
and he made me a green belt so that I would be able to command  
respect.  This was against my principles, and yet I allowed myself  
to listen to him.  I gave it up soon after, however I felt very  
ashamed at not sticking to my principles and at not having put my  
foot down earlier.

Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She  
wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of  
leaving the job only after 2 days employment.

When my fiancee travelled 2000 Km to visit me, and I hadn't seen  
her for 4 months.
When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.

When I went in a clinical hospital and saw in what conditions  
people are attended there.
I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.
Not doing well in the examn.

When a student accused me of having stolen his textbook  as he  
had found a form bearing my name in his other books and all my  
explanations fell on deaf ears.

When I see that my mother forces my little brother (15 years) to  
work very hard for school. I don't agree that she constantly puts  
him to work, but I don't tell it to her, so nothing changes.

I knew a girl so lovely that everyone would like her.  But she  
refused to accept my Christmas present and I tried to forget  
her.

After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and  
having been stupidly cross in every way.

My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we  
had to get separated again.

When my natural parents name would show up on papers and not my,  
what I call real name.

I thought that I could have avoided the above situation (the one  
in fear) if I had concentrated more on my work, which I hate.

I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one  
of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was  
selected to start Nursing.

I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no  
work, only loneliness.

I lost my temper at my mother while she was teaching me.  I felt  
ashamed and sorry at having hurt my loving mother.

I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people,  
with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy.

Being sexually assulted on a bus and noone helped (people only  
laughed).

When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted to  
be a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longed  
for it.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for  
himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as  
we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an  
unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't  
jailed.

When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration,  
simply because the child had been leaning against a window.

I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a great  
effort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, they  
put the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those that  
blame me.

The day I decided to get out of my house I saw in my brother's  
eyes that they blamed me for the situaiton.

Bisshop Ter Schure intoduced himself on TV to the Dutch Nation.  
He spoke as if he was God himself, and didn't discuss the way he  
had achieved this position.

I was in a cafe with another person when, suddenly, several close  
friends of my partner appeared.  I did not know what to do and my  
partner felt uncomfortable.

When I saw that I had passed an exam.  It was the last chance and  
there was a lot at stake.

When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear  
being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in  
situations when an argument is on hand.
[ When my elders do not understand me in the right way.]

When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house with  
violence. I was alone at home that moment.

Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from  
airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in  
contact again.

The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary  
examination.
When the robbers broke in, at night.
Hearing a strange noise in the biology building.
When a little brother of mine damaged a cassette.

As I was taking venous blood from another patient I introduced  
air into the place of puncturing and there was a swelling which  
is dangerous to the patient hence I became afraid.

When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me and  
behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel  
personnel.

I felt anger of a friend when she met "a date" and become nervous  
and pest as she always gets when she meets him.

At the age of 12 (or so) I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree an  
apple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoersky  
would like this).
Deceived by other people and ran into trouble.

When I had to travel alone, unescorted for the first time.     It  
was an over-night journey by train to a distant place.

A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having  
failed the exams.
Saw someone spitting in public.
Not thanking relatives for a favor done.
When I entered at the University.

After having been ill, when I was coming back to the hostel, I  
felt very sad leaving home.

I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day,  
my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could  
influence my parents to take it easy.

It was when I failed standard 8 exams while all my friends  
passed and went to secondary school. In class I was always  
getting more marks than they did.

When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly  
and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly  
negative and distorted results.

When my uncle comes (3 times a year) for the traditional  
Christmas dinner with my grandparents and other relatives and is  
very drunk.
When one of my parents verbally, personally abused the other.

When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone to  
the girl's secondary school.
Not doing well in an examn.

I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes  
came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents  
attention by talking to them.

Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of  
separation from summer.

I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent  
words.
When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.

I saw a terrible accident in which the driver of a motor was  
thrown through the frontwindow of a car. His face was completely  
away.

The repression of rioting and non-rioting "Blacks" in South  
Africa by the police of that "Democracy".
This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.

Last Summer I went camping with some C.U students.  As I was  
working then, I had to leave the second night (some of them had  
joined us the first night).  Next morning, 6 o'clock, a female  
classmate knocked on our door and tried to wake us up.  I was not  
fully conscious and I said something which I should not have.  I  
realized the trouble I had made and wanted to hide.  Later I  
said sorry to her and the matter came to an end.
When I let a person assume a fault that I committed.

I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel  
from our homes to the lectures here every day.  The way the whole  
thing was handled disgusted me.

One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front of  
his friends.  Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed of  
myself.

I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on  
it. I tried to fix it but could not.

When I red a report in the magazine VESA about an Iranian telling  
what she had lived in the prisons in Iran. I felt disgust about  
that people.

I have cut loose from my father a few years ago. I know he is  
very sad about this.
When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.
My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.

When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock  
in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the  
barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my      
own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there  
were ghosts in that area.
When my family allowed me to do higher studies.

I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mine  
abroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, I  
have attempted, but have not actually gone through with  
corresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.

I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead  
mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an  
old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.

I was wearing slippery shoes and I tumbled down in a place where  
there were many people walking by.

When I am in an auditorium with people and I ask a silly question  
so that everyone starts to laugh.

We always made a lot of noise during a certain lecture.  This may  
have been because we did not respect the lecturer. Finaly, the  
lecturer could not tolerate it and he scolded us angrily and  
pointed out our misbehaviour.

A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad  
manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their  
telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.
When I woke up after a nightmare.

My friends and I were sitting at a restaurant. We were talking  
and a few of them said awful things about women. I became  
disgusted by their narrow-mindedness.

I felt the emotion when I fought somebody who was drunk and tried  
to disturb us while we were having meals.
Walking on a dark street with noone around.
When I broke-down while seeing off my friend.

When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and  
there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.

I felt disgusted when a certain lady spoke words of sarcasm when  
I was trying to propose to her.
When I bought new clothes and put them on.

I was captain of the school swimming team. The team was only two  
points in front before the last relay. We won the relay, which I  
swam in, and thus my team won the championship.
Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.

When I came back to my hostel, my bed was full of newspapers and  
dirty clothes.  My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for him  
as he had no time (this was his responsibility).  The food we  
shared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).

When I wet my head (or bed ?) one day my sister discovered it and reported  
it to the other siblings. So my mother had to scold me.

A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from  
his car.  It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.
Someone ruining someone's property just for the fun of it.

My patient died of Anaemia while I was organising blood  
transfusion for him, so I felt guilty, because I thought that may  
be I was slow.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might  
get tetanus.

When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher.  The  
notification came by post.

A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not  
as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She  
implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time,  
and taking 3 University exams part time).

When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeeping  
while my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a period  
of exams when I had to study very hard.
My sister marrying a bad man. He is cruel to her.

When I was about 14 years old, I "borrowed" a can of drink from  
the refrigerator, intending to replace it later that day. But it  
was found missing before I could do anything - no one owned up to  
its disappearance.
When I was fined for speeding.

I was drinking a glass of wine and eating something when there  
suddenly appeared pictures about the famine in some parts of  
Africa.

I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train  
arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt  
glad.

When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and I  
did not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it.  I was in there for  
several minutes.
Being looked at by someone I do not like.

I felt disgust as a result of one of my midterms - I thought I  
had prepared well for it, but the end result wasn't what I had  
expected.

I promised to join a meeting but did not turn up as I did not  
want to do the work.
[ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]

When I bribed the person who caught me doing something I was not  
supposed to have done.  I was very ashamed of what I had done.
When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.

I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in which  
there were storiees of paranormal experiences.  My leg was  
itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another  
strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the  
blanket)
When I gave my boyfriend a brush-off.
I felt sad when my boyfriend and I were apart for some time.

I received a wedding invitation from an ex-flatmate, enclosed was  
a small note that overcame a lot of the differences that had  
arisen between us due to the circumstances in which she left the  
flat.
I did badly in the mid term examination.
The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.

I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to  
study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had  
passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in  
my hometown.

On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown  
who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt  
disgusted.
I was ashamed to tell my mother that I fell down with a bicycle.

Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening  
around me which pleases me.
I got to know that I had been accepted at university.
When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.
Walking home in the dark from college.

I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was least  
expecting it.

At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal  
for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she  
refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.

One day when I was a little boy, my friends asked me to play  
with them outside and to catch some boys.  However our parents  
did not know that we were out and when I got home it was very  
late and I feared being scolded by my parents.
Going to a concert.

I am not very affectionate and I feel guilty as I do not give as  
much affection as I receive.

A sister broke a cup and when mother asked I was reported to have  
been responsible.
My behaviour at a recent party.  I passed out early, luckily.

In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came  
in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while  
I was trying to concentrate on the program.

In an exam I answered the questions rather carelessly and  
afterwards I thought that the exam would have been better had I  
answered more carefully.

I just opened the bathroom without knocking not knowing that  
someone was bathing inside, it happened to be my father.

One day I went for a bath. I took off my clothes and as soon as I  
had finished my brother came in. I felt sad and I found no reason  
why he came in.

When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through  
a wood.

A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very  
disgusting, especially because I was eating.
When I heard of the death of my mother.

When I blamed my failure to the bias and favouritism in the         
marking system, in fact I had not worked hard enough.
When my cousin passed away.

When I inadvertantly made some close friends and relatives feel  
bad.

When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male  
creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart  
for all her life.

When I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who   
was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was  
really angry with him then.

During the English lesson we were required to do a play.  A few  
days after doing it the teacher asked us to do it again at a meeting   
and I forgot my part.

I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having  
called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the  
whole night.

Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the Asian  
Olympic.

I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson  
in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood  
face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and  
respected.
Finding out I am not good looking.
I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.

I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student.  
Because everything turned out different from my expectations.  
Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a  
student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the  
beginning of September.

In a school parting we agreed to go to a restaurant.  
We met at school and we separated us in several cars. My car  
broke and we arrived late. All those who already had arrived  
stand up and applauded us when we entered two hours late.  
All the restaurant attention was turned on us.
I could not finish my homework on time.

I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited  
because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam  
very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was with  
her just to go to bed with her.
We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.

It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me  
and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have  
never seen anything like that before.

A ex-boyfriend tried to prejudice me before my fiancT and his  
family saying things about me that let his family worried. We had  
to postpone our wedding and we were already using our wedding  
rings. To be honest I didn't feel just anger, I felt hate.

Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my  
mother's presence.
Fooling around with this guy I did not know.
A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.

When I got my fingers stuck in one of the side holes of the door,  
in the tube.

When I was caught by the police and was kept with a group of  
delinquents, which added to my fear of being shut up.  I was  
afraid of the people near me and the future consequences.
Before taking an exam.
When I did not get the compound which is known.

My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.   
I felt sad about the coming several years.

When I had an argument with my grandfather the day my younger  
brother was born.

When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that  
I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.
I got separated form my closest friend. He went to work abroad.
When I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.

The exam was drawing near and I wanted to prepare for it.  But I  
had a lot of other things to do so I did not have much time to prepare   
for the exams.  Whenever I sat down to study I was scared that I would   
not be able to finish it.

I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate  
result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5  
times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.

When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and  
soul.

My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the  
conditions they imposed on me.

When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a  
patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.

Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men  
committing various acts.

I feel afraid of the way a great friend looks at me, and also a  
little afraid of the directions that it's going.
When I vomitted a lump of blood.

That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 days  
because I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying to  
persuade him.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.

When I don't say the truth, when I don't do a certain thing  
thanks to my laziness.

When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and  
my mother took the teacher's point of view.

My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then  
we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to  
refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my  
anger.

I felt it when I received a letter telling that I had been  
classified in a national concourse of p... I felt happy and  
vanity about it.

I had told a person unpleasant things in a bad manner. He was  
very depressed and caused an accident.

And she said absurd things, false things that filled my ears and  
inflated my head which seemed to be caught in a carcass where the  
heart wanted to explode and where the arm wanted to knock down  
the world.
When I felt that my love was returned.

I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day  
in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold  
for half an hour.

I typed up a letter for this physician at work. She didn't care  
for my style, even though she was not using correct English. I  
told her it was her letter and we would do it her way.

In the begining of teenage, on the matters of sex - speaking  
about sex.

I was afraid when my mother left me alone to live in our house  
for one month.

There was a cup final match between Limbe Leaf Wanderers and  
Silver Strikers and someone promised to give me some money for  
admission fee to watch this game. Unfortunately he did not give  
me.

I happened to see the video-tape movie "This is America - Part  
one" at my friend's place.

When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I  
was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too  
fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then  
toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no  
consequences.

Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied  
at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend  
went to Greece for a holiday for a month.
[ When I was treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds.]
When I left my part-time job.

I had a very short term romance during the summer vacations.  When  
we first met I felt excited but I wanted to avoid him after we had met  
a few times and so I proposed that we stay apart, I felt very  
sad then.

When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and  
ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after  
me and insisted on my apologizing.

When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, died  
after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely  
person and I did not have the means for his company.

I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at  
home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our  
interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope  
of human life is sad.
When my grandmother died.

Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense of  
sadness.

A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We  
became reconciled.
Receiving personal criticisms early in the morning.

I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I was  
eating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warned  
him often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I took  
out his chair I knocked down my own glass.

It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of  
the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.

A railways officer, when asked by the ticket checker to produce  
his tickets, got very aggressive and started abusing and using  
his authority in a very wrong way.

Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money  
stolen.

In class I had to say something aloud and people reacted  by  
laughing.

To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear  
delayed me acting to do this.

My best friend got married and left her home-town to go and live  
in Poona.  After her wedding I felt sad.

When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came  
to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously  
met.

I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of  
a rat.
A friend's mother died.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car.  
We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my  
friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly  
started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for  
me to go to Carinthia.

That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my  
Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and
